365227b8aeebf40b.title: Lead Data Governance Analyst
365227b8aeebf40b.description:
Lead Data Governance Analyst to actively lead Complex projects and programmes which drive the organisations data management, governance and control framework. For the industry leading, award winning financial organisation.

Benefits Include:

28 days holiday + bank hols
5% Pension matching contribution
Annual Bonus (around 10-14% of annual salary)
My lifestyle (cheap cinema tickets / promotions etc)
Sports & Social (monthly draws etc)

I would like to talk to applicants with extensive Data Governance experience, specifically Data Management, catalogues, stewardship and Quality.

Responsibilities:
You will work closely with business areas to maintain and continuously improve enterprise data assets through data catalogues, data stewardship and data quality management, while also supporting continuous improvement through process optimisation and engagement with corporate projects.


To champion Data Governance throughout the organisation
To lead a team of Business Partners ensuring excellent Governance across the business
Support the MI Centre of Excellence,
Manage Committee schedules, including the submission of papers and packs to Senior Management and Executives
Work in a project environment, acting as an SME to facilitate adherence to the data governance framework and support decision making.
Represent the division across small & medium sized projects in relevant forums and committees,
Influence departmental MI teams and/or data stewards
Contribute to cross-functional MI team, working with IT and Change, to ensure that data impacts are identified and managed to conclusion.

Experience required:

Experience in working with data across a range of sources (e.g., relational and dimensional databases, file systems, semi-structured and unstructured data, models, spreadsheets)
Understanding of data governance, quality management
Familiarity with business analysis and process modelling and lineage
Awareness of data modelling and data warehouse methodologies
Risk Management
Stakeholder engagement, management and collaboration with an ability to question and challenge, put forward new ideas and gain buy in through key working relationships
Ability to use the following systems/technologies:
SQL
Advanced Microsoft Office suite
Data catalogues/metadata management solutions (e.g. Collibra) preferred but not essential

A fully remote Governance role for an established project driven data/mi function. Working with an industry leading, aware winning business who have a key focus on employee wellbeing

Candidate Source Ltd is an advertising agency. Once you have submitted your application it will be passed to the third party Recruiter who is responsible for processing your application. This will include holding and sharing your personal data, our legal basis for this is legitimate interest subject to your declared interest in a job. Our privacy policy can be found on our website and we can be contacted to confirm who your application has been forwarded to.

f04b74793f5fa160.title: Data Analyst Apprentice, Leeds
f04b74793f5fa160.description:
AECOM is built to deliver a better world. We design, build, finance and operate infrastructure assets for governments, businesses, and organisations in more than 150 countries. As a fully integrated firm, we connect knowledge and experience across our global network of experts to help clients solve their most complex challenges. From high-performance buildings and infrastructure, to resilient communities and environments, to stable and secure nations, our work is transformative, differentiated, and vital. A Fortune 500 firm see how we deliver what others can only imagine at aecom.com and @AECOM.

To apply you will need to provide the following - if this information is not provided it will slow your application down and therefore you may miss out.

+ CV including details of any work experience, and your education including dates, grades, and what you studied.

+ Covering letter demonstrating your passion, why you are interested in this position, and how your skills and education/qualifications support your application

The role will be supporting the Civil Infrastructure Management team in making key data-driven decisions through both regular and ad-hoc reporting.

Data Science is one of the fastest growing fields in tech, and analytics plays a crucial role in how decisions are made. As a data analyst, you will have the opportunity to drive business strategy and have a tangible impact on how the organization moves forward. You’ll get to the heart of complex business challenges, working closely with key stakeholders and using your expertise to advise on the best course of action. In this respect, you’ll have a direct hand to play in the company’s success—an extremely rewarding position to be in.

Typical responsibilities will include:
+ Produce and publish reports on a weekly, monthly and ad-hoc basis for the business to monitor performance

+ Support the roll out of new initiatives, systems and processes

+ Be proactive in continuing own professional development

+ Utilise different data sources from within the business

+ Build, develop, troubleshoot and maintain various reports and dashboards utilising Excel and Power BI

+ Deliver high quality analysis, reports, using simple and effective visualizations that can be scaled for consumption by a larger audience.

+ Deliver timely reporting and dashboards that satisfies requirements

+ Work collaboratively with team members to deliver business needs on time

+ Performs checks to ensure data quality and accuracy is consistent on all platforms

+ Use software tools to develop reports and analysis which convey relevant and meaningful information in a concise and logical manner

+ Use data systems securely to meet requirements for sensitive internal data

This is a fantastic opportunity to further your career, gaining valuable work experience, within an established and successful consultancy.

This role will combine work-based on-the-job training and learning with further studies and provides an opportunity to develop skills within a supporting environment which encourages challenge and collaborative behaviours.

Applicants must be willing to progress their career after an initial probationary period to undertake a day release course at an identified Further Education College studying a Level 3 or 4 Data Analyst qualification.

Minimum Requirements

Minimum Requirements

No experience is necessary, but the position is ideally suited to school leavers at either GCSE or A-Level standard (or equivalent) who can demonstrate:

+ Clear interest in data including data management, manipulation and visualisation

+ Good team player, with ability to interact with staff at all levels

+ Strong problem solving and analytical capabilities

+ Strong organisational skills

+ Excellent attention to detail

+ Commitment to quality and efficiency

+ Creative thinking

+ Curiosity

+ Self Awareness

+ Able to embrace agile working – combining home and office working

+ Good interpersonal and communication skills

Ideal Requirements

+ Experience in Excel

+ Experience in coding (for example R, Python, SQL or similar)

Preferred Qualifications

n/a

What We Offer

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

af5cc3ba8914db58.title: Quant Analyst - QA Climate Risk
af5cc3ba8914db58.description:
Quant Analyst - Climate Risk
London
As a Barclays Quant Analyst - Climate Risk you will be responsible for delivering modelling to quantify the greenhouse gas emissions associated with our business activities and to provide insight into Climate related risk. As part of the team, you will provide a range of models, tools and analytics to support our external Climate Change commitments made in 2020, both to monitor the bank’s greenhouse gas emissions and to provide business insight to help achieve our carbon targets.

Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.

What will you be doing?
• Design, develop and implement models and metrics for portfolio climate/ carbon analysis
Be responsible for Quantitative Analysis of business sector processes from a climate and emissions perspectiveProvide data analysis and data processing tools for both internal and external dataProvide analysis and domain expertise to other modelling groups to support climate commitments

What we’re looking for:
• Bachelor’s degree in Physical Sciences, Engineering, Mathematics or Economics or equivalent
Excellent coding skills in PythonExperience of working with large data setsExperience of the design, implementation and validation of financial or economic simulations and models
Skills that will help you in the role:
• PhD in a numerical field or equivalent
Experience of working with climate data or climate modelsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsExperience of coding in C++, C# or Java
Where will you be working?
In the heart of Canary Wharf, our headquarters at Churchill Place boasts onsite amenities such as; a gym, staff restaurant and deli bar, and is easily accessible by tube and bus links. With a population of around 5000 staff the atmosphere is second to none with a real buzz being created around the offices within.

3eaf808d8afe0365.title: Data Analyst
3eaf808d8afe0365.description: Faethm is scaling! We're looking for a London-based (hybrid working) Data Analyst to join our team in London. We are at an exciting point in our trajectory where we’ve recently joined forces with Pearson Education. Operating as a startup within a larger company, Faethm will continue to evolve over the coming year as we leverage the resources and offerings of our new parent company.”Faethm's objective is to keep every worker, everywhere, employable. Founded in 2017 in Sydney, Faethm is an augmented analytics platform that provides scenario-driven predictive analytics on the impact of external trends on the workforce. Our SaaS AI-driven capability is the world’s data source for navigating external impacts like AI/ robotic technologies, the evolution of work, and COVID-19 on the workforce. Our capability helps clients evaluate the impact of these trends on any economy, industry, organisation, or job and suggests viable transition pathways for impacted employees into 'future proof' career pathways.Faethm is building out its team to manage and support a growing pipeline of client activities across EMEA. Core to your work at Faethm is an interest in process optimisation, system standardisation and creative analytics. We work with large workforce datasets, which are ingested into our AI engine to develop insights on the impact of external trends on a workforce or economy. This means that our Data Analysts are critical stakeholders in successful onboarding, kick-off, and value creation for our clients through analytical insights.As such, Faethm is seeking candidates with two core skill sets:Scrappy 'get stuff done' individuals with a desire to improve systems, create standardised processes, and automate our own capabilitiesPeople with a passion for unique visualisation and data interpretation and a willingness to experiment/create new content to generate value for our clientsWe are looking for a delivery-focused and self-starting Data Analyst to join our team and grow with us. Initial responsibilities are detailed below, but we expect this role will evolve over time. and as such, flexibility, collaboration, a passion for your work, an unquenchable thirst for knowledge, and a sense of humour will be essential._What you’ll be doing: _You will be responsible for the collection and analysis of client data, improvements to process flows, and analysis of key workforce data insights.Work closely with key internal stakeholders (Customer Insights – client delivery, Product team and Sales), to understand their priorities and shifting needs.Utilise a client-driven mindset to ensure Faethm client accounts are set-up in a logical, intuitive manner with clean workforce data to enable impactful insights.Engage in continuous process improvements to the client onboarding process, with a focus on working with the Customer Insights team and clients to enable a seamless onboarding experience to the Faethm platform.Periodically communicate with clients to discuss workforce data requirements, resolve errors, gaps, and limitations in submission files.Collect and assimilate various workforce and emerging technology data.Apply your analytical skillset to understand, interpret, manipulate, and visualise data (e.g. via Tableau, Excel, etc.)Required skills & experienceExperience in processing, cleaning, organising and manipulating data.Programming in scripting languages such as Python.Development, enhancement and standardisation of process automation and process flow, including running and understanding scripts.Strong MS Excel proficiency including pivot tables, filtering, formulas, etc.Ability to effectively communicate complex topics via Tableau, Excel or PowerPoint.Knowledge of AWS.Prior consulting or direct client experience with tact and professionalism in communication.Familiarity with Tableau or other BI data viz tools desired.Join our team in EMEA with a rapid scale mandate and help us build our capability as we support clients across industry verticals.Faethm is an equal opportunity employer. We find excellence in diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.Job Type: Full-time

32da97746404c58d.title: Data Analyst
32da97746404c58d.description:
Data Analyst
Data Idols are working with a market leading HealthTech company with a passion for providing the latest technical solutions for people’s care needs.
After almost 50 years of organic growth and strategic acquisitions, today they are market leaders in tech enabled care across the UK & Europe and are looking for an ambitious Data Analyst who is determined to bring data to the forefront of the business.
The Opportunity
With close to half a million people provided with their services, our client is exposed to a considerate amount of data, and are now presenting an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to sink their teeth into large and complex data sets; digging into the data in a creative way to drive actionable insights.
Working closely with the MD and Business Support Team, your key responsibilities will include:
Collaborating with key stakeholders to define analytics projects required to solve business problems and producing the appropriate dashboards for helpful insights
Ownership of the analytics projects, including reporting from inception to delivery
Become an SME in the various data sources
Communicating discoveries and proposed action to the business and non-tech audiences, working as a collective with various business departments.
Skills and Experience
We would love to talk to an agile and creative data analyst, confident in driving actionable insights and experienced in assisting the development of scalable and innovative data analytics solutions in a commercial setting.
Essential:
You must possess a demonstrated understanding of SQL and Tableau, with hands on experience in your current day-to-day responsibilities.
Desirable (but not necessarily a deal breaker):
You have lead analytics solutions using tools like DBT, Python, GCP, BigQuery, Github, Tableau.
You have experience in building the infrastructure required for ETL from a variety of data sources / have used ETL tools such as Fivetran.
Some experience of designing and implementing internal process improvements
What’s in it for you?
Up to £55,000 salary DOE
Pension
100% Remote Working
If you’re keen to find out more, please do apply or contact us today!
Data Analyst

a836a0d6ced02ecb.title: Data Analytics Support Analyst- Outside IR35
a836a0d6ced02ecb.company: Alexander Mann Solutions for Public Sector Resourcing
a836a0d6ced02ecb.description: Data Analytics Support Analyst- Outside IR35Contract Term: 6 MonthsContracting Authority: Livestock InformationLocation: RemoteImagine having a talent that could benefit someone you’ve never met and solve problems you didn’t even know existed. Well, you do, and you can. And we’re here to help you do just that. At PSR we are the go-to place for talented contractors and temps for a rich variety of public sector roles.The LI data team is currently designing and building its new Azure data analytics platform which will underpin LI data services. Working directly with various stakeholders from across the business, government, and industry the data team are designing and building a data warehouse and associated pipeline technology that moves data from operational and source systems to LI’s data warehouse. A requirement of this data environment is to take data from devolved admins and create a UK view for livestock traceability. We need a support analyst to help develop the support services required for go live and beyond.We need an experienced technical Data and Analytic Support Analyst who understands the unique needs of a data and analytics environment to join the team.The role requires somebody who can work with technical and non-technical members of the data team to understand the requirements of the business and ensure that a support service for the data and analytics environment is defined and delivered. As this is a new service the requirement is to help build a capability for support from scratch.As a Data Analytics Support Analyst your main responsibilities would be:Working as part of the Data Team the Data and Analytic Support Analyst will define and develop the support services for LI’s Azure data analytics environment that maintains a high quality of service from data ingestion through to Power BI reporting· Create Service support documents encompassing service levels, MTR, escalation points etc. This will align with LI’s other service documents and processes.· Work with other members of the data and analytics team and Microsoft to ensure all areas of the data an analytics processes are well documented and define to enable support in case of issues.· Work with the service transition team to ensure all items of data and analytics is reviewed and assessed suitability to go live.· Work with LI’s Service Managers to ensure that the Data and Analytics Support processes can be integrated with the wider LI incident, problem and change processes.· Work with an MSP (Managed Service Provider) to ensure roles and responsibilities are understood and issues/problems/other processes are documented and understood.· Define support processes for the LI data and analytics team working with a technical support/development analyst.· Define artefacts needed before going live· Define run books for Data and Analytics processes· Define and implement monitoring and alerting for the data and analytics environment.· Ensure reporting available on Data Team SLA’s· Work with delivery managers to ensure all areas of development have been included in support processes.· Raising support risks, issues, assumptions, and dependencies to head of data as needed.· Define processes for auditing of users and reviewing environment usage. Identify and document the user base, SME’s and contacts.· Ensure Data environment performance reporting is developed· Define health checks and implemented to ensure quality and service levels are adhered to· Support the data analytic environment ensuring it remains upto date and available providing a stable service to the end users.Essential Criteria:We need an experienced, motivated technical Data and Analytics Support Analyst who can work as part of an agile team, with proven experience of:· Working in complex organisational structures delivering support capabilities in line with business requirements· Strong collaboration and stakeholder engagement, experience of engaging with multiple stakeholder groups and managing stakeholder expectations· Working on Data and analytics environments, implementing support procedures from a standing start· Strong DWH knowledge base with a good understanding of the technical aspects of DWH· Requirements Engineering - requirement elicitation and creating User Stories, translating business requirements into technical language· Working knowledge of the ITIL framework· Proven knowledge of supporting an Azure data and Analytics environmento Specific knowledge of Azure data factory, Synapse, PowerBi· Good working experience of Azure tech stack· Experience with data ingestion processes and the ability to read and understand database schemas, including the relationships between objects and key terminology· Disciplined in working at pace and keeping focus on delivering to milestones· Working as part of an Agile team, experience of Azure DevOpsIf this Data Analytics Support Analyst - Outside IR35 sounds like something that you would be interested in, please click the link to apply"In applying for this role you acknowledge the following; this role falls in scope of the Off Payroll Working in the Public Sector legislation. Any rates of payment quoted will reflect the gross rate per day for the assignment, and will be subject to appropriate taxes and statutory costs. As such the payment to the intermediary and your income resulting from this contract will be different."Job Type: Full-timeSchedule:Monday to FridayApplication deadline: 17/02/2022Reference ID: PSR1JP00054542

5c0ebd004e8186b2.title: Data Governance Analyst
5c0ebd004e8186b2.description:
About the Data Team

A diverse and collaborative global community spread across Dyson locations from Malmesbury to Chicago, Shanghai to Singapore delivers data and analytics excellence at Dyson. Significant recent investments in people and cloud technologies, combined with a broad scope and no shortage of ambition and momentum, data and analytics are recognised throughout the organisation as critical to Dyson’s strategic objectives.
The Global Data Function have end-to-end responsibility for data from the bedrock of data governance and information management, to analytics platforms and delivery of meaningful innovative insights.
Involved with every aspect of Dyson’s global business - from finance to product development, manufacturing to owner experience – Data is enjoying record-breaking investment and mandate for 2022 and beyond, everything we do seeks to release value from data and underpin Dyson Strategic Objectives.
About the role:
A really exciting opportunity to be part of the next generation of data governance, working with the business to seamlessly embed data governance principles. Working on a wide range of topics, including our information protection initiatives, as well as defining, driving and measuring data governance standards and transformation.
Work with Information Management Manager for continuous change in protecting our information and keeping our secrets secret.
Work with business functions to deliver solutions and measurements across data classification, DLP, data retention, rights management, metadata standards and others
Collaborate closely with IT functions including Digital Workplace services and CyberSecurity. Transform standards to measured, effective technology solutions
Work with Legal and Risk and Compliance on internal audits and readiness for external audits
Measure and articulate the tangible value of information management initiatives and excellence, develop effective metrics to measure progress towards targets
Advise and support business areas in the development, agreement and adoption of best data practices and encourage business areas to comply to standard and policies.
Prioritise issue resolution: transparently, using innovation and pragmatism
Keep up to date with Information management current and emerging practices, risks, technologies and legislation.
Contribute to governance forums, as part of GDF governance framework
About you:
Essential:
An understanding of GDPR regulation
Experience with security and compliance principles, M365 compliance console experience would be an advantage
Information records management experience
An inquisitive and innovative approach to identifying risks and opportunities
When faced with competing business agendas, the empathy and clarity of mind to find the right path through and to take people with you
Able to pragmatically balance information management excellence against risk and commercial considerations
Desirable:
ISO 27001 or CISMP qualification
Benefits
27 days holiday plus eight statutory bank holidays
Pension scheme
Performance related bonus
Private medical insurance
Life assurance
Sport centre
Free on-site parking
Subsidised café and restaurants
Discounts on Dyson machines
#LI-Dyson
Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.
Interview guidance

We are following the government guidelines regarding COVID19. At this time all interviews will be conducted via video or telephone. We’re taking these precautionary measures to protect both our employee and candidate wellbeing. Our Talent Acquisition team will work with you and provide further information as appropriate.

2d36537992d6f89c.title: JESG Information Analyst
2d36537992d6f89c.description:
THIS POST IS FIXED TERM FOR 24 MONTHS DUE TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE SERVICE.

The Emergency Services Mobile Communications Programme (ESMCP) will replace the current digital radio communications system used by the Emergency Services across the UK.

An exciting opportunity has arisen within the Joint Emergency Services Group (JESG) and we are looking for a dynamic Information Analyst to provide high quality informatics and reporting in support of projects relating to radio signal coverage in Wales.

The post holder will report directly to the Wales Coverage Manager, based in WAST, working with a range of internal and external stakeholders to ensure the effective use of data, information and knowledge to improve, inform and support a portfolio of projects.

With an informatics background, the post-holder will have specialist knowledge and experience of informatics procedures, information analysis and reporting standards. A flexible and organised approach is essential to ensure that competing demands are met and a high level of analytical and judgemental skills will be needed to support the decision-making process.

As a key member of a national team there may be a requirement to achieve a level of security clearance, travel across Wales, and to London on occasion, to meet with stakeholders.

c06814e02647c52c.title: 2022 Deutsche Bank Analyst Summer Internship Programme - Investment Bank: (FIC) Fixed Income & Currencies: Sales, Trading and Structuring - London
c06814e02647c52c.description:
2022 Deutsche Bank Analyst Summer Internship Programme - Investment Bank: (FIC) Fixed Income & Currencies: Sales, Trading and Structuring - London
Location:

About Deutsche Bank:Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. We’re driving growth through our strong client franchise. Against a backdrop of increasing globalization in the world economy, Deutsche Bank is very well-positioned, with significant regional diversification and substantial revenue streams from all the major regions of the world. We serve our clients’ real economic needs in commercial banking, investment banking, private banking and asset management. We are investing heavily in digital technologies, prioritizing long term success over short-term gains, and serving society with ambition and integrity. All this means a career packed with opportunities to grow and the chance to shape the future of our clients.The Deutsche Bank Internship Programme:An internship at Deutsche Bank is your stepping stone to success and your first look into what life is like on our Graduate Programme. You’ll become part of a collaborative and inclusive workplace as you build on your technical and interpersonal skills, take on real responsibilities, hear from senior leadership through our speaker series, work on live projects, grow your network and learn first-hand how we deliver for our clients. If you want the opportunity to shape your own career as well as the future of the financial industry, then we will give you the platform and foundation to do so. Successful interns will be invited to join the Deutsche Bank Graduate Programme.About the business division: Fixed Income & Currencies (FIC) Brings together a top-ranked institutional sales force, world-class research with trading and structuring expertise across Foreign Exchange, Rates, Credit and Emerging Markets. The Fixed Income & Currencies business enables Deutsche Bank to respond to increasing automation, regulatory expectations and client demand for standardisation and transparency in execution across fixed income, currency and emerging markets. Foreign Exchange Deutsche Bank is an industry recognised leader in the foreign exchange business. Our client centric approach helps us to serve the needs of our customers across the full product spectrum from basic liquidity provision in the spot market to innovative derivative solutions for both asset and liability managers.Rates Deutsche Bank’s Rates business provides a comprehensive range of fixed income securities and OTC derivatives. We give clients access to the Bank’s liquidity and product expertise through our global sales, trading and structuring teams, as well as our electronic trading channels and clearing offering. Our product range includes Government, Agency and Mortgage-Backed Securities (MBS) as well as a suite of interest rate and inflation derivative products. Credit Deutsche Bank’s global Credit trading business enables clients to meet their investment goals and manage credit risk. With industry-leading expertise in market-making and credit valuation, we offer clients a wide range of products across Flow Credit, Distressed Products and Structured Finance Trading. Products traded include bonds, loans and claims, ranging from the strongest investment grade issuers through high yield to distressed assets. Our Structured Finance experts provide structured risk and non-flow financing solutions for clients across multiple industries and asset classes. Emerging MarketsDeutsche Bank’s emerging markets business offers a fully-integrated and global product platform. With unrivalled breadth and superior execution capabilities, we are dedicated to making markets and providing client solutions in a wide range of EM products. Our product range includes external debt and Credit Default Swaps (CDS), FX, rates, options and the more complex cross-market derivatives covering multiple EM jurisdictions.Division specifics about the internship role:Our interns are given the opportunity to learn about our business from different viewpoints, giving you a career advantage. Starting with up to a week of training, you’ll then complete some rotations. These will depend on your interests, your location and the needs of our business but you can be sure you'll gain a real understanding of the work we do. Your day-to-day tasks will vary depending on your role and the desk you’re working on. In FIC you might be pricing products for traders, preparing financial data analysis or refining the way we do forecasts. In Institutional & Treasury Coverage you may be preparing marketing materials for clients or helping to liaise with clients. Whichever areas you experience, the internship is an ideal way of finding out whether a career in these businesses meets your needs and aspirations. Areas in which you could work:* Fixed Income & Currencies (Trading & Structuring)* Institutional & Treasury Coverage (Sales).What we look for:We recruit highly intelligent graduates who are committed and adaptable. They have degrees in many different disciplines. Even though good levels of numeracy are important for some roles, you won’t necessarily need a formal mathematical or financial background. We have very comprehensive training programmes that will give you all the technical knowledge you’ll need to build a career with us. Above all, we’re looking for entrepreneurial people who thrive best in a diverse culture where innovation and agile thinking abound.You should not only be passionate about the world of finance, but also show a keen interest in your chosen field. You already have a record of outstanding academic achievement and you’re eager to go on learning at the same intensive rate. So you’ll thrive on working in a highly collaborative environment with some of the best minds in banking.Although there is no application deadline for this vacancy, we advise applying as soon as possible to avoid disappointment. We review applications on a rolling basis, meaning we will review new applications as and when they are submitted, and therefore reserve the right to remove this job description if we have sufficient applicants to fill our roles. Please be prepared for a short wait during the process whilst we consider your application alongside others.

953936761096f9a8.title: Data Analyst Apprentice
953936761096f9a8.description:
Are you a motivated,organized person seeking a exciting and rewarding opportunity in a fast-paced environment? Would you enjoy being part of a dedicated team that worksin partnership to create a relevant, memorable difference in the lives of our customers and employees? If you're looking for change, and you're ready to make changes … we're looking for you.

We work across multiple sectors including Retail, Automotive, Aerospace, FMCG, Retail, Public Sector and Aviation? This diversity means that no two contracts are the same and the possibilities of career development are almost endless.

At DHL our business is logistics, but people are our passion. With over 500,000 team members in 220 countries, we attract and retain great talent. We are one of the most innovative, most culturally diverse companies on the planet. We provide unmatched opportunities for personal and professional development. We really are a, “Best Place to Work.”

If this sounds like a team you'd like to join … keep reading.

If you want to be part of this incredible journey, DHL Supply Chain has the opportunity for you ?

The key responsibilities in this role include:

Completing customer data analysis to identify warehouse, transport and VAS profiles
Visualising data using tools such as Power BI
Understandingand interrogating business data to provide insights for Solutions Design
Developing tools to assist in the design process and streamline the SD function

What qualification will you achieve?

During the 24 month programme you will work to achieve the Fast Moving Consumer Goods, Level 3 Apprenticeship, covering the below and many more areas

identify data sources to meet the your team's requirement
cleanse and manage data
identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in data sets
analyse data to produce actionable insight
produce a range of standard and nonstandard statistical and data analysis reports
clearly and convincingly present a range of solutions derived from assessing data
You won't find another job like the one you'll find with DHL Supply Chain. Now, here's what we need from you:

GSCE Maths & English (Grade C or 4-9) or an equivalent functional skills level 2 qualification – We will require copies of these or copies of predicted grades for those who have not full completed their qualifications yet.
An ordered mind set
Eagerness to learn
Knowledge of all Sectors, Customers and Products beneficial
Computer literacy and knowledge of MS Office applications - desirable
the role is a hybrid working environment, there is a requirement for you to work within our site at Tyrefort, but also there will be days where you will be able to work from home.

What you'll need to do next?

If you have a proven track record of achievement to match the requirements for this role and you are looking for your next career move, simply apply online ensuring that a full up to date CV is attached with your application, along with your prior qualification certificates.

We will ensure that all our resourcing action are fair, transparent and consistent across the UK. We want to ensure that the candidate experience is of the highest professional standard.
DHL is passionate to ensure we provide equality of opportunity for all employees. Furthermore we aim to ensureworkplaces are free from discrimination and that not only employees but also our potential future employees are treated fairly and with dignity and respect. We ensure that equality of opportunity maintains a high profile in our organisation

For any questions regarding the Apprenticeship, please contact us:emergingtalent@dhl.com

f1ba451ffb83bda8.title: Energy Data Analyst
f1ba451ffb83bda8.description: About Best.EnergyBest.Energy is a global leader in energy monitoring and management and our mission is simple: to forge a built environment that is more energy efficient, more intelligent, more sustainable, and more pleasing to live and work in.Our industry leading technology and products are used in over 40 countries by hundreds of well known brands such as KFC, 7-Eleven, Walmart, IBM and McDonalds. We’re an outcomes focused business, and in the last 18 months, we have grown substantially and are proud to have such talented people in our business. To help us on our journey, we need more brilliant people to join us to tell the world about the great story never told. If working with purpose is important to you, and you want to contribute to protecting our planet, then read on.*The Role - Energy Data Analyst*As a Virtual Energy Manager at Best.Energy, you’ll help our customers achieve their energy saving goals. Your new role is centred around providing customers with knowledge and expertise on how their energy is being used and where they can make savings without impacting their business and identifying potential issues such as changes in the behaviour of assets.You may have previously worked in roles such as Energy Analyst, Data Analyst, Energy Manager or perhaps a Sustainability Consultant. The VEM team is located in several global locations (UK, US, and Malaysia) therefore collaboration and communication are key. This is a junior level role and will suit someone either recently having left education or, someone who has a couple of years experience in a data related role.Monitor equipment remotely though the Best.Energy Analytics platform and other online dashboards.Provide analysis and insight into how a customer site uses energy and other utilities to enable the customer to make smart decisions and save energy/utilities.Create and distribute reports based on analysis for distribution to customers and internally.Make recommendations for how to improve current ECMs (energy conservation measures)Recommend new ECMs to further save energy.Recommend changes in customer and staff behaviour to save energy and maintain customer standards.Create, monitor, and respond to alarms alerting to specific behaviour or circumstances to ensure ECMs are being followed, energy is being saved and customer business is not impacted.Identify changes in performance of equipment and potential maintenance issues and advise customers of these.Help customers resolve issues and follow-up any issues to ensure client satisfaction with outcomes.Work with the wider Energy Services Team to ensure the best possible service is delivered at all times.Contribute to ECM solution design and improvement.You - Virtual Energy ManagerTo be successful in this role you’ll need:Customer facing skills, confident communicator not afraid to pick up the phone and talk to customers.Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office products, especially excel and/or equivalent tools.Ability to analyse and manipulate data.Strong communication skills.What You’ll Get - Life at Best.EnergyLife at Best.Energy is busy - make no mistake about that! We’re people on a mission (and a great one at that) and we all look after each other. We’re about to unveil our shiny new offices in Bristol which you’ll have the option of working in with our hybrid working approach. For now, the role will be 100% WFH until our new space is ready. Our benefits package needs a little TLC, we know that and it’s something we’re working on, but hopefully you’ll love the sound of us and want to know more.Hybrid and WFH options.Location - Bristol, UK but considering applicants from across the South West.Pension scheme through NEST Pensions.25 days holiday + Bank Holidays.Monday - Friday 09.00 - 17.00 - flexible to suits parents and carersSalary £25 - £30k per annum DOE.We celebrate diversity and know that it’s critical for our success at Best.Energy. We’re working hard to make sure we’re inclusive. We welcome applications from black, Asian and minority ethnic candidates, LGBTQ+ candidates, candidates with disabilities and veterans. We encourage applications from all socio-economic backgrounds so if you’re brilliant at what you do then we want to hear from you.Location: BS1 2DP,Bristol, Bristol BS1Job Type: Full-timeSalary: £25,000.00-£30,000.00 per year

7110d918f53f2dbd.title: Data Analyst
7110d918f53f2dbd.description:
Site Name: UK - Surrey - Weybridge
Posted Date: Feb 15 2022
Consumer Healthcare have a new role for a Data Analyst on a full-time permanent basis.
The primary purpose of this role is to support the Consumer Health global Safety, Clinical and Medical (GSM) teams through support of master data and metadata to ensure data quality, consistency and to support overall inspection readiness state.
The role will involve interaction with business users and Tech partners to assess current state, continuously evaluating data requirements (active and archival) and assess impact to company’s established processes and intervene as issues are identified that will support the business in identifying operational efficiencies and KPI reporting on business activities and data quality reporting KPI’s.
Key Responsibilities
This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career. These responsibilities include some of the following:
Ensure quality of the data, accuracy and integrity of data flows and continuity of business processes
Development and maintenance of CH master data and ensure processes deliver timely and quality content for business users
Assist with plan development/strategy for implementation
Implementation and usage of datasets, content, and metadata to facilitate consistent usage, re-use, and data stewardship
Implement and document reports, dashboards, and insights through storytelling
Storytelling or share the results of the captured data to provide the best options for resolution to the initial inquiry
Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions
Ensure and support data quality standards are considered and maintained through all system versions
Support Audit/Assessment/Inspection readiness and participate in system internal audits and/or external inspections as needed
Accountable for resolving and escalating incidents, managing user requests in collaboration with Consumer Healthcare (CH) Tech team. Develop important messages relevant to all levels of stakeholders, including content and plan of systems releases, issues, etc
Why you?
What are we looking for?
Bachelor’s degree in related field (Scientific-related field or Computer Science / Information Management / Data Science)
Proven pharmaceutical industry and/or consumer goods industry knowledge and experience
Experience in a data operations support role within the R&D environment / data domain, with a focus on clinical trials, safety, or medical affairs
Experience and knowledge of all aspects of technical discipline – master data and content management plus analysis, and quality reporting
Strong professional communication skills with both technical & non-technical audiences
Be inquisitive for knowledge, drive for results. Keen to learn and continuously improve
Self-motivated and capable of working cross-functionally, across geographies and cultures
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Ability to work well under pressure with tight timelines
Desired Veeva, Stibo, Power BI, MS Forms, SharePoint, Expert in Microsoft Excel or similar system experience
Experience of working within Agile delivery methodology with an understanding of the system development life cycle a plus
Preferred experience:
If you possess the following in addition to the above, it would be a plus:
Technical background and computer proficiency in a variety of R&D systems, report building capabilities and familiarity with MS O365.
Enhanced customer service orientation and ability to communicate professionally to diverse cross functional non-technical and technical audiences.
Experience in work requiring high level of attention to detail and excellent follow-up.
Ability to learn new technologies quickly & be knowledgeable about integration of new platforms as required.
Application Details:
APPLICATION CLOSING DATE – 1st March 2022
Please take a copy of the Job Description, as this will not be available post closure of the advert.
When applying for this role, please use the ‘cover letter’ of the online application or your CV to describe how you meet the competencies for this role, as outlined in the job requirements above. The information that you have provided in your cover letter and CV will be used to assess your application.
Why Consumer Healthcare?
Right now, we’re on an incredible journey as we prepare to become the first independent, 100% focused consumer healthcare company. We’re doing this at a time when the work we do has never mattered more. Better everyday health is about improving the health and wellness of the consumers that we touch every year – over a billion and a half of them – and it goes beyond products. It’s about truly helping people manage their health proactively in different ways as consumer needs evolve.
With category leading brands such as Sensodyne, Voltaren and Centrum, built on trusted science and human understanding, and combined with our passion, knowledge and expertise, we’re uniquely placed to do this and to grow a strong, successful business.
This is an exciting time to join us and help shape the future. It’s an opportunity to be part of something special.
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
In Consumer Healthcare we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone.
We’re striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives
Location
Recently we’ve shared some exciting proposals with our colleagues which mark an important moment in our preparations for separation and becoming a new, standalone Consumer Healthcare company.
Our preparations are going well. GSK is on track to separate in mid-2022 and create two incredible new companies, each with the ability to improve the health of millions of patients and consumers worldwide, and both great places to work.
We’ve already confirmed that our new Consumer Healthcare company will be headquartered in the UK and the first step we’re taking is to announce proposals to move our CH business from our current location in GSK House in Brentford when we separate, into a new, CH headquarters in Weybridge. This will be a temporary, but important move in the short term, whilst we take this opportunity to design for the future and create an inspiring, flexible, collaborative workspace that meets the changing needs of our people and our business needs.
Inspired by our new culture and purpose, and with a commitment to our sustainability goals, we plan to build a new campus close by which would be home to our headquarters teams, our UK business, our global Oral Health category, R&D and innovation teams, as well as a state-of-the-art Shopper Science lab
As a company driven by our values of Patient focus, Transparency, Respect and Integrity, we know inclusion and diversity are essential for us to be able to succeed. We want all our colleagues to thrive at GSK bringing their unique experiences, ensuring they feel good and to keep growing their careers. As a candidate for a role, we want you to feel the same way.
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are open to all talent. In the US, we also adhere to Affirmative Action principles. This ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, colour, national origin, religion, gender, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class*(*US only).
We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.
Please don’t hesitate to contact us if you’d like to discuss any adjustments to our process which might help you demonstrate your strengths and capabilities. You can either call us on 0808 234 4391, or send an email ukdiversity.recruitment@gsk.com
As you apply, we will ask you to share some personal information which is entirely voluntary. We want to have an opportunity to consider a diverse pool of qualified candidates and this information will assist us in meeting that objective and in understanding how well we are doing against our inclusion and diversity ambitions. We would really appreciate it if you could take a few moments to complete it. Rest assured, Hiring Managers do not have access to this information and we will treat your information confidentially.
Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies
GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.
Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. For more information, please visit GSK’s Transparency Reporting For the Record site.

2aefed201a30bb1b.title: Data Analyst
2aefed201a30bb1b.description:
SB Digital Media is a performance marketing company that has been operating in the sector since 2012. Since then, it has grown steadily and is now looking to expand its team to meet the increased demand for its products and services globally. SB Digital Media is an innovative company driven by the passion of our excellent employees, we expect our team members to continuously seek to progress and achieve their targets to ensure that the company continues to reach its expansion goals. The company focuses on servicing a key set of unique clients that specialise in mobile marketing and service delivery. SB Digital is a leader in the field where the focus is on the staff working smart and technology does the heavy lifting to deliver results for the company and its clients.
The role of data analysts within the business is core to the success of each department. Responsibilities include contributing/delivering project work (often leading to direct bottom line company benefits) and working on ad-hoc analysis work for our different line of business teams, as and when required. As an example of ongoing project work requiring input we have:
Extending out traffic routing logic for best outcomes - Profit vs. Scale vs. Client satisfaction
Automating sales opportunity creation
Web funnel reporting and optimisations
Marketing campaign debugging/automation
Required Skills:

Strong knowledge MySQL, being able to handle large datasets. How indexing works, and good general knowledge of database systems
Hands-on experience of using Python in development, ideally to solve data problems
Advantageous attributes:
At least a Bachelor's in Statistics or a similar field
Experience of a mainstream data visualisation tool – Tableau, Power Bi, Qlik etc
3 year’s experience in a similar field
Naturally analytical approach to work

35b8ed473365be03.title: Quantitative Analyst
35b8ed473365be03.description:
Job Title: Quantitative Analyst
Corporate Title: Vice President
Division: Risk
Location: London
Overview:
The Model Risk and Analytics team provides independent oversight and governance for senior managers of model analytics and their implementation into the risk architecture that drive valuation, risk and stress results. Model Validation is responsible for the independent review and analysis of all derivative pricing models used for valuation and risk across the Bank.
Key Responsibilities:
Reviewing and analysing derivative models for price and risk of interest Rates, and Foreign Exchange (FX) products
Using deep understanding of the mathematical models used, implementation methods, products traded in these markets, and the associated risks
Completing theoretical analysis and reviewing it (where appropriate) that model/products are independently implemented in a managed C++ library
Reviewing, analysing, and independently implementing will form the basis of discussion with key model stakeholders including Front Office Trading, Front Office Quants, Market Risk Managers, and Finance Controllers
Actively engaging with the due diligence aspects of the New Product Approval Process and having involvement in Bank-wide strategic initiatives
Skills & Qualifications:
Educated to Bachelor’s degree level or equivalent qualification/relevant work experience in a numerate subject, such as Mathematics, Financial Mathematics, Physics or Statistics, is beneficial
Extensive experience in a Model Validation or Front Office Quant role
Excellent mathematical ability with an understanding of Stochastic Calculus, Partial Differential Equations, Monte-Carlo Methods, Finite Difference Methods, and Numerical Algorithms
Deep understanding of interest Rates and FX derivative models
Strong interest in financial markets (especially derivative pricing) demonstrated by qualifications and/or experience
Experience coding in C++ in a managed codebase
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.

We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.

bb9cd1b4d7672f3b.title: Image Analyst
bb9cd1b4d7672f3b.description:
We are looking for a highly motivated image analyst who is keen to learn more about new innovations involved in medical imaging to join our research group at the University of Oxford. The position offers the opportunity to work on a new collaboration between The University of Oxford and academic institutes in the USA. This exciting new project will involve the analysis of CT coronary artery (CTCA) scans from patients who have had COVID-19 infection to help us quantify changes in cardiovascular inflammation and plaque progression, and therefore help us to identify any ongoing cardiovascular risk post infection. You will report to Professor Charalambos Antoniades, the PI, and work alongside other team members contributing to the same projects.

You will be responsible for the analysis of medical images, and clinical and research project data. You will be required to liaise with clinical staff and other team members as part of image quality control, and to manage data received from a variety of sources.

You are required to hold a Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in a technical or life-science subject (e.g. biomedical sciences). Strong attention to detail and the ability to prioritise competing tasks will also be essential with experience of medical imaging / quantitative data analysis being desirable.

This is a full-time appointment on a fixed term contract for 3 years funded by The National Institutes of Health (NIH) COVID award with a possibility to extend depending on funding availability.

You will be based at RDM Division of Cardiovascular Medicine, John Radcliffe Hospital, Oxford, OX3 9DU and the new big-data facility recently established within the Acute Vascular Imaging Centre.

Applications for this vacancy are to be made online; you will be required to upload a CV and supporting statement which explains how you meet the selection criteria for the post.

Only applications received before 12.00 midday on 01 March 2022 can be considered. Interviews are scheduled to place at the beginning of March.

The University is an Equal Opportunity Employer
