b1a4e003ffd2e118.title: Junior Data Analyst
b1a4e003ffd2e118.description:
At Creditspring, we do things differently. We've completely turned lending on its head. By not charging interest, we believe we are on the same side as our members. We don't want them to stay in debt forever. We don't want them to borrow unnecessarily. We don't want to make money by confusing them.
We are looking for a candidate experienced in data analysis with knowledge of writing SQL (ideally PostgreSQL) and ideally a degree or higher within Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or a related discipline.
We are a fast-growing FCA-regulated consumer credit company, and our mission is to improve the financial stability and resilience of our customers by providing them with the tools they need to better manage their finances and steering them away from high-cost, short-term credit options.
You will be joining a world class, well-funded, diverse team from eighteen different countries that believe in the product they are building. We have grown significantly in the first half of 2021 and have ambitious plans for the second half of the year and beyond, scaling our product and team at an exciting pace.
What we need you to do:

You will work across the business to understand our operating model
You will be able to communicate effectively with key stakeholders to help them determine their requirements
You will help the team to triage tasks based on competing priorities
You will be responsible for making improvements to, and maintaining, existing dashboards
You will develop ad-hoc and new reporting working together with the cross-functional teams
You will be adept at both SQL and Excel (or G Sheets)


What we need you to have:

Proven experience with SQL
Proven data analysis experience with either Excel or Google sheets
The ability to work as part of a team but also enjoy working independently to prioritise tasks based on different stakeholder requirements
Existing knowledge or a demonstrable appetite to learn about the UK consumer credit market
Interest in data visualisation skills with a BI platform (Qlik Sense would be ideal)


And be:

Curious about the wider company and proactive about offering ideas (and solutions) on how to improve things
Open-minded to other viewpoints and different approaches
Able to work independently in some situations but collaborate with the team for larger or cross-functional projects


Working at Creditspring means you will get:

Flexible working conditions
Equity participation
£1500 personal training budget for conferences, courses and books
Health Insurance with Bupa
Classpass membership

192e6f2e75fdb171.title: Data Analyst, EMEA
192e6f2e75fdb171.description:
Who we are
At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.
Overview
Analytics at Criteo is about transforming business problems into solutions using data. You will provide actionable insights and recommendations that empower our stakeholders to make informed business decisions, generating more revenue for our clients and for Criteo.
Partnering closely with commercial and technical teams in our respective markets, we provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry in order to meet the objectives set by our advertisers. We also focus on delivering insights, improvements, and recommendations that will have immediate and measurable impacts. We get to play with exciting technologies such as Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git and Python to grow the portfolio of analyses that we offer to internal and external stakeholders. We are always excited to take initiatives and enjoy the process of starting from an idea, then carrying out a complex data analysis, developing the results with the commercial teams and presenting it with them to our clients. We rely on each other’ strengths, experiences & ideas, and work collaboratively as a team to constantly innovate in an open, fun and inclusive environment.
What you´ll do : Client insights: you will analyse complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights Business strategy: you will partner with the commercial team to help drive client strategy and direction Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership teams Testing: you will design, monitor and analyse A/B tests to understand better how our products work for our clients Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company Strategic Big Data Synergies: this doesn’t actually mean anything, but we’re happy you read this description until here. If you’re open to play Among Us with us, we’ll be happy to have you!
Who you are : You are a logical thinker and are interested in analytics You have previous experience in problem solving You are business-minded and want to drive business strategy using data You are a strong team player and feel comfortable in a highly collaborative environment Some experience in SQL, Python, Tableau would be a plus. If not, a willingness to learn it! You are fluent in English and are able to communicate about complex subjects to non-technical stakeholders Must be eligible to work in the UK full-time with no restriction. (you’re a data wizard Harry)!
Why you'll love us : Competitive compensation Career advancement and global mobility opportunities Medical and dental insurance to maintain your client-facing smile Generous vacation policy
How you’ll be working : Office: open space Teleworking/work-from-home Nearly exclusively on-screen work (laptop) Job may require travel for client meetings (once/twice per quarter) Special ergonomic advice possible Semi flexible-working hours If you need special working hour flexibility, we’re open to discussing it
We value teamwork, openness, technical innovation, and results-oriented thinking. Join us to contribute to one of the leading-edge technologies in the online industry, in a multicultural and open environment!
#wttj
At Criteo, we are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed.
Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

27ca132e72c9af14.title: Principal Information Analyst
27ca132e72c9af14.description:
Band 8a

Barts Health NHS Trust is one of Britain’s leading healthcare providers and the largest trust in the NHS. It was created on 1 April 2012 by bringing together three trusts: Barts and The London NHS Trust, Newham University Hospital NHS Trust and Whipps Cross University Hospital NHS Trust. The new trust has a turnover of approximately £1.1 billion and employs approximately 15,000 staff.

An opportunity has arisen within the Business Intelligence Team for a Principal Information Analyst.

The Government has announced that the legal requirement for all NHS workers in England, to be double vaccinated, is currently under legislative review.

We do however encourage those in roles that have face to face contact with patients to be double vaccinated against COVID-19 (unless they are medically exempt), and are continuing to support the vaccination uptake for all staff as this remains the best line of defence.

This key position will support the Business Intelligence Senior Partner in the provision of accurate and timely information for the site management team. The post holder will also be responsible for the provision of information to both internal and external customers.

As part of a wider Business Intelligence Team, we will support you in the development of both your knowledge and management skills.

The successful candidate will play an active role in providing information to support the operational management and strategic development of the site. They will enjoy working with managers and clinicians to improve services and make data meaningful.

Barts Health is one of the largest NHS trusts in the country, and one of Britain’s leading healthcare providers.

The Barts Health group of NHS hospitals is entering an exciting new era on our improvement journey to becoming an outstanding organisation with a world-class clinical reputation. Having lifted ourselves out of special measures, we now have the impetus and breathing space to chart a fresh course in which we are continually striving to improve all our services for patients.

Our vision is to be a high-performing group of NHS hospitals, renowned for excellence and innovation, and providing safe and compassionate care to our patients in east London and beyond. That means being a provider of excellent patient safety, known for delivering consistently high standards of harm-free care and always caring for patients in the right place at the right time. It also means being an outstanding place to work, in which ourWeCarevalues and behaviours are visible to all and guide us in how we work together.

We strive to live by ourWeCarevalues and are committed to promoting inclusion, where every staff member has a sense of belonging. We value our differences and fully advocate, cultivate and support an inclusive working environment..

We particularly welcome applications from Black, Asian and minority ethnic candidates as they are underrepresented within Barts Health at this band.

This is a golden opportunity for the right person to further their career in the exciting field of health informatics.

If you think that you have the requisite skills and experience to meet this challenge, then we would like to hear from you.

In return we will offer you the opportunity to further develop your skills, be recognised for them and to make a difference.

For an informal discussion please contact Paul Bird on 0734 084 7589.

4f61ebac35d5d89c.title: Group Sustainability Data Analyst – London/UK
4f61ebac35d5d89c.description: Company Description*Informa PLC is a leading international events, intelligence and scholarly research group.*Our purpose is to champion the specialist. Through hundreds of powerful brands, we work with businesses and professionals in specialist markets, providing the connections, intelligence, and opportunities that help customers grow, do business, make breakthroughs, and take better-informed decisions. Informa is listed on the London Stock Exchange and a member of FTSE 100, with around 10,000 colleagues working in over 35 countries.FasterForward is Informa’s approach to sustainable business.In 2021, Informa was named top of our sector in the DJSI, ranked 5th in the FTSE100 for our approach to climate change by EcoAct’s annual ranking, and scored well in a collection of other rankings and indices including A- in the CDP. This builds on several awards over the last three years for being the most improved business on sustainability – something that we believe comes from our committed approach to this agenda.To see more info about FasterForward, please click this link: https://www.informa.com/sustainability/faster-forward/The sustainability team in InformaIn the last five years, Informa has invested significantly in sustainability, growing the team to 15 people spread across the business supported by 100s of sustainability champions.Job Description*Introduction*We’ve created this role to offer someone the opportunity to join our growing team to help us meet these challenges and learn from experienced sustainability reporting and engagement professionals.The Group Sustainability Data Analyst will report into the Group Sustainability & Reporting Manager, who in return reports into the Head of Sustainability.Informa operates a balanced working model, with some home working and some office working. Most of our sustainability team is based out of our London offices. Our expectation is that the role would be hybrid working between home and office working, preferably in the UK, but other locations would be considered for the right candidate but with some required trips to our London office.Key Responsibilities*This role will primarily be working together with the Group Sustainability & Reporting Manager and the wider Sustainability team to support Informa’s sustainability reporting, including our annual sustainability report, our FasterForward commitments, submissions to a dozen indices such as CDP and DJSI, investor and banker reporting, and obligations to comply with reporting schemes such as the UK Energy Savings Opportunity Scheme (ESOS) and the Streamlined Energy and Carbon Reporting (SECR). It will also involve helping find ways to improve performance through special projects working with others in the business.The role will engage heavily with Informa’s other teams including communications, compliance, HR, IT, events management and the wider sustainability functions, as well as teams from around the business.The Group Sustainability Data Analyst is primarily responsible for:Supporting with Informa’s reporting and compliance obligations such as the Sustainability Report, Dow Jones Sustainable Index (DJSI), CDP, FTSE4Good, ESOS, SECR, Ethibel and other programmes.Working with colleagues from across the business ranging from IT and privacy to compliance, H&S, HR and marketing, to gather groupwide non-financial KPIs environmental and social data, analyse it and report back to them and other stakeholders.Identifying and filling gaps in the data through resilient chasing and/or appropriate extrapolation.Calculating carbon footprint for use in our carbon neutral certifications for our company and products.Supporting with the collation of metrics such as economic impact assessments, social impact assessmentsSupporting with the preparation of our annual sustainability report including the design, selection of stories and designing appropriate ways of explaining out performance.Identifying ways to improve our approaches to data collection, reporting and performance such as the installation of new non-financial data reporting systems, use of tools such as PowerBI etc.Working with the group sustainability teams, as well as other teams such as finance, procurement etc, to identify routes to improving our performance.Supporting work with our procurement teams to engage with our top 100 suppliers on sustainable procurement.Supporting, and project managing where appropriate, on other projects such as our work on the UN SDGs, science-based targets, net zero, economic impact, etc.Provide support to Sustainability Team on ongoing projects such as research and analysis.This list is not exhaustive and the right candidate is expected to be involved in a variety of other activities and engage with any other reasonable duties as required. Each of these will be delivered in partnership with other sustainability team members.Qualifications*Essential skills*A passion for robust data that allows consistent and insightful analysis as well as the tenacity and resilience to track down missing data, and the ability to accept gaps and extrapolations where necessary.Attention to detail and the ability to work to a high standard, while balancing a diverse workload effectively in order to meet key deadlines. The candidate needs to be incredibly reliable with the ability to focus.Ability to perform analytical-related activities of large amounts of data and identify trends, as well as the actions to improve both the data collection and the performance.Intermediate to advanced Excel capability and ability to learn new technology platforms: in particular experience in data manipulation in Excel including PivotTables and analysis is essential.Experience working with incomplete data and extrapolating in an effective way.Happy to manage own tasks responsibly and work independently, with little supervision but working within a common mission and an absolute ability to ‘catch the balls and run with them’.Flexible, proactive, and collaborative attitude.Self-motivated, driven, and open to new challenges.Analytical mindset and curious nature able to absorb detail and identify actionable insights.Demonstrated interest in Sustainability and making an impact in the world is absolutely key.Good communication skills in English.Desirable skillsPrior experience in a role focusing on financial or sustainability data is preferable. This role might be well suited to someone looking to transition from a finance or analytics role into sustainability, or someone new into sustainability who has a real interest in data and analysis.An understanding of corporate sustainability reporting across a variety of ESG topics.Experience in tools such as PowerBI or other data analysis or presentation tools.Ability to communicate effectively with individuals at all levels.Project management experience.Additional Information*Why work for Informa?*25 days annual leave plus bank holidays, 4 days for volunteering and a day off for your Birthday!Friendly staff who are all “expert’s experts” and additional training for developmentPension match and a range of other entirely flexible benefits to suit your needsRegular Social Events and Networking opportunitiesShare-Match options - become a shareholder!We know that sometimes the 'perfect candidate' doesn't exist, and that people can be put off applying for a job if they don't fit all the requirements. If you're excited about working for us and have most of the skills or experience we're looking for, please go ahead and apply. You could be just what we need! We believe strongly in the value of diversity and creating supportive, inclusive environments where our colleagues can succeed. As such, Informa is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, ancestry, national origin, religion, or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, citizenship, or other protected characteristics under local law.Location: 5 Howick Place, London SW1PJob Type: Full-time

5037275f45adb35d.title: Data Analyst
5037275f45adb35d.description:
Job Outline:
Due to high growth within the company, we are looking to grow our Data Team to help us provide agile data across all aspects of the business. This is an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst who is looking for a varied and interesting role in Europe’s largest equity crowdfunding platform. The job is based in our Exeter or Cardiff office with flexible remote working.
Who we are:
As a leading European retail investment marketplace, Crowdcube raises finance for Europe's hottest high-growth businesses by giving investors the opportunity to back businesses they believe in. Having amassed an investor community of over 1 million people, which has funded over 1,000 businesses, Crowdcube was named the most active investor in private equity in 2020.
Crowdcube was inspired by an unshakable belief in entrepreneurs that dream big, push at the edges and want to make a difference. Our mission is to democratise investment, helping to fuel the next generation of business who want to leave a mark on the world.
Since founding in 2011, we’ve successfully funded over 1,000 campaigns with brands from across the globe, such as Monzo, Brewdog, Grind, Cowboy, Mintos and what3words.
Working within the Data Team to provide agile data that yields insights and inspires data-driven decision making across the business.
Day to day you will:

Liaise with 3rd party data aggregators to ensure accuracy of Crowdcube data

Work with all departments across the organisation, to help them understand their data needs and collaborate to provide effective solutions

Monitor and respond to internal data requests

Maintain data integrity within internal data systems

Liaise with one of the Product teams to provide data support and considerations to upcoming and current projects.

Requirements:

Knowledge of SQL, Excel, Google Sheets

At least one year commercial experience in an analyst role

The ability to think critically and solve problems

Ideally you will:

Have professional experience preferably in a financial context
Have knowledge of data visualisation tools (desirable)

And will be:

A great communicator and team player

Eager to learn and demonstrate initiative

Comfortable working in a fast-changing business

What we are offering:
We like to nurture talent and ensure members of our team develop and hone their skills through training, attending conferences and subscriptions to online courses. We’re passionate and hard-working, and we take care of our team:

£25 - £30K per annum DOE
Participation in the employee share option plan (subject to the prevailing company policy at the time)
25 days holiday + bank holidays + holiday for tenure
Pension Scheme at 4% matched (UK Residents Only)
Private Medical Scheme with AXA including dental and optical cash plans
Access to Healing Clouds, a mental health platform
Life Assurance Scheme (4 x salary)
Access to Sunlight - a learning & development platform with a £1000 training and wellness budget per year
Cycle to Work Scheme
Weekly demos to show what we're working on, monthly team meetings
Company perks such as fruit, snacks, fitness classes and weekly office beers
Company outings and activities (previous fun included a trip to a gin distillery, karaoke, charity football match, Square Mile Relay, bowling and a day at River Cottage)

Our interview process typically consists of an initial phone screen, an interview with the hiring manager and a task, followed by a final interview with other members of the team. There aren't any trick questions and the task will typically be based on a real scenario the team have worked on.
Our policy is to employ the best-qualified people and provide equal opportunity for the advancement of employees including promotion and training and not to discriminate against any person because of gender, race, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion, belief or disability.
We are a flexible workplace. Cuber Choice enables Cubers and future Cubers to do their best work, in whatever way is best for them and the business. We commit to treating all employees equally, whether they are home or office-based. We do not reward presenteeism but focus on impact. Employees may choose a different work schedule to meet personal or family needs. This includes early finishes, late starts, selecting your own working hours, and you may also choose to split your time between home and office.

e53f7f34a4f4b186.title: Reporting +Data Analyst
e53f7f34a4f4b186.description: MBA are proud to partner one of the Midlands most innovative technology organisations in their search for an experienced Reporting & Data Analyst on a permanent basis.The role is Remote / Home working, office is based in Central Birmingham.Working as part of the Business Intelligence & Reporting Team, the Reporting & Data Analyst is responsible for delivering business intelligence to customers and internal stakeholders using Qlik Sense.The Reporting & Data Analyst will be responsible for analysing raw data to produce digestible, informed results that key stakeholders can use to make business decisions.The role holder will be expected to use their own initiative, working with available tools and systems, to identify new opportunities and develop new analysis frameworks. They will be required to work closely with product managers, sales, operations and customers to develop new revenue streams, efficiencies and products in line with our overall strategy and goals.The dashboards need to be built from the ground up, so extensive experience with data extraction and transformation scripts using Qlik Sense for complex data sets is essential.Experience using N-Printing, extensions, mashups and integrating Qlik into other applications are all advantages for this role.Candidates need a flair for intuitive design using Qlik Sense and have the confidence to demonstrate their applications to large audiences and senior management.Reporting & Data Analyst – ResponsibilitiesThe Reporting & Data Analyst will be responsible for the following activities:Collaborate with colleagues, suppliers and customers to create and sign off BI requirementsAnalyse and interpret multiple data sets, including complex data, to create integrated data models, dashboards and reportsApply critical thinking skills and perform advanced analytics with the goal of solving complex and multi-faceted business problems utilising Qlik SenseProduce and present data to business stakeholders in a clear, concise and informed manner which can be used to make business decisionsWork with accuracy and attention to details address data anomalies providing accurate information to stakeholdersEffectively communicate with project team members and sponsors throughout the project lifecycle (status updates, gaps/risks, roadblocks, testing outcomes, etc.)Develop, monitor and maintain business forecasting models which support the business in managing riskPro-actively seek process efficiencies and business opportunities within current and new data sourcesSupport product development through integration of new data sources including telematicsSupport team administration tasks as requiredAssist with training new team members or multiskilling colleaguesReporting & Data Analyst - ExperienceWorked previously in data analyst role or similarProven ability to strategically develop complex, highly visible analytical dashboards from concept through implementationStrong background working with leading BI tools, specifically Qlik Sense and associated productsKnowledge & experience of Data Warehousing / Data Lake / Business Intelligence strategies and architectureCan demonstrate track record of developing data models and analysis to support business goalsExperience with telematics data and automotive/fleet industry preferable but not essentialGet-it-done mindset with a strong bias towards action.Ability to translate ambiguous business problems into a conceptual analytical and technical architectureProficient in conducting advanced statistical analyses, working with large data sets. Has demonstrated ability to apply statistical methodologies to identify value add to the businessReporting & Data Analyst Skills & QualificationsExcellent knowledge of developing in Qlik Sense and associated productsExcellent knowledge of Microsoft Office and other commonly used office packagesGood mathematical and statistical knowledgeStrong problem-solving skillsKnowledge of programming languages including SQLExcellent written and verbal communication skillsQualifications within a relevant subject matterAbility to work on own initiative when requiredReporting & Data Analyst - PerksCompany pension schemeFlexible working / holidaysTraining and development opportunitiesSalary: £30,000 / £40,000Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £30,000.00-£40,000.00 per yearAdditional pay:Bonus schemeBenefits:Flexible scheduleWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shift

f27063cfe421abfc.title: Data Support Analyst
f27063cfe421abfc.description:
Data Support Analyst – Saint-Gobain Off-Site Solutions Division

‘Making the world a better home’ – Saint-Gobain’s purpose, we have a history spanning more than 350 years and have a responsibility to address the major challenges faced by humanity. We are on a journey to make the world a beautiful and sustainable place to live and have pledged to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2050!

Off-Site Solutions Division is a collection of specialist manufacturers of high quality products and building systems. Offering expertise in design, logistics, supply chain, delivered through a partnership approach with our specialist brands International Timber, Intrastack, Pasquill, Roofspace Solutions and Scotframe.

For hundreds of years, Saint-Gobain has been at the forefront of materials innovation. We’re now harnessing the collective expertise within our manufacturing and distribution brands to help our partners embrace the opportunities available through off-site construction.

This is a fantastic opportunity to join as a Data Support Analyst with Off-Site Solutions (Chorley) where you are responsible for maintaining Master Product Files across our Trading and Engineering Applications. Liaising with Buying Department on Supplier, Product and Cost updates and providing management reports on Business requirements, movements, usage and stock levels.

As a Data Support Analyst member you will be involved in:

Maintenance of the Master Product Files in both Trading and Engineering applications, maintaining a direct link between the 2 databases.
Rationalising and cleansing the databases.
Maintaining supplier database to capture relevant data that relates to the supply of goods into the business, to include price updates and the tracking of any increases.
Creating data extraction reports in the business ERP and design the mechanism for moving this data into SQL Server.
Designing data collection tools for capturing information not available within the companies ERP and then design the mechanism for moving this data into SQL Server.
Resolving data issues within databases to explain and correct issues.
Interviewing stakeholders to design reports that help to make decisions.
Providing analysis and reporting support to the finance team when resource cover is required.
Constantly reviewing Products & identify rationalisation dependent on requirement & availability.
Preparing reports for internal and external audiences using business analytics reporting tools.
Creating easy to follow Data visualisations & Dashboards with user interaction.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Am I who you are looking for?

First and foremost, we always want to recruit talented people that align well with our values and way of working; we innovate, we collaborate, we’re agile, we act with entrepreneurial spirit, and we’re supportive of and close to our customers. Does this sound like you?

To be suitable for the Data Support Analyst role you will have:

Further education in an IT Science subject (college/university level).
A-Level Mathematics and GCSE English or equivalent.
Highly capable in Excel, Pivot tables, Charts etc.
An understanding of the fundamentals of databases.
Excellent communication skills, written, verbal & listening.
Demonstrate a strong analytical mind-set.
Windows / Microsoft Product knowledge.
Hold a valid UK driving license (desirable).

There are 32+ fascinating Saint-Gobain businesses that recruit talented people in the UK and Ireland. However, regardless of which business you join, you are assured to be welcomed into a professional and warm environment, where we value all of our employees equally and have a strong focus on their health, safety and wellbeing at all times.

This vacancy is working for Saint-Gobain Off-Site Solutions Division, Saint-Gobain is the world leader in the habitat and construction markets, with over 170,000 employees and operations in 67 countries worldwide. With such a significant presence we are proud to offer our employees a career without boundaries… Are You in?

What are the benefits?

In addition to a competitive base salary, you will benefit from a significant focus on your own personal development and also have access to:

A defined contribution pension scheme.
31 days holiday including the statutory bank holidays (Increasing to 33 with service).
A defined share purchasing scheme (Each month you put away an agreed amount from your ‘pre-tax' pay and we use it to buy Saint-Gobain shares for you. As an added bonus, for every four shares you buy Saint-Gobain will give you an extra share free of charge).
As an employee, you are automatically covered by the Saint-Gobain Life Assurance Scheme.
Staff discounts and various other benefits.

The world of work is changing, and at Saint-Gobain we are open to new ways of working in order to attract talented people to our business. We understand that everyone has different needs and commitments. Therefore, we are very open to discuss any flexible requirement or need that you may have for this role. We can’t guarantee to meet all requests for flexibility when we are recruiting. But, we promise to listen.

So are you up for handling the ultimate, frontline responsibility for a business and its goals? Could you help sustain a world class reputation? Then apply today!

c1adcbc29bfae3ef.title: BI Analyst
c1adcbc29bfae3ef.description: Nice to meet you - we are Kornit X!We are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team!As a BI Analyst you will help create data-driven strategies that maximize proficiency and productivity with our products and services. You will work with our finance, product and management teams to mine data, display KPIs, develop analytics tools and deliver them to our customers and staff.If you have a passion for data and a highly analytical mind, as well as great written and verbal communication skills – you belong with us! We need you to proactively spot customer trends, create data awareness and help push our business forward.Reports to:  Finance DirectorLocation:  Manchester, United KingdomWhat will you do?Understand our software platform and design data end pointsDevelop KPIs to measure both business performance, industry trends and software usageMonitor analytics and metrics results, perform data profiling to identify and understand anomaliesBuild interactive dashboards to allow both staff and customers to identify best network partners - our GFN productWork closely with customers and our team, to develop business intelligence reports and dashboards, whilst promoting trends through graphical reporting.Identify opportunities to improve processes and strategies with technology solutionsPerform deep analysis of issues and develop solutionsCreate and maintain documentation including requirements, design and user manualsCollaborate, train and provide technical support to the business users on our different BI productsRequirements:﻿What should you have?Ideally, a Degree in Mathematics/Computer Science with specialism in information systemsAt least 3 years of experience in BI analytic systemsVery good knowledge in Power BIAbility to write code and create DAX measures - an advantageData driven person with proven analytical and problem-solving skillsExperience integrating new software and programs to data servicesHighly familiar with databases, data analysis, SQL language and complex stored proceduresAbility to contribute both independently and as part of a teamExcellent listening, communication, interpersonal and presentation skillsHighly motivated and proactive problem solverJob Type: Full-time

b83100415721fd6d.title: Data Insight Analyst
b83100415721fd6d.description: Location: Blend of London Office and Home workingWorking hours:  Minimum of 35 hours per weekContract:  PermanentThe Salvation Army is looking for a Data Insight Analyst to join its incredibly successful Marketing & Fundraising Department. We raise over £90 million a year and this role is a key part of that success.As the Data Insight Analyst you will be responsible for delivering insight and analysis to the fundraising teams so they can make informed decisions around their fundraising strategies. You will have a strong understanding of data and the ability to communicate key findings to a variety of audiences. You will have experience of scheduling and delivering analysis requests, as well as being proactive at looking for trends within the data and providing actionable insights.This is an exciting opportunity to bring your specialist skills to one of the UK’s most inspiring and best-known organisations. As part of a small, dedicated data team you will have a real impact on our fundraising strategies and growth.In summer 2023 The Territorial Headquarters will be moving to a new, modern headquarters at Denmark Hill, London, SE5 8BQ. 28cb5208b0cff603.title: Junior Data Analyst
28cb5208b0cff603.description:
Junior Data Analyst
There is an exciting and dynamic entry level opportunity at BGC Partners to join the European Swaps desk as a Data Analyst/ Inputter. You will be part of a highly experienced team who are eager to teach and train new recruits.
BGC Partners is a leading global brokerage company servicing the financial and real estate markets, based in Canary Wharf, London. We are experts in our fields, agile and dynamic in our approach, and built upon the foundation of cutting-edge technology and exceptional talent.

Key Responsibilities:
Ensure the smooth running of the desk, inputting data into the system.
Assisting with the day-to-day operational and administrative functions of the desk and providing support to the wider team where necessary.
Adhere to BGC’s policies and compliance with BGC’s operational risk requirements.
Opportunity for progression on the desk, and the move from internal data to data that will be visible to clients.

Key Skills/Experience:
Strong technical and Microsoft Excel skills essential.
Strong market awareness and understanding.
Strong numerical and statistical skills.

Personal attributes:
Resilient, motivated and dynamic attitude.
Personable with the ability to build relationships with stakeholders and customers.
Personal and professional integrity.
Ability to work in a high-pressured, intense environment.
Self-motivated and able to demonstrate initiative.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Highly organized, punctual and pro-active.
Excellent attention to detail.
Dedication and the ability to adapt and overcome adversity.

To all recruitment agencies – BGC Partners & affiliates do not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our job alias, employees or any other company location. BGC Partners & affiliates are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Please contact the Recruitment function for additional details.

dfe02ca70dfd9c0c.title: Data Analyst
dfe02ca70dfd9c0c.description:
Location: Home Based

Grade: K4

Reports to: Head of Operations SQE

Direct reports: None

Key stakeholders: SQE Senior Leadership Team, SQE teams, SRA, SQE Candidates

Who we are & what we stand for

We design and deliver world-leading professional assessments. In 2018, we were
appointed as the independent assessment organisation for the new Solicitors Qualifying
Examination (SQE) which is being introduced in 2021. This will become the sole route to
qualifying as a Solicitor of England and Wales and be taken by upwards of 13,000
candidates per year.

We are part of the Kaplan group, one of the world’s largest and most diverse education
and assessment providers. We operate in over 30 countries and maintain relationships
and partnerships with more than 1,000 school districts, colleges and universities,
professional bodies and over 10,000 businesses. Our vast breadth and scope in terms
of both capabilities and assets sets us apart.

We work hard to make this a great place to work where everyone can succeed. Sex,
race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion or other belief, marital
status, pregnancy or parenthood - none of these should be a barrier to anybody’s
success at Kaplan. If you require any adjustments, or additional support within the
recruitment process, please contact us directly and we’ll do our best to help.


How you’ll help us succeed

You’ll be helping us deliver outstanding assessments by managing our data and
providing high quality analysis to inform key decisions and drive improvements. You
will also be championing our efforts to ensure that we remain GDPR compliant, working
with the Kaplan GDPR team. This is a brand new role, so the ability to be flexible and
adapt as the SQE grows and develops will be crucial.

Data Reporting and Analysis
Work with key stakeholders to standardise reporting requirements, developing

and enhancing reporting to support the delivery of the SQE
Interrogation of data to aid strategic decision makingEnsure that all routine data analysis tasks are carried out within the specified

timescales
Create high quality management information that’s easily accessible and easy to

understand
Keep the SQE KPI dashboard up to date ensuring that reporting deadlines are

met
Aid or Assist the forecasting of candidate numbers, engaging with key

stakeholders to understand assumptions and the factors driving any trends
Assist with the creation of candidate satisfaction surveys, including the provision

of the relevant data set and analysis output
Assist with the maintenance of Monitoring and Maximising Diversity surveys for

candidates and staff (MMD surveys) and support the team with the associated
analysis and reporting related to them
Continuous monitoring of candidate bookings and analysis of booking trends

GDPR Business Champion

As the SQE GDPR Business Champion you will provide a point of contact within the SQE
team to help the business to better incorporate GDPR compliance into day to
day operations. The GDPR Business Champion will:
Make the team aware of the resources available to support GDPR compliance
and Kaplan specific GDPR processes; ensuring these policies are reflected in the
teams day to day processes of working
Provide basic GDPR coaching for new starters and in response to queries from
the team, and identify emerging training issues from within the SQE Team in
relation to GDPR
Review data breach incident reports and liaise the relevant stakeholders in
regard to preventative action
Take responsibility for specific GDPR activities (e.g. ensuring the Data Retention
Schedule and data purge plan remains up-to-date);

Candidate Scheduling & Results
Work with the Operations, IT and Psychometric teams to ensure that the results
processing data is accurate
Support the Operations Manager for Timetabling with candidate scheduling, as
required

7d4246ba789cf887.title: Investment Data Solutions Analyst
7d4246ba789cf887.description:
Investment Data Solutions Analyst
London
As a Barclays Investment Data Solutions Analyst, you will work within The Investment Data Solutions team. The team applies advanced data techniques to deliver quantitative and qualitative analysis on investment performance and investment risk based on data driven insights, to both the WM&I entity and its clients. Across a broad spectrum of standard and alternative investment vehicles, the team utilises a variety of investment performance and investment risk methodologies to meet client requirements.

Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.

What will you be doing?
• Executing deep dive diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive analytics and data solutions to enhance investment performance and risk analysis in each stages of the investment process
Developing complex queries and performing extensive programming to access, transform, and prepare data for statistical modellingEnhancing the existing advance analytics modelling, methodologies and contributing to new ideas in methodology and modelling, algorithms and report visualizationContributing to the enhancements of the investment performance and investment risk infrastructure to ensure market practices, standards and competencies are followedDesigning and creating reports/dashboards using a range of data sources and making the information accessible, understandable and usable by audienceAdapting delivery style of investment data solutions to the audience and outputs findings, requirements and insights to both technical and non-technical audiences as requested
What we’re looking for:
• Excellent numerical and quantitative competency combined with accuracy in investment performance and risk reporting
High levels of analytic, consulting, influencing and presentation skills and an ability to communicate with ease and credibility with stakeholdersExperienced in dashboard and reporting design and creationAbility to manage and influence stakeholders, both internally and externally, while working to challenging timelines
Skills that will help you in the role:
• A minimum a graduate degree; preferably with a post graduate qualification or equivalent Chartered qualifications (CFA, CQF, FRM)
Relevant work experience in investment/data analytical rolesFamiliar with WM&I business, investment process, products and servicesA good understanding of third party investment analytical platforms including but not limited to Morningstar, Factset, Bloomberg and their data methodology
Where will you be working?
In the heart of Canary Wharf, our headquarters at Churchill Place boasts onsite amenities such as a gym, staff restaurant and deli bar, and is easily accessible by tube and bus links. With a population of around 5000 staff the atmosphere is second to none with a real buzz being created around the offices within.

e89e51771b264c0d.description:

What you will be doing...
Reporting to the Revenue Planning Manager, the Airline Revenue Analyst is responsible for optimising the amount of revenue generated on Jet2.com flights by managing ticket prices to our fantastic range of Sun, City and Ski destinations.

In this role, you will take responsibility for a portfolio of Jet2.com flights, for which you will decide the price of each seat that we sell. You will use a variety of pricing strategies to ensure that we maximise both the load factor and yield achieved on each flight within your portfolio. This role is data driven – key responsibilities include analysing sales, identifying trends and forecasting future demand, and you will utilise a host of different data analysis tools and reports, including Microsoft Excel and Tableau, as well as our bespoke Revenue Management System. Consequently, you must be analytical, with great attention to detail – the ability to make reasoned and informed pricing decisions, after analysing data from different sources, is crucial to success in this position.

Furthermore, you will be a dynamic, approachable and proactive team player, as you will be working closely with a number of internal departments, including our Holidays Revenue, Network Planning and Contact Centre Teams.

Additional responsibilities include providing prices to our Groups department, based on analysis of flight performance, to ensure the best available fares are provided for large bookings, along with processing aircraft and schedule changes, making suggestions where we could better utilise our varied fleet of aircraft to maximise our revenue generating opportunities. You will also monitor all competitors of Jet2.com and Jet2holidays, ensuring our fares are fully optimised within the marketplace.

Experience within Revenue Management, although not essential, and a keen interest in the aviation / travel industry would be highly advantageous in this role.

In return, we offer an excellent salary and benefits package with fantastic opportunities for progression in a growing business.

This is a great opportunity to be part of an exciting, forward-thinking business. We operate scheduled leisure flights to holiday destinations in the Mediterranean, the Canary Islands and to European Leisure Cities from our 10 UK bases.

Help us to send our all-important customers on holiday with Jet2.com and Jet2holidays!!

bac20beaa5dcd1ee.title: Global Data Analyst - Marketing
bac20beaa5dcd1ee.description:
Job Title: Global Data Analyst - Marketing
Location: UK, Port Sunlight or Kingston
About Unilever
Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of Food, Home and Personal Care products with sales in over 190 countries and reaching 2 billion consumers a day. Unilever has more than 400 brands found in homes around the world, including Persil, Dove, Knorr, Domestos, Hellmann’s, Lipton, Wall’s, PG Tips, Ben & Jerry’s, Marmite, Magnum and Lynx. Faced with the challenge of climate change and the need for human development, we want to move towards a world where everyone can live well and within the natural limits of the planet. That’s why our purpose is ‘to make sustainable living commonplace”
About Data & Analytics at Unilever
For Unilever to remain competitive in the future, we need to continue the path to become data intelligent. The purpose of the Data & Analytics team is to help Unilever become Data Intelligent and a clear analytical competitor- partnering with the business to power key decisions with data, insights, advanced analytics and AI.
Our ambition is to enable democratisation of data, information and insights as a completely agile organisation that builds fantastic careers for our people and is accountable for delivering great work that maximises impact and delivers growth.
The Data & Analytics function endeavours to create clear accountabilities for all aspects of Data Strategy, Data Management, Information Management, Analytics, and Insights. We are accountable for impact of solutions, maintaining market relevance and minimising unnecessary overlaps in analytics products, ensuring simplicity and that our solutions better meet the needs of our users.
We have four key operating principles:
One teamConnected to the businessDeploying with pace and disciplineDesigning for experience
Our vision is to make Unilever data intelligent, partnering with the business to power key decisions with data, advanced analytics and AI to accelerate growth.
Our 5 strategies to achieve this are:
Accelerate & simplify access to relevant data, information and insightsBuild in-house, leading-edge data, information, insights & analytics capabilityLead the data & insights culture and careers to empower employees across
Unilever
Rapidly embed analytics products, solutions and services to drive growthAdvance Information Automation at Scale
Job Purpose
This is an exciting opportunity to join the Global Global Marketing Data Team as part of Data & Analytics, Data Centre of Excellence (CoE).
This role is hands on and tasked to deliver the data foundations needed to deliver maximum value from data to drive business and organisational performance.
Areas of Focus
The role has three main accountabilities:
Serve as the trusted data analyst for the Data CoE Global Marketing Data team, building data into functional DNA and supporting the global agenda to build-out our thought leadership around data and insight.As a functional Data CoE analyst in one of the areas of Global Marketing Data, you will design, execute and embed Enterprise Data Platform, delivering the data foundations needed to fuel our analytical products and deliver the democratisation of our data across the whole organisation.As the Data Analyst, drive excellence in Marketing data ensuring the delivery of a strong enterprise data platform. This will include providing transparency over end-to-end linage, data governance and quality controls across our internal, 2nd and 3rd party data assets from source to product.
As a member of the Global Marketing Data, Data CoE team you will be jointly responsible to partner with functions and markets to deliver the functional design specification for the data platform. You will work with the Senior Data CoE Management execute and collaborate with senior stakeholders to drive cultural shift around data within the organisation; explore innovation opportunities around new data channels, new data feeds; identify interdependent activities and bias towards front-loading high impact work.
All About You
The ideal candidate will be a well-rounded commercial and analytics professional. They will have a good knowledge of the Marketing Data operations and value chain in a consumer goods company, that is complemented by working knowledge of data management, data strategy or business information intelligence, and emerging technologies required to deliver a world class data service. Most importantly, the ideal candidate will enjoy rolling their sleeves up to drive towards outcomes.
Relevant Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, data modelling, economics, finance, business administration or similar technical backgroundSeveral years experience in demonstrable enterprise value realisation from data and business intelligence.Ability to manage multiple requests and priorities simultaneously.Data Governance understanding preferred.Azure experience preferred.
Professional SkillsData lifecycle management – Fully OperationalAnalytical power and actionable insights generation – Working KnowledgeGlobal Customer / Shopper / ecommerce data domain knowledge / exploitation – preferable knowledgeBusiness Intelligence / Data Modelling and Visualisation – Fully OperationalTechnical knowledge SQL – working KnowledgeCoding Skills in R, Python or similar – preferable knowledge
General Skills
Strong Communication and influencing skills - working KnowledgeEffective Team Management – preferable KnowledgeProject Management - preferable Knowledge
What We Offer
Not only do we offer a competitive salary, but also our pension scheme, an annual bonus, a free gym, a staff shop and shares. You’ll get the opportunity to work directly with our renowned and exciting brands in a flexible and agile environment. We strive to achieve a family-friendly culture and to, above all, create possibilities for all.
D&I Statement
Diversity at Unilever is about inclusion, embracing differences, creating possibilities and growing together for better business performance. We embrace diversity in our workforce. This means giving full and fair consideration to all applicants and continuing development of all employees regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, and pregnancy and maternity.

138a328bf704c7a1.title: Junior Data Analyst
138a328bf704c7a1.description:
Who we are
Reach PLC is the UK's largest commercial news publisher, with influential national newsbrands such as the Daily Mirror, Daily Express, Sunday People, OK! Magazine, Daily Record, and more than 100 distinguished regional titles. Every day our newsbrands - national and regional, in print and online - reach millions of people up and down the country.
Last year we sold 620 million newspapers, with 5.8 million readers of one of our brands each month. Our network of over 70 websites provide 24/7 coverage of news, sport and showbiz stories, with 26 billion page views per year. Combined, we have a total monthly readership of 47 million people.
Reach Solutions is the commercial side of the business, generating revenues from advertising, partnerships, events and other digital and physical products.
Key Responsibilities
Digital experimentation and A/B testing drive decision making at Reach plc. We want data and test results to guide the business, which in turn promotes a culture of experimentation. We are recruiting a Junior Data Analyst to join the Experimentation and Optimisation Team, - which sits in our wider Data Science Team - to assist with the day-to-day analysis of tests running across any one of our diverse portfolio of publications. We are a relatively new team and are constantly looking to learn, innovate and develop the Experimentation function. If you are a keen problem solver and have a background in mathematics, statistics or a numerate field, you might be the candidate for us!
Responsibilities/tasks
Day to day maintenance of test logs and dashboards
Completing conclusion reports for every experiment
Run significance calculations for all metrics tested in experiments
Querying our data warehouse to get experiment data for analysis using SQL
Attend regular ideation sessions to come up with new and innovative test ideas
Assist with prepping tickets in our backlog to ensure ideas are in a testable format
The Ideal Candidate
Minimum 2:1 in computer science, mathematics, physics, statistics or a numerate field
Keen problem solver and open to tackling new ideas
Good presentation skills
Experience with a stats package/language (SPSS and/or Matlab)
Experience using SQL either academically or professionally
Additionals
An additional programming language (Python, R or Ruby)
Experience working with an A/B testing vendor (Google Optimize, Optimizely, VWO)
Experience with using Google BigQuery
Package Description
Help to save for your retirement - join our pension scheme and we’ll match contributions up to 6%
25 days’ holiday per year when you join. After three, five and ten years’ service with Reach, you’ll accrue one additional day of annual leave. We also have a Holiday
Purchase Scheme
Giving back day- an additional day’s leave each year to support a cause close to your heart
Flexibility - This role will be split between ‘Home and Hub’ giving you more flexibility to balance home and life and we’ll support you with your home set-up. The majority of time will be working from home, but you’ll need to be able to come to the office when required for face to face team or customer meetings.
Enhanced family leave - including maternity, paternity and adoption - and you’ll be eligible after just six months’ employment
Private Healthcare Cash Plan - free health cash plan so you can claim back cash for a range of medical expenses
A "share" in our future
As one of the UK’s top 50 Inclusive Employers everyone’s invited to join our events, programmes and networks to celebrate diversity and build an environment where all our people can thrive
Wellbeing support - including a 24/7 assistance programme for you and your family, a free subscription to mindfulness app Headspace and access to free mental health coaching through Sanctus
We are a FTSE 250 Company, and also a member of the 30% Club, a global campaign aimed at increasing gender diversity at board and senior management
Reach plc believes diversity brings benefits for our customers, our business and our people. This is why we are committed to being an inclusive employer and encourage applications from all suitable applicants irrespective of background, circumstances, age, disability, gender identity, ethnicity, religion or belief and sexual orientation. We will be reviewing applications as they are received so please don't delay in submitting your application.

3804e7688d785f3e.title: Graduate Data Analyst - Remote UK with some travels
3804e7688d785f3e.description: Why join us?Swoon was founded in 2012 with a mission to create distinctive designs that owners will want to keep forever, and a lofty goal to spark home obsession everywhere.We’re an online-only furniture brand that’s making a digital experience better than a store. We design original pieces in-house and our innovative NPD process discovers the next trend, fast. Our testing platform ensures designs sell online at their intended price, and our data-led approach grows sales within families exponentially, quickly. Our business model cuts out expensive overheads like shops and overstocked warehouses, which means our prices are affordable too.Our distinctive look unlocks collaborations with leading retailers like John Lewis and many more. This diversified growth strategy is powering our brand to a significant market share. And we’re just getting started...What we’re looking forWe design and make things all over the world and must get them to customers perfectly and on time. But the truth is that it’s hard. We are constantly looking to improve the experience for our customers and we need every part of the supply chain working efficiently to ensure this happens.The role: Kick start your career and develop your skills in Swoons analytics team.You’ll be the first point of call for understanding how changes in the supply chain are impacting the business. We’ll need you to visualise large and complex data sets into reports, and dashboards, and present this to key stakeholders. Requests will be coming thick and fast so organisation is key, as well as the ability to develop and maintain crucial reporting tools. You’ll need to spot patterns and anomalies in the data and relate these to the real world.We’ll be supporting your development through additional training courses and exposure to all areas of the business. Bonus points if you have a passion for utilising new technologies as our goal for 2022 is to rebuild our data structure from the ground up and you’ll be playing a pivotal role.This is a great opportunity to gain great day to day operational experience as well as the ability to work on a larger project and help shape the future of the business.Responsibilities: The things you’ll be on the hook for:Regular operational reporting across manufacturing, logistics, customer care and presentation to the wider businessProduct and supplier level performance reporting, with related KPI managementProvide analytical insight and deep dive analysis for internal stakeholders to both inform and support operational and strategic decision makingAd hoc data preparation, analysis and projects across all business units including finance, retail and marketingIdentify and partner with functional leads to implement improvements in existing processesInfluence our future analytics roadmap using cloud based analysis and visualisation tools centered around accessibility, accuracy and standardisationRequirementsA passion for data and accuracy to drive business valueAbility to draw out trends from raw dataAbility to step between detail and the big pictureExcellent communication and presentation skillsExcellent organisational skills and ability to juggle multiple prioritiesTeam player who is willing to take on a challengeA logical mindsetIntermediate spreadsheet skills (Index match, pivot table)Able to handle cleaning and reconciling large amounts of data from various sources, whilst still being a champion for data integrity and continuous improvementYou have experience in data cleansing and extraction techniquesYou have experience in using SQLYou have some experience in using ETL toolsDesirableNumerate degreeYou have some experience in using G suiteYou have some experience or understanding of business information systemBenefitsLife at SwoonUpbeat, ambitious and collaborative – that’s us. We’re a lean team of 25, so if you relish responsibility and like to impact an outcome, we’re the place for you. We’ve made flexible working a permanent thing. Right now, the team works from home but we’re open to what people might need in the future. We hold weekly day workshops in London and if the team wants to get together in a co-working space, that’s fine too.We have a wide range of perks and benefits including:Competitive salaryShare options programmeBonus schemeWellbeing allowancePension schemePrivate medical coverYour birthday as an additional day offA day off for volunteer/community workFree furniture on each anniversary of employmentIncreasing holiday allowance with tenureFriends & family discountLiked what you read and keen to join us? Send us your application and we will get in touch very soon!Job Type: Full-timeSalary: £30,000.00-£40,000.00 per year

07fdccaf5e1be502.title: Commercial Analyst
07fdccaf5e1be502.description:
About the role
The role can be based in any of our UK locations, However, as a result of the wide variety of clients and projects, you may be asked to work in other locations and beyond, sometimes at short notice and sometimes over lengthy periods of time. Your desire and ability to do this will be discussed as part of the recruitment process. Candidates who are unable or do not wish to work on projects in other locations will still be considered. Please note that BPSS or SC Clearance may be required to perform certain activities within the role.
Overview
The role of Commercial Analyst is focused on the interrogation and challenge of commercial data, with the objectives of discovering and leveraging useful information that can be used to support evidence based decision making. The Commercial Analyst is expected to support clients in the analysis of key commercial data and identify levers to drive efficiencies against their current models.
Role description
The Commercial Analyst will be required to support engagement teams with a number of tasks. The focus of the role will be the review and evaluation of supplier data and assessment of complex cost models. Typical examples of these are included below:
Cost modelling: analysing and challenging client cost models, and creation of 'should cost' models to identify and drive efficiency opportunities. Includes cost analysis, assessing cost drivers such as: labour rates, Indirect / direct costs and escalation.
Incentive modelling: analysing how the financial and performance incentives of a contract (e.g. pain / gain share, KPIs) could influence supplier behaviour.
Profit checks: to assess whether suppliers are correctly applying yield rate by assessing errors in cost modelling to ensure that costs are correctly quoted.
Competitor analysis: to review, compare and challenge supplier and contract cost data to identify potential efficiencies.
QDC modelling: explores how Qualifying Defence Contracts (QDC) can best apply the information and rights granted under the single source contract regulations to deliver efficiencies and value for money.
Historical cost benchmarking: assesses what has been paid previously for the same or similar items and uses that information to determine a comparable cost.
Component cost analysis: breaking down the cost of individual product elements so that they can be challenged.
The successful candidate will also be expected to participate in other commercial, procurement, financial and data analytics projects as the need arises.
As a Manager you will be able to resolve unusual and nonstandard problems and issues, is aware of alternative options and approaches to situations, can guide and advise others in this skill and is able to look ahead and anticipate. Displays extensive practical experience and applied knowledge of the subject in a wide range of work situations. Is seen as a role model for others and people will seek their advice. May be involved in coaching or mentoring activities related to this skill.
Requirements
We're looking for candidates with the following:
Commercial Management/Buying Experience and/or working towards/achieved MCIPS status.
Experience working as a data analyst in a corporate function
Knowledge and/or certifications demonstrating capability working with data models and reporting packages (Primarily Excel or Power BI)
Ability to analyse large data sets
Ability to write comprehensive reports
Strong verbal and written communication skills
An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
Attention to detail
Preferred
Experience working as a data analyst in a corporate function
Undergraduate degree (e.g. BSc, BA)
Financial analysis experience (with a particular focus on Cost Accounting) and/or working towards/achieved chartered CIMA status.
What is in it for you?
As we're responsive to client demands, your role will be varied and challenging, providing you with an opportunity to work with a wide variety of high profile clients. We're also exceptionally passionate about providing you with the necessary skills, experience and training to help you develop both personally and professionally. You'll therefore be included on our specific Operate training framework, tailored to match your skills, needs and career aspirations. Fully funded by us, you'll complete externally accredited qualifications that will benefit you in the role you are working in. Our training programme is further enhanced through a variety of softer skills training sessions focusing on your relationships and leadership skills.
In addition to the client projects and training, our employees are also rewarded with various other as part of your employment.Our dedicated internal Careers Service.Competitive salary plus a potential discretionary bonus (performance related)25 days standard holiday pro rata, with options to increase this through your benefits packageFlexible benefits scheme that can be tailored to suit your (and your family's) needs.Provision of a group pension plan with additional funding provided by PwC
Not the role for you?
Did you know PwC offer flexible contract arrangements as well as contingent work (ie temporary or day rate contracting)?

The skills we look for in future employees
All our people need to demonstrate the skills and behaviours that support us in delivering our business strategy. This is important to the work we do for our business, and our clients. These skills and behaviours make up our global leadership framework, ‘The PwC Professional’ and are made up of five core attributes; whole leadership, technical capabilities, business acumen, global acumen and relationships.
Learn more here: www.pwc.com/uk/careers/experienced/apply
The Deal
We want all of our people to feel empowered to be the best that they can be, which is why we have ‘The Deal’.

Find out more about our firmwide Employee Value Proposition: https://www.pwc.co.uk/careers/about-us/the-new-deal.html

Diversity
Valuing Difference. Driving Inclusion.

We work in a changing world which offers great opportunities for people with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We seek to attract and employ the best people from the widest talent pool because creating value through diversity is what makes us strong as a business, enabling us to solve important problems and deliver value to our clients. We encourage an inclusive culture where people can be themselves, are valued for their strengths and are empowered to be the best they can be. As an organisation with an increasingly agile workforce, we also support different ways of working offering flexible working arrangements. Learn more here about our work to support an inclusive culture.

www.pwc.com/uk/diversity

92767444ca04d7b4.title: Scientific Data Analyst - MLC 1770
92767444ca04d7b4.description:
We are seeking a scientific data analyst to join a new data management team based at MRC Harwell. This is an opportunity use knowledge of biological data and build skills in data analysis and data management.
At Harwell, the Mary Lyon Centre (MLC) runs and develops specialised screening tests to investigate mouse gene function and develop preclinical models for human genetic disorders. These tests cover behavioural, physiological and metabolic assays. These generate complex datasets which present unique challenges to data management and analysis. The data management team will work to validate data prior to its release to researchers and collaborators. This work will involve developing validation pipelines, managing data across projects, and investigating how to validate novel datasets.
This role would suit a recent PhD or MSc graduate in life-sciences interested in applying their knowledge of in-vivo or other datasets and developing skills in data science. For example, a PhD graduate with experience in behavioural or metabolic assays and relevant datasets, who has a desire of translating this knowledge into software solutions and learning programming skills.
Main duties / key responsibilities:
Use data analysis pipelines to conduct comprehensive data validation of complex scientific datasets.
Learn skills to develop and maintain data analysis pipelines for varied biological datasets.
Use knowledge of in-vivo measurements and liaise with animal technicians and researchers to determine necessary steps in data validation.
Flag and investigate issues in in-vivo datasets.
Work day-to-day within the data management team, discussing current technical issues and informing key stakeholders on plans and solutions.
Communicate effectively to the data management team and stakeholders when discussing and presenting data, data issues and processes.
Collaborate with software developers to standardise and automate data upload and validation.
Ensure that data is validated according to schedule, prioritise work to ensure that schedules are maintained.
Contribute to data standards, documentation, protocols and to Github repositories.
Expand knowledge of in-vivo measurements as MLC innovates and integrates new datasets (such as telemetry and video-tracking).
Working relationships:
You will be part of the data management group and report to the data manager. The data management team works with the phenotyping team as they gather datasets. The data management team will also work alongside the IT infrastructure team software development teams. You may also work with external collaborators and industrial partners.
Additional information:
The Scientific Data Analyst position is based at our office in Harwell. However, depending on candidate preference there is an option for an on-site/home working hybrid working pattern.
Equality & Diversity:
The MRC values the diverse skills and experience of its employees and is committed to achieving equality of treatment for all. Our objectives are that all individuals shall have equal opportunities for employment and advancement on the basis of their skills, aptitudes and abilities. The MRC is committed to the engagement and retention of the best possible talent and to creating an environment that encourages excellence in scientific research through good equalities and diversity leadership and management.
Corporate/Local responsibilities & requirements:
The job holder must at all times carry out their responsibilities with due regard to the MRC’s:
Code of Conduct
Equality and Diversity policy
Health and Safety policy
Data Protection and Security policy
Job descriptions should be reviewed on a regular basis and at the annual appraisal. Any changes should be made and agreed between the post holder and their manager.
The above lists are not exhaustive and the job holder is required to undertake such duties as may reasonably be requested within the scope of the post. All employees are required to act professionally, co-operatively and flexibly in line with the requirements of the post and the MRC.

Person Specification
Knowledge and experience:
Essential:
Qualification in life sciences (PhD or MSc).
Experience of managing or validating datasets.
Advanced understanding of in-vivo experimentation.
Desirable:
Ability to grasp complexity of scientific datasets.
Knowledge of concepts in data science and data analysis.
Willingness to learn new techniques and tools (such as Python for data analysis).
Capable of working under pressure to meet deadlines
Personal skills/behaviours/qualities:
Essential:
Strong communication skills
Desirable:
Evidence of having developed and maintained effective relationships.
Further Information
MRC Harwell specialises in mouse genetics research, from the earliest stages of development to diseases of ageing. The MLC is the National facility for mouse genetics providing resources to many HEIs and commercial collaborators and is the central hub for the MRC’s newly launched National Network for Mouse Genetics (https://mrc.ukri.org/research/initiatives/national-mouse-genetics-network/. We are also a key player in the International Mouse Phenotyping Consortium (IMPC), a large-scale collaboration that aims to find a phenotype for every gene in the mouse genome. We are very keen to push our research towards translational studies in humans, and collaborate with clinical and medical professionals for many of our research programmes.
The MLC’s activities are focused on applying mouse genetics, transgenesis and phenotypic screening to investigate mammalian gene function at a systems level. We are working with new genome editing technologies which are allowing us to introduce genetic variants, especially those seen in human patients, as well as generating new mouse strains for preclinical and discovery research. We are also involved with the development and application of a number of new automated phenotyping tests including those involving video and auditory analysis.

The MRC is a great place to work and progress your career, be it in scientific research or the support functions.The MRC is a unique working environment where our researchers are rewarded by world class innovation and collaboration opportunities that the MRC name brings. The MRC is an excellent place to develop yourself further and a range of training & development opportunities will be available to you, including professional registration with the Science Council.

Choosing to come to work at the MRC (part of UKRI) means that you will have access to a whole host of benefits from a defined benefit pension scheme and excellent holiday entitlement to access to employee shopping/travel discounts and salary sacrifice cycle to work scheme, as well as the chance to put the MRC and UKRI on your CV in the future.

Our success is dependent upon our ability to embrace diversity and draw on the skills, understanding and experience of all our people. We welcome applications from all sections of the community irrespective of gender, race, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sexual orientation, disability or age. As "Disability Confident" employers, we guarantee to interview all applicants with disabilities who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

UKRI supports research in areas that include animal health, agriculture and food security, and bioscience for health which includes research on animals, genetic modification and stem cell research. Whilst you may not have direct involvement in this type of research, you should consider whether this conflicts with your personal values or beliefs.

We will conduct a full and comprehensive pre-employment check as an essential part of the recruitment process on all individuals that are offered a position with UKRI. This will include a security check and an extreme organisations affiliation check.
