This will give you the opportunity to ensure our data is accurately assessed and maintained while making sure any errors are identified across multiple system.This will require a good level of attention to detail as you will be completing daily reconciliations and identifying anomalies in data, while taking the right steps to resolve these. d7b02a81b254e3e4.title: Junior Healthcare Data Analyst
d7b02a81b254e3e4.description:
Job Description:
Junior Healthcare Data Analyst
Staines, London or Manchester
Permanent, Full Time hrs (37.5p/wk)
£32,000 - £36,000 depending on location and experience, plus benefitsAt the moment we are running a hybrid working scheme of a couple of days in the office and a few from home each week. So you will need to be a in travelling distance from one of our main offices; Staines, London or Salford Quays
A bit about us
Bupa is one of the most well-known and respected healthcare businesses in the world, because what we do matters. From our contact centres to our care homes; health and dental centres to our state of the art hospitals across all four corners of the globe, every part of our operations are dedicated to our purpose of helping people live longer, healthier, happier lives. We pride ourselves on working with brilliant people who put our customers at the heart of everything they do.
About the area you’ll be working in
We provide a range of health insurance options which can give customers access to diagnosis, treatment and specialist support services. The benefits available to our customers include; access to Bupa-approved consultants, breakthrough treatment and drugs, our 24/7 Anytime HealthLine and cancer cover that comes with the Bupa cancer promise.
What you'll be doing
In this role, you will have the opportunity to work in an analytical team responsible for the healthcare data associated with 'payment integrity' within our wider healthcare analytics department supporting the senior analysts and management, getting involved on a variety of different projects, reporting, data sets, and dashboards, using a multiple of systems and languages such as R, SAS, SQL, Power BI and excel.
You will analyse health data and produce, verify and interpret analytic findings and develop reports. You will learn to be hands on with data and at the same time, apply and adapt your academic knowledge to a fast paced, data driven and professional environment.
You will also develop an awareness of the health care industry and private medical insurance business as well as gain an understanding of the financial implications that drive business decisions.
What’s a typical day?
A typical day will require you to be working across teams under the supervision of various analytics managers to develop analytic plans, methods, tasks and timelines for a number of different projects. You’ll be applying statistical techniques and methodologies to drive business solutions and improve efficiency of existing processes.
You will be designing and implementing program code for analytic studies, while maintaining, evaluating, and reporting on findings and completing ad-hoc projects relating to data investigations and providing insights and recommendations to the relevant stakeholders.
You will need to work with stakeholders across departments to translate findings into operational processes and metrics and be developing methods of reporting and evaluation for health initiatives, programmes and internal processes.
Who we’re looking for?
Newly qualified graduate with a Master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Epidemiology, Bio-Statistics or Public Health.
Alternatively a Master’s degree in Decision Science or Computer science with significant applied leaning of Machine Learning and Data Mining will also be considered.
Proficient with Microsoft Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint.
Experience with statistical packages and software e.g. R and/or SAS, and SQL, as well as Power BI
Strong analytical, problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
Motivated to learn and stretch beyond comfort zone. · Ability to prioritise and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
Ability to work independently and as a member of a team. · Ability to provide input into, feedback on, and follow a project schedule.
Excellent verbal and written communication, organisational and interpersonal skills.
What’s it like to work here?
As you’ll already know, we want people to ‘love working here’, so much so that’s it’s at the top of our agenda and something you’ll hear a lot about here at Bupa. We offer our people a great range of benefits, many of which are flexible and can be tailored to suit what’s most important to you. We’re a healthcare company so there’s a huge focus on our people’s health and wellbeing, supported by a healthy work-life balance and workplaces which are friendly, appealing spaces to support you to be at your best.
Why Bupa?
We are a health insurer and provider. With no shareholders, our customers are our focus. We reinvest profits into providing more and better healthcare for the benefit of current and future customers.
Our benefits are driven by what matters to our people. It’s important to us that these benefits support a work-life balance that keeps people healthy, both mentally and physically. You’ll be eligible for:
25 days holiday, increasing through length of service, with option to buy or sellBupa health insurance as a benefit in kindAn enhanced pension plan, life insurance and income protectionAnnual performance-based bonusOnsite gyms or local discounts where no onsite gym availableVarious family friendly benefits
Diversity and Inclusion
Bupa is committed to making sure that every applicant is assessed solely on personal merit and qualifications. We actively celebrate the diversity of our colleagues and provide an inclusive environment so you can bring your true self to Bupa. We’ll make sure you are treated fairly regardless of disability or circumstance. That’s why we’re happy to offer reasonable adjustments as part of our recruitment process to anyone that needs them.
Whether you’ve found your feet or are discovering a new path.
Welcome to a place that celebrates you.
This isn’t where you've been.
This is where you're going.
This is what we have belief in.
Time Type:
Full time

32f7a17a83bc4e30.title: Data Analyst
32f7a17a83bc4e30.description:
Our mission is to break down the barriers of today to release the potential of tomorrow. Join us today and release yours.
There are two things that we want to share with anyone considering joining us.
Firstly, we’ve got big ambitions for our colleagues and the future of the organisation. These include our vision that inclusion and accessibility drive every conversation we have and every decision we make. We want our workforce to fully represent the communities and customers we serve, because a diverse business is a better business. We value every colleague, their diversity and the contribution that they make. When we say you’re welcome at BT, we really mean it.
Secondly, the one thing the pandemic has taught us is that a lot of current and future colleagues, where and when possible, want to embrace hybrid working. Therefore, we are introducing smart working at BT. Smart working means having the flexibility to choose, as a team, how and where you work depending on your team’s deliverables and needs; when you are at your shared core location to connect with others and when not. It may not be for every role, and, as part of the recruitment process, you’ll have the chance to discuss smart working and how it might work for the job you are applying for.

About this role
Customers are at the heart of everything we do, and we’re pretty much nothing without them. Our customers experience various ‘journeys’ with us, and these journeys often cover multiple parts of our company.
This job matters because you will work out how to make these journeys brilliant, using the wealth of data we have at BT. You will use this data to ensure decisions are data-led, our work is shaped by the data, and we track our progress with data.
However we have a huge amount of data, it can be interpreted in multiple ways, and there isn’t necessarily a right answer. This means you will bring high levels of contextual knowledge, be able to make judgement calls, and work out how to generate a proposal that turns your insight into changes that make a difference to our customers.
You'll have the following responsibilities
Bringing data together from multiple sources, making sense of it, and integrating into a customer and BT view of customer journey performance.
Working with teams across BT on use cases for the data, helping those teams extract value.
Innovating new ways of managing and understanding our data so that we improve the quality of our customer journey analysis.
You'll have the following skills & experience
Data analysis and management.
Customer journey analysis.
Great collaborator.
Systems design / systems thinking (methodical and clear).
Coding skills relevant to data manipulation e.g. PL/SQL, Python.
Visualisation and analysis tools e.g. Qlik, Tableau
Benefits
25 days annual leave (plus bank holidays)
10% on target bonus
Life Assurance
Strong pension scheme (5% from you, BT contributes 10%)
Option to join BT share schemes
Option to join the Healthcare Cash Plan or other benefits such as dental insurance, gym memberships etc
50% off BT and EE mobile pay monthly or SIM only plans
Exclusive colleague discounts on our latest and greatest BT broadband packages
Discounted BT TV, including BT Sport and the NOW Entertainment membership, and 25% off NOW Sport, Cinema and Kids
30% discount for friends and family on EE mobile pay monthly and SIM only plans
#LI-DN

About BT
BT has a key role in British society, fostering change and leading technology innovation. From delivering the Olympics, to supporting the emergency services, to investing more into research than any other UK technology company, we take pride in everything we do - and in the people who work here.
We're now a global company operating at the forefront of the information age, employing 90,000 people in 180 countries. And we're on a mission. Guided by our core values of Personal, Simple and Brilliant our goal is to help customers, communities and businesses overcome barriers and release their potential.
So, if you're interested in the power of potential, why not join us today and release yours? You can read more here about what it's like to work at BT
How to Apply
It's easy to apply online; you just need a copy of your up-to-date CV and to follow the step-by step process. Don't worry if you need to make changes - you'll have the opportunity to review and edit your work on the final page. We look forward to receiving your application!

477009c3bc7b9e83.title: Logistics Graduate Data Analyst
477009c3bc7b9e83.description:
THG is a fast-moving, global technology business that specialises in taking brands direct to consumers. Our world-class proprietary tech and infrastructure powers our extensive portfolio of beauty, nutrition and lifestyle brands and is now helping drive exponential growth of our clients' brands globally.

We're powered by a global team of over 10,000 ambitious people around the world. Our culture is fast-paced and entrepreneurial, it's this DNA that has supported our incredible growth.

We're always looking for individuals that can bring fresh and innovative thinking to THG, and play a part in driving the group forward on its exciting journey. So, if you're ready to take the next big step in your career, challenge yourself every day and evolve with the world around you, THG is ready for you.

The Hut Group is one of the fastest growing online retailers on the planet. We're an ideas-led tech company that's always had a desire to break out of conventions. Ambition that has established us as a leader in the Beauty and Wellness spaces, and now we're going beyond. Our culture is fast-paced and risk-taking, we like to move twice as fast as any normal person thinks is reasonable. Over a decade of building and growing brands in the Beauty and Wellness sectors, across over 140 markets. We specialise in creating brilliant digital brand experiences, and we are hungry for more.

Our culture celebrates original thinkers, tech pioneers and skilled technologists. A group of over 4,000 diverse, smart thinkers – our people are unquestionably our strength. An environment that empowers our people to achieve their full potential, creating innovative digital experiences that deliver results. Our culture is one of a kind, recognising great achievement with great reward.

THG's primary focus is health, beauty, prestige and nutrition related consumer goods. The company owns and operates many leading brands including LookFantastic.com, Grow Gorgeous, Mio Skincare, ESPA and MyProtein.com - The world's #1 online sports nutrition brand.

Because of the high volumes of applications our opportunities attract, it sometimes takes us time to review and consider them all. We endeavour to respond to every application we receive within 14 days. If you haven't heard from us within that time frame or should you have any specific questions about this or other applications for positions at THG please contact one of our Talent team to discuss further.

THG is committed to creating a diverse & inclusive environment and hence welcomes applications from all sections of the community.

4cc29f6d280a7f38.title: Customer Data Analyst – Customer Engagement
4cc29f6d280a7f38.description:
Customer Data Analyst – Customer Engagement
Job Introduction
Are you looking for a new challenge that gives you the chance to use your knowledge and passion for Data Analysis to take Customer Insights at Selfridges to the next level? Looking for a company that wants to help further your career as well as provide you with an exciting, inspiring, and fun place to work?
If the answer to all of these questions is ‘yes’ then you’re just the kind of person we’re looking for!
Role Responsibility
Selfridges has a brilliant opportunity within the Customer Analytics Team, reporting to the Senior Customer Analytics Manager. As a Customer Data Analyst, you will have the exciting chance to work in a fast-paced environment, to help us take our business to the next level.

As a Customer Data Analyst – Customer Engagement, you will:
You can expect to work daily with SQL, as well as work on visualisation of data and extracting insights.
Work with fellow analysts to create accessible, relevant, and actionable reports and dashboards, using multiple sources of data.
Support VIP Comms and Membership Manager and Clienteling Manager, by sharing campaign results and deliver actionable insights and recommendations from this, so that we always continue to evolve and improve the work we do
Provide weekly and monthly reports on key customer KPIs understand the drivers of their performance
Use robust statistical and data methods to build analyses
Champion a culture of self service by ensuring your stakeholders are suitably skilled in how to use our analytics tools.
The Ideal Candidate
Experience in the Customer/CRM analytics domain with a demonstrable track record in influencing business decisions using data.
A good working knowledge of SQL
Experience using industry-standard data-visualisation tools (Tableau preferred)
Experience working in a big-data environment
A highly numerate and analytical mindset focused on the customer and the commercial benefits of making change.
Experience preparing and giving presentations to your stakeholders.
About the Company
Our Creative Spirit
We are more than a shop. We are a social space where culture and commerce collide to release an energy that we call the Selfridges spirit. We are here to make our world brighter, and everyone is welcome.
Our Awards Cabinet
We’re not ones to brag, but since you asked...Selfridges has won the award for The World’s Best Department Store an unprecedented four times at the IGDS awards, with an additional award for the Best Sustainability Campaign. We were also recognised as a ‘Best 25 Big Company to Work For 2020’ as awarded by The Sunday Times.
Our Future
Since 1909 we have been at the forefront of retail and today our stores in London, Manchester and Birmingham – alongside selfridges.com and the Selfridges App – continue to redefine the way we shop and socialise. As a Selfridges team member, you will learn what it takes to consistently drive innovation, success and amazing customer experiences.
Everyone is welcome
We are committed to a diverse and inclusive working culture, and we see this as key to our success and our working culture. Here at Selfridges, everyone is welcome - irrespective of race, gender, ethnicity, sexuality, age or disability, we stand by equal opportunities for all. We are diverse, we are inclusive, we are Selfridges.
The Fun Stuff
There are lots of reasons to be excited about joining Team Selfridges – from our fantastic team member communities to volunteer days and behind-the-scenes Selfridges experiences throughout the year.
Other benefits and rewards include:
Generous bonus and/or commission scheme
Discounted gym memberships
Pension contributions
Annual travel pass and cycle to work schemes
Up to five paid volunteering days
Access to a wide range of training programmes to help your career development

Selfridges

1daf6afe879004a8.title: Junior Data Governance Analyst
1daf6afe879004a8.description:
Junior Data Governance Analyst
My client, a well renowned British newspaper publisher, have an extremely exciting opportunity for a Junior Data Governance Analyst.
The ideal candidate will play a key role in implementing a governance framework to support efficient, compliant and ethical processing of data to enable risk aware decision making.
As a Junior Data Governance Analyst, you will be focused on, but not limited to:
Understanding of industry standard data governance framework/standard
Understanding of working in the Data Governance domain, especially around transparency, lineage, quality, risk management, information security and compliance areas
Ensuring successful delivery of initiatives through development and management of overall project plan, documentation and schedule
Assisting the Data Governance Manager with facilitating the teams ceremonies including stand ups, backlog refinement sessions and retros and any other ceremonies that are deemed necessary
Understanding of DPA2018, GDPR, PECR, CCPA requirements
Key Skills/Experiences
Effective verbal and written communication skills and stakeholder engagement experience
Familiarity with project tools such as Confluence and Airtable
Lorien Plc is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Job description
Job Title

Analyst – Healthcare Digital and Data Analyst - IGH
The Team
KPMG is acknowledged as a leading advisor and professional services provider to the UK Healthcare industry with hundreds of professionals daily supporting our clients across the country. You will be joining a successful and growing team, who are looking to consolidate recent year on year growth and deliver a step change in the size and reach of our practice including growing international revenues. This is an exciting opportunity for talented individuals who are looking to grow their skills and abilities within a well-regarded and rapidly expanding team, offering clear progression opportunities.
We are keen to recruit talented people who have the energy and drive to succeed in a dynamic and challenging environment and who have a passion for delivering excellent service and building strong relationships in healthcare.
The team works in an agile and flexible manner, with plenty of opportunities to develop new skills and gain new knowledge. We are keen to support and develop our people to enable them to be the best they can be.
We believe we are market leaders in promoting diversity and inclusion in the workplace and want to encourage applications from people of all backgrounds and cultures.
Take a look at our website with the link below to see “What Makes Us Different”
http://www.kpmg.com/UK/en/about/WhatMakesUsDifferent/Diversity/Pages/default.aspx
The Role
The successful candidate will join our UK Infrastructure Government and Healthcare (IGH) Data Analytics, as an Analyst based in London. We provide a wide range of data analytics, modelling, data modelling services to our clients in a diverse range of sectors such as health, transport, policing, local and central government
Our services include:
Data Modelling and Analytics
Interactive data visualisation, presentation and reporting
Dashboard development, publishing and maintenance
Advanced analytics including exploiting modern data science techniques like machine learning and applied statistics to extract valuable data driven insights
Cloud-enabled analytical services
Requirements gathering and stakeholder engagement
Agile analytics project management and delivery
Development and delivery of training in visual analytics solutions
Data analytics strategy design and implementation
Developing and delivering data strategy, data operating model, data governance or data maturity programmes for public sector clients
Supporting the implementation of data strategy and digital transformation programmes and initiatives
Business and data modelling
Data blending and database development
Cost benefit analysis and financial modelling
Modelling the impacts of business change, including options analysis, cost optimisation, outsourcing and other operational and financial restructuring
Transaction modelling (mergers and acquisitions, buyouts, refinancing, bids and bid defence)
Management and KPI reporting solutions
Model build and assurance
We work closely with teams across all functions within KPMG, such as Operational Transformation, Transaction Services, Corporate Finance, Restructuring and others. We work on some of the most exciting projects in KPMG, delivering high-quality, flexible and bespoke analytics and modelling solutions for our clients.
Responsibilities
We are looking for an Analyst to join our award-winning and growing team, with technical expertise in data visualisation, analytics, and data modelling. The individual should have data analytics expertise, ideally with some public sector experience.
The Analyst will support projects in the following areas:
Interactive data visualisation, presentation and reporting
Business modelling
Dashboard development, publishing and maintenance
Cloud-enabled analytical services
Requirements gathering and stakeholder engagement
Rapid proof of concept development
Data strategy and data maturity assessment
Cost benefit analysis and financial modelling
Development and delivery of analytics training
ETL, data blending and database development
Relational and star schema data modelling
This role offers the candidate the opportunity to develop their knowledge and experience of sophisticated data management and analytics techniques, whilst also developing client-facing, project management and consulting skills. The roles require working to tight deadlines, prioritising workload, project management and providing a high level of client service at all times. The level of responsibility you will be given will depend on your aptitude and willingness to learn and take on new challenges.
Experience:
We would expect the successful candidate to have many of the following experience, attributes or skills:
Core Skills
An interest in the public sector and public sector data
Excellent communication skills
Working knowledge of Microsoft BI technology stack including SQL Server, SQL SSIS, NS Excel, MS Power Query, MS Power Pivot, MS Power BI
A passion and commitment to developing their technical knowledge in a changing environment and the willingness to share and develop this in others
Desirable requirements
A numerate (computer science or maths-based) degree
A relevant professional qualification (e.g. Microsoft SQL Certified Professional)
An understanding of best-practice approaches to the development of data models in Excel, and SQL (“our modelling tools”)
Experience with leading data visualisation and analytics tools like Tableau, QlikView, Python or R
Expertise in delivering best-practice data visualisations and interactive dashboards
Experience of incorporating business processes and user requirements into dashboards with a consistent workflow and/or actionable insight
Experience and or an interest in developing and implementing effective data strategies to make more effective use of data
Positive approach towards problem solving under pressure, including the ability to think through a problem and apply a logical, analytical approach to develop a solution
The ability to manage time and work independently
Ability to quickly assimilate information and propose workable solutions
Ability to describe complex technical issues in a clear non-technical way
Strong enthusiasm for solving complex problems with our modelling tools
Strong analytical and interpretative skill
Sustained attention to detail
Additional Information:
Work will be delivered nationally so willingness to travel is important.
We know that our success depends in no small way on your expertise, talent and skill. We have built a reputation for working with people to invest heavily in their training and career development. If you can take charge of your career, meet the targets and broaden your expertise, we will provide all the support and the opportunities to realise your full potential. The successful candidate will join a group of like-minded and dynamic people that regularly works in challenging situations that present opportunities for personal development and career advancement
Service Line Information

In KPMG's Management Consulting practice, we don't limit ourselves to either strategy or implementation. Instead, we deliver both - equally well.
Technology - our clients need to deal effectively with technology related risks and derive maximum value from data and documentation. Our specialists provide independent, jargon free advice and advanced technology capabilities to help our clients proactively manage their technology risks and use their data to its full potential.
Recognising and Motivating you

At KPMG, your long-term future is every bit as important to us as it is to you. That’s why our aim is to give you experiences that will stay with you for a lifetime. Whether it’s great training and development, mobility opportunities or corporate responsibility volunteering activities – you’ll gain a wealth of experiences on which to build a rewarding career. We’re a firm that encourages you to be yourself, values your contribution, and inspires you to act as a role model, always focused on doing the right thing for each other, our clients and our communities
Intelligent Working

While our client-facing professionals can be required to travel regularly, and at times be based at client sites, our flexible working arrangements can help you to achieve a balanced lifestyle. We offer part time roles with flexible working arrangements which could include, annualised hours, early or late starts to fit around other commitments, shorter working days etc. We are happy to discuss your own requirements and our range of flexible working arrangements in more detail, should that be of interest and, as part of the recruitment process, we can put you in touch with people who work flexibly.
KPMG’s commitment to inclusion

KPMG consistently features in the Sunday Times Best Big Companies to work for, which has been recognised with a special achievement award to mark our 10 years in the Top 25. We pride ourselves on being a place where your individuality is valued; you can be yourself and still achieve your potential. We believe that your individuality helps us to deliver the best results to our clients. Diversity of background, diversity of experience, diversity of perspective - that's the KPMG difference. But, don't take our word for it, find out more about diversity at KPMG by viewing our Policy
Applying with a disability

KPMG are proud to be an inclusive, equal opportunity employer and we seek to attract and retain the best people from the widest possible talent pool. As a member of the Business Disability Forum we're committed to ensuring that all candidates are treated fairly throughout the Recruitment Process. Should you be successful after the initial application stage, please discuss with your recruitment contact any reasonable adjustments to our Recruitment Process that you may require.
Policy for Agencies

KPMG has a commitment to sourcing candidates directly and as such we do not accept speculative CV’s from agencies. Please check here to see our policy on agencies: Policy

Why Consulting at KPMG?
Technology is a critical focus for us. It underpins everything we do. We're investing in technology like never before – not least because the pace of technological change is disrupting organisations in new and challenging ways. Through advanced data analytics and emerging tech-enabled solutions like AI and machine learning, we're helping clients across diverse sectors to navigate that change. We enable them to avoid any unnecessary risks and to uncover new, transformative opportunities that could give them a competitive edge. A career here means stretching your skills and honing your expertise by solving complex problems as part of a collaborative, results-driven and supportive team. Whether we're helping our clients to reduce their costs, make better decisions, improve efficiencies or deploy the latest technologies, we bring together broad specialisms and talents to deliver robust, connected solutions.

3484a3fd6d537340.title: Data Analyst
3484a3fd6d537340.description:
Advert People make Sage great. From our colleagues delivering ground-breaking solutions to the customers who use them: people have helped us grow for more than thirty years, and people are driving our future as a great SaaS company. We're writing our next chapter. Be part of it!

At Sage, we recognize that the world of work has rapidly shifted over the last few years, particularly how we work. That is why we have committed to working in a hybrid way going forward. Human connection is an essential ingredient of the 4 principles that make up our Flexible Human Work hybrid framework and we want to be transparent in what that looks like when you join our Sage family. On one hand, our offices will continue to play an important role in our future and serve as a place for spontaneous conversations, connection, collaboration as well as focused time. On the other hand, we have learned to reimagine where and when we work and to unlock that flexibility and innovation for our colleagues offering them the opportunity to work flex across their home, Sage offices or customer sites.

We invite you to join us and help us write our next chapter. Follow us on our social media sites to join in conversations about open positions and company news! #lifeatsage #sagecareers. If you would like support with your application (or require any adjustments) please contact us at careers@sage.com for assistance. All qualified applicants will be thoughtfully considered and never discriminated against based on their race, color, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Job Description The Data analyst ensures that key performance reporting & analytics is delivered to drive the success of the business daily. They support the UKI Reporting Manager in defining, designing and visualising complex data from multiple sources to build and maintain accurate, efficient and timely reporting that is used to ‘run the business’. The Data Analyst will also provide frequent analysis and partner with key stakeholders to understand performance and drive data driven decision making

Key ResponsibilitiesWork in partnership with the Data Delivery team to ensure raw data is accurate, timely, well-defined, and continuously improved.

Build and maintain a suite of key standardised and consistent BAU reporting, with world-class data visualisation, UI and UX to be used by a wide audience to run the business.

Provide repetitive and BAU predictive and prescriptive analysis to help key stakeholders understand and drive the business

Seek out and proactively work on continuous improvement projects looking at the way data is presented and identify opportunities for improved accuracy and business processes

Identify gaps in the reporting suite and work with key stakeholders within the UKI business and the UKI Reporting team to plug them.

Proactively analyse outputs to provide recommendations to the wider business on opportunities and risks to performance.

Adhere to standard ways of working and governance alongside a rigorous release and change management cycle.

Advanced Power BI and Sales Force Knowledge and experience

Experience in data viz best-practice

Good knowledge and experience using SFDC including SFDC Data Objects

An ability to manipulate and work with large data

Experience working with Snowflake

Knowledge of SQL, DAX, MQuery, Python, R

Cross -functional stakeholder management skills

An ability to effectively manage & prioritise workload, working to tight deadlines

Agile worker who can adapt easily to and embrace change in a fast-paced environment

Someone who has an eye for business process

A data enthusiast who follows the industry closely

c2a8fb45ff3cb9b9.title: Senior Fraud Data Analyst
c2a8fb45ff3cb9b9.description:
Our people work differently depending on their jobs and needs. From home working to job sharing, visit the remote and flexible working page on our website to find out more.
This role is based in the United Kingdom and as such all normal working days must be carried out in the United Kingdom.
Join us as a Senior Fraud Data Analyst
Take on a new challenge in Data & Analytics and help us shape the future of our business
You’ll be helping to manage the analysis of complex data to identify business issues and opportunities, and supporting the delivery of high quality business solutions
We're committed to mapping a career path that works for you, with a focus on helping you build new skills and engage with the latest ideas and technologies in data analytics
You'll be managing real time strategies that protect our customers from fraud using systems such as Falcon, Arcot, TSYS CardGuard
We're offering this role for a period of 15 months
What you'll do
As a Senior Fraud Data Analyst , you’ll be planning and providing high quality analytical input to support the development and implementation of innovative processes and problem resolution. You’ll be capturing, validating and documenting business and data requirements, making sure they are in line with key strategic principles.
We’ll look to you to interrogate, interpret and visualise large volumes of data to identify, support and challenge business opportunities and identify solutions.
You’ll also be:
Performing data extraction, storage, manipulation, processing and analysis
Conducting and supporting options analysis, identifying the most appropriate solution
Helping to maintain full traceability and linkage of business requirements of analytics outputs
Seeking opportunities to challenge and improve current business processes, ensuring the best result for the customer
Creating and executing quality assurance at various stages of the project in order to validate the analysis and to ensure data quality, identify data inconsistencies, and resolve as needed
The skills you'll need
You’ll need a background in business analysis tools and techniques, along with the ability to influence through communications tailored to a specific audience. Additionally, you’ll need the ability to use core technical skills. Fraud Prevention and Investigation knowledge is preferable, but not essential, as is experience in writing SAS and SQL and Python.
You’ll also demonstrate:
The ability to manage your own workstack and adapt to quickly to changing priorities
Knowledge of Card Fraud and Commercial Customer fraud risks
Excellent communication and collaboration skills as you will be engaging with multiple teams on a daily basis
Strong analytic and problem solving abilities
A keen eye for detail in your work
If you need any adjustments to support your application, such as information in alternative formats or special requirements to access our buildings, or if you’re eligible under the Disability Confident Scheme please contact us and we’ll do everything we can to help.

ea0b8209eab809f2.title: Data Analytics Intern
ea0b8209eab809f2.description:
MathWorks has a hybrid work model that enables staff members to split their time between office and home. The hybrid model provides the advantage of having both in-person time with colleagues and flexible at-home life optimizations. Learn More: https://www.mathworks.com/company/jobs/resources/applying-and-interviewing.html#onboarding.
Do you want to join our engineering team to develop MATLAB-based tools used to make critical design and operational decisions?

Thousands of engineers use MATLAB and Simulink every day in the automotive and aerospace industries to model and monitor the performance and reliability of vehicles and systems, from design to test to service. MATLAB is used to continually collect data from sensors and run predictive models and machine learning algorithms to calculate metrics such as fuel efficiency and remaining useful life.

By joining the MathWorks consulting team, you will contribute to our customers' projects to streamline the modelling of engineering data, by adopting advanced software development practices, using machine learning to automate model building and decision making, sharing models and reporting results and running MATLAB on cloud and enterprise platforms.

Design machine learning algorithms and models for performance analysis and predictive maintenance.
Implement features for a platform to share tools and models.
Interview MathWorks customers to understand requirements and present results.
Participate in design and code reviews.

Good analytical, problem-solving and programming skills
Knowledge of automotive and/or aerospace engineering challenges
Experience with MATLAB

Candidates must be pursuing a master's level or a PhD level degree in a technical discipline.

00b29a0e88c355f2.title: Data Analyst (Full-Time or Part-Time)
00b29a0e88c355f2.description:
Eat Work Art is looking for a Data Analyst to analyse and visualise EWA’s extensive CRM data, with the objective of presenting clear data-driven insights which the wider team can use to make informed decisions.
Eat Work Art has recently implemented a CRM system to gather, analyse and report on data for a number of business processes - from lead generation and conversion, to lease management and revenue gain/loss on our studios. Data is currently being gathered and stored effectively, however we are looking to improve our data analytics and reporting to advance our current situational awareness and long-term decision making ability.
This role is a permanent position and can either be full time or part time, focused on data analytics and visualisation. The primary objective of this role is to analyse and visualise EWA’s extensive CRM data, with the objective of presenting clear data-driven insights which the wider team can use to make informed decisions.
This role will give the right candidate the scope to engineer the company’s data management tools and processes, whilst supporting them to develop their knowledge and experience.
The role is based at our Head Office at Hackney Downs Studios, you might also be required to travel across our other sites.

The closing date for applications is the 29th Feb 2022, however we are reviewing applications as they are received.

2aedc98467bb2918.title: Data Analyst
2aedc98467bb2918.description:
Data Analyst

US Remote/ Full Time

Reports to VP of Operations
We are looking for a driven and detail oriented Data Analyst to take ownership of all data collection, analysis and reporting.

If you are interested in education and technology and would like to work in a dynamic, entrepreneurial and mission driven environment we would love to hear from you!

We are very passionate about what we do and this is an exciting opportunity to join our talented team and work with our fantastic products.
About Us
MarcoPolo Learning is an award-winning developer of educational curriculum and technology for early learners. Serving both the home and school market, We are best known for our flagship learning app, MarcoPolo World School. Emmy-nominated for its premium video content and highly engaging child-facing technology, the program focuses on skills that develop curiosity and a lifelong love of learning. Our STEAM-focused TV series, THE POLOS, reaches over 500 million households across the world.
With offices in New York and London, we have put our focus on serving a global audience and developing our brand by partnering with leading media and educational groups throughout the world including Teaching Strategies (US), Bright Horizons (US), New Oriental (China), SKY (UK), BT (UK), Viacom (India), NatGeo Kids (Latin America) and many others. MarcoPolo is a venture-backed startup with strategic investors New Oriental (NYSE: EDU) and Boat Rocker Media of Canada (CA: BRMI).
About The Role
As Data Analyst you will develop an ongoing data process and will help to deliver key insights to a collection of internal and external stakeholders.
You will partner and collaborate with teams across the business and help them make smarter and better informed decisions by providing critical insights analysis.
What You Will Do

Create and refine reports for our clients and internal stakeholders
Analysing and translating business needs into data models
Contribute to future product strategy through data-driven insights
Create solutions to surface critical data and performance metrics
Find, extract and organize data from our systems and databases
Collaborate with Engineers to establish solutions to support the information and analytic needs.
Collaborate with key business stakeholders to define and improve key business outcomes


Your Skills and Experience

Must have experience with working with a wide range of reporting needs generated from different business units
Must have a solid understanding of how modern web and mobile applications work
Must have a solid understanding of how a consumer internet business operates
Experience in analyzing datasets, benchmarking, creating performance reports etc.
Ability to cleans large data sets, interpret data, and draw conclusions
Experience in developing data dashboards and data visualizations
Ability to use analytical and statistical techniques to analyze data and present insights in support of a business aim
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Accuracy and exceptional attention to detail
Experience working in a fast-paced startup environment


Nice to have

Experienced with at least one BI tool (Amplitude, MixPanel, Tableau, Power PI, Looker, etc.)
Experience using SQL, Python or R to produce reports and analyses


What We Offer
Competitive salary based on experience

Comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and vision plans,

remote work flexibility.
We want to recruit the best talent for the next phase of company growth. MarcoPolo Learning is based in London and New York. We anticipate this role will be based in the US with the option to work in our New York office.
How to Apply
If this sounds like a perfect role for you send us through your resume and someone from our People team will be in touch shortly.
MarcoPolo Learning is committed to building a diverse team. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

b451f302c34f293b.title: Margin & Collateral Analyst
b451f302c34f293b.description:
Team responsibilities

Calculate, issue and agree margin calls with Brokers to mitigate credit risk exposures on behalf of our clients.
Agree and book collateral trades to satisfy incoming margin calls from Brokers.
Liaise directly with our clients and their Brokers on a daily basis via email and telephone.
Perform daily reconciliations between systems and the market to ensure accurate record keeping and risk mitigation.
Partner with internal groups within Agency Collateral to provide a superb client experience that will assist in retaining current business and growing new client activity.
Additional Information
The Collateral Management team provides a service to our wide range of clients across European working hours, and is also required to work UK Bank Holidays as governed by client requirements.
Cover may be provided via rotational shifts so a flexible approach to working hours is therefore needed, including overtime.
The team supports flexible working including occasional working from home.
There will be the potential for opportunities to travel both domestically and internationally once established in role.
Continued growth of the team provides opportunities for progression for team members demonstrating strong levels of performance.
Qualifications / Experience

Excellent Client Service skills
Numeracy skills
Attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to understand complex models within financial sphere
Problem solving and data analysis
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to prioritise and to work under pressure
Ability to work under own initiative
Educated to at least A level standard or equivalent - education within subjects relating to finance favourable - e.g. Maths, Economics etc.
Experience within Collateral or Derivatives is favourable but not essential.

The world's most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. We provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk and extend liquidity in markets around the world.
Operations teams develop and manage innovative, secure service solutions to meet clients' needs globally. Developing and using the latest technology, teams work to deliver industry-leading capabilities to our clients and customers, making it easy and convenient to do business with the firm. Teams also drive growth by refining technology-driven customer and client experiences that put users first, providing an unparalleled experience.

ec612215cc77d62b.title: Data Analyst
ec612215cc77d62b.description:
Data Analyst required; I am working very closely with a Global Security Organisation who are on the search for a seasoned Data Analysis to join their team. This Data Analyst role is a key part of accelerating the move in this direction and will be responsible for building the structures & frameworks required for us to surface the right data at the right level.
Primarily remote opportunity, with very occasional travel into their London Based Office.
Responsibilities and Accountabilities:
Empower product teams to easily make data-informed decisions via self-serve solutions such as visualizations, dashboards, and other data / statistical models.
Set up & develop the infrastructure and frameworks required for squads to be able to independently acquire pertinent data to inform decision making
Work with and support product, business & technology teams in their decisions using quantitative and qualitative data to inform next steps

Personal Specification:
Strong communication skills, verbal and written, able to break down complex topics into simple solutions and ideas
Ability to speak and write English fluently (only applicable if we recruit outside of UK/US)
Comfortable working with, managing & influencing a variety of stakeholders from multiple business areas
Previous experience in delivering analytical solutions for complex product-related tasks (user pattern research, feature analysis, use case analysis etc)
Driven by creating business value and achieving outcomes more than complexity of technical solution

Please note that you will need to either be on a ILR or hold a British Passport to be eligible for this requirement! My client does not have the capacity to sponsorship!

313df143cd5c0a15.title: Data Analyst
313df143cd5c0a15.description:
Establishing a presence in Europe over 18 years ago, the European business now has some 800 staff in a broad range of professional services including: Performance Improvement, Financial Institutions Advisory, Tax and Disputes and Investigation Services.
Over the past year A&M Europe has transformed its internal Management Information systems creating new data pipelines and building out analytical and visualisation capabilities to provide real-time insight to the business. Due to an increasing demand from the business for these tools and insights we are now looking for a recent graduate to join the team to continue this journey.
The successful candidate will be responsible for collecting business requirements, building out ETL processes and creating/developing Management information systems. The candidate will work with all our practice areas including Private Equity Performance Improvement, Corporate Transformation, Disputes & Investigations, and Financial Services Advisory.
Overview of the role:
The successful candidate will:
Use data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI to present findings in dashboards to internal teams.
Work with large datasets helping the business draw insights through a range of data-driven solutions including financial modelling, time series analysis, KPI development, and reporting.
Be skilled in a range of tools including R, Python, or other language as well as SQL to interrogate and understand the data as well as continue building out internal databases.
Will have an entrepreneurial spirit and not be afraid to challenge the status-quo.
Necessary Skills and Qualifications:
A 2:1 Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university or equivalent work experience
Experience in utilising data to solve business/financial problems.
Experience in SQL and/or another coding language (Python, R)
Experience building and maintaining Relational Databases
Preferred Skills and Experience:
Experience working with data visualisation software (Tableau, Power BI)
Data focused master’s degree or relevant analytical work experience
Diversity & Inclusion
A&M’s entrepreneurial culture celebrates independent thinkers and doers who can positively impact our clients and shape our industry. The collaborative environment and engaging work—guided by A&M’s core values of Integrity, Quality, Objectivity, Fun, Personal Reward, and Inclusive Diversity—are the main reasons our people love working at A&M. Inclusive Diversity means we embrace diversity and we foster inclusiveness. It runs through how we recruit, develop employees, conduct business, support clients, and partner with vendors. It is the A&M way.
Voluntary Inclusion

It is Alvarez & Marsal’s policy to provide and promote equal opportunity in employment, compensation, and other terms and conditions of employment without discrimination because of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service, pregnancy, marital status, family status, religion, national origin, age or disability or any other non-merit based factor in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations.
Unsolicited Resumes from Third-Party Recruiters
Please note that as per A&M policy, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters unless such recruiters were engaged to provide candidates for a specified opening. Any employment agency, person or entity that submits an unsolicited resume does so with the understanding that A&M will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion without any fee owed to the submitting employment agency, person or entity.

27f04d0e83bf02cd.title: Liability Data Analyst
27f04d0e83bf02cd.description:
Reference
VN-22051
Role Type
Permanent
Location
Hove
Salary
Up to £37,000 Depending on Experience
Closing Date
4 March 2022
Your role at a glance
Are you an inquisitive and passionate Data Expert? Do you enjoy stimulating collaboration that drives innovative delivery? If you are looking for a role a where you can improve your skill and grow your career. This is the perfect role for you!
Our growing Liability Data Service (Institutional Retirement) team in Hove have this unique opportunity for a Liability Data Analyst to join the team.
In this role, you’ll support end to end Pension Risk Transfer Transactions, ensuring the data schedule between L&G and the Trustees accurately reflects the liabilities that are priced and transacted. You’ll also ensure that all accurate data is passed on to the relevant downstream users for loading to the core administration systems.

What you'll be doing
Taking responsibility for operational data management within the following - Data Cleansing, Data Validation, Data Transformation, Data Integration and Data Mining.
Ensuring that high standards of quality (to include accuracy and timeliness) are delivered to the customer.
Consulting with a range of internal Legal & General Retirements customers to understand their requirements deliver the required solution. Assisting in the development of solutions for new and existing customers to meet their requirements.
Supporting in the testing and documenting of all processes.
Ensuring all internal customers and any relevant third parties are kept updated in a timely fashion on any key information which impacts their processing to enabling them to treat the end customer fairly.
Ensuring that all processes are created in the most efficient method and allowing a full audit trail throughout the lifecycle of all data items.
Working with all internal partners to improve the quality of the data held on all systems.
What we're looking for
Knowledge:
Understanding of project management and test frameworks
Proven technical aptitude
Understanding of legislation and remains compliant: GDPR, Money Laundering, Complaints, Treating Customers Fairly, Breach guidelines
Strong customer focus with ability to maintain and improve relationships with both internal and external stakeholders and customers
Understanding of defined benefit pension schemes is highly beneficial
Ability to provide an accurate and cost-effective service -getting it right first time

Experience:
Advanced user experience in MS Excel & Access
Familiarity with either SAS, SQL, Python or VBA is beneficial
Experience in delivering best practice MI solutions - highlight reports & management dashboards
Benefits
Whatever your role, we reward ability, performance and attitude with a package that looks after all the things that are important to you. Our employees have a wide range of benefits including a generous pension scheme, life assurance, 25 days’ holiday, private medical insurance, discretionary performance related bonuses, paid overtime, a variety of share schemes, discounts at both a huge range of high street stores and our own great products. Your hard work will be rewarded when you join us.

5eb89e037a663759.description:
Introduction
The client has an office in London and Swindon but they are happy with people working remotely. There will be an element of travel to client sites. This could be weekly depending on the client.

Our client is ranked by the Financial Times in the UK’s Top 20 Leading Management Consultancies, and the highest ranked SME.

They transform their clients’ operational data into actionable, operational intelligence to achieve measurable and sustainable cost benefits.

Whether their clients are looking to make longer-term strategic cost decisions or drive operational efficiencies at pace, they work as part of their clients’ teams to deliver tangible, quantifiable results.

They combine consulting expertise and our proprietary digital platform to generate and embed client-specific insights that deliver operational cost savings.

The client is looking for someone with experience with visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau, and also experience SQL and Python. The successful candidate will need to be very strong technically and take leadership of some projects.
Key responsibilities
As a management consultant you will develop a deep understanding of a client’s business, their customers operations, and key drivers
Managing and building client relationships
Acting as a Project Lead, ensuring delivery excellence and exceeding customer expectations across data driven projects
Developing execution plans for data projects, performing risk analysis and managing change control
Generating key ideas and conceptual frameworks to help solve problems and drive out insightful fact-based findings and recommendations
Recommending approaches to collecting and interrogating client’s data to meet the projects requirements, identifying additional opportunities where appropriate
Reviewing and testing the quality of data ensuring consistency across all sources
Contributing to proposal submissions and business development initiatives under the direction of the Leadership team
Manage a team and prioritise workload for self and others to ensure deadlines are met
Skills & experience
A minimum of 5 years’ experience as an Analyst gained in one or more of the company’s core sectors:
Aerospace and Defence
Automotive
Consumer products
Industrial manufacturing
Private equity
Technology, Media & Telecoms
Transport & Infrastructure
Experience delivering and managing data driven projects within a consultancy
Managing and coaching junior analysts
Data consolidation, cleansing and validation to provide business insight
Manipulating large data sources, optimising using indexing and subsets to provide usable data for fast analysis
Data Visualisation using software such as Tableau and PowerBI
Building data models in Excel, Python or SQL
Presenting analysis results to clients and senior stakeholders

If you have the relevant skills and experience, we would be really excited to hear from you!

Our client is committed to providing a diverse and inclusive workplace and welcomes applications from all backgrounds.
Additional benefits
25 days holiday plus bank holidays
Wellbeing cash plan
24/7 GP Access
Cycle to work scheme
Workplace Pension
Wellbeing sessions

88ec2875da93a886.title: Business/Data Analyst
88ec2875da93a886.description:
About us

National Grid touches the lives of almost everyone in the UK, with an energy network that stretches across the Atlantic. We’re an international team, and our work underpins the lives of millions of people. Feet forwards, head up, and eyes bright, we’re working hard to create value for people today – and shape the future of energy tomorrow.

In the UK, we don’t generate or sell energy – we join the dots to get energy from A to B. From making a cup of tea in the morning, to keeping the lights on in hospitals, our electricity network puts power in the hands of people. Without it, the world as we know it would grind to a halt.

The world of energy is changing beyond recognition. Working at National Grid, you won’t just be touching the lives of almost everyone in the UK – you’ll be shaping the way we use and consume energy for generations to come.

Job Purpose

We have a new and exciting role for a Business Analyst to be responsible for providing function expertise against the IT Tower capabilities; in identifying and evaluating options for improving business processes & systems, defining requirements and ensuring effective use of information systems in meeting the needs of the National Grid business.

Key Accountabilities

You will be responsible for investigating business situations, identifying and evaluating options for improving business processes & systems, defining requirements and ensuring effective use of information systems in meeting the needs of the National Grid business.

You will work independently leading investigation work to determine business requirements and specify business processes through improvements in information systems, information management, practices, procedures and organisation change, whilst conducting investigations for strategy studies, business requirements and feasibility studies.

The role will require you to apply and monitor the use of required modelling and analysis tools, methods and standards giving special consideration to business perspectives and identify your stakeholders and their business needs.

You will have good Leadership skills and a track record of ability to influence business or IT colleagues. You will have a desire to continue your own development as a Business Analyst constantly striving to improve techniques and methods employed.

Qualifications

You will be a talented Business Analyst working on the delivery of artefacts for medium and large sized projects, such as the investment proposal, user stories, business requirements document and supporting analysis deliverables.

You will have experience and knowledge of project development processes and Agile methodologies.

You will hold a relevant business analysis qualification – e.g. BCS BA Diploma or working towards.

You will have experience working as a Business Data Analyst on projects delivering data pipelines &/or data analytics.


What You Get

A competitive salary between £44,400 – £61,450 – dependent on capability

As well as your base salary, you will receive a bonus based on personal and company performance and a competitive contributory pension scheme where we will double match your contribution to a maximum company contribution of 12%. You will also have access to a number of flexible benefits such as a share incentive plan, salary sacrifice car and technology schemes, support via employee assistance lines and matched charity giving to name a few.

ad8e96d7c64bd127.title: Climate Data Business Analyst
ad8e96d7c64bd127.description:
Job reference 3745 - Intermediate
Job summary
At Phoenix Group we’re passionate about helping people achieve a more secure and sustainable future. With circa 14 million policies, we make a difference to the lives of millions of people as the UK’s largest long-term savings and retirement business. Join us now and you’ll grow with us as we build on our success.

We’re currently recruiting for a Climate Data Business Analyst to join our Sustainable Investments team to support our activities in the evaluation and reporting of the carbon profile of our investment portfolios.

Key Responsibilities

Assist with measuring, collecting and consolidation of the carbon profile of the Shareholder and Policyholder investment assets of the Phoenix Group.
To design and populate reports to summarise the carbon intensity and other related metrics.
Working collaboratively with different stakeholders to gather asset data and other inputs to perform the key calculations.
Data cleansing – identifying, assessing and resolving any data quality issues where required.
Developing good relationships with users across the firm and interacting with them to resolve any data quality issues.
Working with IT to incorporate this data into Phoenix Group’s strategic investment platform: INVista

What We’re Looking For

Essential

Ability to review, analyse and manage large volumes of data.
Outstanding attention to detail and a meticulous approach to work.
Strong organisational skill.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

Technical Skills

Educated to degree level or equivalent.
Broad understanding of how Financial Services operate.
Microsoft Office with advanced knowledge of Excel

Desirable

Knowledge of Carbon foot printing methodologies
Knowledge of Asset Management and/or Life and Pensions insurance

What We Offer

Bring your ‘whole self’, skills and dedication to the Phoenix Group and we’ll recognise your effort, support your development and help to drive your ambition. We’ll ensure you’re rewarded for your contribution with a competitive package that includes an attractive pension, annual bonus potential, private medical insurance, generous holiday entitlement, enhanced maternity and adoption leave and a range of other financial services and lifestyle flexible benefits.

Join us and you join a unique organisation. It’s not just the 14 million policyholders we serve, or the £300 billion of assets we look after. Or that we’re a FTSE 100 company that has been listed as one of the UK’s Top Employers for nine years running. It’s our talented, inclusive and diverse workforce that makes us a success. We offer flexible working opportunities ensuring we attract and retain the very best of talent. Find out about more about our people’s stories, our values and our commitment to diversity.

Key Competencies

Analytical Skills

Use of a variety of diagnostic techniques to understand a situation/issue/problem by breaking it down and tracing the root cause/underlying implications in a methodical step-by-step way.

Communication Skills

Clearly and effectively communicates information, ideas, plans, requests and opinions to internal and external stakeholders through a range of channels including written and oral. Ensures alignment with communication guidelines and policies.

Information Seeking

The ability to efficiently and effectively collect information, to provide insight to others or to help solve business issues.

Stakeholder Management

Interprets and influences both the external and internal environments by creating positive relationships with stakeholders through the appropriate management of their expectations and agreed objectives.

Online Interviews and Onboarding

All our interviews, onboarding and new joiners are now managed remotely. We have in place a strong virtual support network to ensure new colleagues are supported and developed as they navigate their first few months with us

About Us

Phoenix Group is a member of the FTSE 100 index and is the UK’s largest long-term savings and retirement business. We specialise in the acquisition and management of Heritage life insurance and pension funds. We’ve businesses in the UK, Germany and Ireland and hold a broad range of both Heritage and Open products split across three key business segments: UK Heritage, UK Open and Europe. Our open business manufactures and underwrites new products and policies to support people saving for their future in areas such as workplace pensions and SIPPs, primary under the Standard Life brand. And we market corporate pension trustee services and manufacture products to be sold under other brands. Did you know Phoenix Life manufactures SunLife’s market leading Guaranteed Over 50’s plan? Find out more about Phoenix Group here.

We value diversity in our workforce and welcome enquiries from everyone.

Then we have the right opportunity for you.Here at Newcastle Financial Advisers Limited we are seeking bright and ambitious new talent to help us achieve our ambitions and have an exciting opportunity to join us this September in our operations team.Oh and by the way we also don’t just pay a training allowance you will join us on a ‘real living wage’ salary, we believe our colleagues deserve a fair day’s pay for a hard day’s work.About the roleAs a Data Analyst Apprentice, you will be working towards a Level 4 Data Analyst qualification to become a fully-fledged Data Analyst by the time you’re finished.You will support the Newcastle Financial Advisors Limited team through the management of key administrative processes and the development, maintenance and analysis of the central MI suite.With the support of your manager and mentor, you will have objectives to work towards to make sure you are developing during your time with us. You will have exposure to the responsibilities of wider team by supporting projects and tasks in the department.What else?Love a challenge?We go beyond the traditional apprenticeship route to offer you the opportunity to help you learn and experience things beyond your role that will support your career development through a team challenge project with our Early Talent community.We’re passionate about our programme and always looking for ways to evolve and improve and that’s where’ll you come in. We really want to hear your ideas throughout your time with us, so you’ll have lots of opportunity to suggest new and innovative ways of working.Like what you see? It’s easy to apply were all you need to do is submit a short application form & CV via our online portal. Our approach to selection is through a virtual assessment centre which will include competency based interview and an activity specific to the business area that you have applied for and a group task. We anticipate that this will take place 5th April 2022.About YouYou should have a minimum of 5 GCSE’s (Grade A*-C/ 4-9, including Maths and English) are essential, preferably including an ICT grade.An ability to communicate effectively with others via a range of methods along with first class attention to detail is a must.Be able to demonstrate basic understanding and usage of a personal computing device with basic IT administration skillsFor full details please download the role profile.About UsNewcastle Financial Advisers is the Society’s financial advice subsidiary and has been providing trusted advice to new and existing customers for over 17 years. Our teams of Financial Advisers deliver expert face-to-face advice to customers across our entire branch network, supported by our sales support team, providing technical and administrative services.We deliver a restricted advice service through our Appointed Representative partnership with Openwork, one of the UK’s largest financial advisory networks. The Openwork proposition provides access to a wide range of investment, pension and protection products from some of the UK’s biggest financial brands to meet the financial planning needs of our customers.As an inclusive employer and a member owned mutual, we aim to reflect the communities we serve in order to drive the right colleague, customer and business outcomes. We encourage applications from candidates from a variety of backgrounds and life experiences, providing the diversity of thought required to constructively challenge and drive innovation.As well as joining a great team within a truly local organisation our colleagues also benefit from;25 days holiday plus bank holidaysCorporate bonus schemeGenerous Pension SchemePerformance Related PayStaff offers and access Subsidised event ticketsEmployee Assistance ProgramLife assuranceThe health, well-being and safety of our colleagues and candidates during this challenging time is paramount. With this in mind, we have refreshed our approach to recruitment and have outlined a new process of remote selection and on boarding. Upon starting a new role with us, we will ensure you are equipped with the correct tools and technologies to enable you to do your best work remotely. Longer-term, our focus remains on driving a culture of flexibility and encouraging colleagues to maintain a healthy work/life balance through flexible working arrangementsJob Type: ApprenticeshipSalary: £17,889.00 per year

c199da7b536dcbe0.title: Data Analyst
c199da7b536dcbe0.description:
.
Data Analyst
Location: Thimble Mill Lane, Birmingham
Business Area: Highways
Contract: Permanent, full time

Let’s shape a world, together.
Kier Group is many things to many people. We’re a leading Regional Builder, the UK’s No. 1 Highways service team and a Top-Three Utility & Power provider. We’re an industry-leader in health and safety at work - and a responsible citizen who adds billions of pounds of social value to the communities where we do business. Above all, we’re a team of people built on many backgrounds and experiences, a company that values you for who you are and what you do
Key Responsibilities
The BHISC Performance Analysts are part of the Quality & Performance Team. The contract completes approximately 14,000 unique jobs per month, managed through the Contract’s Management Information System, CONFIRM.
The Team actively monitors the creation, planning, progress and close of the jobs, matched to the performance obligations of the ISC, working closely with the operational teams:
Inspections; Planning; Highways; Street Lighting and Signage; Traffic Signals; Life-cycle; Structures; Urban Traffic Control & Customer Services.
Contract Management, including identification of Performance KPIs
Identify local data owners for general performance data and KPIs
Develop dashboards with data owners to identify data validation and potential conditions
Write reporting exports from operational works database system
Develop performance reporting identifying potential issues from large datasets
Ensuring the timely submission of complete and accurate performance reports
Benchmarking performance data against similar contracts / industries
Produce Business Reports summarising findings from verifying client or local queries
Process Mapping and Lean Sigma to identify Business Improvement opportunities
Produce Business Cases supporting Business Improvement ideas
What do we need from you?
Educated to ‘GCSE’ Maths and English or equivalent you’ll be confident in challenging data and performance levels with Senior Managers. Proficient using MS Office, particularly Excel advanced reporting graphing with large datasets. Have experience in development of Excel analysis and automation using Macros (Visual Basic for Applications).
What will you receive?
You can expect a competitive salary and an outstanding package that includes a matched pension scheme up to 7.5%, 26 days’ annual leave + bank holidays (with the opportunity to buy or sell holiday) together with two employee Share Scheme options (Sharesave and Share Incentive Plan).
Pre-employment checks
It’s worth remembering that if you are successful, we’ll undertake the relevant / standard pre-employment checks after you have been offered a job. This includes taking up your references, verifying your right to work in the UK, verifying your driving licence (if applicable) and a health assessment.
Thinking. Doing. Innovating. Delivering.
Being part of Kier means living our values of being Collaborative, Trusted and Focused. We all have the potential to shape our world, and it’s through these values that we will leave a lasting legacy. Bring your talent and ambition to Kier and you will be given the scope and opportunity to invest in your own future, to build your expertise and contribute to a rich and diverse culture.
Kier is committed to creating supportive and inclusive opportunities for all of our applicants and employees. We appreciate applicants from all backgrounds and we specifically encourage those from underrepresented communities to apply.
If you require any reasonable adjustments during any part of the application process, please let us know so we can discuss and arrange these.
Closing Date: 23/03/2022
Please note, interviews may take place before the closing date, and we reserve the right to close applications early.
Recruitment Agencies - opportunities at Kier are managed by our internal recruitment team. We are unable to accept unsolicited CVs and communications from external recruiters. If there is a specific business need a member of the recruitment team will engage with agencies who have signed up to our PSL to ensure all CV’s are uploaded onto our portal to be considered. For further information, visit our Careers Help page
