e8ef34405ec0b7a8.title: Analyst, Risk
e8ef34405ec0b7a8.description:
ASR Group is the world’s largest refiner and marketer of cane sugar, with an annual production capacity of more than 6 million tons of sugar. The company produces a full line of grocery, industrial, food service and specialty sweetener products. Across North America, ASR Group owns and operates six sugar refineries, located in Louisiana, New York, California, Maryland, Canada and Mexico. In the European Union, the company owns and operates sugar refineries in England, Portugal. ASR Group also owns and operates mills in Mexico and Belize. The company’s brand portfolio includes the leading brands Domino®, C&H®, Redpath®, Tate & Lyle®, Lyle’s® and Sidul®.
OVERVIEW
This position is responsible for executing daily commodity risk management processes in Europe, while providing support for daily commodity processes in North America. These commodity processes reside within the activities conducted by the Global Sugars Group, Risk and Finance functions of ASR Group. This is a great role for expanding one’s knowledge of commodity markets and the underlying instruments. The individual will work directly with a team of 5 – 6 Risk Team members, plus personnel from Global Sugars and Finance on a daily basis.
DETAILED ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
The core element of this role involves the validation of all commodity transactions and price curves, ensuring that they are captured accurately in the risk systems and that risk reports are accurate and fairly represent the commodity and currency positions of the company.
The commodity transactions fall in the following areas:
Raw sugar and direct consumption transactions.
Freight and logistics transactions.
Foreign currency transactions.
Energy transactions.
Futures, options, swaps and other derivatives related to the above.
In each area, the daily processes involve:
Prepare daily and weekly risk reports that may include position reports, limit reports, MTM and P/L reports, strategy reports, transaction reports and summary reports.
Provide transaction and information support to commercial and finance personnel.
3rd party validation that all transactions have been captured in the system properly.
Validate that all sugar, freight, currency and energy price curves have been captured in the system properly.
Validate that melt and sales forecasts have been captured in the system properly and are up to date.
Validate that currency forecasts have been captured in the system properly and are up to date.
Validate that freight assumptions have been captured in the system properly and are up to date.
Validate that FFA and bunker transactions have been captured in the system properly.
Validate the reasonableness of daily margin calls.
Ensure data and position reports reconcile to other company reports including trader position and flash reports, IBP forecasts, accounting results, etc…
In addition to the daily processes, this role is expected to:
Assist and support other commodity risk analysts.
Assist with compliance reporting requirements.
Assist with testing of periodic risk system changes and upgrades.
Assist with market lessons learned training to commercial, risk and finance personnel.
Assist with the planned implementation of a new SAP CTRM system.
This role will require close coordination with Global Sugars, Risk and Finance personnel, as well as with personnel in adjacent processes such as sales, supply chain and IT. Relationships will be very important in fulfilling the job responsibilities.
This position is not just about the numbers. Of critical importance, this role must listen to and understand the strategies and day-to-day commercial activities that are occurring in order to place the transaction activity in context and ensure fair and accurate risk reporting.
WORK EXPERIENCES
Entry level experience as a commodity risk analyst is desired but not required
EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Management Information Systems or similar area of study.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY
No direct reports.
ESSENTIAL CAPABILITIES (KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES AND PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES)
An understanding of commodity transactions and risk management / portfolio management processes.
Strong interpersonal communication skills with commercial and finance personnel.
Attention to details in order to diligently make sure that transactions are captured, valued and reported accurately.
At Tate & Lyle Sugars, the group's values are the cornerstone of our success.
Leadership - our goal is to be the leader in every arena in which we compete. Teamwork - our strength is magnified when we work together. Integrity - honesty and trust are the foundation of our success.Service - we know that the people and communities in which we operate are crucial partners to our success. Sustainability - the member companies of ASR Group are committed to sustainable agricultural and business practices.

eb285f562af5472b.title: Business Analyst
eb285f562af5472b.description: This Business Analyst role reports into the Senior Project Manager at RCHL Group Limited. RCHL is a holding Company for a collection of FCA regulated businesses who specialise in insurance distribution accross a range of sectors including commerical, leisure, professional risks, transportation and associated industries. The role is home based with ad hoc travel to Leeds. If you have general insurance experience and looking for a new exciting opportunity then apply today.OVERALL PURPOSE OF ROLETo work across all business areas on business case development, requirements specification, data migration, testing (including test scripting, regression testing and UAT co-ordination/support) and business intelligence/reporting definition.KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIESRequirements Specification – Uses formal methods to specify business and user requirements to aide applications development including but not limited to the design of transactional web sites, the design and specification of Insurance rating products together with associated risk capture requirements.Facilitation – Successfully facilitates business process and application requirements workshops driving through efficiency and business change for the benefit of the group.Testing – Defines together with relevant business stakeholders the test strategy and test approach for changes. Supports the business areas in test planning, scripting, and test execution.Data Migration - Manages the specification of data migration requirements, mapping specifications and supports the business in migration testing.Systems Analysis –Reviews current systems and their usage to identify deficiencies, inappropriate use and opportunities.IT Delivery – As a member of the IT Team works to ensure that system changes are developed in line with specifications, tested and delivered according to agreed procedures.Supplier Management – Working with partners of RCHL to deliver new applications and enhancements. Acts as an interface between business stakeholders and their requirements and third-party partner’s delivery of systems in order to meet those requirements.Project Management and Change Management – Working with the Project Manager to manage small projects to scope, time, budget and assist with the management of change including; understanding the impact, testing requirements through to live implementation and review.Business Case Development - To support the decision process for new changes including support for developing business cases, producing key decision papers and representing the project at senior stakeholder forums where appropriate.Data Protection and TCF – Ensures that the requirements of the groups Data Protection Policy, the principles of the data protection act and the requirements of Treating Customers Fairly are considered during systems and process specificationsEXPERIENCE, SKILLS & KNOWLEDGEMandatory: Strong experience in the General Insurance industryKnowledge of insurance trading applications and associated toolsDemonstrable experience of working on projectsStrong analysis and problem-solving abilitiesAbility to identify and resolve features and problems in dataAnalytical ability to break down complex problems with excellent problem-solving skillsAbility to create functional and rating specificationsAbility to design and run application test scriptsDesirable: Demonstrable Business Analysis experience across full project lifecycleExperience in documenting business processes, user stories and functional requirementsExperience of working in a formal Project Management environmentAbility to pull together strong business cases based on tangible paybackOther: Ability to communicate complex matters both verbally and written (at all levels)Ability to handle multiple tasks, working effectively both within a team and independentlyAbility to work with initiative, enthusiasm and flexibilityAbility to work under pressure, meet deadlines and prioritise workloadsContinuous ImprovementTeam WorkCommunicationCustomer FocusAchievement focusInnovative approach to workJob Type: Permanent

0b02d42b63add5fd.title: Security Training & Awareness Analyst
0b02d42b63add5fd.description:
The Vocalink Cyber Security team is looking for a Security Awareness and Training Analyst II. This is a newly created position for the Security Operations capability within the Vocalink Business unit under New Payment Platforms (NPP) division at Mastercard. The role will play a key part in the delivery of the Vocalink Security Awareness and Training programme, primarily as the lead on three key deliverables - administrator for the Vocalink Security Information site and coordinator for training and awareness activities to enable colleagues to understand their responsibilities related to Mastercard, Vocalink Security policies and information security controls. Additionally, to be responsible for processing feedback and training data reports and translating into visual representations to enable meaningful evaluation and governance reporting.


Vocalink will have confidence that their security work streams are executed in a timely and effective manner with appropriate governance and communication updates. This will help maintain Executive confidence that security initiatives are focussed on balancing business needs and security controls that align with Vocalink’s position as a supplier of Critical National Infrastructure services. The communications and outcomes managed by the role will also form evidential artefacts for audit purposes and articulate effective Cyber resilience capabilities as defined by regulators.


Role

The role is pivotal in making sure security information is available, current and valid enabling colleagues to source guidance on their security responsibilities. The role will also be key in coordinating training and awareness activities collaborating with SMEs and stakeholders to collate content and supporting through all steps of the training cycle to implementation and collating evaluation and feedback.


The ideal candidate will bring innovation and energy to the role to support maturing the Vocalink Security Awareness and Training programme and to help colleagues to do the right thing.


Support with the development and delivery of awareness and training solutions to develop a positive organisational Security culture.


Act as lead administrator and subject matter expert for the Vocalink Security Information site.


Provide informal training and support to content owners to ensure the Vocalink Security Information site provides current and valid information.


Advise management of corporate intranet policy changes and process updates.


Support production of security awareness communications for publishing through multi-platform internal communications channels (e.g., corporate intranet, newsletters, videos, blogs, email announcements, webcasts).


Collate content with technical subject matter experts throughout each stage of the training cycle.


Coordinate and support Security Awareness and Training events (e.g., booking facilities, scheduling sessions, supporting facilitators and attendees with necessary guidance, supporting in-person / virtual session delivery etc.).


Coordinate with third parties to create infographics and other visual materials to support colleagues' understanding of their Security responsibilities.


Contribute ideas on how to advance internal communications channels and solutions.


Collate and process feedback and management information for Security Awareness and Training solutions for reporting and analysis.


Update and maintain reports and processes.


Track and report internal metrics for employee engagement on Vocalink Security Information site and awareness campaigns.


Provide support to management and junior level team members to achieve team objectives.


All About You

In this role you will need to be able to do, and have experience of, the following:


Exposure to security, including network and internet systems security.


An understanding of Security roles and responsibilities.


Demonstrates basic knowledge of Risk analysis; begins to develop relationships with risk managers, business and technology partners.


Knowledge of the training cycle.


Experience of administering online information sites (e.g., Corporate intranet, information site, Microsoft Teams etc.).


Experience working with internal colleagues across functions and job families and leveraging internal resources.


Experience of collaboration with stakeholders and colleagues across corporate communications.


Experience of organising and delivering awareness campaign events.


Experience of organising and coordinating training and engagement sessions.


Ability to support delivery of training sessions (e.g., presentations, informal learning, workshops).


Demonstrate ability to ask clarifying questions and answer questions in a clear and concise manner.


Use of applications to create visual interpretations and infographics of data.


Use of applications to support creation of presentations and operational process documentation. (e.g., PowerPoint, Adobe etc.).


Proficient in use of Applications and software for the collation and production of data (e.g., Excel, Access etc).


Familiar with online meeting formats for setting up engagement and training sessions.


Ability to work as part of a team supporting management, peers and junior level team members.


Ability to work autonomously with accountability.


Self manages priorities and time to achieve team and personal objectives.


Experience working with ISO27001 and PCI DSS standards.


An understanding of social engineering processes and related positive behaviours.


Broad understanding of data analysis techniques.
COVID-19 Considerations
We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together. In many locations, which may change over time, we’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by video or phone. In addition, in some locations, only individuals who have been fully vaccinated will be permitted inside Mastercard offices until further notice.
In the US, Mastercard is a government contractor, which may legally require most Mastercard employees to be vaccinated unless a verified approved medical or religious exemption is granted. Further, we are currently making every effort towards having employees return to work in the office 2 days per week, if that makes sense for their team. Everyone must be vaccinated to enter Mastercard offices at this time. Therefore, we expect all candidates to be vaccinated or to be approved for a medical or religious accommodation prior to commencing work at Mastercard.
Corporate Security Responsibility

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

a6d77ad5ec6a7ce1.title: Data Scientist, Product Analytics
a6d77ad5ec6a7ce1.description:
As a Data Scientist at Facebook, you will shape the future of people-facing and business-facing products we build across our entire family of applications (Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp, Oculus). By applying your technical skills, analytical mindset, and product intuition to one of the richest data sets in the world, you will help define the experiences we build for billions of people and hundreds of millions of businesses around the world. You will collaborate on a wide array of product and business problems with a diverse set of cross-functional partners across Product, Engineering, Research, Data Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Finance and others. You will use data and analysis to identify and solve product development’s biggest challenges. You will influence product strategy and investment decisions with data, be focused on impact, and collaborate with other teams. By joining Facebook, you will become part of a world-class analytics community dedicated to skill development and career growth in analytics and beyond.Product leadership: You will use data to shape product development, quantify new opportunities, identify upcoming challenges, and ensure the products we build bring value to people, businesses, and Facebook. You will help your partner teams prioritize what to build, set goals, and understand their product’s ecosystem.Analytics: You will guide teams using data and insights. You will focus on developing hypotheses and employ a diverse toolkit of rigorous analytical approaches, different methodologies, frameworks, and technical approaches to test them.Communication and influence: You won’t simply present data, but tell data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your partners using clear insights and recommendations. You will build credibility through structure and clarity, and be a trusted strategic partner.


Responsibilities:

Work with large and complex data sets to solve a wide array of challenging problems using different analytical and statistical approaches.
Apply technical expertise with quantitative analysis, experimentation, data mining, and the presentation of data to develop strategies for our products that serve billions of people and hundreds of millions of businesses.
Identify and measure success of product efforts through goal setting, forecasting, and monitoring of key product metrics to understand trends.
Define, understand, and test opportunities and levers to improve the product, and drive roadmaps through your insights and recommendations.
Partner with Product, Engineering, and cross-functional teams to inform, influence, support, and execute product strategy and investment decisions.


Minimum Qualifications:

A Bachelor’s degree (BA or BS)
A minimum of 4 years of work experience in analytics (minimum of 2 years with a Ph.D.)
Experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), and/or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R)


Preferred Qualifications:

A Bachelor’s degree (BA or BS)
A minimum of 4 years of work experience in analytics (minimum of 2 years with a Ph.D.)
Experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), and/or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R)


Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

1a08d93a43ccc452.title: Analytics & Data Science Opportunities
1a08d93a43ccc452.description:
What We'll Bring:
About TransUnion


At TransUnion, we have a welcoming and energetic environment that encourages collaboration and innovation and we’re consistently exploring new technologies and tools to be agile. This environment gives our people the opportunity to hone current skills and build new capabilities, while discovering their genius.
What You'll Bring:
About the Data Science and Analytical team
In the Data Science and Analytical team, we rely on powerfully insightful data and we’re seeking data scientists, engineers and analysts to work in a dynamic, research-oriented team. We serve a broad range of customers who we provide predictive modelling and scoring solutions to. We are also involved in the development of and update of key data products. Our roles include opportunities to take part in data analysis and modelling projects from design to communication of results. The engineering-based roles involve working closely with our data scientists to help build the data assets needed for analytical projects and data products.
We in an exciting period of growth and have several roles available both in the UK and Lithuania.
The types of roles we have include:
· Data Scientist
· Analytical Consultant
· Data Engineer
We pride ourselves on the collaborative and supportive way in which we work, both in our dealings with customers and as an internal community of professionals. We’ve established effective ways of working from home that help to keep our associates engaged with our work and with each other, regardless of location.
We’re part of a Global structure and work together with our international colleagues to share best practice, knowledge and expertise.
Impact You'll Make:
What’s in it for you?
At TransUnion you will be joining a friendly, forward thinking global business.
As well as a competitive salary, our benefits package includes 26 days’ annual leave (plus bank holidays and a buy/sell holiday scheme) a generous contributory pension scheme, private health care and a host of other employee lifestyle benefits. TransUnion have held the wellbeing of all employees at heart throughout the COVID pandemic and have given additional TU holidays and offer Headspace accounts to all UK employees as ways of supporting our mental health and work life balance.
We take Corporate Social Responsibility seriously; our TU Good Works scheme supports communities around the world by advancing financial inclusion and education.
Remote Interview & Hiring Process
Protecting the health and wellness of our colleagues and candidates considering a career at TransUnion is our highest priority. Our recruitment and on-boarding experience for this role is fully virtual for the time being. Candidates interviewing will get to know our team over the phone and video, and this role will operate virtually upon hire until we return to the office. Even though we're not physically together right now, our goal is to provide you a supportive candidate and on-boarding experience that will immerse you in our culture and set you up for success at TransUnion
TransUnion Job Title
Sr Analyst, Data Analysis

2aaa1b1af4a287ec.title: Data Visualisation and Automation Analyst
2aaa1b1af4a287ec.description:
We’re a multi-channel, multi-brand business serving millions of customers a day, with the UK’s largest loyalty scheme and an ever-evolving set of digital platforms. All of this equals over 1.2 billion transactions each year, presenting a volume, depth and complexity of data that few can match.
We don’t think we’re exaggerating when we say we have the most exciting data set in the country. And from the insights gained, we build scalable, high-performance products using cutting-edge technology that give our customers an amazing shopping experience – like our award-winning Smartshop app. In an inclusive, agile environment, you’ll have the space to be curious, to experiment, and to solve real-world challenges. And you’ll get to see your creations in the hands of millions of people across the UK.
Working within an Agile framework, as a Data Visualisation & Automation Analyst, you’ll contribute to the production of data products focused on supporting the delivery of our goals.
You’ll deliver value through data across all aspects of the business, providing a range of scalable data products to various business units to help solve complex business challenges and ultimately help Sainsbury’s to become more data centric.
Creating the right, most efficient solution first time is key. You’ll contribute to our focus on rationalising non-value adding tasks, removing inefficiencies and maximising the return that we generate from our data products.
More about the role
Work with product owners in relevant squads to create an automation, reporting and visualisation backlog
Work with the product owner to understand where the biggest value-creating opportunities lie and then deliver both POCs and productionised reporting capabilities that fulfil the requirements
Prioritise requirements and produce a roadmap of activities, with product owners, which will deliver in a timely, cost-effective and highly repeatable way for your stakeholders
Develop innovative and engaging ways to interpret data, challenge the status quo and create a capability around data interpretation to make sure that we go beyond delivering the data
Grow and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders presenting information in a credible manner
Help drive the community practices for data visualisation, better design and delivery of the platform
More about you
A strong understanding of the tools and technologies that can support great reporting, including Microstrategy, PowerBI, Tableau, SAS
A detailed understanding of the ‘art of the possible’ for automation, reporting and visualisation
A strong understanding of the tools and technologies that can support great reporting, automation and visualisation
Strong knowledge of database, data warehouse and big data technologies and how to leverage them
An explicit understanding of data and data structures that support the creation of automated reporting and products
Proactivity and initiative with commitment to delivery
The ability to engage with and influence stakeholders
An ability to present specific work to stakeholders
Ability to quickly understand complicated issues and reporting scenarios
A good commercial understanding and how that relates to opportunities in data, analytics and science

As well as lots of on-the-job training and endless opportunities, you’ll get:
Colleague discount across our multi-brands – Sainsbury’s, Argos and Habitat
Holiday allowance
Bonus scheme
Pension plan
Special offers on gym memberships, restaurants, holidays, retail vouchers and more

Work-life balance is important to us, so we offer our colleagues as much flexibility as possible in line with the needs of their role. We trust them to decide how, where and when they work, combining remote and collaborative working with a flexible approach to hours, giving them plenty of time and space for life outside of work whilst delivering against our business goals.

cc26d067d94f4869.title: Financial Support - Data Analyst
cc26d067d94f4869.description:
Flexible on location with travel to Birmingham once or twice a week
Some careers shine brighter than others.
Our Wealth Management teams provide a range of services to HSBC customers, supporting key life events, such as saving for university fees, buying a new home to retirement; whilst protecting their family and interests for every eventuality, providing confidence and reassurance.
We support every aspect of a customer’s financial life, helping them to grow, manage and preserve their wealth and provide a professional service in a world of increasing complexity. This includes a greater range of financial products and solutions, and a better understanding of our customers’ affairs. For us, Wealth Management is genuinely a relationship-based service.
For our customers, this means a tailored approach, personalised attention and our teams working collaboratively to support their entire life journey.
We are currently seeking an experienced individual to join this team in the role of Financial Support – Data Analyst
In this role, you will:
Consult with stakeholders (FST) to understand and translate business needs into data products for reporting, visualization, analytics and machine learning.
Find quantitative solutions to business problems and articulate the results clearly to all stakeholders
Collaborate with global teams on the development of global data products and metadata standards.
Develop, deploy and maintain models which can predict, forecast and simulate scenarios with different variables
Conduct in depth analysis into potential issues and identify possible resolutions
Requirements
To be successful in this role you should meet the following requirements:
Experience of managing large quantities of data to identify solutions
Strong working knowledge of excel and SAS
Ability to work with and influence senior stakeholders
Experience and development of ML and analytic models.
Experience of agile and agile lifecycle management tools, in particular JIRA and Confluence
At HSBC we look to enable our employees to better balance their work / life priorities and have the flexibility required to meet challenging needs as they progress through different life stages. Where possible we will consider the following flexible working options: part-time working, job sharing, term-time working, and working from home and staggered hours. If in considering a role with HSBC you have a need for some flexibility in your working arrangements please discuss this with the recruitment team in the early stages of the application process.
As a business operating in markets all around the world, we believe diversity brings benefits for our customers, our business and our people. This is why HSBC is committed to being an inclusive employer and encourages applications from all suitably qualified applicants irrespective of ethnicity, religion, age, physical or mental disability/long term health condition, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by local law in the jurisdictions in which we operate. a7cfa298a23709d4.title: Data & Systems Analyst
a7cfa298a23709d4.description:
Health & Safety is crucial in our business to keep our colleagues as safe as possible, therefore it is important we review, analyse and improve! With all of this in mind this is why we are on the lookout for a Data & Systems Analyst to join our Health and Safety team on a remote basis.
This will be a brilliant opportunity for a Data Analyst looking to make a career move into Health & Safety as all training and qualifications will be provided.
Interested? Read on to find out more!
The Role:
It is an exciting time here at City Plumbing. We’ve recently become a stand-alone business and are making real strides in creating a diverse and inclusive workplace that celebrates and values diversity.
One of the areas we’re looking to recruit for is a Data & Systems Analyst to provide excellent analytical and reporting information to deliver improvements across our Health and Safety.
Your day to day role will play a pivotal part in this so we can make the right decisions in relation to safety improvement decisions. You'll maintain the Incident Reporting System so that the information displayed is accurate and reflective of the businesses approach and policies.
Areas of focus include:
Be part of and engage in Safety Improvement Plans to move the Safety Performance forward.
Compile reports with identifying trends to improve safety & wellbeing throughout our branch networks.
Working with the Head of Safety carry out deep dives into the management of businesses key safety risks, external benchmarking and reporting.
Ensure actions are communicated throughout the business and analysed.
This is primarily a remote-based role with visits to our office on an adhoc basis as required.
You should be based in the UK and our Head Office is based in Crick, Northamptonshire.
This means you could be from areas such as Birmingham, Chesterfield, Coventry, Derby, Leamington Spa,
Leeds, Leicester, Loughborough, Manchester, Mansfield, Milton Keynes, Northampton, Nottingham, Peterborough, Rugby, Sheffield.
You:
You’ll live and breathe our customer-first ethos, with a creative and proactive approach. You’ll enjoy working collaboratively with the wider team and you’ll be committed to acting with integrity and honesty in everything you do.
Required skills and competencies:
Enthusiastic about Health & Safety and keen to learn, ideally with a NEBOSH National General Certificate, NEBOSH Diploma or equivalent Membership with IOSH but if not we can provide training.
Experience within process management, keenly identifying improvements.
Critical thinking with an “outside the box” approach.
Be able to work remotely whilst engaging with the wider team and business networks.
It is highly likely you will have worked in any of the following roles and/or markets, and worked with the following products and/or services: Analyst, Builders Merchants, Building Products, Construction, Data & System Analyst, Data Analyst, H&S Analyst, Health & Safety, Plumbing & Heating, System Analyst.
Us:
From boilers to bathroom suites, tubing to towel rails and everything in between, City Plumbing has all the products our customers need to complete the job. And we have all you need to build a successful career!
We’re proud of our reputation for selling quality plumbing and heating products to both trade and retail customers and we’re super excited about our future. We put our colleagues at the heart of all we do, giving them all the tools they need to be successful, happy and feel rewarded in their career with us.
Benefits Package and Cultural Environment:
Discounts, savings and cash back at numerous retailers
Savings on driving lessons, phone bills, gym memberships as well as further benefits
Life assurance
Bonus
Extended family policy including maternity, paternity, additional annual leave and more
Mental Health First Aiders and Employee Assistance Programme, let's be there for each other
Complete induction and a company that lets you grow and encourages development
Financial education and loans
Flexible working options
Striving to create an environment of inclusion so everyone can be their true self
And more!
We’re passionate about creating an inclusive workplace that celebrates and values diversity. Bring your whole self to work regardless of age, disability, gender identity or reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. We don’t want you to ‘fit’ our culture, we want you to enrich it. #BelongWithUs
We are committed to best practices in recruitment and undertake Basic Criminal Record Disclosures for candidates that are offered employment within our branches that undertake deliveries for British Gas. This check will only be undertaken after the acceptance of an offer of employment.

241a1965d7f2cd64.title: Intern - Data Analyst
241a1965d7f2cd64.description:
PEARSON DIGITAL & TECHNOLOGY INTERNSHIP PROGRAM
Data Analyst
Why join Pearson’s intern program?
Pearson is the world’s learning company. We help people of all ages acquire the knowledge and skills they need to be successful in their work and careers. We believe that everyone should be able to keep learning, every day and in every way, throughout their lives. Bringing together everything we know about the science of learning and the latest technology; we’re shaping the future of teaching and learning.
We’re looking for the next generation of talented undergraduates to join our team for an unforgettable 12-week internship. An internship at Pearson is an opportunity to bring your own unique perspective as a learner, together with your academic knowledge, technical skills, and enthusiasm, to help create products used by students like you.
As one of our interns, you will gain a comprehensive introduction to our business. You’ll be assigned to a team and work on real-life projects that bring our qualification delivery and services to life. Support in the role, in job training and professional development will be provided to enable you to contribute to the business. You’ll also have direct access to a senior member of the team, as each intern will be mentored to help you make the most of the 12-week program.
We foster a work environment that’s inclusive as well as diverse, where our people can be themselves. Every idea and perspective are valued so that our products reflect the people we serve — our teachers and learners.
What Does the Internship Program Offer?
Successful candidates will spend 12 weeks working with our UK Qualification and Assessment Technology teams.
You will be paid for the duration of your internship. The internship begins on Monday, June 6th and ends Friday, August 26th.
Job Description
As a Data Analyst, you will develop expertise in acquiring, understanding, and developing requirements from the business around functionality and support, working collaboratively with the content creation and development, engineering, solutions management, and architecture teams. You will be helping Pearson analyze problems, working with technical partners and teams to understand the business needs. You will be a competent user of word processor (Word), spreadsheets (Excel), and Python or user of SPSS and/or R (and a willingness to learn new programs).
What does the 12 weeks involve?
Interns will develop a broad knowledge of business analysis at Pearson, completing rotational work with several teams focused on different business and technology assessment delivery There will also be an opportunity to work and contribute to solutions management strategic initiatives.
Minimum Requirements
We look for Students pursuing a STEM degree (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) with information strong written and verbal skills or relevant work experience.
We also look for Students pursuing a degree in computer science, software engineering, information security, engineering, or technology.
Students should also have strong communication skills, both written and verbal along with an ability to translate business requests into technical asks. Experience in computer software is a bonus.
Students should be a ‘people person’, well-rounded and happy to take on new challenges. Flexibility is important, as you will be joining a versatile and agile solutions management team.
Graduation date between December 2022 and May 2024 and should be able to travel to one of our office locations.
Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.
Learning is the most powerful force for change in the world. More than 20,000 Pearson employees deliver our products and services in nearly 200 countries, all working towards a common purpose – to help everyone achieve their potential through learning. We do that by providing high quality, digital content and learning experiences, as well as assessments and qualifications that help people build their skills and grow with the world around them. We are the world’s leading learning company. Learn more at pearsonplc.com. Pearson believes that wherever learning flourishes, so do people. We are committed to being an anti-racist company in everything we do. We value the power of an inclusive culture and a strong sense of belonging. We promote a culture where differences are embraced, opportunities are accessible, consideration and respect are the norm, and all individuals are supported in reaching their full potential. Through our talent, we believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion make us a more innovative and vibrant place to work. People are at the center, and we are committed to a sustainable environment and workplace where talent can learn, grow, and thrive.
To learn more about Pearson’s commitment to a diverse and inclusive workforce, please click here: http://www.pearson.com/careers/diversity-and-inclusion.html
Pearson is an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against employees or job applicants and select the best person for each job based on relevant skills and experience.
We are also committed to building an accurate picture of the make-up of the workforce and encouraging equality and diversity.
The information you provide will stay confidential, and be stored securely. It will not be seen by those involved in making decisions as part of the recruitment process.
Job: PROJECT/TEMPORARY WORKFORCE
Organization: Assessment & Qualifications
Schedule: FULL\_TIME

6f5ea3f102782481.title: Data Ethics Analyst
6f5ea3f102782481.description:
Are you looking for a unique opportunity in a fascinating and fast developing field? Data is becoming the world’s most valuable asset; however, its misuse is among its biggest risks. At Admiral we recognise the huge benefits Data Science can bring to our customers by developing new and exciting propositions tailored to their needs. However, we also recognise that without due care there are risks.
Data Ethics is an engaging new area helping Admiral ensure that we are treating our customers data with respect and ensuring our predictive models are as free as possible from bias. The role will sit in our Group Data Protection and Privacy function and involves working with Data Scientists across the whole organisation. It involves thinking about the potential biases in predictive models and guiding the business to better solutions. The role will involve thinking about the potential biases and noise that may impact predictive models and helping advise Data Scientists on how to achieve fairer outcomes. These considerations will rarely be simple and will involve careful thought and balance.
We appreciate this is a new area and therefore, the person, their attitude and their determination are as important to us as their experience.
Location
We are open to discussion around remote working possibilities (UK only). Our whole business is still working remotely. We will provide you with everything you need to work comfortably from home. We expect you to be working remotely for the foreseeable future. Once it’s safe to return to the office, you can agree your on-site days at the office with your Line Manager. Ideally we would like to see you at least once or twice a week at our Cardiff office but we do offer some flexibility depending on your location.
Responsibilities
Include but are not limited to:
Reviewing data science models to detect potential bias
Providing practical advice on how to improve predictive models
Writing practical and realistic guidance papers on the ethical use of Artificial Intelligence
Working with data governance colleagues across the business to provide support and guidance

Key Skills, Qualifications and Experience
Essential
Experience with data science and artificial intelligence
Understanding of best practices when building predictive models and segmentations
Passionate about data ethics
Ability to think through the factors that may bias a predictive model
Comfortable communicating with Data Scientists, stakeholders, and data protection professionals
Confident in acting as a subject matter expert
Strong presentation skill with ability to champion data ethics
Possession of strong team working and leadership skills

Desirable
Technical knowledge of data privacy and data governance practices
Strong report writing skills
Experience in designing processes
Passionate about continued learning and personal development

We recognise that this is a broad list of requirements and not everybody will have all of these. Therefore, we welcome you to tell us what other skills and experience you will bring to the role.
Interviews will take place during weeks commencing the 7th and 14th of March 2022.
Salary, Benefits and Work-Life Balance
We do not have a set salary for this position, as it will be dependent on the successful candidate’s experience. We are happy to see CVs from all candidates who meet the requirements and will be happy to discuss the remuneration package.
As the only FTSE 100 Company headquartered in Wales and ranked one of the best big companies to work for by the Sunday Times, Admiral is an exciting place to take your career. We are proud to be a diverse business where we put our people and customers first. We have great benefits to ensure colleagues have a great work-life balance; it's one of the reasons we are proudly the only company to have been named one of the Best Companies to Work For every year since 2001. We want you to have an element of freedom to define a working lifestyle that supports this, so accommodate flexible hours wherever possible.
You can also view some of our other key benefits here; https://admiraljobs.co.uk/employee-benefits/.
Please note, we are unable to accept CVs via email. If you would like to apply for the position, please click "Apply".
#LI-SE

70575ca5cc12458e.title: Product Catalogue Data Analyst
70575ca5cc12458e.description:
Product Catalogue Data Analyst
The Product Catalogue Data Analyst is the technical expert when it comes to own bought and concession product data within the life cycle of the Harrods Product Catalogue. You will be responsible for managing the technical elements of the product catalogue, on-boarding and maintenance, integrations across multiple projects. You will work actively with our project coordinators, business teams and external partners, both business and technical, to ensure best in class data quality accuracy and service. As a senior member of the Product Catalogue Operations team, you will develop a deep understanding of our data and lead the way in delivering insight into our data for functional teams across the business.
About Us
The IT Department at Harrods provide support for all electronic communications systems within our luxury store in Knightsbridge, the Hammersmith Head Office and all other subsidiaries of the Harrods Group through both internal and external support teams.
About You
Experience with SAP Retail is preferred, particularly Materials Management. We will also prefer it if you have experience with Data Syndication platforms. Experience in E-Commerce, product catalogue management, or supply chain would be valuable, as well as working on a multi-national level with multicultural teams. You must have the ability to work on own initiative, prioritise work, handle pressure and take day-to-day decisions on the running of the different on-boarding projects. You will be a demonstrable influencer, ability to drive impact and implement change without direct lines of authority. You will be resilient and flexible, comfortable with complexity and ambiguity. We are looking for an individual that is results-driven and a person of upmost integrity.
Our Promise to You
No one gets slotted into a box at Harrods. We will encourage you to be yourself and bring your whole personality to work. Then, together, we will find new ways to delight customers, bringing them luxury experiences that redefine the art of what is possible.
More immediately, you will benefit from an excellent benefits package, including a company pension, flexible working, 25 days’ holiday and your birthday off, up to 33% in-store discount and a season ticket loan.
Uniquely You
At Harrods we believe the personality and authenticity of our people sets us apart. We celebrate and invite applications from all cultures, backgrounds, tastes and experiences and are proud of our culture where people from all walks of life can grow and thrive. What makes you unique makes us exceptional.
If you want to know more about our people and our culture, search #TogetherHarrods on LinkedIn, Facebook or Instagram, or tune in to our podcast True Tales from Harrods. Listen on Spotify, iTunes, Google Podcasts or Amazon Music.

Job Title: Data Analyst
Location: London
Corporate Title: Assistant Vice President
You will be joining our Name List Screening Run The Bank Data Team are working on Regulatory commitments relating to identification and remediation of critical data elements and controls, as well as the need to align to the Bank’s data strategy to support the delivery and maintenance of the Name List Screening (NLS) global data quality controls framework.
You will be monitoring and reporting on Data Quality exceptions across all party data feeds working with the a wide variety of stakeholders including the Business to ensure adherence to Regulatory data demands and Deutsche Bank Policy such as Party Data meets minimum data requirements.
Our team of experts will be there to coach and support your development to ensure you excel in this role. Enhance your career prospects through exposure to these advanced technologies and tools.

What we’ll offer you
A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its centre.
You can expect:
Competitive salary and non-contributory pension
30 days’ holiday plus bank holidays, with the option to purchase additional days
Life Assurance and Private Healthcare for you and your family
A range of flexible benefits including Retail Discounts, a Bike4Work scheme and Gym benefits
The opportunity to support a wide ranging CSR programme + 2 days’ volunteering leave per year
Your key responsibilities:
Responsible for ensuring Data Quality remediation reports are issued for over 100 source feeds to respective stakeholders in each business line
Responsible for ongoing monitoring of completeness attestations and building Management Information (MI) to ensure producers adhere to regular attestations
Delivering monthly monitoring reporting to all appropriate forums and key staff within each business line and dealing with any queries that may arise
Ensuring that all data quality queries from source teams are tracked appropriately and investigated on a timely basis
Escalation of Data Quality issues to NLS Data Lead
Your skills and experience :
Ability to interpret MI and deliver key messages to senior stakeholders
Ability to prioritize multiple tasks and work under pressure
Educated to Bachelor’s degree level or equivalent qualification/work experience
Knowledge of JIRA and Confluence
Good experience within Anti-Financial Crime
How we’ll support you :
Training and development to help you excel in your career
Flexible working to assist you balance your personal priorities
Coaching and support from experts in your team
A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs
About us and our teams

Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network.
Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.

We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.

6d902794d3be50bd.title: Junior Data Analyst
6d902794d3be50bd.description:
About Us
Facilities Management (FM) are responsible for maintaining the diverse portfolio of buildings in the West Sussex estate such as libraries and fire stations. The maintenance and repair that our FM teams provide to WSCC buildings ensures that our colleagues across WSCC can continue to deliver the important frontline services to the residents of West Sussex.

For more information about West Sussex County Council, please visit our WSCC About Us page.
About The Job
Salary: £29,577 - £32,234 per annum

Working Pattern: Full time, 37 hours per week

Location: Chichester, County Hall
Interview Date: Week commencing 7th March 2022

This role sits within the Performance and Requirements team that supports the operational FM teams to deliver a quality service, whilst also focusing on business optimisation. Your data analysis will cover all areas of FM, from analysing helpdesk performance to reflecting the delivery of FM services to the schools. Your analysis will provide important data to assist with decision-making on these key areas of FM, producing regular reports and dashboards tailored to the varying needs of FM operations at all levels of management and delivery.

You will have excellent working knowledge of Microsoft packages including complex Excel formulas and functions (e.g. VLOOKUP and pivot tables). You will have an intuitive curiosity about the story the data is providing and be able to pre-empt when second order analysis will be required. You will also have theoretical and practical knowledge of data collection and visualisation and experience of using software such as PowerBI.
Experience and Skills
Key Skills:
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to research and analyse varied and complex data from a variety of sources and produce qualitative information with minimal guidance.
Ability to undertake specific projects, from designing collection of data to production of final report, organising and planning own workload, meeting business requirements and working to agreed deadlines.
Highly computer literate with sound and accurate IT skills in order to manipulate complex data and produce reports using a variety of software.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to present analysis and findings clearly, concisely, and accurately to a range of audiences in ways that promote understanding.
Advisory, negotiation and persuasion skills to encourage others to adopt a particular course of action
Sound problem solving skills with the ability to analyse complex issues and diagnose business solutions, making logical and rational decisions based on all information available.

Qualifications and/or experience:
Relevant degree, or equivalent qualification or experience demonstrating that level of applied knowledge in data / information management and complex statistical analysis.
Demonstrable evidence of designing and developing data management systems.
Experience of reviewing collection and management systems and implementing change.
Experience of undertaking complex statistical analysis and detailing findings to a wide range of audiences.
Demonstrable evidence of organising and handling large amounts of data and of producing high quality reports to inform business decision making.
Experience and confidence in dealing with people and the ability to establish credibility at all levels of the organisation

Rewards and Benefits
As an employer we recognise that it is our employees that are central to everything we do. We aim to create a supportive and dynamic working environment where employees can achieve their full potential, achieve a healthy work-life balance and are rewarded for the work they do.

For a full list of the benefits offered to you as a West Sussex County Council employee you can find them on our Rewards and Benefits page.
Further Information
The reference number for this role is EIE00858 .

For an informal conversation or for further information regarding the role, please contact Amelia Dovelle (Business Intelligence Manager) at Amelia.Dovelle@westsussex.gov.uk.

To apply, please follow the links below upload your CV and complete the application explaining the skills and experience you can bring to the role ensuring that any gaps in employment are covered in your CV. Please ensure you have saved the job description attached to the main advert on our website as, once the job has closed, you may not have the opportunity to download again.

We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults. This post is subject to referencing and a health check.

West Sussex County Council is an equal opportunities employer committed to promoting an environment that is inclusive and free from all forms of unlawful or unfair discrimination and values the diversity of its people. We actively welcome applications from people of all backgrounds and take every possible step to ensure that no individual will be disadvantaged.

For information regarding your eligibility to apply for this role under our Disability or Veteran’s Guaranteed Interview Scheme, this can be found on our application help page.

382e1c4685952225.description:
POSITION SUMMARY
We are recruiting for a Finance Data Analyst to join our team in Salford.
This role will offer the opportunity to be involved in executive level analysis and reporting and you will be expected to be a pro-active contributor to ideas and projects that will improve the efficiency of the finance department and help add value across the business. It will also offer full study support towards the completion of Chartered Institute of Management Accountants qualification.
You will be supporting the FP&A manager to provide a regional function that takes ownership of performance data and directly impacts the financial decision-making process through analysis, financial projections and reporting. A function that provides robust and adaptive support to the finance team and wider business in a fast paced, commercial environment and can provide valuable insight for a global organisation that continues to grow both organically and through acquisition.
This role will be worked on a hybrid basis, a blend of WFH and in office.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide accurate monthly Client Profitability analysis for the regions sites using various reports and systems to gather data and allocate costs accordingly.
Provide detailed analysis of outsourced production costs for the region by site and by client on a monthly basis.
Support the FP&A Manager to develop and maintain accurate KPI analysis for the EMEA region.
Support the FP&A Manager to develop and maintain standardised Financial Performance reporting for the EMEA region
Support the FP&A manager to leverage the different financial reporting systems to develop more accurate and insightful KPI reporting for the business.
Execute and develop reports and dashboards in the financial reporting systems for use by various financial and non-financial end users.
Support the monthly forecasting process, creating / running reports from the forecasting system and inputting data into the forecast templates.
Support the annual budget process by providing financial data to the budget owners and helping to complete budget templates for the UK sites.
Maintain existing monthly commercial reporting.
Maintain existing financial models that support the financial analysis of the UK business.
Provide ad hoc cost analysis, retrieving data from the various systems to highlight overspend vs budget by site and by cost centre.
Provide analytical support to the Business Partners and FP&A manager on ad hoc projects.
Gather financial and non-financial information from across the business and produce reporting that provides business insight.
Successfully complete the requirements of the CIMA apprenticeship scheme.
QUALIFICATIONS / REQUIREMENTS
Foundation level CIMA or equivalent.
Ability to learn new systems quickly.
Comfortable working with multiple systems and large volumes of data
Proficient Excel Skills
Ability to adapt priorities quickly and to work within strict reporting deadlines.
Ability to work autonomously and at the same time pro-actively work with various functions across the business to gather financial and non-financial data.
Determination to get to the root cause of any data inaccuracies and resolve any issues

a238168285f95a4f.title: Healthcare Data Analyst
a238168285f95a4f.description:
Our client, Holmusk, is a data science and digital health company building the largest Real World Evidence platform for mental health, generating evidence and developing digital solutions which advance health research, innovation and care.
To join their UK based team, they are now seeking a Healthcare Data Analyst to work in their growing analytics and data science team, delivering the important role of processing and analysing clinical record data to support the successful development and implementation of their award-winning Management and Supervision Tool (MaST).
Healthcare Data Analyst, your responsibilities:
Managing the day-to-day implementation of MaST for existing clients and the development and adaptation of MaST for new clients and future solutions
Developing and maintaining a deep understanding of mental health data collected by clinical record systems
Investigating queries in data and processing, providing appropriate testing, validation and adjusting processes where necessary
Working closely with client sites to explore and determine analytical insights that deliver value for mental health services via their products
Developing and maintaining regular and ad hoc reporting to communicate insights to clients and colleagues
Gathering feedback on the products from clients and clinical colleagues and making clear recommendations to the team about valuable improvements to the analyses and data visualization
Collaborating with the technical and clinical teams so that analytics is seamlessly incorporated into MaST (and future digital solutions)
Collaborating, and sharing insights, with the wider Holmusk business
Developing expertise in and upholding information governance, clinical safety requirements and ethical standards

Healthcare Data Analyst, perfect applicant:
Proven expert in creating algorithms using data sets, gaining understanding and insight out of data, particularly complex data sets, translating non-technical suggestions into quantitative analysis
Highly developed, passionate problem-solving ability
Moderate/advanced data processing using Python and scripting for SQL-based databases, ideally SQL Server
Ability to present complex data results clearly and effectively using Excel or other data presentation tools
Proactive desire to explore and understand the "why" of analysis results
Experience of database structure design, creation and optimisation of databases
In depth knowledge of software design and development practices, including version control, unit testing, documentation management, code deployment, and ideally in the context of data processing
Capable of healthcare data sets, particularly mental health
Passion for improving healthcare, preferably with experience of doing so
Ability to manage multiple stakeholders’ priorities and deadlines
Willingness to travel, mainly in the UK
Motivated, comfortable with ambiguity, proactive and paying attention to detail
Experience of applying machine learning techniques a bonus

Healthcare Data Analyst, the benefits:
Competitive salary
Opportunity to join vibrant and diverse team
Fuel reimbursement
Role specific governance training (internal and external support)
25 days holiday

The appropriate training, internal and external support will be provided.
This is a full time, permanent role with flexible hours – you will be home-based, but some travel will be required. A full UK driving licence and your own transport is a must.
Pure Human Resources Limited works in partnership with Holmusk in providing Recruitment support. No applications from agencies please.

9fd83172fb0230f5.title: Cloud Data Analyst
9fd83172fb0230f5.description: As a Data Analyst at CTS you will be at the forefront of cloud technology, using your skills in a varied and evolving consulting role. You will solve complex customer-facing challenges, helping diverse organisations to create and modernise data analytics platforms as they move to the cloud.You’ll analyse and define your customers’ requirements, and then manage the end-to-end execution process. You’ll liaise with multiple stakeholders to ensure the timely delivery of appropriate outputs, in accordance with project plans and deadlines.Exposure to a wide variety of technologies and software is a given, and you’ll be expected to investigate the use of new technologies as they become available.You’ll understand the value of our long relationship with Google, and will help to grow and promote our data analytics capabilities within their teams.Please Note: Experience with 'Looker' is highly desirable for this role.What you'll do: Strong data processing experience and understanding of developing against common database technologies (such as MS SQL, PostgreSQL, MySQL, etc)Comprehensive problem-solving skills and proven ability to apply creative and innovative thinking in order to identify and support the resolution of data quality and integrity issues.Understanding of developing visualisations and reports using BI solutions (such as Looker, Google Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI, etc)Confident in presenting findings in an effective, structured and actionable way to a wide set of audiences with varying levels of understandingHold the Looker Certified LookML Developer certification or have equivalent Looker experienceDesirable Skills: Exposure to data modelling / data science methodologies is a bonus.Prior experience working in a customer-facing role.Experience working in an Agile team, understanding of project management methods, disciplines and project lifecycles.Location: This role can be based from any of our offices in Manchester, Edinburgh, Utrecht, or it can be fully remote based. Those who choose to work remotely might be required to travel to customer sites and to CTS offices for specific meetings or events. Travel expenses will be charged back to the business.What you’ll get: In addition to the competitive salary, you’ll get private health insurance and company contributed pensions as standard.We have a multitude of other benefits, including a market leading parental leave policies, health & wellbeing initiatives and access to a discounts and rewards programme (including discounted gym membership)You’ll be invited to the bi-annual international company ‘kick off’ conferences, which are a great chance to meet your colleagues that you don’t see everyday.Diversity & Inclusion: Diversity & Inclusion: At CTS, we look after each other and support everyone on our team. We’re proud of our people-centred culture; our diversity brings us innovation and our commitment to inclusion drives us forward. If you share these values and would be interested in joining one of our teams, get in touch today.About Us: CTS is the largest dedicated Google Cloud practice in Europe and one of the world’s leading cloud transformation experts. We offer a unique full stack Google Cloud solution for businesses, encompassing cloud migration, transformative working and IT infrastructure, through to machine learning, big data and app development.We have a brilliant team of more than 200 people in offices in Manchester, Edinburgh & Utrecht as well as across our globally remote workforce. But we’re still growing, and that means we need more brilliant people who share our ambition to join our team.Job Type: Full-timeWork remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

1d9cfb24602c5ca2.title: Data Analyst
1d9cfb24602c5ca2.description:
Primary Details
Time Type: Full time
Worker Type: Employee
QBE’s European Operations, which accounts for over 27% of QBE Group turnover, is a leading specialist in London market and European commercial lines business. Active in both the Lloyd’s and company market, QBE offers considerable diversity to the broking community. We are a socially responsible company and give our customers the ability to invest a portion of their premiums in environmentally and socially beneficial projects.
The Opportunity:
For our Data Analyst role we are seeking recent graduates. Our fantastic and supportive team will be there to train and develop you into the role. We are also offering study support which will allow you to gain further qualifications whilst in employment.
The main responsibility of the Data Analyst will be to assist the Balance Sheet Control Team with accounting and reporting activities ensuring the accuracy and consistency of underlying data, and to liaise with external and internal customers to formulate and implement policy
Your responsibilities for this role may include, but are not limited to:
Be aware of the Data & IT strategy in order to appropriately align effort with this direction
Positively promote the department and company, in order to maximize brand leverage and develop team profile
Participate in internal meetings in order to share and develop strategy, knowledge and best practice
Contribute to developing awareness of Data & MI deliverables across the business in order to ensure the highest standards of compliance
Determine own work priorities and activities in line with team plans to ensure the achievement of personal and team objectives
Build and maintain strong productive working relationships with internal stakeholders to ensure service delivery meets business needs
Deliver data analysis to support business requirement definition and governance compliance
Maintain, monitor and update pertinent to your team, ensuring information is accurate and presents an accurate picture of activity
Support the design, development and implementation of fit-for-purpose data solutions for our customers
Undertake problem investigation, analysis and resolution to maintain and improve service to customers
Contribute to the on-going development of the services provided to ensure it continues to support and meet business needs
You will need to be able to display you have the following qualifications and experience:
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Effective communication and stakeholder management skills
Excellent time-management skills
Willingness to learn
Experience on; Excel , MS Office applications, Word, PowerPoint etc
At QBE, we view our people as our most precious asset. We understand the importance of fostering a work environment that is responsive to the changing needs of today's workforce. QBE aims to build a workplace that is fair and inclusive because we want to attract and retain the best people to do the job. We’re ‘Happy to talk Flexible Working’.
How to Apply:
To submit your application, click "Apply" and follow the step by step process.
Equal Employment Opportunity:
QBE is an equal opportunity employer and is required to comply with equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction it operates.

0276870a90eb09c4.description:

The Ecosystem Data Analyst role will support and coordinate the entire digital and data ecosystem understanding of our organisation to succeed in first party data build-up strategies and therefore deliver more effective, targeted and personalized omnichannel marketing planning and performance in a cookieless ecosystem.

10ec70593a6c6fd9.title: Data Analyst
10ec70593a6c6fd9.description: Wagestream is on a mission to bring better financial wellbeing to frontline workers.We partner with some of the world’s most famous employers, like Pizza Express, Hilton and the UK’s National Health Service, to give their teams access to fairer financial services - all built around flexible pay. Almost a million people can now choose how often they’re paid, track their shifts and earnings, start saving, use budgeting tools, get free financial coaching, and access fairer financial products. All in one financial wellbeing super-app.Wagestream is unique: VC-backed and growing at scale-up pace, but with a social conscience. The UK’s leading financial charities and impact funds were our founding investors, and we operate on a social charter - which means every product we build has to improve financial health and reduce the $5.6bn ‘premium’ lower-income earners pay for financial services each year.You’d be joining a team of 100 talented, ambitious people, growing in Europe, Australia and the USA, building a category-leading fintech product and all united by that same mission.The Opportunity: We are looking for a Data Analyst who will use insight to improve our product for both our users and clients. You will get the opportunity to answer big, undefined questions through data analysis using a modern stack (dbt, SQL, R/Python, Tableau), and have a real impact on our product from day 1.We are just getting started in tapping the potential of our data here at Wagestream. The Data Analyst will be tackling problems not previously investigated, as well as given the freedom to identify new areas of opportunity.The Team: We are currently a small data team, but looking to grow quickly in the next year. In terms of line management, you will report to the Senior Data Scientist who will support you technically and with prioritisation.In terms of your day to day working, we work in a matrix structure and you will be fully embedded into one of our squads working alongside Product Managers, Engineers and Designers. This could mean working in our growth squad in growing user adoption, or in our app squad testing new features and designs.What will you be doing?: As a small team, our data analysts get to span the full data lifecycle; expect to spend some of your time building data models in dbt, doing deep dive analysis using SQL, R or Python, and building dashboards in Tableau. You will also spend time with a mix of stakeholders, getting to know their problems and delivering insight in a clear manner that improves their decision-making.Data at Wagestream is not a service function; you will be empowered to make recommendations and challenge stakeholders based on your knowledge of the data.RequirementsWhat experience might you have?We are looking for a self-starter, focused on business impact, with demonstrated success in a business intelligence or analytics function3+ years of experience in an analytical roleStrong SQL skillsExperience in data visualisation tools (we use Tableau)A strong ability to communicate findings in a concise and engaging mannerExperience working with stakeholders; understanding and challenging requestsCan-be-learnts: Knowledge of statistics (e.g. experimentation design, statistical inference)Experience with dbt, or R/PythonWithin 1 month you’ll have: Spent time understanding our business/product, and aligning with key stakeholdersGot up to speed with our tools and technologiesWithin 3 months you’ll have: Embedded into a squad and working with Product Managers, Engineers and Designers to leverage our data to improve decision-makingWithin 6 months you’ll have: Answered some of the biggest questions facing your squadKey dashboards developed and built for team members to access in a self serve mannerBenefitsYou'll receive £250 "home office allowance" to buy anything to get your home office comfortableState of the art, brand new equipment - from Apple MacBook Pros, 34" curved monitors and Wagestream Swag!We'll help you manage your busy lifestyle with flexible working opportunities; most of the team work "core hours" to allow touchpoints with their team, but we also make sure you have the time to pick the kids up at 3pm, or go for that mid-morning run to boost your productivity. We want you to have the best of both worldsWe offer 25 days annual leave in addition to public holidays (up to 5 day rollover), as well as flexible time off allowances for any ad-hoc childcare/family/caring needsWe offer 12 weeks paid maternity leave and up to 4 weeks paid paternity leave for employees with over 12 months serviceWe will support you with your career endeavours: you'll have access to our learning partner platform - SkillerWhaleWe want to invest in you financially, so we have a pension scheme with AvivaIf you love cycling as much as we do, keep yourself physically fit with our Evans Cycles Ride to Work schemeAnd after a long weeks' work, join us in undoing it all - with membership to The Wine Society. (They also do gin and beer!)We want everyone to achieve "zen mastery" with a free subscription to Calm — work can be stressful and we want to help you switch offFor the days when meditation isn't enough, you'll have access to Spill - free mental health support on the go.And the best benefit of all... Free access to the Wagestream service - naturally!Job Type: Full-time

6f3fc681633d551c.description:

What you will be doing...
Jet2.com and Jet2holidays are looking for a Data Analyst Apprentice to join our growing Customer Data Team in Leeds City Centre. You will be enrolled on to the Level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship, where you will combine high-quality classroom training with online learning, coaching and on-the-job experience to develop real world skills.

Your apprenticeship will last approximately 24 months. Upon completion you will be expected to progress to the role of Customer Data Analyst.

In this role you will run a suite of standard reports regarding customer analysis, purchase patterns and marketing analysis ensuring they are disseminated in a timely and accurate manner, while seeking opportunities to improve the existing regular report portfolio, removing obsolete reports and adding new reports as required. Using SQL to query and manipulate data, you will deliver actionable insights through management information and ad-hoc analysis to drive improved business performance, visualising outputs within Tableau. Our friendly and approachable team members will support your career growth while sharing the same team goals, giving you the opportunity to learn on the job and reinforce your skills while sharing in your team's success.

Desirable Qualities:
A passion for the customer insight and using data to drive performance
A good understanding of Excel
Data matching and writing queries in SQL would be an advantage
A strong communicator
Entry Requirements:
GCSE Maths & English (or equivalent) at grade A-C (9-4)
Strong IT skills
You must not hold an existing qualification at the same or higher level in a similar subject
This is a great opportunity to be part of an exciting forward-thinking business. We operate scheduled leisure flights to holiday destinations in the Mediterranean, the Canary Islands and to European Leisure Cities from our 10 UK bases.
