1e0dfc128a4a6ac2.title: Junior Business Intelligence Engineering Specialist
1e0dfc128a4a6ac2.description:
Kraken IM is an award-winning tech start-up based in Middlesbrough. We build tools for some of the world’s largest engineering companies all over the world to ensure they get the data they need to complete their products and meet their challenges towards net-zero carbon.

We are seeking a talented and detail focussed BI specialist to work closely with the existing team and help develop and shape how we leverage data within Kraken IM.

You will have the opportunity to make your mark utilising cutting edge technologies and processes throughout the whole data lifecycle. The successful applicant will be working in unison closely with the team and our customers so there is huge potential to broaden your experience also learn from some successful and highly experienced individuals.

You’ll be using both our existing Kraken tools and BI processes and tools to work with and generate useful insights by transforming and wrangling engineering data.

Tasks

We are looking for an enthusiastic junior BI specialist/analyst to join our team. You will report directly to the management team. Your primary focus will be to gather, exploit and transform our client data. There will be a large element of transforming and mapping engineering data.


Extract live data from the systems and convert data into meaningful and actionable insights
Apply and transform naming in customer data to engineering standards
Implementing, delivering and maintaining effective business intelligence solutions and dashboards
Ability to work independently and be proactive in seeing work through to completion
Maintain and develop own skills, knowledge and capability to an appropriate level to fulfil the role

Requirements


Exceptional Excel and experience with Data Visualisation - PowerBI is preferable
Self-motivated and dynamic with the ability to consistently work towards tight deadlines and prioritise effectively in accordance with business needs
Knowledge of databases and operating systems
Ability to learn new software and technologies quickly

It would be awesome if you had experience with some, or all, of the following but again, this is a junior role so if you don't then that's not an issue. We're more interested in your mindset and enthusiasm than a specific experience for this role.


Basic engineering knowledge for the process sector in particular around equipment or construction
Understanding of lifecycle analysis for greenhouse gas emissions
Have a passion for decarbonisation

Benefits


Flexibility in both location and working hours
Relaxed atmosphere
Competitive salary £25-30k depending on experience
Great benefits

This is an excellent career progression opportunity – we’re still a young company so you have a chance to grow and develop alongside the company and you’ll get the opportunity to be involved in our decisions. This is an opportunity to broaden your skillset, work on projects all over the world in an exciting new space.

18c8c2d1b2cb4601.title: Data Analyst
18c8c2d1b2cb4601.description:
Springer Nature opens the doors to discovery for researchers, educators, clinicians and other professionals. Every day, around the globe, our imprints, books, journals, platforms and technology solutions reach millions of people. For over 175 years our brands and imprints have been a trusted source of knowledge to these communities and today, more than ever, we see it as our responsibility to ensure that fundamental knowledge can be found, verified, understood and used by our communities – enabling them to improve outcomes, make progress, and benefit the generations that follow.

Visit: group.springernature.com and follow @SpringerNature

.sfpanel .content {padding: 0 40px !important;}

At Springer Nature we are dedicated to providing the best possible service to the research community. We help authors to share their discoveries; enable researchers to find, access and understand the work of others.

We are now looking for a Data Analyst to join our product team dedicated to digital transformation in peer review and open access publishing.

Our product teams constantly strive to make the process of publishing research better, easier and more rewarding through strong focus on researcher needs, use of new solutions and challenging the status quo.

As a Data Analyst you will join our product group and work closely with product managers and product teams to further drive our data-driven approach to problem solving and opportunity mapping.

Currently, the job is mainly remote. When normality resumes, the role will be based in Kings Cross, London, with flexible working from home policies. You will also be working with colleagues in Lisbon, Berlin, Heidelberg and Pune, so expect some travel.

Visit sndigital.springernature.com to learn more about who we are and what we do.
The Work

Springer Nature has a portfolio of over 3,000 peer-reviewed journals and books across all areas of science. The Digital Transformation group you’ll be joining has been looking at the legacy systems and processes across our imprints and working on creating a world-class submissions experience for our global audience of scientific researchers and editorial staff.

As a Data Analyst, you'll be analysing data from our core submission and peer review platform as well as from related websites, systems and tools that offer additional services to our users. You will provide actionable analysis and insight into the behaviour of editors, researchers (in their roles as authors and peer reviewers) and general trends in the world of research and research publishing.

You'll be working in close partnership with the Head of Product Strategy, Product Managers and cross-functional product teams in Digital Transformation, data teams in other areas of the business and other business partners from Springer Nature.

What you will be doing

Within 3 months

You will:
Understand the core of our processes and customer journeys

Become familiar with the work that is ongoing or already done in the metric and data tracking space

Get familiar with the our data tools and system infrastructure

Audit our data capabilities; understand the key metrics that each team and the program as a whole is responsible for and why.

Within 6 months

You will:
Help create a longer-term data health plan that shows how we can remove unnecessary complexity, conflict and noise in data sources, consolidate data sources where possible and streamline our data gathering and analysis processes;

Support the product development teams in creating and delivering tools that allow them to easily track, share and socialise their KPIS/OKRs.

Create data dashboards and visual monitoring tools that provide real-time information about progress on the program-wide key results and strategic metrics.

Provide regular updates the teams and other groups both within and outside the program about progress, initiatives, ideas, success stories and lessons learned and support the drive for ongoing adoption of a data-driven decision making mindset

Support teams in constructing and evaluating experiments

6 months and beyond

You will:
Continue with the execution of the data health plan

Deliver insights to support Springer Nature and our customers, looking for opportunities both in business innovation and customer experience

Champion and educate about best practices, governance and safety checks to maintain data tracking integrity.

Continue consulting with stakeholders and partners throughout the business to shape and implement solutions in support of business objectives

Implement cutting edge analytics and data science solutions in partnership with the wider team

Role Requirements:
Strong analytical/quantitative background or equivalent experience

Good working knowledge of SQL and Python

Demonstrable experience of using data insights and analytics to add tangible value in achieving the wider goals and strategy of the business

Excellent analytical problem solving capabilities coupled with business acumen

Well organized and accurate with good time management

Statistics, data science or coding experience is beneficial but not essential

Familiarity with Google data products (Datastudio, Looker, BigQuery, Dataform, Colab, Google Analytics)

Provide training to the wider analytic community and mentor junior roles

Springer Nature is a Disability Confident Committed Employer and we encourage applications from candidates with disabilities. If you consider yourself to have a disability or learning difficulty and wish to submit your application in an alternative format or would like to discuss reasonable adjustments during the application and interview process, please get in touch either by phone on +44 (0)207 014 4020 or by email SpringerNatureUKCareers@springernature.com so we can make any necessary arrangements.

At Springer Nature we value and celebrate the diversity of our people. We recognise the many benefits of a diverse workforce and strive for an inclusive workplace that empowers all our colleagues to thrive. Our search for the best talent fully encompasses and embraces these values and principles. https://group.springernature.com/jp/group/taking-responsibility/diversity-equity-inclusion.

b237e990cfb9adcd.title: Data Analyst Asset Strategy
b237e990cfb9adcd.description:
Contract Type: Permanent Full time 35 hours per week
Location: Cray House Sidcup or West Ham Lane Stratford
Persona: Agile working (60% - 80% working from home)
Salary: Competitive


Closing date for completed applications: 7th March 2022 at 11pm

Remote interviews will be held on 11th March 2022


Due to COVID19, colleagues in eligible roles are currently working from home in line with government guidelines


Early applications are encouraged as we reserve the right to close the advertisement and interview earlier than stated


This is an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join the Asset Strategy team at L&Q.

The Asset Strategy team are responsible for developing and communicating the major works investment programme, which is looking to be upwards of £1.9bn over the next 7 years, this is the largest investment in existing homes the sector has ever seen.


The investment will include traditional component replacement programmes, complex projects, remodelling of dwellings in blocks, retrofit and energy efficiency measures, mechanical & electrical replacement and be aligned to fire remediation projects.
The Data Analysts will be responsible for:

 Leading the collection of data across multiple systems in relation to the condition of over 110,000 homes
 Developing the Major Works investment plan of up to £300m per annum in what will be the largest capital investment programme in the sector
 Championing new ways of working including the use of technology e.g. Power BI to improve the way we develop our programmes
 Working with stakeholders across the business to deliver the largest positive impact to our residents including plans for Net Zero energy retrofit measures
 Support the communication of those plans to internal and external stakeholders

To be considered for this role candidates must be able to demonstrate:
 Detailed knowledge of housing, business planning and asset management systems such as Keystone, Pimms, QL or other stock condition \ asset data systems
 Knowledge of the housing sectors regulatory and statutory requirements
 Highly analytical and able to use and build multiple, complex data sources inc. SQL, Excel to draw effective conclusions
 Commitment to providing high levels of customer service
 Experience in data administration, management and change control processes
 Experience of using Power BI – Desirable
If you are interested in this role and have the experience required, then apply without delay!


At the foundation of everything that we do are our corporate values and associated behaviours. Our organisational behavioural framework outlines the core expectations of all employees, which should be demonstrated at all times when representing L&Q. More information about L&Q’s values can be found on our website and a copy of our behavioural framework can be provided on request.

d93371a9c17df3dc.title: Data Analyst
d93371a9c17df3dc.description:
Job Title: Data Analyst
Data Analyst - 12 month Fixed Term Contract
Location: Can be based anywhere in the UK as long as you’re willing to travel to Hereford when needed!
Salary: £26k-£29k depending on experience, Bonus, Bupa, monthly HEINEKEN brands (alcohol and alcohol-free options available) plus award winning pensions and benefits!
HEINEKEN has been around for over 150 years, and we intend to be around for another 150 years by making a difference in society. As the UK’s leading pub, cider and beer business, the way we make and serve our products can have a significant impact on our customers, communities and the environment. Working sustainably and responsibly is fundamental to how we do business. It’s how we can protect the future of our business and our planet. www.heineken.co.uk/sustainability

What’s the role?
We are looking for a fantastic analyst who will be able to maintain our existing databases across the breweries and support the resolution of any incidents. With strengths and interest in analytics, you will provide support to sites in the roll out and implementation of Global projects and initiatives. Your job is to make sure the flow of information and reporting in the brewery is as smooth as possible.

At HEINEKEN UK we believe in creating advocates out of our colleagues, we need you to become our digital advocate and be recognised as the digital “go-to person” for our stakeholders. Building relationships with all manufacturing sites, Digital & Technology and Global Teams will be key in ensuring successful implementation of digital tools aligned to TPM standards.

What are we looking for?

Ideally, we are looking for relevant qualifications in Business Information Technology or similar, but we would look to someone with proven analytical experience within a similar manufacturing site too. . The tasks of this role mean that you will need advanced Excel skills and PowerBI, as well as a working knowledge of MS Access and SAP. Equally experience of project coordination is sought after. If you had other experience in other Manufacturing and or Supply Chain Operations (e.g. Purchasing, Technical, or Logistics) within a complex supply chain environment, we are always looking to build on our processes and bringing the outside in.

What have you got to lose by applying?
We are extremely proud of the progress we have made on our I&D agenda. We’ve reviewed our policies, introduced smarter working principles, and created colleague taskforces focusing on LGBTQ+, Race & Ethnicity, Disability, Age and Gender. Research shows that some of us in these groups are less confident to apply for roles when we don’t have all the experience required. If you’re passionate about this role then we’d very much encourage you to apply, telling us why you see such a good fit in your covering letter, and let’s see what happens next!

Closing Date – Monday the 14th of Feb

4eba1f1a650ecd59.title: Quantitative Analyst
4eba1f1a650ecd59.description:
Quantitative Analyst
London

As a Barclays Quantitative Analyst, this is your opportunity to head the full development lifecycle of the market risk models according to the standards defined by Basel, local governing regulators and internal risk management. The output of QA Model Risk suite of models includes key capital and Risk Weighted-Assets metrics such as Value-at-Risk, Expected Shortfall, Incremental Risk Charge, Credit Valuation Adjustment, Valuation Adjustment Risk, and standardized RWA.

Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.

What will you be doing?
• Participating in the design and the development of robust, scalable, and extendible Market Risk quantitative solutions
Developing and supporting various parts of our strategic Market Risk Engine framework for scenario generation for VaR and Stresses based on historical simulationsInitiating clear and solid designs to implement proposed modelling changes and/or extensions to existing ones, and, importantly, deliver in dynamic, agile, and ambiguous contextsAssisting in the development strategic frameworks and platforms to perform market data validations and general data modelling analyticsSupporting current risk models and actively contribute in on-boarding any necessary improvementDelivering prototypes using or extending as appropriate our Python-based modelling platform

What we’re looking for?
• Master’s degree or PhD in engineering, physics, mathematics (or other equivalent scientific discipline)
Extensive knowledge of quantitative finance / financial engineering. Practical experience with Market Risk models, risk metrics, tail statistics and financial productsHands-on development experience in Python, including scientific stack, object-oriented design patterns, machine learning libraries, shared codebase, data structures and databasesOrganized and superb communicator. Strategic thinker, with great ability to explain complex ideas in a clear and coherent mannerStrong attention to detail, but capable to deliver on time

Skills that will help you in the role:
• Familiarity with Credit Flow & Structured products business and their quantitative modelling
Experience with scenario generation, Monte Carlo and/or historical simulation methods, time series processing, data miningExposure to advanced data modelling techniques for algorithmic validation and missing data imputation (outliers’ detection, machine learning / neural networks regression for proxying)Proficiency with GUI design and interactive tooling to deliver our analytics to clients and stakeholders

Where will you be working?
North Colonnade is home to our investment bank and is in the heart of Canary Wharf, just a short walk from our headquarters at Churchill Place. It boasts an array of onsite amenities such as dry cleaner as well as a deli and buffet style staff restaurant. The building is easily accessible by tube, docklands light railway and all major bus links. The atmosphere is second to none with a real buzz being created around the offices within.

a6c5a53f2a9b6caf.title: BCP Fraud Data Analyst
a6c5a53f2a9b6caf.description:
Fraud Data and Control Analyst
Northampton
As a Barclays Fraud Data and Control Analyst you will be working within Global Financial Markets (GFM) with a focus on BPI (Barclaycard Payments Issuing) portfolio. You will be providing data & insight support across Fraud Strategy and Operations working with Fraud analytics and wider business functions. This is an exciting opportunity to support the business with the provision of first line of defence Fraud Risk Strategies that meet Barclays Enterprise Risk Management Framework.
Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.
This opportunity is open to flexible working arrangements. Such as working from home, flexible or compressed hours, and part-time options. If you have a need for flexibility, please apply and discuss this with us during the hiring process.
Flexible working gives everyone at Barclays the opportunity to integrate professional and personal lives, if you have a need for flexibility then please discuss this with the hiring manager.

What will you be doing?
Undertaking investigational analysis on cases from different areas to help determine root causesTaking responsibility for the production of governance and reporting to assist the management of the fraud payments issuing portfolioDeveloping, interpreting and presenting reports to operational and Senior Managers on quality performance, providing regular reports to highlight issuesBuilding accessible data for analysis, maintaining, enhancing and creating data marts to enhance granular reportingOptimising and maintaining the company’s Fraud’s data and control environment, supporting data initiatives across the portfolio including migration to SAS Grid and HadoopPerforming agreed controls and checks to ensure the business adheres to fraud proceduresAssessing the impact on change both driven internal and external to fraud and the impact this could have on the operational teamsSupporting and driving local continuous improvement initiatives to enhance processes, controls etc.
What we’re looking for:
Proficiency in performing data analysis utilising a standard statistical package such as SAS (preferred) or SPSSA clear understanding of the methods underlying predictive modellingCompletion of a degree in a numerate or semi-numerate subject or equivalent relevant work experienceThe ability to deliver against complex data projects from inception through to completion
Skills that will help you in the role:
Experience in the financial industry: ideally within a card environment with knowledge of the Fraud operating environmentsCommunication and persuasion skills with the ability to think quickly and package ideas and results in a logical, understandable and compelling wayA passion for adding value to the business through the production of empirically sounding policies and approachesA passion for data and modelling, and how this contributes to the business
Where will you be working?
Northampton was the birthplace of Barclaycard in 1966 and we've been based in Pavilion Drive since the building opened in 1997.
We purchased the building from the landlord in early 2018 as a sign of our commitment to investment in Northampton. Plans to further develop this Campus-style location are under way to allow for a real collaborative work environment. Based just off the A45 it is easily accessible by both car and bus routes.

ee985d9aecdf086e.title: Data Analyst
ee985d9aecdf086e.description:
Data Analyst
00086022
Shared Services
We serve and protect those who serve and protect us. Attracting and retaining the sharpest minds is essential for our Shared Services Business. Our aim is to recruit the very best talent. At BAE we want to be the leading employer in defence and security for valuing diversity and inclusion. We care about difference in all forms and want to create an inclusive environment where everyone can be themselves and reach their full potential.
We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and particularly from sections of the community who are currently under-represented within our industry, including women, people from ethnic minorities, people with disabilities and LGBTQ+ individuals. We also want to be a preferred home for veterans and reservists.
At BAE Systems we are committed to supporting work life balance for all our employees and embrace a range of modern working practices, which aim to enhance flexibility for individuals whilst also enabling business performance. Flexibility provisions vary by role, but include; hybrid working arrangements, flexible working patterns and shift working.
Our Shared Services Business
If you’d like to make a real difference where it counts, BAE Systems is the place for you.
From keeping soldiers, sailors and pilots safe to helping countries prosper, from developing the next generation of supersonic aircraft to investing in the next generation of super-smart talent – at BAE Systems, we work together to give our customers an essential edge in protecting the things that really matter. Lives, livelihoods, ways of life.
As part of the Shared Services team, you’ll be at the heart of this endeavour – working closely with our air, maritime, land and cyber and intelligence businesses to support our customers around the world.
Join us and you’ll be encouraged and rewarded to excel in this important work. Apply your talent where it counts.
Data Analyst
The Shared Services Data & Analytics Hub is at the heart of the company data and insights landscape, bringing together data from our global sectors to generate a broad range of insights to inform key business decisions.
We are looking for talented Data Analysts to join us in our exciting journey as we expand our scope, develop new service offerings and leverage new technologies.
This role will provide you with the opportunity to contribute to the design, delivery, and continuous improvement of data insights products, working as part of a high performing multidisciplinary team.
We have a number of roles based at either Preston, Farnborough, or Glascoed for a minimum of two days a week with Hybrid working arrangements in place for the remainder.
Your main responsibilities as a Data Analyst will involve:
Delivering packages of work containing analysis, reporting and/or visualisation activities.
Leading elements or work packages within these projects, to deliver to required time, cost and quality.
Ensuring your work is conducted to our according to our project and technical processes, and meets our standard of technical excellence.
Contributing to scoping and designing solutions to address routine stakeholder business questions or needs.
Taking a role in training junior team members to develop their technical skills and knowledge.
Your skills and qualifications:
Data Analytics delivery experience, across the lifecycle of a project from defining requirements, designing analyses and insights, development and testing, preparing data insights products to be ready to move into service.
Track record of successfully of delivering Data & Analytics work packages to time, quality and budget.
Experience of engaging with end users to understand their requirements and proposing solutions that answer their business questions.
Intermediate knowledge of Tableau and Alteryx toolsets (desirable) or other similar analytics toolset.

What we are looking for in you:
You should have an analytical mind set, as well as an inquisitive, methodical approach. You will be keen to develop your skills, and learn new approaches and tools. While taking pride in your work, be ready to adopt best practise ways of working. You should be enthusiastic about sharing knowledge, and learning from others.
Location: Preston/Farnborough/Glascoed
Salary: £29000+ depending on experience
Benefits: Our employees receive an excellent benefits package which includes a competitive pension scheme, enhanced annual leave allowance and a Company contributed Share Incentive Plan. We also offer a range of additional benefits such as flexible working, an employee assistance programme, Cycle2work and many local and national employee discounts. Some employees may also be eligible for an annual incentive.
BAE Systems:
BAE Systems is one of the world’s leading global defence, security and aerospace companies. We work at the cutting edge of technology, creating more than 100 new inventions every year for customers in over 100 countries.
Please be aware that many roles working for BAE Systems will be subject to both security and export control restrictions. These restrictions mean that factors including your nationality, any previous nationalities you have held, and/or your place of birth may limit those roles that you can perform for the organisation.
Due to the volume of applications we receive, we sometimes close our vacancies early. It is therefore advisable to apply as early as possible if you would like to be considered for a role with BAE Systems.
Job IT
Primary LocationGB-ENG-LAN-Preston
Other LocationsGB-WLS-Gwent-Glascoed, GB-ENG-HAM-Farnborough

d61e41e30b8d82dd.title: Data Analyst
d61e41e30b8d82dd.description:
Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Location

London , United Kingdom
Are you a graduate searching for an opportunity in Data Management or somebody in Data Management looking for your next challenge? Our team is looking for their next team member.

If the opportunity to learn along with support and development in a flexible working environment are high on your list of priorities, then this could be just the position for you!

Your job
Job Purpose:

Working within Data Management Team who are responsible for :

Translating, onboarding and validating client data and ensuring storage in consistent format.

First point of contact for all data issues in the branch

Supporting various functions within the business on specialist data and reporting needs.

Producing data analysis and reports for internal and external clients
General Duties & Tasks:
Develop and manage data transformation scripts used for various client data.
Data cleansing, profiling, mapping and mining.
Develop and support various ad-hoc reporting needs for both external and internal clients.
Support business requirement gathering activities especially on their data and reporting needs.
Ensure data stored in consistent format and in line with treaty arrangements
Support and improve where possible tools used in the team.
Determining, monitoring and reporting the quality of client data.
Liaison with internal and external clients to fully understand data content to maximise the benefits to the business, uncovering possible weaknesses and working for their correction.
Gather, understand and document detailed business requirements for data using appropriate tools and techniques, and ensure these are agreed at all levels throughout the business.

Your profile
Key Skills and Experience Essential
Data analysis and data management skills
VBA, SQL Server and MS Excel and Access
High level of numerical and analytical skills
Ability to investigate data issues and apply cost benefit analysis
Remote working set-up
Desirable
Understanding of insurance /reinsurance business
Technical / commercial knowledge of Longevity business
R, Python and/or other Data Science syntax and knowledge
Power BI or other Business Intelligence software knowledge.
Experience of performing data audits
Demonstrable experience of working with relational databases e.g. Oracle and/or SQL
Qualifications and Educational Requirements:

Degree in Mathematics or related subject or relevant equivalent
Personal Attributes:

Good attention to detail

Excellent problem solving skills

Ability to work independently and take ownership for delivery of client requirements

Well organised, with ability to multi-task and prioritise work efficiently

Effective communicator
About us
Benefits

You will be rewarded with a competitive salary, 25 days annual leave (pro rata) along with private medical insurance and employers contributory pension of 10%. We offer a hybrid working policy with a mix of working from home at our London office.
About Us

Here at Munich Re we seek to offer our staff the opportunity to grow in an exciting, results-oriented and diverse working environment. We believe that your dedication to apply your outstanding knowledge crafts the future; the future of our clients, of Munich Re and of course your own.

Munich Re is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our employees.

Apply now!

443e2e295327ac47.title: Data & Analytics Analyst
443e2e295327ac47.description:
Our people work differently depending on their jobs and needs. From home working to job sharing, visit the remote and flexible working page on our website to find out more.
This role is based in the United Kingdom and as such all normal working days must be carried out in the United Kingdom.
Join us as a Data & Analytics Analyst
Hone your analytical skills and take on a new challenge with great learning and development potential
We’ll look to you to provide an expert analytical service so that we can better understand our customers, processes, channels, products and overall business
You'll be joining a forward thinking and collaborative team environment, where you can expect great visibility for you and your work as you work with a range of stakeholders
What you'll do
As a Data & Analytics Analyst, you’ll use your passion for data and analytics to help challenge and improve our business processes to benefit the bank as well as our customers. To do this, you’ll simplify complex data into clear data visualisations and compelling insight to resolve problems and implement innovative processes, while making clear and actionable recommendations and spotting potential business issues and opportunities.
It’s a highly collaborative role which will see you working closely with your data colleagues and business stakeholders as well as with the wider areas of analytics to progress projects initiatives, translate business questions into clear analytical plans and promote the innovative use of data across the bank.
Along with this, you’ll be:
Coaching and developing less experienced analysts and delivering through others
Providing analytical support to bank-wide projects, bringing your analytical expertise to cross functional working groups
Applying appropriate statistical techniques and concepts to develop data led solutions to business problems
Performing data extraction, storage, manipulation, processing and analysis and managing multiple analytical deliveries concurrently
Keeping up to date with the latest technical developments within analytics and making sure that changes to industry best practices are adopted
The skills you'll need
We're looking for a keen problem solver with an analytical mindset and strong attention to detail to join us in this role. You’ll be educated to a degree level in a numerate discipline or you’ll have equivalent practical experience in an analysis related field.
Additionally, you’ll need:
Significant experience with analytical or database querying software such as SQL, SAS, R or Python, as well as data visualisation software, big data environments or using cloud environments for analysis
A track record of delivering a complex analytical service and experience of using statistical techniques to articulate and translate business problems
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills
The ability to identify wider business impacts or opportunities across key outputs and processes
Experience of coaching and developing, and delivering through others
If you need any adjustments to support your application, such as information in alternative formats or special requirements to access our buildings, or if you’re eligible under the Disability Confident Scheme please contact us and we’ll do everything we can to help.

900b9fe826211a2c.title: Data Processing Analyst
900b9fe826211a2c.description:
Data Analyst
Northampton

As a Barclays Data Analyst, you will be part of Cards and Payments – Data Technology, which is a Technology section within Barclays providing technical data services, infrastructure, guidance and support to the Cards and Payments business area. You will translate Data Requirements into workable Data Processing Solutions adhering to Team Strategies. You will maintain knowledge of department strategies and develop skills and knowledge to be able to contribute to Solution Options.

Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.

This opportunity is open to flexible working arrangements. Such as working from home, flexible or compressed hours, and part-time options. If you have a need for flexibility, please apply and discuss this with us during the hiring process.

What will you be doing?
• Working with Change & Technology Project Managers, Solutions Architect, and Enterprise Architects to understand Data Processing application needs
Understand the requirements of end to end solution to complete a change scope assessment for the data processing componentsCommunicate the data processing solution and scope with the relevant design, build and test teams to enable them to validate solutionProduce Documentation and update existing legacy documentation to reflect requirements; interface these with the build teams for successful on time deliveryEnsure consistency in approach to design, and output to deliver quality and concise design solution documentationDefine, promote re-usable, extendible, scalable, maintainable solution considering trade-off for cost vs benefitIdentifying new sources of data or more efficient use of data, data environments and supporting infrastructureBe a point of reference for data and data warehouse related queries

What we’re looking for:
• Prior exposure in a Data Processing or in Report compiling capacity
Appreciation of Data Relationships and Structures for Reporting and MI/ BI needsExperience with databases for querying and extraction of Data for analysisAbility to think logically and articulate process designs

Skills that will help you in the role:
• Good attention to detail/ hands-on with excellent organizational skills
Exposure to Data Design and Data Modelling specification/ documentationUnderstanding of Data Modelling concepts e.g. Relational ModelsUnderstanding data transformation and components of MI/ BI reporting

Where will you be working?
Northampton was the birthplace of Barclaycard in 1966 and we've been based in Pavilion Drive since the building opened in 1997.
We purchased the building from the landlord in early 2018 as a sign of our commitment to investment in Northampton. Plans to further develop this Campus-style location are under way to allow for a real collaborative work environment. Based just off the A45 it is easily accessible by both car and bus routes.

948131ae0154781e.title: Level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship
948131ae0154781e.description:
Join Disney for a challenging and rewarding Apprenticeship!

During an Apprenticeship at Disney, you will get the chance to work side by side with industry leaders while you study towards your apprenticeship qualification. You will gain valuable skills working within one of the strongest family of brands on a global scale while building lasting connections. Imagine that!

The Walt Disney Company Ltd. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, colour, religion or belief, sex, nationality, ethnic or national origin, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, disability or pregnancy or maternity. Disney fosters a business culture where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a rapidly changing world.

About The Apprenticeship

We have several Level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship opportunities across The Walt Disney Company. You could be joining our Media Networks Research Department, our Viewer Experience Team in our Direct to Consumer segment or be based in our Disney Media Entertainment and Distribution Technology Team. Whichever of the teams you become a part of you will be working to support and optimise household brands such as Star Wars, Marvel and Pixar.

As a Data Analyst Apprentice your daily activities will centre around collecting, organising and studying data to provide business insight. You will assess information in order to provide insights and drive business decisions using data specific systems and tools. You will monitor key performance indicators and metrics, reporting on findings to internal clients which will improve business intelligence and campaign performance. The role of a Data Analyst is not just about crunching numbers or becoming an Excel wizard, it also involves understanding the products we are working on, the customer journey across our channels and mapping patterns of customer behaviours.

You will be given full support and training via the Apprenticeship programme and our supportive managers. As an apprentice you will work alongside a Senior Analyst or Research Manager on a variety of data focussed projects developing highly transferrable skills.


Eligibility
Must have achieved / be on target to achieve 2 C’s or above at A-Level
One of your A-Levels at C or above must be in Maths or ICT
Must have achieved 5 grades 4 - 9 at GCSE (C or above) including Maths and English
Must have the right to work in the UK already in place
Must be available to start the apprenticeship in September 2022
What are we looking for
Potential - this is an Apprenticeship! We don’t expect you to come with all the skills and knowledge, but what we do want is enthusiasm; we want you to be eager to learn the job and committed to your apprenticeship studies too.
A passion to start a career as a Data Analyst
Analytical and data orientated approach
Collaborative approach
Attention to detail and the ability to work well under pressure
Ability to communicate with people at all levels in a professional and mature manner
Ability to prioritise tasks, meet deadlines and undertake various administrative duties
Comfortable with Microsoft Office
What We Offer
Develop your workplace skills and experience and help build the foundations of your future career within a best in class Research/Tech function
You’ll study towards the Level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship.
This programme is 18 months long
20% of your working hours will be allocated to study time for your Apprenticeship
Support from our trusted training provider
Competitive salary with 25 days holiday (plus bank holidays)
Great discounts on Disney products!
How To Apply

Apply with your CV and cover letter via the link on this page. Please note that applications without cover letters will not be considered.

Your cover letter should be approximately 400 words and include the following:
Why have you chosen this Apprenticeship?
Why have you chosen Disney?
What qualities do you possess that would encourage Disney to choose you for the Apprenticeship?

Please only apply to one Apprenticeship position. We offer several Apprenticeship opportunities across our business and if appropriate we will consider you for all relevant opportunities when you apply.

The application deadline is Sunday 27th February 2022 however, if we receive a high volume of applications we may close the role before this date, therefore we strongly advise you to apply early.

Should you need to reach out to us regarding potential support in the recruitment process, for example to discuss what adjustments you might require, then please drop us an email in advance to Recruitment.London@disney.com and we will happily pick up a conversation on this.

For hints and tips on your application, please check out our guide here: https://disneycasting.net/kenexa/profintern/Candidate_Hints_and_Tips.pdf

Procure to Payables, Order to Cash, Forecast to Fulfil) and core financial data (eg Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Payroll, Inventory, Staff Expenses, General Ledger)Experience in data matching, data profiling and data transformationExperience in some (not necessarily all) of the following: business process analysis; financial control analysis; forensic investigation; revenue, cost and margin analysis; customer segmentation; sensitivity analysis; ERP analytics.Experience using SQL suite of software including the ETL processConfident communicator and self-motivating.Tenacious problem solving ability.This is a great opportunity and salary is dependent upon experience. 1539aff9e5bcc3f0.title: Data Analyst
1539aff9e5bcc3f0.description:
Job title: Data Analyst

Location: London, Bristol (including hybrid)

Salary: £36,000 - £75,000

Kaluza's vision is to help create a world where decarbonization is easy. We are an agile scale up energy tech business.

From revolutionising customer billing to smart electric vehicle charging, our technologies are empowering some of the biggest energy suppliers to better serve millions of customers and unlocking the benefits of renewable energy and smart devices to help decarbonise the grid. Our products are built with differentiation in mind, giving developers endless ability to extend our core capabilities.

Where in the world of Kaluza will I be working?

You'll be part of the centralized Kaluza Data Analytics team and wider Kaluza analytics community where you'll share knowledge, support other analysts and contribute towards the team's methodologies.

In this role, you'll also be embedded in one of our cross functional teams which we call 'squads'.

What will I be doing?

Data is the foundation of everything we do, and to deliver our vision we need curious, tenacious people who can turn this data into strategy and actions with their expertise. As a Data Analyst at Kaluza, you'll help product teams derive insights, identify patterns and solve challenges with data. You'll be working with outstanding product teams develop industry leading agent tooling and drive decision making through data.

Is this the job for me?

Aiding Kaluza's move to track its product performance using analytics on key user journeys. Helping to define what is important to track, how to track them and supporting the adoption of these metrics.
Defining metrics and building dashboards to support performance analysis, operations, decision making and product development
Taking on complex, multi-functional problems through the use of analytical techniques, statistics and hypothesis testing
Building out our robust data estate to enable self-serve analytics and democratize Kaluza's rich data
Developing and optimising sophisticated retail data products that form aspects of the Kaluza platform
Commercial modelling, creating cost/benefit analysis of proposed actions and outcomes based on a consistent value model.
Promoting ethical methodologies across how all data is used and processed, always ensuring compliance and security is placed first.

 Ideally you will have:

3+ years in a similar data or analytical role, with good experience querying, analysing and extracting insights from data.
Deep SQL experience (ideally BigQuery) & Excel/Sheets skills
Confidence in building and communicating significant data visualisations and experienced in using a business intelligence platform (we use Tableau)
Experience in programming for analytics, preferably in Python.
Experience with user interaction tooling (e.g. Mixpanel) and an understanding of customer journeys
Highly numerate & analytical; able to seek complex problems and delve into the detail while thinking strategically
Statistical knowledge including significance, hypothesis testing and basic probability theory
Proven track record engaging with internal and external partners
Excellent presentation and communication skills - able to articulate results clearly and concisely to senior stakeholders.

From us you'll get*

An additional 9% of your salary to spend on a wide range of benefits, including your pension, a selection of lifestyle, health and green benefits, or simply take it as cash!
Private Medical Insurance and Life Assurance
26 days holiday, including a day off for your birthday you can take at any point
Flexible bank holidays, 5 of which you can choose to take whenever you like (3 are fixed days)
Progressive leave policies with no qualifying service periods, including 26 weeks full pay if you have a new addition to your family
Discretionary annual bonus
A dedicated personal learning budget
Flexible working — we trust you to work in a way that suits your lifestyle
And more...

Even better? You'll have access to these benefits from day 1 of joining.

We want the best people

At Kaluza, we empower our people to have choices around where and when they work - flexible working arrangements can be discussed for all of our roles.

Please speak to the Talent Acquisition team for more info.We're keen to meet people with varied backgrounds - our view is the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

We want to build teams which represent a variety of experiences, perspectives and skills, and we recognise talent on the basis of merit and potential.We understand some people may not apply for jobs unless they tick every box.

If you're excited about joining us and think you have much of what we're looking for, even if you're not 100% sure… we'd love to hear from you.Learn more about working in Kaluza on our careers page and LinkedIn.

feeb179831c6f131.title: Finance - Reporting and Decision Support Analyst
feeb179831c6f131.description:
We aim to provide an environment for creative minds from different backgrounds to thrive, bringing a wide range of skills and experiences to everything we do. As a purposeful, values-driven brand, we are committed to being a force for good in the world as well, creating the next generation of sustainable luxury for customers, driving industry change and championing our communities.

JOB PURPOSE
The role reports to a Finance Manager within the Reporting and Decision Support (RDS) team part of Burberry Business Services Centre of Excellence (BBSCOE) team. This high profile team delivers improved management reporting and insights to Finance and Business leaders throughout the organisation in an efficient and effective way. The successful candidate will have the unique opportunity to join the RDS team to become the provider of standardised reporting and insight for the wider Burberry Finance Community.

RDS will produce insightful and standardised management reporting for Business Functions aligned to the Burberry Global operating model. This will be achieved by;

Designing and implementing new SAP BPC Reporting consistently suitable for global teams. The suite of management reports, delivered from this central team, will support Global Finance teams, cross functional stakeholders and senior leadership to allow timely and impactful decision making.Change Management by way of supporting material/training as appropriate to all users across Finance and impacted teams.

The key objectives of the RDS Analyst role is to provide:

50% Management Reporting:
Provide support to the RDS team in delivering reports in productionEmbed and manage processes to ensure the timely and accurate report production for finance management reportingEffectively communicate with the wider team and stakeholders on any risks and issues requiring mitigating actions and/or further technical development supporting the culture of ‘No Surprises’Adopt tools and forums in place to ensure timely communication with finance teams globallyContinue to develop and enhance management reporting and analysis to support decision making to Finance teams.Gain competence in the regular production of Management Reports, their maintenance and the production of new reports to support business requirements in the future.

50% Risk Analysis:
Provide data, analytics and gap analysis of key areas of compliance in the business that would leave us potentially exposed from a risk perspective if not highlighted. This reporting is to be provided across multiple departments.

The successful candidate will have opportunity to gain senior level exposure and play an important role in both Financial and Risk reporting and analysis. They will need to be comfortable in leading recommendations for change and will play a fundamental part in the successful delivery and development of the RDS Vision by leveraging a broad skillset including data analysis, stakeholder management and system/process knowledge.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Management Reporting Responsibilities

Produce and maintain standard desktop procedures to support BAU activity.Utilise SAP BPC and Think Cell tools for the production of reports (in addition to Excel and Powerpoint)Produce live reports to global finance teams on a regular basis in line with phased launches.Own, maintain, and control a standard suite of management reports, referencing non-financial metrics as appropriateProduce standard management reports, including draft first line commentary and initial explanation of variances, and distribute in a timely manner (Regions, Functions, Group & Other)Ensure accuracy in the numbers by performing validation checks prior to sharing reportsAttend monthly calls on performance, take meeting minutes and share actions post meetingPrepare materials (data, reports and slide packs) for the Executive Boards and Committees, owning the data packs that support theseInteract with data owners and other BBS teams (Finance and non-Finance) to enable management reporting and analysis activitiesProvide standard information and simple ad-hoc analysis and insightsDevelop a deep understanding of Finance source data and data hierarchiesConsult with Finance Business Partners on reporting and data needsDrive initiatives to rationalise, standardise, and automate management reportsMake sound recommendations via appropriate feedback mechanisms (e.g. Governance group) for report design and reporting processes to ensure reports remain efficient, standardised and insightful for global users.Maintain process documentation / Standard desk top procedures for live reports and ensure reporting library, user access and stakeholder lists are kept up to date.

Risk analysis responsibilities:

Data Mining (IntelliQ)
Review of automated KPI and trend analysis reporting and flagging relevant issues to key stakeholders.Build a suite of reports to highlight exceptions and/or breaches in key areas utilising both SAP and IntelliQ.System Maintenance to include: checking daily data loads were successful and clear any errors, weekly gap analysis, regular updates of key data streams from HR, product and finance to ensure reporting is accurate and up to date. Troubleshooting as required to fix issues.

Data Management

System Maintenance of the APP Operations database to include keeping store master and HR data up to date.Data Cleanse monthly APP incident reports from stores and upload these to Power BI for regional teams to access.Support the team with bi annual loss reporting to include data cleansing, performing analysis on required areas of concerns and creating store level posters.

PERSONAL PROFILE
Qualified or Part-Qualified in relevant finance qualification (CIMA, ACCA, ACA)
Comfortable in using and understanding SAP BPC within a global retail organisation
Excellent communicator with the ability to thrive under pressure and operate effectively in a cross functional team
Highly analytical with an impeccable attention to detail with and ability to troubleshoot and identify data issues
Prior usage of an ERP system desirable and experience in handling large volume of data and presenting high level insights / recommendations
Experience of using BPC or similar consolidation software preferable, but not essential, to perform insightful management reporting
Experience in working in a fast paced, global organisation
Proven track record of delivering process improvements (e.g. Reporting efficiencies) in a structured and timely way

Burberry is an Equal Opportunities Employer and as such, treats all applications equally and recruits purely on the basis of skills and experience.

4a0cfb49a84e6b2a.title: Band 5 LMS Data Analyst And E-learning Administrator
4a0cfb49a84e6b2a.description:
This is an exciting post within a great team. The Core Skills Team are responsible for maintaining the Learning Management System that is used by all 14,000 staff. Managers depend on the information they receive from the team and the person in this post will be making a significant contribution to that information and so a clear and logical approach is required.


The post holder will have the following responsibilities:
To provide an information and analytical service to the Core skills team. To lead on core information requirements for Core skills performance. To liaise with users of information to resolve problems, provide innovative ways of presenting information and develop new analysis to inform compliance reporting. To support the maintenance and development of the Learning Management System (LMS).
Assist the Head of Learning Systems and members of the senior management team in all areas of data provision and analysis, ensuring data quality standards are maintained.
To provide a support service to the Trust around the development of eLearning modules and be willing to learn to use eLearning authoring tools.
The post holder will be responsible for the preparation and import of data into our Learning Management System (Kallidus LEARN) including training records and the weekly people feed from ESR as well as for updating core skills reports in our Qlik Sense apps. They will create and maintain group ‘rules’ on LEARN which define the training needs of our staff.
As systems administrator they will help to set up and maintain courses on LEARN, investigate errors or issues, support users and be responsible for the training and support of local LEARN administrators across the organisation.
As eLearning administrator they will be responsible for the production of basic eLearning packages using authoring software such as Gomo and Articulate Storyline. They need to be willing to develop their skills in the use of these tools through self-learning.
The successful applicant will be logical, methodical, well-organised and have excellent attention to detail. They will have advanced excel skills and experience manipulating and analysing large amounts of data. Ideally, although not essentially, they will also have some previous experience of systems administration, Learning & Development or working in the NHS.

At Imperial College Healthcare you can achieve extraordinary things with extraordinary people, working with leading clinicians pushing boundaries in patient care. Become part of a vibrant team living our values - expert, kind, collaborative and aspirational. You’ll get an experience like no other and will fast forward your career. Benefits include career development, flexible working and wellbeing, staff recognition scheme. Make use of optional benefits including Cycle to work, car lease schemes, season ticket loan or membership options for onsite leisure facilities.

The statutory requirement to be fully Covid-19 vaccinated as a condition of employment from April 2022 is subject to legislative review. At Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust, we strongly encourage and support vaccination uptake as this remains the best line of defence against COVID19. The successful applicant may have contact with patients and service users and as part of our pre-employment checks and risk assessments, we will ask all candidates to confirm whether or not they have been fully vaccinated or have a medical exemption.

As part of our continued response to Covid19 we are still conducting the majority of our interviews virtually.

We are committed to equal opportunities and improving the working lives of our staff and will consider applications to work flexibly, part-time or job share. Please talk to us at interview.

Develop a working knowledge of Learning and OD operational business and use this knowledge to advise on information requirements and presentation.
Develop new and different uses of information resources through investigative analysis and frequent liaison with Learning and OD management team.
To collate, monitor and produce timely and accurate reports. To provide ad-hoc data analysis and reports on request.
To suggest new ways of presenting and commenting on data to make it accessible and useful to all members of the management team.
Liaise with other directorate staff regarding the ongoing development and refinement of directorate systems.
To act as contact for departmental information system such as Qlik Apps, Kallidus Learn, shared drive and intranet.
To manage data collection systems within the directorate to ensure that accurate and appropriate information is available in suitable format and in an agreed timeframe.
To engage in self-directed learning around the use of eLearning authoring tools and to use this knowledge to support the Trust in the development of eLearning modules.
General Responsibilities

Data:

To provide advice and commentary to staff and managers on the training information and performance indicators.
To provide detailed information support, as appropriate, in discussions with internal and external bodies over performance.
To collate and manage data provision for the directorate working closely with the senior management team and their staff.
To run statistical reports and analyse the data for submission to Trust committees, CQC and other bodies
Run reports from the LMS system, analyse data and transfer into understandable reports for other directorate or departmental managers.
To ensure that the data held on the LMS systems is accurate, consistent and complete.
Produce monthly reports for the directorate for submitting to meetings.
Regularly assess data entry errors and put in place a remedy to ensure they do not reoccur. Undertake audits to maintain the integrity of the data.
To act as a contact point for data queries and all information related matters. This includes responding to adhoc queries.
To deputise for other members of the Core Skills team to present data at meetings.
Data manipulation and analysis using advanced excel skills including combining data from multiple sources; VLOOKUP's; pivots; summaries and graphs
Preparation of weekly people feed from ESR into LEARN
Imports of training data to LEARN, including Doctors in Training core skills records
Preparation of data for current reporting system (Qlik App)
Systems Administration

Supporting the Head of Learning Systems and Reporting Systems Manager as required in the maintenance of Kallidus LEARN. This may include:

Setting up new courses on Learn
Providing training and support for LEARN administrators
Investigating and analysing systems issues and access issues
Maintaining Group ‘rules’ for reporting on LEARN
Content Development
Support the Trust in the development of eLearning modules.
Learn to use eLearning authoring tools by self-directed learning so as to be able to create basic eLearning content and assessments.
Learn to use recording and editing equipment by self-directed learning to support the development of eLearning modules.
Liaise with managers, subject matter experts and educators who require eLearning modules to be developed to understand their requirements
Liaise with other staff in the Trust who are involved in eLearning development
Evaluate whether any developments can be actioned within the Trust or need to be referred to external consultants.
Other duties
To work with the Head of Learning Systems in developing reports and business plans as appropriate.
To co-ordinate the production of monthly/bimonthly/quarterly/annual reports as required.
To co-ordinate all systems management meetings
To ensure that all duties are performed efficiently and within an agreed and defined timescale

ea0a634e6c148192.title: Compliance Data Analyst
ea0a634e6c148192.description:
Company Description
Fascinated by the future and captivated by technology?
Smart, driven and want to make a difference in the world?
You’ll fit right in.
Join a diverse team at Visa, where your individuality fits right in. We can provide the opportunity to shape the payments experience globally. Together, let’s transform the way the world pays.
Think you know us?
Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, reliable and secure digital payment network that enables individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.
Individuality fuels our brand and our global team – we’re proud that we are a talented team of 15,000 individuals with unique backgrounds, perspectives and experiences. Therefore, we understand that you are much more than your day job. We encourage quality of life outside of the office, whether it’s taking advantage of agile work schedules or our wellness programs, Visa respects and encourages meaningful work/life balance for everyone.
So, if you’re not satisfied with the status quo, we can satisfy your desire to explore new territory, giving you the runway to really make an impact, whilst connecting you with teams around the world in a truly inclusive culture that celebrates our uniqueness.
If you think you could support Visa as a Compliance Data Analyst, we want to hear from you – together, let’s make Visa a great place to work.

Job Description
What’s it all about?
The Compliance Data Analyst is responsible for the implementation of rules and parameters across the Visa Payments Compliance function to assist the Compliance Management team in the delivery, maintenance and improvement of the compliance risk and control framework.
 Focus is on the following financial crime risks:Counter Terrorist Financing (CTF/Sanctions)Anti-Money Laundering (AML)Anti-Bribery and Corruption (ABC)Fraud Management Review and Prevention
And the associated monitoring and reporting obligations; including but not limited to:Suspicious activity monitoring, identification, and reporting
What we expect of you, day to day.
The role of the Compliance Data Analyst is to be a control gatekeeper within the Compliance function. This individual will oversee any changes made to our controls/rules in Compliance. A large part of the role is to analyse data to create and record new rules across the compliance function to reduce stop rate whilst applying a risk-based approach to boost efficiency and enhance the Visa Payments control framework.
Maintain documentation around rules management, including testing, changes, and rationales (of the addition/removal of rules).
Solving compliance-related inefficiencies using data-driven techniques, looking for order and patterns in data, as well as spotting trends that can help identify processing bottlenecks.
Assess the current rules within our live transaction screening, monitoring and retrospective transaction monitoring tools, to ensure we are applying a consistent risk-based approach to reducing false positives and trigger payments that need additional scrutiny in line with Visa Payment’s risk appetite.
Setting new client controls in collaboration with the various sub-teams in compliance.
Produce ad-hoc reports to provide oversight of any new rules/controls that have been created/amended as part of the monthly Management Information (MI), contribute to MI as a data SME for Compliance.
Contribute to building internally and externally facing dashboards to display key Compliance Operational metrics.
React to geopolitical trigger events and Network Partner requirements.
Undertake assigned Compliance project work ad-hoc (e.g., Data Protection, Fraud) to gain an understanding of real events/threats to the business and implement the appropriate rules and controls with the assistance of the Visa Payments Compliance Leadership Team.
Engage with relevant internal and external stakeholders, including other functions and departments, FIUs, law enforcement and regulators
Identify and internally escalate actual or suspected financial crime incidents to the Visa Payments Nominated Officer (N.O.) and via the online internal Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) tool.
Develop an understanding of Visa Payments business operations and payment processes.
Develop a deeper understanding of the roles and responsibilities within the Visa Payments Compliance function.

Qualifications
What we’re after…
EducationProfessional qualifications in Data Analysis/Statistics.
And/orA relevant graduate degree or equivalent professional qualification/s (International Compliance Association (ICA) AML, Compliance and/or Financial Crime Post-Grad Diplomas)
Your Experience
Essential
Experience in a related environment (i.e., Payments industry, compliance, regulation)
Ability to analyse data, looking for order and patterns in data, as well as spotting trendsAbility to display key data metrics by creating internally and externally facing dashboards/reports.Excellent organizational skillsA good understanding of Microsoft ExcelStrong communication skills, written and oralAttention to detail (regulatory environment)A team playerAbility to think laterally and problem solve using a risk-based approachSelf-starter, motivatedAbility to work to deadlines and under pressure
DesirableAn understanding of stop rate/false positive reduction using a compliance tool and/or a rules platformPrevious experience in financial/corporate sector payments and/or complianceUnderstanding of IT systems, operational and/or product development payment processes, especially in e-Commerce environments for retail and/or corporate payments
Your Personal AttributesMotivated to learn and able to identify and solve problemsAble to work independently and efficiently to meet deadlinesCourteous and friendly nature (team player)Be open, inclusive respecting others and promote an ethical culture of complianceRecognises the importance of attention to detail (regulatory environment)Ability to follow a process driven taskConfident presenting to key internal/external StakeholdersThe desire to do the right thing (i.e., report suspicious activity)
Additional Information
Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

f630a07c7aa5916e.title: Data Analyst Apprentice
f630a07c7aa5916e.description:
Candidates should be 18 years or over before the start date and have the right to live and work in England

For the apprenticeship program we prioritize applicants eligible to government funding for their apprenticeship and for this you need to:
Have lived in the UK or in the European Economic Area (EEA) for the last 3 years
Be a resident of the UK for the entire duration of the program
Not be registered to study on a UK government funded course ending June 2022 or later

5 GCSEs including 1 STEM, Maths and English C/4 or above / equivalent

Please note, you will be required to evidence your qualifications. If you have gained qualifications outside of the UK you will be required to evidence that they are equivalent.

Note: This Apprenticeship assumes the candidate has some or little knowledge/ experience of the occupation, and is NOT suitable for candidates who already have a similar or higher-level qualification in the same or similar subject of the apprenticeship. If you already have related qualifications or 2 years plus experience in this field please visit amazon.jobs

Job summary
As a Data Analyst Apprentice at Amazon, you’ll gain a vast range of useful experiences and skills. You will work towards the L4 Data Analyst apprenticeship standard

You will build your skills over a 24 month period, starting in July, which will help you develop personally and professionally. Your apprenticeship will be made up of;

Classroom/virtual based training to cover knowledge,
On-the-job training in Amazon UK location-your base office
Online learning,
Mentoring from our experienced team members.

Alongside extensive development of your technical skills, you will also grow your abilities in crucial complementary areas like organization, prioritization, data and problem-solving techniques, teamwork, communication, and presentation skills.

You will work alongside the team supporting with day to day tasks learning how Amazon works and delivers for its customers. As your knowledge and skills increase over the duration of the scheme you will have opportunities to be part of and lead projects, making a difference for customers. The on the job experience will help you build a portfolio of evidence towards your apprenticeship. You will be given dedicated time to focus on your studies to help you stay on track and work towards successfully completing your qualification(s). Once you have successfully completed you will be able to apply for relevant roles across the business.

You will attend a number of workshops across the duration of the apprenticeship, workshops will be a mix of face to face and online delivery by a training provider. You will also attend internal workshops/ training to support you in developing Amazon related skills and knowledge. Depending on the scheme and location of the training provider you may be required to travel and stay overnight. (costs will be supported by Amazon)

Key job responsibilities
As a working student your primary focus is to complete your studies by learning and developing your skills, knowledge and behaviors to work towards successful graduation. You will be set objectives and goals by your training provider and hiring team to support your studies.

About the team
Amazon is the perfect place to start your career as Data Analyst. Our Data Analyst apprentices can work across a number of tech and no tech teams in Amazon supporting the business team in completing ad hoc data requests and analyses as needed, develop reporting using Tableau and Quicksight for repetitive data tasks where data pipelines/queries are already in place (concessions, CS metrics, operations), automation of manual processes and undertaking deep dive on metrics to help the business team understand metric changes, utilizing trend analysis

These will be a plus for your career at Amazon, but are not necessary to enter the programme:


You are able to operate in a challenging and fast paced environment and able to communicate well
You are able to demonstrate drive and a passion for learning

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
