b633593248033164.title: Performance Marketing Junior Data Analyst
b633593248033164.description:
Your Journey

At Sweaty Betty, we’re more than just a global activewear and lifestyle brand for women.
We’re also a community that believes fitness is a flip-the-switch trigger for becoming the woman you want. Leggings and sports bras won’t change the world on their own. But with a grab-my-hand, let’s-go-for-it-now spirit, the women who wear them can.
If you want to join us on the next chapter of our adventure, you’re in the right place. This is an exciting opportunity for a Junior Data Analyst to join us on our mission to empower women through fitness and beyond, focusing on our acquisition and growth.
Your key objective will be to support the Data Analyst in collating, analysing and validating our global customer data to provide valuable insights to the business. Your reporting and insights will be used to shape our marketing and product strategies, as well as driving strategic decisions around customer acquisition and growth.
SB Values:
 We Really Care First, Best, Bravest Our Strength is in Each Other Stand Up, Speak Up, Shout Out
Your SB Journey:
Creating, analysing and supporting the delivery of regular and ad hoc reports on our new customer activities, interpreting the data to find actionable insights – from what our customers are buying, to where they are shopping & how frequently they are coming back
Own reports and share insights on best tactics for new customers, those that drive the best repeats, highest value customers and best efficiencies whilst suggesting improvements. Support with building out reporting for our new region
Communicate these findings to varying teams and stakeholders across the business, presenting back ideas and insights in a clear manner
Support Performance Marketing by providing these insights on new marketing channels & campaigns, analysing their effectiveness and return on investment
Support the Digital team with Allowable CPA modelling, feeding back findings and supporting spending decisions and utilising our forecasting tools to predict our customers behaviours and the best journeys to recruit through
Dive into our data and understand the logics used to ensure it is kept as accurate as possible across platforms, through regular validations
You will become a super user on our global customer database, CRM tools and platforms such as Power BI, whilst getting to know our data inside-out
You will be proactive and forward thinking in creating reports to address our business requirements and improve our current processes
Must Haves
Prior experience within CRM and Digital Marketing, Google Analytics, Power BI and data models or reporting packages.
Excellent computer skills including advanced Excel are essential (cleaning, de-duplicating, analysing data using formulas including IF, vlookup, pivot tables and conditional formatting).
SQL skills would be beneficial but are not essential.
Highly numerate, excellent written and verbal communication skills with fantastic attention to detail.
Confident using large datasets pulled from different sources.
Ability to effectively plan and prioritise in line with business requirements.
Our D&I Commitment

Our mission is to empower all women. This means doing more and working harder to make the long-lasting changes necessary to become an inclusive, diverse and actively anti-racist company. We care about our people, our community, our world. And we want to stand up for what we believe in.
We want to give our people a platform to use their voice. And actively listen and learn from what they have to say. This involves focusing on learning, development and progression across the business. Training our leaders, managers and teams about their rights under our equality, diversity and inclusion policy. And being clear on the responsibilities we hold to each other and our community. It also means being committed to equal employment opportunities. Ensuring we consider ALL applicants for jobs. And work harder to make our job advertising more inclusive.
Ultimately, we’re working to create a culture and team that represents our customers, our community and our mission of empowerment. We want to celebrate our diversity and the power it gives our team and our business.
We know we’re on a journey. And far from perfect. But we want to be a part of the solution to the problem. It might not be comfortable or straightforward. But if we weren’t up for doing the hard work and breaking the mould, we wouldn’t be Sweaty Betty. We are committed to working across our business and with our Internal Diversity & Inclusion Squad to be champions, allies and inclusive, always. Because when we say All, we mean it.
The Extras
Generous clothing allowance
50% off all Sweaty Betty merchandise
23 days holiday, with buy and sell holiday option
Sample sales
Company bonus scheme
Cycle to work scheme
Monthly Office Meeting
Generous Company Maternity, Paternity and Adoption Pay and Childcare support
Discounts at the best Studio Classes
SB Flexible Working: we currently work flexibly between the office and home. Our focus remains keeping everyone safe and we will continue to review this in line with government guidance

70aedf55c9ac5a04.title: Graduate Sustainability Data Analyst
70aedf55c9ac5a04.description:
Company: Exertis UK
Salary: Up to £25,000 per annum
Location:
GB, RG24 8EH
Contract Type: Permanent
Date Posted: 15-Feb-2022
Description:
Exertis has undergone significant international growth in recent years both through organic expansion and acquisition. The Group BI and Data function was established 4 years ago and has since grown from a sole analyst to a team of 5, supporting across all tiers and geographies to drive organic and M&A growth, and optimise the existing businesses.
Our commitment to delivering long-term value for our stakeholders has made Exertis successful over many years. Making our business resilient and sustainable is not new. We are clear on the issues that are important to our long-term sustainability. This newly created role within the Exertis Group Data team will play a critical part in enhancing the governance of sustainability activities across the technology division. The role holder will have a keen interest in cooperatively creating and maintaining systems, structures, data analytics and reporting on sustainability across the four pillars of the Sustainability Framework:

Climate Change & Energy Transition
Safety & Environmental Protection
People & Social
Governance & Compliance

The role will work closely with Exertis Legal & Compliance, HR and Health Safety and Environmental leadership and the Exertis businesses to provide superior research, due diligence, analysis, records creation and management and report writing across the Sustainability pillars. There will be duties external to the Exertis Sustainability Programme required on an ad hoc project basis.
The right candidate will be offered a fully funded Level 4 – 7 Data Science apprenticeship from a leading training provider with protected study time to support their work and personal development, depending on prior experience and technical level covering key data scientist skills including:
Data lifecycle and manipulation
Visualizations and BI analytic dashboarding
Python coding for data science
SQL for databases
NLP & data scraping
API creating and JSON formatting
Forecasting

Click to read the 2021 DCC Sustainability Report: Sustainability – DCC plc

Key responsibilities
Sustainability
Serve as data subject-matter-expert to find, analyse, and present data against the metrics under the four pillars of the Internal Sustainability Reporting Framework.
Identify, collect, cleanse, and normalise relevant data from multiple sources across the Exertis Group businesses using automated processes and modern data science techniques to build bespoke reports and analytics for the quarterly meetings of the DCC Technology Sustainability Committee.
In conjunction with the Exertis Group Head of Business Intelligence assess the effectiveness of data sources and data-gathering techniques and continuously improve data quality and collection methods. Liaising with existing DCC and DCCT data teams to leverage existing data and reporting infrastructure.
Establish strong working relationships with the Exertis Group Head of Business Intelligence, the Chairs of the divisional Councils (in particular the Diversity & Inclusion (D&I) and Health Safety & Environmental (HSE) Councils), the Associate General Counsel and relevant cross-functional leaders in the operating businesses worldwide involved in activities impacting Sustainability.
Group Data Science Projects
Support on ad hoc data science projects for the global Exertis businesses including reporting, data cleansing and manipulation / automation, BI tool creation, unstructured data analysis (survey data), and forecasting.
Maintenance of the shared data science server and virtual machine. Automated process scheduling and monitoring, maintaining appropriate standards of project tracking and documentation.

Team Support
You will be supported to quickly learn the business with developmental care on a regular basis from senior leaders as part of a team which values learning, mutual support, and excellence.
Be an active member of the digital team. We are on an exciting journey and are looking for someone to get stuck in and help create something very special. The team will be right by your side to make sure you are supported in making that happen.
Demonstrate a strong awareness of and commitment to Ethics & Compliance and the DCC Group Code of Conduct.

Skills & Experience
Essential
Strong data collection, analysis, reporting and presentation skills
Strong research, due diligence, risk assessment and documentation skills
Excellent English language communication skills (written and spoken)
Familiarity with data manipulation in Microsoft Excel using pivot tables, lookup functions
Desirable
Bachelor’s Degree in Math/Sciences, Data Science, Statistics or other relevant discipline (minimum 2:1 class, 3.5 GPA or equivalent)
Prior experience in Data Science/Analytics with some knowledge of Python, R, SQL or other relevant coding languages
Prior experience in the technology sector, including technology distribution
One or more European language skills(s) (French, Dutch, German, Spanish or Swedish in particular)
What’s in it for you
It’s important to us that our people love what they do and in turn we put together a benefits package that rewards a job well done. We’ll give you:
23 days holiday from start increasing up to a maximum of 27 days with length of service
Access to a Cash plan provided by Healthshield
Income protection scheme (including access to a wellness early intervention scheme)
Access to cycle to work scheme
Employee assistance programme
Death in service
Holiday purchase scheme
Loyalty award at key service milestones
Enhanced, Maternity, Shared Parental, Paternity and Adoption pay
Training from a top UK data science education provider, combined with practical on-the-job application to a commercial environment
Being part of a new, fun, smart, diverse, and exciting collaborative team where you will drive real measurable results at a time of substantial digital transformation, with visibility at the very top of a FTSE 100 company
The chance to work with some of the coolest and biggest tech brands in the world
Competitive package and flexibility
The option to travel internationally and work across continents, CV19 situation permitting
Personal development and coaching, with mutual career ownership from senior leaders

We value diversity and inclusion and champion a culture where everyone feels valued, included and celebrated. We’re open to conversations about flexible working. If it’s right for our customers, our business and for you then we’ll do what we can to support it.

Build client relationships and your banking career
At Barclays, we are working together to build a better bank, a more efficient bank that is safe, intuitive and that will support people and businesses responsibly and sustainably. A bank that knows its customers and clients, champions innovation and thinks digital first, offers trusted money management guidance and support, and provides personalised advice to match customer and client life goals. And it’s where we keep our eyes on the future, shaping what the best customer experiences will look like for years to come. As a Summer Analyst, you’ll join the team that drive growth for our Retail businesses and gain opportunity to build a strong technical foundation and learn to use data and decision sciences. A place where you can thrive

And if you really impress us, this could be the beginning of an incredible career. We invite top-performing, eligible Summer Analysts to join us as full-time Retail Banking Data & Analytics Analysts after graduation.

currently be pursuing an undergraduate degree with anticipated graduation year 2023.

an ambitious problem-solver

7d00e36f0729b56c.title: Data Analytics Graduate
7d00e36f0729b56c.description:
Do you aspire for a career within financial services, consulting or technology? Vantage Point’s specialised graduate scheme gives you expert award-winning training and guidance and then launches you into your dream career with a head start. So, who are we?
Vantage Point are a leading Consultancy that engage with the world’s top Banks, Financial Services Businesses and Brokers. Our areas of specialism include Process Engineering, Data Operations, Front-Back Office Operations, Regulatory Compliance, and Risk.

ac6e02fc3ab94a29.title: Junior Data Governance Analyst
ac6e02fc3ab94a29.description:
Job Description

Role: Junior Data Governance Analyst

Team/Programme: Data Governance Team

Reporting to: Data Governance Manager

Department: Data Hub

Location: The News Building, 1 London Bridge, London SE1 9GF

About News UK Data Hub

News UK is a phenomenal company full of talented, dedicated and creative people. We are an ambitious and ever growing organisation with a real passion for quality content and storytelling. Our newspapers and digital products include some of the most powerful media brands in the world, reaching over 30 million people each month. Our brands include national newspapers - The Sun, The Times, and The Sunday Times, and the Wireless Group, comprising talkSPORT, talkRADIO, and Virgin Radio and several regional radio stations.

The Data Hub is a new team with people, data and insight at its heart. Consisting of four specialist areas - data strategy, data analytics, customer insight and data governance - the Data Hub is driven by passionate and trusted experts responsible for creating industry leading solutions by attracting and developing the best talent.

About the Data Governance team

The Data Governance team is responsible for implementing a governance framework to support efficient, compliant and ethical processing of data to enable risk aware decision making. We help with all strategic and tactical Data Hub initiatives, assist Technology to implement the governance framework and help the business end users understand their governance responsibilities when planning to use customer data assets.

About you and the role

We are seeking an experienced Junior Data Governance Analyst, who will be focused on:

Understanding of industry standard data governance framework/standard
Understanding of working in the Data Governance domain, especially around transparency, lineage, quality, risk management, information security and compliance areas
You should be comfortable analysing and interpreting multiple data sets, doing gap analyses, interviewing various stakeholders, documenting findings and providing recommendations for best practice solutions in order to be successful in this role
Build of new processes and documenting assisting or proposed processes to support and automate internal Data Governance initiatives
Assisting the Data Governance Manager with facilitating the teams ceremonies including stand ups, backlog refinement sessions and retros and any other ceremonies that are deemed necessary
Assisting with the management of the backlog and ticketing system
Ensuring successful delivery of initiatives through development and management of overall project plan, documentation and schedule
Familiarity with project tools such as Confluence and Airtable
Assist with internal governance reviews
Effective verbal and written communication skills and stakeholder engagement experience
Ability to tailor approach to communication, analysis and team activities according to the given context
Understanding of DPA2018, GDPR, PECR, CCPA requirements
Assist with identifying risks and blockers to the way data is being processed and communicating these findings in a clear and consistent manner
Identifying the best way to capture and document the requirements and present them using non-technical jargon
Assist with implementing the capabilities according to the roadmap
Support with the application of appropriate project methodologies to build collaborative, cross-functional teams delivering value to the business where appropriate
Be knowledgeable around Data Governance initiatives through continuous learning and training (seminars, webinars etc.)
Seek to improve and be a positive influence on the team and other colleagues
Life at News

At News UK some of us work flexibly, in many different ways. We encourage you to talk to us about the flexibility you need. We can’t promise to offer exactly what you want, but we do promise not to judge you for asking.

We champion diversity and inclusion, we strive to maximise and encourage every individual’s potential and ensure everyone feels valued. We support this through our Diversity Board, D&I strategy & training, creating more diverse content and our intern and apprenticeship programmes. We also have 8 employee-led networks; Cultural Diversity, News is Out, GenZ, Sustainability Champions, News for Parents, Women in Tech, News UK Christian Fellowship and we are awaiting the launch of our Women’s Steering Group.

We take pride in looking after our amazing talent at News UK supporting the Health and Wellbeing of our staff. We offer private medical insurance covering pre-existing conditions, discounted gym memberships, ClassPass at Home, weekly virtual HIIT, yoga and run club classes, and a ‘Bikes for Work’ scheme, as well as offering opportunities for physio/massage, counselling and legal support.

In addition we also offer:

A generous pension scheme with employer contributions of up to 5%;
25 days holiday and up to 4 volunteering days per year;
Maternity leave up to 18 weeks full basic salary & paternity leave up to 2 weeks;
Wide range of training available, plus full LinkedIn Learning access.

We want to ensure that everyone we meet has the opportunity to perform to their best when interviewing, so feel free to let us know, at any stage, whether you require any reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process, and we will do our best to accommodate.

dca8946e73911420.title: Global Space Strategy Analyst Graduate - 2022 Start
dca8946e73911420.description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. We are now looking for talented individuals to join us in 2022 - people who want to inspire creativity and co-create the future with TikTok.

Regardless of the function you choose to specialise in, our graduate roles will enable you to participate in meaningful and innovative projects. Your potential for growth at TikTok is limitless. Join us to enhance your skill set and develop your network in the tech industry.

The Global Space Strategy (GSS) team aims to define and deploy strategies that support our global expansion and regional business growth. Our consultants and analysts are responsible for comprehensive research and analysis on Global Real Estate markets, whilst leading our real estate business strategy development and roll-out.

Responsibilities include:

Conduct qualitative and/or quantitative analysis on Global Real Estate markets, covering different countries - to detail regulation impacts, geographic advantages, demographic trends, industry developments, benchmark analysis, etc
Be engaged in communications with key stakeholders for research information exchange, generate insightful impacts and help to draw actionable plans for Real Estate by region and by function, so as to strongly support company strategies and growth ambitions
Assist in end-to-end implementation of Global Real Estate / Space Strategy with timely feedback, assess external and internal potential risk and assist in preparation for mitigation plan to ensure and enhance strategy implementation
Assist in modelling where necessary to analyse feasibility, rationalise logic behind and forecast future trends
Currently enrolled in a Bachelors or Masters degree, graduating in 2022
Available to start in September 2022
Beneficial to have previous internship or project experience in a strategy consulting firm or in-house corporate strategy team
Strong data analysis and presentation skills
Quick learner with logical thinking abilities
Great communication and teamwork skills
Self-motivated with an interest in Technology and Innovation, etc.

2f632b10cfb5bf93.title: Data & Analytics - Internship
2f632b10cfb5bf93.description:
Our people work differently depending on their jobs and needs. From home working to job sharing, visit the remote and flexible working page on our website to find out more.
This role is based in the United Kingdom and as such all normal working days must be carried out in the United Kingdom.
About you
To be eligible for our Data & Analytics internship, you’ll need to be in your penultimate year of university and be on course to achieving a 2:1 in your degree
We’re looking for curious, inquisitive people who show a real passion for data and technology, and the drive to explore how it can be used to make a positive difference for our customers
You’ll bring strong problem solving skills, along with an analytical approach and an appreciation of analysis techniques.
About the programme
Over the course of this eight week summer internship, we’ll give you a taste of what it’s like to work with us, along with valuable experience to help guide your career choices.
We’ll reward you with a starting salary of £21,500 pro rata, depending on your location.
For eight weeks, you can expect to:
Learn about our culture, values and goals and build an understanding of the products and services we provide
Attend training workshops, get involved with our day to day work, and take part in a business improvement project
Develop your team working, planning, creative thinking and problem solving skills
See first-hand how we work together to deliver an outstanding service for our customers
Experience what it’s like to work in a purpose led organisation that puts the customer at the heart of decision making.
About the business area
Our data is one of our greatest assets, and how we harness it to understand the world, our business and our customers’ needs is crucial. In Data & Analytics, we promote the intelligent use of data and make sure it’s used in the right way.
Good data engineering helps us get to grips with the data we have. And data science allows us to apply statistics, computer science and problem solving skills together with strong research methods to test, learn and optimise machine learning powered decisions to help customers.
Applications for this programme will be open until we receive enough applications to complete our hiring. When that happens, we’ll close the programme to new applications. It’s important to take the time to make sure you’re making the right decision about the programme you want to apply for (you can only apply for one Graduate/Intern programme) but please complete your application as soon as you can to make sure you don’t miss out.
If you need any adjustments to support your application, such as information in alternative formats or special requirements to access our buildings, or if you’re eligible under the Disability Confident Scheme please contact us and we’ll do everything we can to help.

7180113e179ad42c.title: Transport Data Analyst 2022 (Glasgow/Edinburgh) *
7180113e179ad42c.description:
Redefine your personal best.
Have you ever thought about joining a Graduate Development Programme where you get to work in a diverse, welcoming, and fun environment, on amazing projects, whilst starting your journey to becoming professionally qualified?
We have a large and diverse graduate cohort, spread across all our offices in the UK. You will join our existing cohort of Engineers, Scientists, Project Managers, Data specialist, Environmentalist, Talent Acquisition & HR, Health Safety and Business Management to name a few. We have a structured 2 year graduate program that is catered to your specific discipline. You will learn on the job, work on some amazing projects and be mentored by some of our industries leading practitioners.
If this sounds like something that appeals to you, then look no further than Stantec, where we have an exciting opportunity for a Graduate to join our team in either Glasgow or Edinburgh.
Stantec has a reputable and well-established Transport Team spread across the UK. We are currently seeking a junior data analysist to support an established and growing data analytics team.
You will have the opportunity to work across a broad range of high-profile transport and smart city projects, working for both our transport modelling and transport technology teams. Data is transforming our industry and you will be working at the forefront of this transformation.
You will also have the opportunity for career progression and personal development, through the delivery of high value quality services to influential clients.
Key responsibilities / duties include:
Undertaking data analytics and geospatial analysis, drawing information from large and complex datasets
Supporting the development of multimodal transport models
Supporting the development of new approaches in using data to assess schemes and polices
Using programming (e.g. Python) to develop data analytics tools
Supporting the analysis of data as part of intelligent transport systems and smart city schemes.
Reporting and presenting data from a variety of sources
About You
You will have a degree or higher qualification, ideally in Mathematics / Physics / Computer Science, or equivalent.
You will be highly numerate, with good statistical skills and with good communication and report writing skills. You will have a keen interest in data analysis and the application of big data.
Ideally you will have experience in areas such as programming (using tools such as R, Python and SQL), web / app design, geospatial work using GIS and the use of dashboards.
As we are looking for someone to come in at a junior level, experience that you have gained while studying or at home is valid experience.
From our side we can offer you continuous opportunities to develop and progress your career, a great learning culture and working environment, flexible hours, a competitive benefits package and much more.
Application closing date - Friday March 18 2022
Stantec provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for future and current employment and prohibit discrimination on the grounds of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression. We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning recruitment, hiring, referral, promotion, compensation, fringe benefits, job training, terminations or any other condition of employment. Stantec is in compliance with local, state and federal laws and regulations and ensures equitable opportunities in all aspects of employment. EEO including Disability/Protected Veterans

ef9fa864fcd4d2b2.title: Data Analyst
ef9fa864fcd4d2b2.description:
Please switch to a desktop device before starting your application.
NECS works across the UK to support health and social care customers in meeting strategic and operational challenges, to improve outcomes and increase efficiency. We deliver a diverse range of services to organisations working within health and social care across the North of England and beyond.
NECS combines specialist skills and expertise with scale and resilience to achieve required results. Many of our people have extensive NHS and public sector experience and we combine core NHS values with a sharp focus on customer care and a relentless pursuit of continuous improvement. We very much see ourselves as a key partner in the future success of the healthcare system and we take our share of the responsibility for shaping effective delivery.
We understand how complex the health and social care sector is and have regularly proven to an excellent standard that we can deliver projects and services involving a wide range of partners and stakeholders to STPs, ICSs, FTs and CCGs.
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join the Data Management team at NHS North of England Commissioning Support Unit. The Data Management team is pivotal to the success of our ambitious organisation and handles many thousands of data flows a year.
To fit into this team you will be a detail focussed team player with a proven track record of delivering datasets to customers. The successful candidate will be proficient with MS Office products particularly Excel and have an understanding of the basics of SQL Server. You will possess the ability to adapt quickly to new technologies and whilst it certainly can be learnt on the job previous experience of using SSIS would be desirable.
Knowledge of NHS data sets and commissioning arrangements would be desirable, but the lack of these would certainly not rule out a candidate with the right attitude, knowledge and skills.
A large element of the role is the routine operation of existing data management processes, to deliver data to our internal and external customers in an efficient and accurate manner within agreed time scales. This requires a strong attention to detail along with excellent planning and prioritisation skills. This role would be ideally suited to a well organised completer-finisher personality.

9366c8c7441396a6.title: Apprentice Data Analyst - Level 4
9366c8c7441396a6.description:
Siemens Energy Transmission Solutions are recruiting for a Level 4 Data Analyst Apprentice, based at our Manchester office. This exciting new opportunity represent a new growth period for Siemens Energy Transmission Solutions and offer excellent opportunities to be part of our apprenticeship programme.
If you are tech-savvy, enjoy problem solving and can spot patterns effectively, a career as a Data Analyst at Siemens Energy could be a great fit for you!
LET’S TALK ABOUT YOU
Your profile
A-levels (or equivalent) in STEM subject and preferably IT related subject
Enthusiasm for a career in IT, Data Analysis or Digital
Logical and analytical
Enjoyment of problem solving and finding root cause of issue
Knowledge of data (structured/unstructured, database system design, data analysis lifecycle) would be beneficial
Happy to interact with internal and external clients
Ability to show initiative, especially when working independently
Responsibilities
The role of the Data Analyst Apprentice is to ascertain how data can be used in order to answer questions and solve problems. Data analysis is a process of requirement-gathering, inspecting, cleansing, transforming, and modelling data with the goal of discovering useful information, informing conclusions and supporting decision-making.
Activities could include:
Using a range of analytical techniques such as data mining, time series forecasting and modelling techniques to identify and predict trends and patterns in data
Using data systems securely to meet requirements and in line with organisational procedures and legislation
Analysing data sets taking account of different data structures and database designs
Collaborating and communicating with a range of internal and external stakeholders
Your Opportunities for Personal Growth
Gain experience in Data Analysis and related areas
Gain first-hand exposure to the role by working closely with colleagues from a variety of different departments within the business
Become a technical expert in a role that is critical to the growth of the business
LET’S TALK ABOUT US
"Let’s make tomorrow different today" is our genuine commitment at Siemens Energy to all customers and employees on the way to a sustainable, CO2 neutral future.

Our Transmission Division offers customers a broad portfolio of products, systems, solutions, and services geared around the key market trends of digitalization, decarbonization, grid stability and electrification. Our people are the drivers behind this. With expertise, passion and commitment, we are working to transmit energy as efficiently and environmentally friendly as possible. Sound interesting? Join us and help make the difference.
Check out our Transmission LinkedIn page for more insights here: https://www.linkedin.com/company/siemens-energy/life/7501be3a-bc8b-43a0-8c50-072ce21f0e3e/
MORE INSIGHTS
Be Energized. Be you.
Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion and compassion. Our combined creative energy is fuelled by at least 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society. All of society.
Organization: Gas and Power
Company: Siemens Energy Limited
Experience Level: Student (Not Yet Graduated)
Job Type: Full-time

04d3c0083e7d545b.title: Financial Data Analyst - Spanish Speaker
04d3c0083e7d545b.description:
Serve as a data monitoring analyst to support Moody’s Structured Finance group with financial data capture, validation and publication and project management
Ensure the accuracy and timeliness of financial data captured in performance overviews and performance summary reports for various structured asset classes such as ABS, RMBS, CMBS and covered bonds
Monitor data entry of outsourced resources and provide feedback and training materials to reduce recurrence of errors
Publish performance overviews and performance summary reports on a regular basis
Coordinate with analysts and transaction counterparties to ensure timely receipt of data
Ensure timely responses to queries from investors, servicers and central banks
Assist other team members and take initiative to lead projects / tasks to improve processes
Qualifications:
BSc (or equivalent) in finance, economics or engineering; relevant work experience in accounting, finance, or structured finance background preferred
Fluency in English and Spanish
Experience
Advanced MS Office skills, especially Excel (knowledge of Excel VBA); SQL programming skills would be beneficial
Customer service
Accurate data entry
Key Skills
Attention to detail
Ability to work under tight deadlines
Ability to work independently with minimum supervision
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong organization, administration, interpersonal and presentation skills
The SFG Data & Analytics team consists of a diverse set of Financial Data Analysts (FDA), supporting Structured Finance group. The team is based in multiple locations including London, Frankfurt, Bangalore, Mexico City, Hong Kong, Singapore and Tokyo in order to support Analysts based in EMEA, the AMERICAS and ASIA PACIFIC.
Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.
Moody's (NYSE: MCO) is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions. Our data, analytical solutions and insights help decision-makers identify opportunities and manage the risks of doing business with others. We believe that greater transparency, more informed decisions, and fair access to information open the door to shared progress. With over 11,000 employees in more than 40 countries, Moody's combines international presence with local expertise and over a century of experience in financial markets. Learn more at moodys.com.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity
Moody’s Investors Service is among the world’s most respected and widely utilized sources for credit ratings and research. Our opinions and analysis on a broad range of credit obligors and obligations are valued around the world for their insight and rigor.
At MIS, our workplace culture supports our mission to be the Agency of Choice for our customers, employees and future employees. Our Culture focuses on Excellence and embodies behavioral qualities such as Integrity, Responsiveness, Collaboration, Respect and Passion. Our people are our core asset and we look beyond outcomes to ensure that behaviors and interactions matter.

84fb215848e58699.title: Product Analyst (m/f/d)
84fb215848e58699.description:
We're looking for an expert analyst who can deliver data-driven insights and find improvement opportunities. Want to take on a key role in our Berlin tech hub, helping a talented team create the best product based on data? Then keep reading…
Our story (the bitesize version)

Whether it's party-night pizza or superb salads, we keep millions of food-lovers happy. Having expanded as Just Eat Takeaway.com, we're now delivering in 24 countries worldwide – from the Netherlands to New Zealand. But the secret to our growth isn't food, it's people. From marketing maestros to tech specialists and analytics experts, our international teams give us the ingredients for success.
All about the role

As the Senior Product Analyst for our Frontend team, you'll help build an exceptional customer journey for our website and app users. Combining with a range of colleagues, from the Scrum Master to developers and UI/ UX designers, you're able to add new features, improve conversion and identify innovation opportunities.
Using data-driven insights, you understand how the user navigates our platform and can locate pain points and find innovative solutions. You'll then use that data to provide performance insights and monitor our KPIs, communicating your findings to the Product Owner. In this role, we're also counting on you to:
Build a clear, quantitative understanding of our users, their usage behavior, and journeys to guide product design.
Be the first point of contact for behavioral analysis by using Google Analytics, Firebase, BigQuery, and similar tools
Proactively find opportunities to optimize product experiences and drive user adoption & engagement
Interpret the technical issue behind any question and explain all topics clearly and concisely to stakeholders
Support the alignment and guidelines of our data infrastructure, as part of the Customer data & analytics team
Can you deliver…

Here is what we need from you:
5+ years' experience as a Product Analyst, Web Analyst, Conversion Optimisation Specialist or another similar job
Advanced knowledge of SQL and Business Intelligence tools, including Tableau & Google Analytics and good knowledge of programming languages – e.g. R, Python
Able to assist with insights from the digital analytics platform & help stakeholders optimise their products for app/ web applications
Strong understanding of how data is gathered and processed by different tools
Able to collaborate effectively with product, IT stakeholders and other colleagues
Good communication skills and enthusiasm about sharing knowledge in a team environment
Experience of troubleshooting tracking implementations on customer-facing applications is a plus.
Experience with Firebase Performance Monitoring and/ or Instana data insights is a plus.
Here is our offer
Being part of a dynamic and international e-commerce company with flat hierarchies
Joining an international and professional team
Nobody owns code in our company, so you are free to contribute to any project
Competitive salary
A laptop with your desired OS
Awesome team events and global gatherings, such as our annual ski trip and summer event at the beach!
Did we raise your appetite? Click the Apply button now to send us your CV.

38741d9cb01242dd.title: Applications and Data Analyst
38741d9cb01242dd.description:
What's involved
Department
IT Services
Salary
£36,200 - £40,300
Do you want to make a difference and be part of an organisation that has been helping save lives for more than a century? Applications and Data Analyst is a key and vital role as it’s responsible for managing and supporting our critical services, applications and technology platforms across the organisation.

Excellent opportunity to join our growing, thriving and supportive Technology Team, delivering support services, application enhancements and deliverables as a workstream on larger projects. The role requires being able to balance working within a service and solution delivery setting, prioritising workloads and identifying opportunities to improve technical solutions and the overall user experience at every opportunity.


Working a 35-hour week with options to work; remote within UK, from our office in London or hybrid options. The role benefits from a competitive salary, generous pension, 33 days holiday (including bank holidays), options to buy and sell holiday, Blue Light and NHS discounts, life assurance, eye care and mental health, wellbeing tools and volunteering days. It will also provide opportunities to grow and develop your career, achieve a healthy work life balance and to be recognised for the great work you do.


Please see the job description for more detail (this can be viewed on our website or once you click apply)

About You:

There are two roles available - product knowledge configuring, developing and maintaining two or more of the following would be preferred; SAP, Business One, WMS (Warehouse Management System), QlikView / Qlik Sense, MS Dynamics 365, MS Power Platform (Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate), MS SharePoint, Jira Software.
A minimum of two years working within an application team or similar role
Experience of working with business-critical applications and complex data sets
Experience of working with enterprise scale reporting technologies
Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to communicate effectively at all levels

About the Role:

Resolution of assigned complex incidents and problems within defined SLAs
Own the fulfilment of assigned service requests within defined SLAs
Identify, escalate and assist resolving major incidents and act as a key part of major incident resolution teams
Monitoring of applications, platforms and data-sets, taking timely preventative action to avoid service interruption
Action critical maintenance tasks to systems and databases to ensure continuation of service
Work as a key member of project teams to meet challenging deadlines

About Us:

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a team of over 1,700 employees and over 30,000 volunteers, united by our goal of saving lives through essential first aid services, training and campaigning. As a charity with a long history of serving humanity, we are proud of our past and excited about creating a healthier, safer, more resilient future.


Find out more about us, including our new Ask Me campaign, at www.sja.org.uk

Application review date: 15/03/2022


For all other candidates, or St John Ambulance volunteers wishing to apply: please apply below

St John Ambulance are committed to increasing the diversity of our team and making sure we best reflect the diversity of the communities we serve. At St John, everyone is valued and supported to thrive. We do not tolerate any form of discrimination and engender a sense of belonging for all, by creating an environment of mutual respect, where we value unique differences and demonstrate authentic allyship. We believe passionately about equity, diversity and inclusion.

Recruitment Agencies: We are not utilising the services of recruitment agencies for this vacancy and will accept direct applications only.

b7b6a9f99b7fcf10.title: Market Research Analyst - Healthcare
b7b6a9f99b7fcf10.description: In today’s digital world, more and more people can have the luxury of being able to work from home and manage their own time. Being a market research analyst allows you just that. With flexible project work you can be your own boss and only take on the projects that young have the time to commit to.The healthcare industry is a rapidly growing one and marketing and branding play a big part in this expansion. At Replay Research, we specialise in analysing and transcribing interviews for market research in this sector. We offer all new recruits comprehensive, free training, full insurance and membership to the healthcare market research industry body.Within the healthcare industry, market research plays a big part in helping companies determine their business strategy. In a rapidly growing sector, it is essential for business intelligence and paves the way for new treatments and advancements in healthcare.Part of the market research journey involves assimilation of data from interviews and that is where we come in. As an analyst for Replay Research you will be involved in analysing interviews either on a content analysis basis (amalgamating data and grouping responses on a template) or as verbatim transcriptions.We are looking for:- Bio-science graduates looking for a new challenge- An interest in marketing, appreciation of the big picture and an understanding of the pharmaceutical industry- Great attention to detail, good time management, good typing skills, excellent written EnglishThe length of projects can vary from one week to four weeks and may involve up to six hours per day or just a couple. The great thing about project work is that it is flexible and you can choose to take on projects that work around your other commitments. You can use this position as a launch pad for a new career or work part-time as a side hustle while you studyPart-time hours: 12-30 per weekJob Types: Full-time, Part-time, FreelanceSalary: £12.00-£23.00 per hourBenefits:Flexible scheduleWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayWeekend availabilityApplication question(s):Do you have a bio-science degree?Are you based in the UK?Work remotely:Yes

d37217a3161f2b13.title: Advertising Data Analyst - CST UK
d37217a3161f2b13.description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Who are we?
Client Solutions are trusted advocates connecting key stakeholders, providing inspiration and insights, driving collaboration that translates into long term client partnerships and growth! We are responsible for the day to day relationship and for ensuring success of advertiser investment. As trusted partners, we proactively advise our clients of opportunities and solutions to exceed their expectations, securing future investment.

We are currently looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to help scale our advertising business. Analysts are key players in the Advertising team, working cross-functionally with Sales, Product, Marketing Science and Strategy to create automated tools for daily usage and create actionable, data-driven business insights for C-suite client leadership.

The Analytics team partners with an array of departments to provide bespoke analytics solutions to their needs, both internally and externally facing. Your work will play a guiding role in shaping decision-making around advertising strategy iteration and how we communicate this with our clients. If large data sets excite you, you have a track record of creating narratives that drive action and you thrive in working through ambiguity, this is the role for you.

Key roles and responsibilities include:

Creating robust performance metrics based on historical and forecasted data to give the wider team granular insights into relative campaign execution success.
Building and scaling automated tools for analysis, reporting and forecasting.
Performing deep-dive analyses on our key advertisers to optimize their strategy for our platform.
Using data to identify trends, conduct root cause analysis and suggest potential opportunities for product/process improvements across the team.
Collaborating with members of cross-functional teams and key stakeholders (e.g. Sales, Ad Ops, Product, Strategy) to optimize overall product adoption and project's goals.
Creating meaningful dashboards for the sales team and upper management.
Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or other quantitative field.
Practical experience in problem solving through data analysis.
Proven knowledge of at least one programming language such as SQL, Python, or R
Strong understanding of data modeling and statistical analysis techniques, including: hypothesis testing, model evaluation, common regressions, classification algorithms.
Knowledge of Visualisation tools (Tableau, QlikView, Power BI etc) – ability to create interactive, user-friendly and compelling dashboards and reports is a plus.
Self-starter, a fast learner who has strong critical thinking skills.
Have a passion for TikTok
Solid communication skills across technical and non-technical audiences and the ability to synthesize and communicate complex concepts and analyses in easy-to-understand ways.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

a44934d792e06257.title: Junior Analyst - Data and Statistics Division
a44934d792e06257.description:
Junior Analyst - Data and Statistics Division
- (006244)
Primary Location UK-ENG-London
Job Statistics
Organisation 544000 - DATA AND STATISTICS DIVISION
Job Posting 01-Feb-2022, 9:41:11 AM
Department Overview

Data and Statistics Division (DSD) is part of the Data and Analytics Transformation Directorate (DATD). It is a division with responsibilities spanning production and management of some of the Bank’s core datasets, to aspects of data management and data culture that reach into the working lives of almost all Bank staff. This is a time of significant change: the way we collect and manage data, and compile statistics, is evolving as we seek to make use of new technology and techniques. This means drawing on a wide range of skills, including: data management; data science; operational work; expertise in aspects of economics, statistics; and people and process management.
The Teams
The roles sit in the Money Credit Group (MCG) and Financial Statistics Group (FSG) of DSD.
One role sits in the Industrial lending team in MCG. The primary focus of MCG is to quality assure, produce, explain and publish the Bank’s monthly money and credit statistics. We also quality assure SONIA submissions, to promote confidence in this published benchmark rate for sterling markets. We are making increasing use of tools such as R and Tableau in our work, as we strengthen our capacity to deal with both our focused objectives and also contribute to the wider Division.
The Industrial lending team is responsible for all statistical datasets covering bank lending to, and deposits from, different industries and sectors of the economy. These are high profile statistics, used by policy areas across the Bank and by a number of external analysts and commentators.
The other role is based in the Securities Team in FSG. The main focus of FSG is on the analysis, compilation, and publication of key statistical datasets such as capital issuance, monetary financial institutions’ contribution to the National Accounts, and International Banking Statistics.
The Securities Team is responsible for the collection of securities data that are used in variety statistical outputs such as the Capital Issuance statistical release, net finance raised by UK private non-financial corporations, and the UK National Accounts.
The work will involve working to strict deadlines, quality assuring, compiling, and analysing the data that feeds into these outputs. The role will also entail project work, which will range from developing and improving processes or creating new analytical tools in applications such as R or Python, to reviewing data methodology and undertaking conceptual pieces of analysis.
Job Description
The successful applicants for these roles will take responsibility for producing some of the Bank’s monthly statistics that receive a high degree of attention within the Bank and externally. At the same time, they will be able to contribute to divisional initiatives changing how we work and the tools we use, especially for our monthly statistical production work. Previous experience of using relatively new analytical tools, such as R, will be advantageous for these roles, and a keen desire to develop these skills is essential. These positions offer opportunities to develop and demonstrate analytical skills for future roles, and have the flexibility to be moulded towards each job holder’s skills.
The specific responsibilities undertaken by each job holder will depend on their skill set.
The roles will involve being part of the monthly data round, helping compile and explain movements in our measures of borrowing by different sectors of the economy, and in particular borrow by different industrial sectors.
As part of this you will:
Conduct due diligence on banks’ statistical returns to understand unusually large movements or spurious stability in the data;
Capture market intelligence from individual banks as part of the due diligence process, identifying common themes and stories that emerge;
Have the opportunity to present the latest developments in the data to other areas of the Bank, for example via the Sectoral Rates meeting.
Explain technicalities and movements in the data in response to queries from internal and external users.

Depending on the skills and development wishes of the applicant, each job holder will also have the opportunity to be involved in some of the following:
Be involved with DSD wide projects, developing common ways of working, embedding them into the team’s daily work. This includes using new technology to design the future of plausibility checking data, or build a tool that allows effective sharing of information about data returns across teams in DSD;
Development and maintenance of R or Tableau Dashboards to allow a ‘self-service’ culture for data; and
Contribute to users understanding of our data, for example via writing the Money and Credit Indicator, or statistical release.
Each job holder will also be encouraged to actively challenge the way we work, and suggest ways in which we can use technology to work more effectively and inclusively as a team.
The roles also offer an excellent opportunity to participate in high profile work contributing to the calculation of the SONIA rate, published daily at 9am. Involving stakeholder management across the Bank and with external financial firms, the key task here is to plausibility check SONIA-eligible, unsecured and secured trades.

Role Requirements
Essential (minimum) requirements
Each jobholder will need to have:
Strong technology skills, including the desire to develop these skills further. A good understanding of new analytical tools such as R, Tableau or Python would be highly advantageous, or a strong desire to build these skills essential;
A keen interest in understanding developments in our statistics, and how these relate to policy issues of our users;
Strong numeracy skills;
Strong interpersonal skills to be able to work across a large team;
Be well organised, and able to make progress on projects whilst dealing with the commitments of a monthly round;
To be a strong team-mate, but also work autonomously; and
To be ambitious, and motivated by DSD’s move to a self-managed culture.
The Bank values diversity and inclusion – we want to reflect the society we serve better, we want the best people to work for us and we want our workplace to be inclusive. We value all forms of diversity, including but not limited to age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, race, religion and sexual orientation. One way we support diversity and inclusion is through our staff-run networks, which are summarised here.
We are fully committed to having a diverse and inclusive working environment, and are open to considering how the role might be carried out with flexible working. This role is therefore open to flexible working patterns.
We are also committed to making adjustments for candidates and employees where possible, and have partnered with external expert organisations to support us in this. We are a member of the Disability Confident scheme, summarised here, and people who wish to apply under this scheme should check the box in the ‘Candidate Personal Information’ under the ‘Disability Confident Scheme’ section of the application.
We anonymise applications so hiring managers will not be able to see your personal information when reviewing your submission, including your CV. Please fully complete the application form questions as requested, as any incomplete submissions may not be reviewed.
The Bank of England is a distinctive institution and our rewards are one of the things that set us apart. As well as enjoying a competitive salary you will work in a collaborative, inclusive environment, with a subsidised restaurant, flexible working opportunities and plenty of wellbeing initiatives.
This specific role offers a base salary of circa. £28,050 (subject to experience and skills) per annum, along with our comprehensive benefits package as follows:
A non-contributory, career average pension giving you a guaranteed retirement benefit of 1/95th of your annual salary for every year worked. There is the option to increase your pension (to 1/50th) or decrease (to 1/120th) in exchange for salary through our flexible benefits programme each year.A discretionary performance award based on a current award pool.A 7% benefits allowance with the option to take as salary or purchase a wide range of flexible benefits.25 days annual leave with option to buy up to 13 additional days through flexible benefits.Private medical insurance and income protection.
The closing date for applications is 22 February 2022.
Please apply online, ensuring that you answer the application questions, complete the work history and submit your CV.

daeff323e7b201c0.title: Data Analyst
daeff323e7b201c0.description:
Join Our Team
The Data Analyst is a vital member of the Baker Hughes team, as this role is responsible for the production of pipeline inspection reports delivered to clients across the globe. Delivering high quality, accurate technical reports based on thorough analysis is the cornerstone of Baker Hughes' Pipeline Inspection business and is integral in ensuring the safe operating of oil and gas pipelines around the world.
Although the skills required to be a fully certified Data Analyst in the Pipeline Inspection industry are developed over time, the ideal candidate is a persistent problem solver who enjoys data intensive, analytical work. This individual must be process oriented, as adherence to industry standards is required, and should also be deeply committed to quality and accuracy at a highly detailed level.
Additionally, those most successful in this career tend to be adept at managing workloads and resources, have a participative, team approach, and have the ability to communicate well with others in their immediate work environment.
Data Analysts are ultimately responsible for the organization and control of pipeline inspection data, comprehensive analysis of that data, and for facilitating the on-time delivery of the Pipeline Inspection report to clients. In certain cases, this will include post-report client support.
As a Data Analyst, You will be responsible for:
Six-Months to One Year Post Hire:
Achievement of industry certifications allowing for full scale data analysis
Flawless execution and on-time delivery of data analysis
Knowledge of data preparation and processing
Pipe-book production, fitting and defect identification, fitting and defect classification, and AGM assessment and inclusion
Integration of any supplementary data
Application of client profiles to organize and report In Line Inspection results
Identifies quality or productivity issues and potential solutions
Report to various levels of management on project milestones
One to Two Years Post Hire:
Data preparation, processing, assessment, and confirmation of acceptable data
Interpretation and quantification of signal data
Detailed defect sizing assessment
Training, coaching and mentoring newer analysts
Ensuring the consistency of work for other analysts, when acting as the Lead Analyst on a specific report
Pre and post report client support; including involvement in Client Presentations
Identifies quality or productivity issues and potential solutions
Effective utilization of resources to meet reporting time scales and budgets
Provision of pre and post-sales support service for reporting information
Preliminary and Final report production
Quality check of pipeline listing and report content
Report to various levels of management on project milestones
Examples of Key Deliverables and Performance Indicators:
On-time delivery of reports
Report First Time Yield (% of time the first report is the final report)
Procedural compliance
Report cycle time / hours per km
Fuel your passion
To be successful in this role you will:
Be an effective Problem Solver
Be detailed and Process Oriented with deep commitment to quality
Have the ability to persevere during periods of high work volume
Drive for results and ensure deliverables are met
Qualifications/Requirements
Basic
Educated to high school level with science and/or mathematics content
Detailed, analytical, process orientated approach
Ability to drive issues to a robust closure in a timely manner
Excellent interpersonal, communication and facilitation skills
Strong analytical/experimental/statistical skills
Work in a way that works for you
We recognise that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone. In this role, we can confidently offer the following flexible working patterns:
Occasional remote working as required
Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit in everything in and work when you are the most productive
Working with us
Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.
The Good Stuff
We believe in rewarding our people with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:
Generous annual leave and money to spend on wellbeing activities
Life assurance and income protection
Private medical cover
A defined contributory savings plan
Additional elected benefits.
About Us
At Baker Hughes, we are transforming the future of energy. With operations in over 120 countries, we develop and deploy industry-leading technologies and services to take energy forward. For more than a century, our inventions have revolutionized energy. Today, we bring our expertise to make oil and gas safer, cleaner and more efficient.
Join us
Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values ideas and new ways of thinking? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will challenge and inspire you
About Us:
With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we’re committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we’re always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.

Join Us:
Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.

Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

0321badcac37e8ec.title: Credit Risk Analyst
0321badcac37e8ec.description:
Credit Risk Analyst

Job Number: 3200439
POSTING DATE: Feb 2, 2022
PRIMARY LOCATION: Europe, Middle East, Africa-United Kingdom-United Kingdom-London
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Credit Risk
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Analyst

DESCRIPTION
Division: Firm Risk Management
Role: Credit Risk Management
Level: Analyst
Location: London
Recruiting Contact Name: Martin Deavin
Recruiting Contact Email: Martin.Deavin@morganstanley.com

Firm Risk Management
Firm Risk Management (FRM) supports Morgan Stanley to achieve its business goals by partnering with business units across the Firm to realize efficient risk-adjusted returns, acting as a strategic advisor to the Board and protecting the Firm from exposure to losses as a result of credit, market, liquidity, operational, model and other risks.

Background on the Position
The role will reside within Firm Risk Management?s Credit Risk Management Department. Credit Risk Management (CRM) determines risk appetite, approves and manages credit and counterparty risks on an industry, client, geography and transaction basis. The CRM team assigns Internal Credit Ratings to our client base; establishes and manages credit risk limits in accordance with the risk tolerance established by the Board; monitors and reports on credit risk exposures on a regular basis to the Chief Risk Officer and senior management. CRM also interacts with business units to ensure that credit risk assessments are factored into business decisions.


Primary Responsibilities
? Understand how macro-economic, market and company-specific events and new financial regulation impact our portfolio, clients and counterparty credit quality
? Analyze and identify credit risks in transactions (loans & derivatives) and understand the impact these have on our portfolio and risk appetite
? Analyze corporates/counterparties, assist in managing exposures/limits, identify and quantify risk drivers, prepare credit memos and make recommendations, follow up on transaction execution to ensure loans/trades are booked correctly
? Ensure risk reporting systems contain timely and accurate information and financial information is received from clients in a timely manner
? Participate in client due diligence meetings to understand their strategy, financial performance and business requirements

FRM is committed to creating and providing opportunities that enable our workforce to reflect diverse backgrounds and views.

QUALIFICATIONS
Experience
? Understanding of businesses, business models and ability to analyze key risks and mitigants
? Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Excel, PowerPoint and Word
? Strong analytical skills
? The ability to effectively communicate with a wide range of stakeholders. Both written and verbally

? Strong attention to detail and ability to provide information in usable formats
? An interest in working in a fast-paced environment, often balancing multiple high priority deliverables
? Ability to work independently in a self-directed way in a collaborative, team-oriented environment
? Fluency in English is required, plus another European language would be an advantage
? Experience in financial analysis and modelling (an advantage)
? Understanding of financial products, e.g., swaps, FX, equities (an advantage)

Your role at a glance
We are looking for a Data Support Analyst to join us in the Production Support Data & Batch Team. You will be providing business and technical support for these systems with a particular focus on IBOR and Global Analytics, ensuring that issues are properly recorded, tracked and resolved.

Becoming a Subject Matter Expert for the Nexus Data and Global Analytics systems, used by data consumers as a golden source of instrument, index and portfolio data

Offering variety and development as part of a regional collaboration, our Regional Learning & Development team supports performance management, project management and continuous improvement to achieve the organisational aims and objectives for all four East Midlands forces.

Whether you join us for on-going career development or in a highly rewarding job with good pay and flexible hours to suit your needs, we are confident you will enjoy working in our modern, dynamic and fast-moving organisation where teamwork and co-operation really does count for everything.

3ed9dfbf6d60885e.description:
Data and Statistics - BEEDS Analyst
- (006288)
Primary Location UK-ENG-London
Job Research
Organisation 544000 - DATA AND STATISTICS DIVISION
Job Posting 15-Feb-2022, 10:00:30 AM
The Bank of England is the UK's central bank. Our mission is to deliver monetary and financial stability for the British people.

The Bank of England is a diverse organisation. Each of its 4,000 plus people are committed to public service and dedicated to promoting the good of the people of the United Kingdom by maintaining monetary and financial stability.

Research and Statistics Divisions – Advanced Analytics, the Centre for Central Banking Studies, the Research Hub and the Data and Division – lie at the heart of the Bank of England, acting as a centre of excellence for analytics, research and statistics across the institution as a whole.

Data and Statistics Division (DSD) is the Bank’s centre of expertise for compilation, dissemination and publication of regulatory and statistical data, promoting innovation and quality to support analysis, policy and decision making by the Bank’s Committees, UK government departments and international organisations.

Data is collected from banks and buildings societies, credit unions, insurance companies and regulated mortgage lenders and administrators. This takes place via 35 statistical collections and over 200 regulatory collections.
We cleanse a sizeable proportion of these datasets and publish a large number of Statistical data via our interactive database. We support MPC, FPC and PRA Board and our data are used in the Inflation Report, Financial Stability Report, Credit Conditions Review, Stress Test Results, FPC Core Indicators and Quarterly Bulletin.

Department Overview
Data and Statistics Division (DSD) is part of the Data and Analytics Transformation Directorate (DATD). It is a division with responsibilities spanning production and management of some of the Bank’s core datasets, to aspects of data management and data culture that reach into the working lives of almost all Bank staff. This is a time of significant change: the way we collect and manage data, and compile statistics, is evolving as we seek to make use of new technology and techniques. This means drawing on a wide range of skills, including: data management; data science; operational work; expertise in aspects of economics, statistics; and people and process management.

Job description
The BEEDS analyst will be responsible for the day to day management of the Banks Strategic Data Collection System, BEEDS and working with a team of 5 people. The BEEDS analyst will work collaboratively with our key stakeholders in planning and managing the resourcing of future data collection projects. They will work with Business Areas and Project Teams (across the Bank/PRA) on transforming requirements into system configuration designs and then work with their team to deliver the configuration and test changes as they progress through the environments. The ability to continually improve processes and apply efficiencies to our ways of working is essential. The BEEDS analyst will engage with internal customers to keep them abreast of un/planned changes and issues and ensure good information flow between all parties. The un/planned changes and issues will, on occasions, require testing outside of standard 9am-5pm hours. The successful candidate will be expected to share responsibility with the team and smoke test the system some evenings and weekends. Opportunities to line manage are possible in this role if this is desired.

Role Requirements
Minimum (Essential) Criteria
Have a strong desire to want to provide the best service possible.
A strong emphasis on accuracy and working to deadlines.
Strong internal and external stakeholder management skills.
Ability to escalate issues when appropriate.
Ability to communicate well with a wide variety of audiences (technical teams, project teams and business areas).
Motivated and able to work calmly under pressure.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Capable of planning and strategic thinking. Demonstrates forward planning of own work, and that of their team in alignment with the overall project.
Pro-active self-starter

Desirable Criteria
Understanding and experience of working on data collection systems and its processes, in particular BEEDS.
Experience in delivering technical/data related projects.
Understanding of how Data Collection supports the Banks Strategic Objectives.
Experienced in delivering presentations.
Experience using Jira and/or Visual Studio
The Bank values diversity and inclusion – we want to reflect the society we serve better, we want the best people to work for us and we want our workplace to be inclusive. We value all forms of diversity, including but not limited to age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, race, religion and sexual orientation. One way we support diversity and inclusion is through our staff-run networks, which are summarised here.
We are fully committed to having a diverse and inclusive working environment, and are open to considering how the role might be carried out with flexible working. This role is therefore open to flexible working patterns.
We are also committed to making adjustments for candidates and employees where possible, and have partnered with external expert organisations to support us in this. We are a member of the Disability Confident scheme, summarised here, and people who wish to apply under this scheme should check the box in the ‘Candidate Personal Information’ under the ‘Disability Confident Scheme’ section of the application.
We anonymise applications so hiring managers will not be able to see your personal information when reviewing your submission, including your CV. Please fully complete the application form questions as requested, as any incomplete submissions may not be reviewed.
The Bank of England is a distinctive institution and our rewards are one of the things that set us apart. As well as enjoying a competitive salary you will work in a collaborative, inclusive environment, with a subsidised restaurant, flexible working opportunities and plenty of wellbeing initiatives.
This specific role offers a base salary of £28,050 per annum, along with our comprehensive benefits package as follows:
A non-contributory, career average pension giving you a guaranteed retirement benefit of 1/95th of your annual salary for every year worked. There is the option to increase your pension (to 1/50th) or decrease (to 1/120th) in exchange for salary through our flexible benefits programme each year.A discretionary performance award based on a current award pool.A 7% benefits allowance with the option to take as salary or purchase a wide range of flexible benefits.25 days annual leave with option to buy up to 13 additional days through flexible benefits.Private medical insurance and income protection.
