def5692be15ecdb7.description: HSE ANALYSTReporting To: Vice President - HSEFunction: HSELocation: London office – hybrid model 3 days a week/ work from home ​ABOUT SEADRILLSeadrill is one of the world’s most modern offshore Deepwater drilling companies. Using ground-breaking technology we operate in 15 countries across 5 continents, employing some 5,000 people representing 65 nationalities. Our vision is to Set the Standard in Drilling. It’s an ambitious goal. And every single one of us has a part to play. Help us to keep innovating, improving and maintaining the highest safety standards, and we’ll give you what you need to be your best too.Diversity and inclusion are more than words for us. Everyone is welcome—as an inclusive workplace, our people are comfortable bringing their authentic whole selves to work. We continue to build an inclusive culture that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our people. It fuels our innovation and connects us closer to our customers and the communities we operate in.​JOB SUMMARYThe HSE Analyst is responsible for the analysis and reporting of HSE performance globally, supporting the VP of HSE by utilising the data to gather insights, make recommendations and inform decision making. The role will be a subject matter expert in our incident management system; generating reports, identifying efficiencies and process enhancements and supporting end-users.This role will be responsible for the design and roll out of HSE communications that drive end-user engagement and support in the education, implementation and adoption HSE processes globally.JOB SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIESAnalyse and report on HSE Performance globally, to assess the effectiveness of HSE initiatives, identify trends and to support the HSE Leadership team to drive safety performance.Responsible for the ongoing development of the HSE Insights dashboard, ensuring data quality and that insights support the HSE Strategy and maintain relevance across diverse group of stakeholders given their varying expectations and interests.Develop and maintain a communications strategy for the HSE department, integrating data and insights to explain the purpose and desired outcomes of key initiatives and ensuring consistency in messaging to drive engagement and adoption with end-users.Manage and utilise HSE Communication channels and technologies including Microsoft Teams, Yammer, Seanet, Linkedin, to drive engagement and support in the education and adoption of new and existing HSE initiatives.Support the HSE Leadership team in the presentation and delivery of HSE data, insights and initiatives .​SAFETY AT SEADRILLOur goal is to ensure that ‘nobody gets hurt’ whilst performing their job. Everyone at Seadrill has a part to play in meeting our safety commitment.Through strong leadership and personal responsibility from all employees, we take a systematic approach to identifying, managing and preventing the hazards involved in our day to day operations. Nothing is more important to us than the health, safety and security of our workforce and the communities in which we operate and behaving responsibly towards our shared environment. We are vigilant, disciplined and always looking out for one another. We have developed and embedded a strong safety culture onshore and offshore, fostered by all employees, who each have a personal responsibility and the authority to put an immediate stop to the job if they believe it to be unsafe. Everyone at Seadrill is accountable for helping to build this culture of care.​SEADRILL BEHAVIORAL FRAMEWORKIn Seadrill, setting the standard is not just about what we deliver, but how we deliver it.We co-created our Behavioural Framework with our employees, where we identified four key competencies that define our culture and help us to live our values. Our behaviours are embedded in the way we work and support and guide us day to day:Drive & OwnershipChange & Forward ThinkingCommunication & CollaborationService Delivery​KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCEEssentialProficiency in Microsoft Suite, specifically Excel, PowerPoint and PowerBi at an advanced level.​Excellent communication skills with the ability to use data to influence a range of stakeholders and discuss technical concepts and information clearly and meaningfully.​Ability to manage a wide range of stakeholders with varying priorities.​Demonstrate excellent teamwork and collaboration.​Ability to thrive in a changing and fast paced environment and comfortable dealing with ambiguity.​Excellent attention to detail and focus on quality control.​Has an interest to learn HSE / Offshore drilling (Occ Health & Safety as well as Process safety).DesiredExposure to project management processesExperience in developing and implementing integrated communication activitiesExperience working in a matrixed environment and demonstrated ability to influence others toward a common vision or goal.​EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONSMinimum Requirements​Degree qualifiedPreferred​Qualification / interest in HSE​JOIN SEADRILLWe value our people and want to retain them. So, we offer a competitive package built around an attractive base salary and a range of benefits tailored to your location.Join Seadrill. Own the Opportunity.​Job Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits:Cycle to work schemeSick paySchedule:Monday to FridayApplication question(s):What are your salary expectations for this role?What is your current notice period?Do you have the right to work in the UK?Is your right to work in the UK time limited?

7330ed24d27a5604.title: Data Analyst
7330ed24d27a5604.description:
Activate Business School is proud to be launching a new commercial programme in data analytics training for a major existing client. We are now looking to attract a Data Analyst, who wishes to change pathways to work with their skills in a new and exciting way.
Our aim is to support our client's employees to better understand the data they are looking at on a day-to-day basis through a variety of workshop delivery & coaching sessions in client locations, as well as online.
As a Data Analyst Trainer, you will support and empower our learners to achieve their goals through building their knowledge base and skillset that will create greater confidence in handling and reading data.
This is a permanent, full-time role and we offer a hybrid working model based predominately at our client location in Oxford, with some remote working, and occasional travel required to clients across the south of England.
What do you need to be successful?
You will have experience working with data, along with strong data analytic skills and the ability to communicate to people who have little or no understanding of this sector in a way that is compelling and interesting. You will be innovative and passionate about delivery and development, with the ability design and deliver highly engaging workshops which showcase your expertise and understanding in a range of technical competencies.
In addition, you will need to have a flexible approach, coupled with excellent organisational and interpersonal skills. You will have an open mindset and attitude towards technology and virtual learning tools.
You may not have considered a role like this before, you may have experience of training, coaching, or mentoring in previous roles and this could be an opportunity for you to build on those skills to support the future learning and development of this sector.
What are the benefits of this role?
Activate Business School, part of Activate Apprenticeships, are looking to continue to build a high performing team who are passionate about developing skills within industry and seeing the organisational impact that we can make.
In addition, there really is no limit in terms of your personal growth, development and career by joining one of the largest Education Providers in the UK. You will have a comprehensive development program as part of induction together with peer-to-peer learning, a formal development plan and support at every step of the way to set you up for success.
We offer a buddy system, a digital induction module and a close-knit community of experts and leaders across the Group to support the sharing of best practice and encourage individual growth. We also have extensive technology in place to develop digital capability.
What are the benefits of working for Activate Learning Group?
At Activate Learning we are pioneering education with an unwavering focus on providing talent for business and transforming lives through our award-winning Learning Philosophy. Our student experience is the result of our attention to detail in recruiting, developing and retaining the right staff who match and promote the values and behaviours of our brand.
We reward our employees with generous annual leave entitlements, access to training and development, travel subsidies – bus and train, cycle scheme, onsite parking (first come first served), plenty of public transport options for all sites, discounted membership to the Lifestyle Centre (on some campuses) and Employee Assistance Programme.
Applications are reviewed and shortlisted on a rolling basis and we reserve the right to interview, appoint and close adverts early due to the volume of applications we receive.
We therefore encourage you to apply at the earliest opportunity to avoid disappointment as once we have closed a vacancy you will be unable to submit your application form.
Activate Learning is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people and expects all its staff to share this commitment. Successful applicants will be required to undergo a DBS check at the appropriate level.
Applicants must be eligible to work in the UK as we do not sponsor work permits and work permits from other organisations are unacceptable as proof of right to work in the UK.
Applications are encouraged from all candidates meeting or exceeding the minimum criteria for the role regardless of age, disability, gender, orientation, race, religion or ethnicity.
Activate Learning are committed to employing people with disabilities and will ensure our recruitment process is inclusive and accessible. If you require any reasonable adjustments either at application or interview stage please contact the talent team directly.
If an agency submits an unsolicited CV to any partner or employee of our company, you should be aware that they have no authority to enter into an arrangement with you. Should we require recruitment agency involvement, we will contact the agencies on our preferred suppliers list, and we would ask that you respect the relationships we have already built with these suppliers.

2f9a654db0fe3b6d.title: Data and Insight Analyst
2f9a654db0fe3b6d.description:
Company Description

Mitie was founded in 1987, Mitie is the UK's leading facilities management and professional services company, looking after a large, diverse, blue-chip customer base, from banks and retailers, to hospitals, schools and government offices. Mitie has over 77,000 people, 100+ office locations, and thousands of customers across the country, there's no limit to what you can achieve if you work for us.


Job Description

We're looking for an curious and technically capable individual who has proven experience in generating insight from disparate datasets and an ability to provide solutions to technical problems.


Responsible for the delivery of Operational reporting and analytics for Technical Services. Using data and automated reporting to deliver operational insight solutions and utilising Power Bl to support the business and our clients. Developing reports & insight that will drive tangible value and change both internally and externally.


Play a key role in supporting Technical Service and Connected Workspace leadership deliver business and customer goals through the use of data, analytics and story telling.


This role will inform and support the development and adoption of Mozaic, Mitie's award winning analytics portal. Main duties:

Deliver operational reporting to surface insight for users
Driving usage of Mozaic our self-serve analytics toolset
Governance (documentation & lineage) of datasets generated for analytical or reporting purposes
Drive the development of performance reporting & insight for use by Technical Service leadership
Assist with the implementation of change initiatives where necessary, and embed Mitie values and
Adhere and promote best practices and consistency across the team
Qualifications
Proven track record of value added analytical deliveries with at least 2yrs experience in similar roles
Microsoft Power Bl experience highly preferred
Ability to migrate manual processes into automated self-serve solutions
Advanced excel skills preferred
Understanding of one or more data languages (SOL/Pandas)
Specialist analytics skills including modelling, data preparation, visualisation and story telling would be desirable
Must have a curious approach with good analysis skills to produce practical solutions to a range of problems
Experience of facilities management, property industry, customer experience or similar preferred


Additional Information

Health and Safety responsibilities


Follow Group and company policies and procedures at all times;
Report any apparent deficiencies in systems of work or equipment provided that may result in failure of service delivery or risk to health and safety or the environment;
Use all work equipment and personal PPE properly and in accordance with training received;
Report any issues or training needs to your Line manager and /or via your divisional incident reporting system;


Information Security


Ensure compliance with Mitie's information security procedures in all activities;
Proactively identify and report security risks to your manager;
Report actual and suspected security incidents;


Note


This job description Is intended to give the post holder an appreciation of the role envisaged for this position and the range of duties undertaken. Specific tasks and objectives will be agreed with the post holder throughout the period of employment. The job description may be varied from time to time by the Company to reflect changes in the post holder's role and/or the needs of the business.


Data & Insight Analyst

Somerdale Rd, Keynsham, Bristol BS31, UK Full-time

f7049d8076582310.title: Events Data Analyst - Sustainability
f7049d8076582310.description: Company Description*Informa PLC is a leading international events, intelligence and scholarly research group.*Our purpose is to champion the specialist. Through hundreds of powerful brands, we work with businesses and professionals in specialist markets, providing the connections, intelligence and opportunities that help customers grow, do business, make breakthroughs, and take better informed decisions. Informa is listed on London Stock Exchange and a member of FTSE 100, with around 10,000 colleagues working in over 35 countries.FasterForward is Informa’s approach to sustainable business.In 2021, Informa was named top of our sector in the DJSI, ranked 5th in the FTSE100 for our approach to climate change by EcoAct’s annual ranking, and scored well in a collection of other rankings and indices including A- in the CDP. This builds on several awards over the last three years for being the most improved business on sustainability – something that we believe comes from our committed approach to this agenda.The sustainability team in InformaIn the last five years, Informa has invested significantly in sustainability, growing the team to 15 people spread across the business supported by 100s of sustainability champions.Job Description*Introduction*The Sustainable Event Analyst will report to the Senior Sustainability Manager, who in turn reports to the Head of Sustainability.Informa operates a balanced working model, with some home working and some office working. Most of our sustainability team is based out of our London offices. Our expectation is that the role would be hybrid working between home and office work, preferably in the UK, but other locations would be considered for the right candidate but some required trips to our London office.Key ResponsibilitiesThis role will primarily be working together with the Senior Sustainability Manager and the wider Sustainability team to support Informa’s progress to creating more sustainable events in our Informa Markets, Tech, and Connect divisions. This will involve helping implement our FasterForward and Sustainable Event Management Systems across the business and, in particular, this role will be focussed on monitoring and analyzing the collective performance across the divisions, measuring how we’re progressing our carbon neutral and net-zero ambitions, as well as finding ways we can more effectively analyze our progress. It will also involve some creative thinking around how we can efficiently collect data and knowledge across 1000 events and extrapolate to fill gaps and learn patterns.The role will engage heavily with Informa’s divisional sustainability teams as well as other group roles including the group sustainability reporting team, finance, operations, and others.The Group Sustainability Data Analyst is primarily responsible for:Work with the Senior Sustainability Manager and relevant collaborators across the company to establish streamlined data collection and management methods for the events division’s delivery of FasterForward.Develop analytics, progress reports, and KPI dashboards for different stakeholders to help inform strategy for the events division’s delivery of Faster Forward.This would cover KPIs such as event waste, energy, attendee travel, and their resulting carbon impact, events Fundamentals scores, Connecting the Disconnected, Sustainability Inside, events charitable giving, the number of flights created and saved by our events, economic impact measurement, etc.Develop, deploy, train, manage and operate a new automated workflow management platform for The Fundamentals.This list is not exhaustive and the right candidate is expected to be involved in a variety of other activities and engage with any other reasonable duties as required. Each of these will be delivered in partnership with other sustainability team members.Qualifications*Skills and Abilities*Essential skillsA passion for robust data that allows consistent and insightful analysis as well as the tenacity and resilience to track down missing data, and the ability to accept and manage gaps and extrapolations where necessary.A demonstrated interest in events management, sustainability and a broad range of ESG topics.Attention to detail and the ability to work to a high standard, while balancing a diverse workload effectively in order to meet key deadlines. The candidate needs to be incredibly reliable with the ability to focus.Ability to perform analytical-related activities of large amounts of data and identify trends, as well as the actions to improve both the data collection and the performance.Intermediate to advanced Excel capability and an ability/interest in learning new technology platforms: in particular experience in data manipulation in Excel including PivotTables and analysis is essential.Experience working with incomplete data and extrapolating in an effective way.Experience in identifying solutions to complex reporting problemsExperience with working with lots of different stakeholders to gather dataHappy to manage own tasks responsibly and work independently, with little supervision but working within a common mission and an absolute ability to ‘catch the balls and run with them’.A desire to work at a high level across the business but also an interest in getting into the detail of a project and understanding data at a granular levelFlexible, proactive and collaborative attitude.Excellent time management and task manager.Self-motivated, driven and open to new challenges.Analytical mindset and curious nature able to absorb detail and identify actionable insights.Ability to analyze data to identify what it’s telling us, as well as the creation of reports, dashboards and identify trends.Demonstrated interest in Sustainability and making an impact in the world is absolutely key.Good communication skills in English.Desirable skillsPrior experience in a role focusing on sustainability, events management or data analysis is preferable. However, this role might be well suited to someone looking to transition from a finance or analytics role into sustainability, or someone new into sustainability who has a real interest in data and analysis.An understanding of net zero, carbon neutral, GHG protocol or other similar calculation tools is useful and you will certainly have the chance to learn more about this.Experience in tools such as PowerBI or other data analysis or presentation tools.Ability to communicate effectively with individuals at all levels.Experience using other Microsoft software to produce reports and other content.Project management experience.Knowledge of ISO management systems, EMS or similar. Eg ISO20121Additional Information*Why work for Informa?*25 days annual leave plus bank holidays, 4 days for volunteering and a day off for your Birthday!Friendly staff who are all “expert’s experts” and additional training for developmentPension match and a range of other entirely flexible benefits to suit your needsRegular Social Events and Networking opportunitiesShare-Match options - become a shareholder!We know that sometimes the 'perfect candidate' doesn't exist, and that people can be put off applying for a job if they don't fit all the requirements. If you're excited about working for us and have most of the skills or experience we're looking for, please go ahead and apply. You could be just what we need! We believe strongly in the value of diversity and creating supportive, inclusive environments where our colleagues can succeed. As such, Informa is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, ancestry, national origin, religion, or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, citizenship, or other protected characteristics under local law.Location: 5 Howick Place, London SW1PJob Type: Full-time

c895bbf04034f941.title: Data Analyst x3
c895bbf04034f941.description:
Unit : CIO Portfolio

Salary : £34,304 to £40,927

Location : Milton Keynes

Please quote reference : 19487

Full-time, Permanent x1, 12 Month Fixed Term Contract x2

Closing Date : 4 March, 2022 - 12:00

Change your career, change lives
The Open University (OU) is the UK’s largest university, a world leader in flexible part-time education combining a mission to widen access to higher education with research excellence, transforming lives through education.
The Chief Data Office is spearheading a transformation of the university’s data analytics capability. Our aim is to support our key stakeholders in the university by enabling evidence driven decision making through data and analytics.
The role
Data Analysts undertake robust data analysis to present performance insight that facilitates action to improve student success and satisfaction. We support our many stakeholders across the University through specific pieces of strategic analysis, creation of business intelligence reports and dashboards or by responding to requests for data and analysis.
We have a new, exciting opportunity for experienced Data Analysts to join the team in contributing to the development of coherent analytical frameworks which deliver actionable reports or business insights that drive improved student success and satisfaction.
The OU campus is based in Milton Keynes however we are happy to offer flexible working for these opportunities, with occasional travel to Milton Keynes required.
Skills and experience
Do you have strong data manipulation and analysis skills – can you analyse large complex datasets to create clear business insight?
Are you comfortable engaging with stakeholders to understand, challenge and refine their data and analysis needs?
Can you tell simple and persuasive stories with data, presenting complex data in an impactful way for non-technical audiences?
Do you thrive in a multi-functional team environment where collaboration with other analysts, relationship managers and subject matter experts is key to success?

If you can answer “Yes” to these questions, then we would love to hear from you.
The full summary of duties and skills required for the role can be found within the Job Description.

If you would like to discuss the particulars of this post before making an application, please email Resourcing-Hub@open.ac.uk or contact Donna Elstob (donna.elstob@open.ac.uk).

What you get in return
We offer a great range of benefits that support our employees and their families for the long term, including 33 days holiday per annum plus Bank Holidays and Christmas closure days, an attractive pension proposition and free parking on campus.
Colleagues wellbeing and development is at the forefront of our culture. We embrace diversity and recognise and reward our employees for the fantastic work they do. For more information about our people and wellbeing focus, please contact the Resourcing Hub.
How to apply
Unless otherwise stated in the advert, all applications are completed online via the OU Job’s page and following the instructions below and clicking the “APPLY NOW” link below. Applications submitted via 3rd party websites will not be considered.
Access details for disabled applicants are available from the Resourcing Hub, telephone: 01908 655544, quoting the vacancy reference above.
To apply for this role please submit the following:
Your current CV
To ensure that your file is uploaded to our system correctly, please make sure your document is saved with the following file name as appropriate to the vacancy you are applying for: 19487, surname, first initial.
You will need to have your documents ready ahead of submitting the electronic application.
APPLY NOW
Closing date: 4 March 2022 - 12:00
You will receive updates regarding your application from resourcing-applications@open.ac.uk. Please ensure this email address is added to your list of trusted senders. Please also keep an eye on your junk folder to ensure you do not miss any important updates regarding this role.
You can view your application communications on the Candidate portal.
Please note: If you have not heard from us within 2 weeks of the application closing date, please assume that on this occasion you have not been selected for interview, however we thank you for your interest in The Open University and encourage you to apply for future positions.
Find out more about us and our mission by watching this short video (you will be taken to YouTube by clicking this link).

Email : Resourcing Hub
The Open University is committed to equality, diversity and inclusion, which is reflected in our mission to be open to people, places, methods and ideas. We aim to foster a diverse and inclusive environment so that all our staff can reach their potential and attract diverse candidates. We recognise that different people bring different perspectives, ideas, knowledge, and culture, and that this difference brings great strength.
We offer a range of inclusive employment policies which include family and carer friendly flexible working arrangements and have many supportive staff networks and wellbeing services. We also endorse the principles of Athena SWAN, with commitment from all levels of the organisation in promoting gender equity.

15c8ed2627f11dac.title: Junior Data Analyst (f/m/d)
15c8ed2627f11dac.description:
Purpose of Position

Data sits at the heart of the company. Our mission is to ensure that Awin is able to leverage the data it has access to across the group and build out reporting to ensure we are able to make better commercial decisions.

With a background in data analysis or business intelligence this role will be the next step in your career. You will be working within a cross functional team of data analysts, data engineers and data integration analysts, supporting in producing reports for internal stakeholders as well as external customers.

As a Junior Data Analyst you will be expected to help with reporting requests, building dashboards in Tableau and Power BI, creating data sets for ad-hoc analysis and providing assistance where necessary.

Your location: London, Berlin, Madrid, Paris, or Munich (with a hybrid remote working policy)

Key Tasks
You produce, maintain and deliver various reports within an agile framework
You fully utilize Awin's BI tools to produce market-leading insights
You facilitate ad-hoc data requests across the group through accessing the data warehouse
You support senior data analysts with tasks relating to query writing and reporting building
You work on a modern cloud based tech stack in Azure with Databricks, Tableau and Power BI
Skills & Expertise
You have at least 1-year of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analysis or Business Analysis
You have experience in data modelling and/or working with big data environments (Data Science is a plus)
You have strong knowledge in SQL/T-SQL or basic knowledge in SparkSQL and Python
You have a well-rounded tech understanding and affinity to adopt new technologies or software quickly
You are fluent in English. Every other language is a plus
Our Offer
Say thank you to colleagues by sending them a voucher through our peer-to-peer programme
2 paid days off per year, during working hours to volunteer with a community organization
Use our company's training offer to gain and improve specific skills within the role as well as wider professional development
Taking care of yourself with access to various mental health initiatives such as a 4-day-week-trial


Established in 2000, Awin is proud of our dynamic, social and inclusive culture.

Like all businesses, we've had to adapt and nurture our culture in a virtual environment. Our virtual 'Life @ Awin' hub brings our colleagues from across the globe together for various social activities.

Diversity & Inclusion are paramount to us, and we proudly pursue and hire diverse team members. We champion uniqueness and authenticity; this is who we are at our core. Our network of affiliate partnerships are diverse and transparent, as are the employees powering our vision to build the world's leading open partner ecosystem. We welcome all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. If you need support at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Apply now to begin the next stage of your career at a progressive company that supports both your professional and personal development.

0ef1af3c63db8931.title: Customer Success Analyst with background in Football / Sports Data
0ef1af3c63db8931.description:
About Us:
StatsBomb was founded in January 2017 to provide data, analytics and consultancy to football teams, media and gambling companies, and has grown into a global multi-sports data and analytics SAAS provider.


StatsBomb are well known in the sports analytics industry for providing unique insights into the game of football and have developed a strong brand synonymous with highest quality and accuracy of data coupled with excellent customer service and support.

We have grown from our initial founder team of 3 at the start of 2017 to over 700 employees based in Europe, the US and Egypt, and are continuing to expand our operation as we build out our product portfolio and customer base.

Our core products are data and analytics tools, with a tech stack that includes computer vision, machine learning, stream processing, and web-based dataviz. We also have a growing consultancy service that allows customers to have additional access to our expertise and insight. From our origins as a blog pre 2017, StatsBomb have always had a strong foothold in the football analytics community and education remains a constant feature of both our products and our customer support ethos.


StatsBomb is an inspiring place to work. Our vision is clear - to be the world's leading sports data company - and we have a driven and dedicated leadership team to get us there, including the original founders, and headed up by CEO Ted Knutson. Our culture is open, honest, transparent, supportive and driven. Our employees are dedicated, motivated and genuinely love their work as well as the people they work with.
About The Role:
We require a Customer Success Analyst to join our growing team. An individual who has some previous experience working within a Professional Football Club's Data Analytics department and is comfortable using Python and / or R programming languages. Confident interpersonal communication skills are necessary for this role as we speak to customers on a day to day basis. Also a general understanding of Football and Football Tactics would be advantageous. Previous experience working with StatsBomb Data and / or StatsBomb IQ platform. Language skills such as German, Polish, Russian or Portuguese would be useful but not essential.
StatsBomb is an inspiring place to work. If you think you have the passion, drive and talent to join our exciting and fast paced team, we’d love to hear from you!
In return, we offer the following:

Excellent career development opportunities
The opportunity to work with smart and dedicated colleagues, working towards a shared vision
A collaborative and diverse team environment
Remote and flexible working as well as inclusive wellbeing benefits
Team social activities
Competitive salaries
Competitive stock option package for all employees
Competitive holiday allowance:
25 days holiday,
1 wellbeing day per quarter,
1 day off on your birthday,
possibility to buy and sell holidays
Equal maternity and paternity provision
Family friendly policies


Below are some testimonials from our colleagues...


“It is a class place to be and the people are phenomenal. I feel so lucky to spend everyday working with amazing technology, on fascinating projects, as part of the most entertaining industry in the world. StatsBomb is one of those places where the company’s focus is so exciting that you want to be a part of it...some projects are totally confidential and game changing in the industry which is thrilling to be part of. Everyday I work in collaboration with industry leaders and learn from experts pushing the boundaries of computer vision, data science and sporting analysis. I have worked in all environments from global investment banking to growing startups and the culture here is like nothing I've seen. We recruit from different cultures all around the world who feel like distant cousins - events like our conference are like a wedding party that brings everyone together!”

Chris, Senior Tech Engineer


“StatsBomb is such a fun and exciting company to work for. Working with, and learning from, diverse and intelligent colleagues in such a supportive and friendly atmosphere is amazing.”

Corinne, Project Manager

8dcc00962efec7c7.title: Marketing Finance Analyst, Google Nest
8dcc00962efec7c7.description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, a related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with financial analysis and accounting.
Preferred qualifications:

Experience working with SQL.
In-depth experience analyzing data and creating reports with spreadsheet, database query experience, statistical, quantitative modeling, and forecasting skills.
Quantitative and data analysis experience; investment banking, management consulting experience, or experience in coding/financial modeling.
About the job
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. As a Financial Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. While working on multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to solve big picture challenges.

Marketing Finance Analysts help marketers define strategy and recommend investment allocations based on campaign measurement and data-driven insights, underpinned by scaled tools and processes.


In this role, you'll develop and drive a deep understanding of the financials for marketing Google’s Nest business. You will partner with global and regional Finance, Marketing and Go-to-Market teams. Guided by your astute business acumen, you will develop analyses and insights to help your business partners understand the value of marketing initiatives, provide recommendations on where to spend money (which countries, products, channels) and improve day-to-day financial processes – succinctly communicating all of the above to advise and influence business leadership.
The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
Responsibilities
Lead assessments of business performance and understand risks and opportunities to form recommendations on country prioritizations and channel strategy.
Package and communicate insights and actionable next steps to business and Finance leadership.
Define goals, OKRs and provide guardrails for spend based on P&L dynamics.
Ensure sound financial goals and tracking for marketing campaigns, and report on performance to leaders.
Analyze the impact of marketing investments to see the impact of campaigns across markets, help the team diagnose under/over performance.

af4e48fac7cb3ac3.title: Data & Credit Analyst
af4e48fac7cb3ac3.description:
A market leader in credit intelligence, Reorg brings together journalists, financial analysts, legal analysts, technologists, and data scientists to collect and synthesize highly complex information into actionable intelligence. Since 2013, tens of thousands of professionals across hedge funds, investment banks, management consulting, and law firm verticals have come to rely on Reorg to make better, faster, and more confident decisions in pace with the fast-moving credit markets. A proud member of the Warburg Pincus portfolio since 2018, Reorg’s operations continue to grow rapidly across North America, the UK, EMEA, and APAC. For more information, visit: www.reorg.com
Working at Reorg
Consistent with our growth, Reorg hires innovators and trailblazers across the globe to drive our business and our iron-clad corporate culture alike. Our core values – Action Oriented, Customer First Mindset, Effective Team Players, and Driven to Excel – define an organizational ethos that’s as high-performing as it is human. Among other perks, Reorg employees enjoy competitive health benefits, a generous retirement package, generous parental leave, gym subsidies, educational reimbursements for career development, recognition programs, and much more.
The Role
We are hiring data & credit analysts to support our growth in applying data analysis to the credit markets. Each data & credit analyst will work at the intersection of technology and finance and will play a fundamental role in ensuring that our subscribers - including hedge funds, investment banks, trading desks, financial advisors and law firms - receive unique insights about an important but undercovered part of the financial markets.
Find out more about Reorg here: https://reorg.com/products/
Responsibilities
Contribute to our high quality coverage through compiling financial summaries and building capital structures.
Collaboratively work alongside the other data & credit analysts to support coverage.
Develop a strong understanding of how companies are capitalized.
Requirements
Graduates with degrees in business, accounting or finance or recent graduates in these or other disciplines with some experience in the financial industry, including internships.
Some familiarity with financial statements is expected.
Knowledge of Excel.
Drive to continuously improve, owning mistakes and learning from them.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
This is a graduate level role.
Reorg Values
Action Oriented
Customer First Mindset
Effective Team Players
Driven To Excel
Reorg provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Reorg complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

26c72a85c2f745f1.title: Finance Analyst, Regional Business Finance
26c72a85c2f745f1.description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, a related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience
Experience in financial planning and modeling within the payments or technology industry
Experience in analytical and data environments

Preferred qualifications:

Experience effectively partnering with technical, business, and operational stakeholders
Ability to work in an unstructured environment, navigate ambiguity, manage multiple assignments simultaneously, and provide clarity and structure
Ability to communicate with executive management
Familiarity with Google tools, data infrastructure, and SQL
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Desire to structure and solve large, complex, and analytical problems
About the job
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. As a Financial Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. While working on multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to solve big picture challenges.

The Northern Europe region of the Business Finance team supports the Large Customer Sales (LCS) team working with customers to make them successful across Search, Display and Video 360, and YouTube. Our team provides Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) support to LCS. Our work is integral to the operations and strategic decision-making of the business. We identify business growth drivers, forecast future performance, and provide recommendations for resource allocation and investments.
The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
Responsibilities
Provide executives with clear insights and recommendations into drivers of business growth, market trends, risks, and opportunities.
Analyze financial results and key performance metrics on a periodic basis to support decision making.
Provide support for day-to-day operational decisions and macro-level project decisions through financial analysis.
Define Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for the business and own reporting and analysis to track performance.
Build and maintain long-term financial models to understand the viability of projects, analyze expected returns, and support long-term resource allocation.

99706c1a3d0280cd.title: Senior Data Governance Analyst
99706c1a3d0280cd.description:
What We'll Bring:
The role is responsible for the management and adoption of data privacy tools across TransUnion globally. This involves coordination and support for multiple TransUnion regions to document their privacy data assets and automate risk assessment processes.
What You'll Bring:
Supervising the rollout of TransUnion’s global data privacy tool (OneTrust). This will involve engaging with a range of stakeholders across several countries to capture information on data processing, generate assessments, and provide reporting.
Acting as a subject matter expert for the use and adoption of a global privacy tool. Ensuring that the global privacy tool is adequately administered and maintained. Full training will be provided for this.
Supporting with the management of privacy data assets across the globe, ensuring common treatment and methodologies are used, subject to any material differences in global privacy regulation.
Ensuring the use of privacy data assets adheres to existing Data Governance frameworks, relevant policies, standards, and controls.
Serving as a point of escalation for data governance, data management, and data use issues, working closely with stakeholders to improve the value of data assets, while maintaining compliance with regulations.
Supporting with the automation of risk assessments relating to data use, including Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs), and Legitimate Interest Assessments (LIAs).
Reporting on risks, issues, and performance to the Data Governance Manager.
Impact You'll Make:
Key Skills Required:
Solid understanding of data management and privacy risk data concepts. Basic knowledge and understanding of the GDPR, or a similar global privacy regulation, as well as other relevant legislation and regulations.
Ability to manage a network of country teams to facilitate the adoption of OneTrust, to meet the global data privacy requirements of TransUnion. This role will require liaising with stakeholders in several countries to ensure privacy risk is assessed correctly and maintained in a similar manner across the globe.
Familiarity of basic project management and planning disciplines to help drive out global adoption of OneTrust.
Interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact with a variety of technical and non-technical business stakeholders. Ability to articulate a business issue without resorting to technical language.
Organisation and time management, including working to deadlines with multiple deliverables.
Analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
Qualifications:
Desirable
Educated to degree level, or otherwise suitable experience
Experience:
Essential
Basic knowledge and experience of data privacy concepts in the Data Protection Act / GDPR or a similar regime.
Desirable
Experience with OneTrust or a similar privacy assessment tool (training will be supplied in OneTrust as part of the role).
Project Management and planning experience.
Experience in the management and governance of data assets.
Experience with documentation of data assets, including for regulatory compliance purposes, such as Data Protection Act or GDPR.
Understanding of or exposure to Credit Reference Agency products.
TransUnion Job Title
Sr Analyst, Data Asset Management

df5a68ac7e62565b.title: Data Analyst - Early Career Role
df5a68ac7e62565b.description:
Careers that Change Lives
A brand-new Early Career opportunity at the largest medical device company worldwide, Medtronic. Accredited within the UK as a 'Top Employer 2022' has opened with a patient-centric focus behind our daily operations.
Initially in this role, you will support the rest of the Offer Development & Compliance Team for the UK and Ireland by providing automation improvements, task management and Excel expertise, before growing towards becoming an expert within a relevant area.
This role will offer you flexibility between working remotely and within our UK&I Head office in Watford, Hertfordshire.
If you hold an interest in analysing data and improving ways of working, this role is made for you. You will need to be able to solve problems, challenge the conventional and communicate clear insights, as part of a busy Pricing, Contracting & Tender Management Team for a global organisation.
Onboarding onto the Early Career Pathway will allow you to help build your network, find your way around the company and develop. This programme provides support from a peer advisor from the department, regular feedback meetings and a large collection of training resources. An ideal environment to build relationships with colleagues from other functions and regions to help shape and advance your Medtronic Career.
Play an active role in the wider Pricing team, embracing change and supporting new initiatives. Join us!
Your responsibilities will include
As a business partner with operational teams, you will work closely with the Offer Development and Compliance Team, the Strategic Pricing Team, and wider Pricing, Contracting & Tender Management Team within the organisation to meet overall objectives for reporting on contract performance.Research tools and systems to help better support contract compliance.Manage the status and distribution of tasks within the team central mailbox.Understanding of Advanced analytics and Business Modeling analytics.Ability in drawing and framing logical conclusions.

Degree in Business Management, Mathematics, Science, or other relative subjects.Strong IT skills & knowledge of Microsoft Office tools.Analytical mindset & problem-solving skills.Conscientious, with a strong focus on the quality of work and a good eye for detail.Good organizational skills and priority management.Ability to build strong and credible relationships with stakeholders at all levels.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Understanding of Business Intelligence (BI) Platforms, Databases (SQL, Access), Tableau, Power BI & similar tools.Team player with resilience and flexibility.Self-motivated, positive and outgoing with a "can-do" attitude.Inquisitive, and open to new ideas and ways of working.
We Offer
We reward you in the ways that matter most to you. We offer a wide range of benefits and rewards programs to recognise the vital role you play in our Mission to transform healthcare.
About Medtronic
Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies, and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life.
We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be. We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team.
Let's work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients' lives.
Founded in 1949 as a medical repair company, we're now among the world's largest medical technology, services, and solutions companies, employing more than 86,000 people worldwide, serving physicians, hospitals, and patients in over 155 countries.
Whatever your speciality or ambitions, you can make a difference at Medtronic - both in the lives of others and your career. Join us in our commitment to take healthcare Further, Together.

38223a4ee29ae3e3.title: Spacecraft Data Analyst
38223a4ee29ae3e3.description:
Job Description:
A vacancy for a Spacecraft Data Analyst has arisen within Airbus Defence & Space in Corsham.

We are looking for software engineers/data scientists/data analysts willing to diversify within the area of Spacecraft Operations and monitoring. The role forms part of a multi-disciplinary team, collaborating with experts in all spacecraft disciplines.
The position will include aiding the development and implementation of the Analytical Tool Suite used for spacecraft fleet monitoring activities, including but not limited to: data visualisation, statistical methods, long term behavioural trending and correlation analysis. The role will also contribute to the Anomaly Detection Tool Suite which involves real-time anomaly investigation, root cause diagnosis and machine learning techniques.
Spacecraft operations training will be provided on the job and will allow the candidate to become a technical expert in fleet operations and allow them to provide recommendations and advice to the Spacecraft Management Authority.
The successful applicant will need to be eligible to gain UK SC Security Clearance to undertake the role.
Task & Responsibilities:
Developing analysis tools (predominately in python) used for real-time spacecraft monitoring.
Understanding and monitoring the health of spacecraft subsystems (platform and payload) through routine analysis.
Designing and implementing methods within the Anomaly Detection tools, including advanced analytics/ML.
Providing advice as a technical expert to Spacecraft Management Authority.
Required skills:
BSc Systems Engineering, Physics, or equivalent.
Proficiency in Python highly desirable.
Ability to work successfully within a multi-disciplinary team from all spheres of the project.
The ability to think critically and make sound decisions, even in time-constrained situations.
Keen eye for detail with the ability to draw sound conclusions from data and communicate results effectively in a professional manner.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to report succinctly on all topics.
This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.
Company:
AIRBUS Defence and Space Limited
Contract Type:
Permanent Contract / CDI / Unbefristet / Contrato indefinido
Experience Level:
Professional / Expérimenté(e) / Professionell / Profesional
Job Family:
Customer Flight/Mission & Ops Support <JF-CS-OS>

10af08ad900ff65c.title: Systems Analyst
10af08ad900ff65c.description:
To provide a proactive data analytics capability for the MSE procurement & supply chain team.

Responsible for generating cost modelling tools and processes to capture, control and report against spend for all spend categories to support the procurement team in driving spend reduction and supporting strategic sourcing from a range of different data sources.

Represent the procurement Directorate at corporate meetings when ask by Senior Management

Report on procurement performance e.g. Procurement Dashboard highlighting Monthly savings performance, spend reports, compliance reports, Helpdesk performance and seek stakeholder sign off with relevant stakeholders

Deal will ad hoc requests from the Director of Procurement & Supply Chain or Head of Operations to undertake detailed analysis to support Business Cases or Board Papers on an as required basis

The procurement function acts as a centre of excellence for all Procurement & Supply Chain activities across the new group. It manages the provision of goods and services to all departments (clinical and non-clinical) on a daily basis, contracting for the provision with several thousand suppliers. The service performs a strategic business management role, managing £370m of non-pay expenditure in support of its stakeholders across the group. Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust provides services to the residents of Southend, Basildon and Chelmsford. It was formed in April 2020 by the merger of Southend University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust, Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust, and Basildon & Thurrock University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust.

You will be based at Britannia Park. You will generally be expected to undertake your normal duties at the principal place of work, however, in the course of your duties you will also be required to work at any of the sites within the Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust areas as well as other NHS sites as part of the delivery of the service.

811dcb7278381ad4.title: Financial Crime Assurance Analyst (Data)
811dcb7278381ad4.description:
At Monzo, we're building a bank that is fair, transparent and a delight to use. We're growing extremely fast and have over five million customers in the UK, with over 100,000 new people joining every month.

We're looking for a proactive, organised and conscientious FinCrime Assurance Analyst (Data) to join our existing FinCrime Assurance team. This is an exciting opportunity to make a real difference, protecting our customers and the market from criminals.

You'll need to have excellent SQL skills, knowledge of statistics and an ability to understand basic coding. Knowledge of bigquery and google forms is highly desirable.

You will also work closely with the Monzo Data Science team, who support us for more complex data tasks.

The FinCrime Assurance team is responsible for assessing the effectiveness of Monzo's Financial Crime controls, ensuring that we meet our own internal high standards and regulatory expectations.

The Role:

You will work with team members and other Monzo stakeholders to create and maintain fundamental assurance infrastructure, such as Quality Assurance assessment forms, sampling tools, trackers, dashboards and performance metrics.

You will lead on monitoring QA data, ensuring that our processes and systems are operating as efficiently as possible and resolving inefficiencies when they are identified.

You'll spend your time:

Developing and maintaining FinCrime QA assessment forms, sampling tools, trackers, dashboards and systems, so that they are scalable and effective.
Identifying and rolling out opportunities to improve and automate our processes.
Building metrics and dashboards to assist the review of QA results, to determine what errors are occurring and propose actions to prevent recurrence.
Determining key testable requirements from FinCrime business documents and incorporating those tests into QA forms, which will be used by the FinCrime QA assessment team for their assurance work.
Supporting the FinCrime Assurance Lead to deliver consistent, compliant and outcome focussed QA reviews, and provide assurance against Key Risk Indicators across FinCrime.
Using QA insights to identify practical actions that improve FinCrime quality in Monzo.
Driving improvements of processes, procedures and knowledge management.
Delivering timely customer centric feedback to control owners and managers.

You should apply if:

You have excellent SQL knowledge and can understand basic coding;
You have good knowledge of statistics and how to interpret them;
You are able to build dashboards and MI information;
You are comfortable in developing data capture forms and datasets;
You are comfortable owning data problems end-to-end, from identification to resolution;
You have experience of analysing data to identify issues and drive improvements;
You are confident in using data to back up decisions and improve understanding;
You have a strong attention to detail and analytical skills;
You can provide constructive feedback to enable personal growth and development.

Desirable (But Not Essential) :

You have a background in Financial Crime, with a sound knowledge of regulatory requirements;
Experience or knowledge in G Suite API and BigQuery;
Capable of using Looker to generate MI;
Strong influencing and stakeholder management skills, and ability to challenge others, as well as having exposure to senior management;
Experience in a QA related role;
Knowledge and experience of implementing FCA principles & Treating Customers Fairly.

Our vision of 'making money work for everyone' is dependent on every Monzonaut committing to putting customers first. We're also committed to employing a diverse and inclusive workforce, reflective of the customers and communities we serve – where everyone can be themselves and succeed. So if this sounds like a culture that you'd like to be a part of then be assured that we'll welcome your application.

Logistics

Salary range entry point is £45,000 with flexibility to increase on this depending on experience (plus stock options and other benefits)

This role can be based in our London office or remotely within the UK

The closing date for applications for this role is 6pm on 4th March 2022

We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.

Diversity and inclusion is a priority for us – if we want to solve problems for people around the world, our team has to represent our customers. So we need to attract the best talent and create an environment that supports and includes them. You can read more about diversity and inclusion on our blog.

The application process consists of a 30mins phone call with a recruiter, followed by a practical written exercise and 2 x 45 minute interviews conducted remotely via hangouts. We promise not to ask you any brain teasers or trick questions.

Equal Opportunity Statement

At Monzo, embracing diversity in all of its forms and fostering an inclusive environment for all people to do the best work of their lives with us. This is integral to our mission of making money work for everyone.

We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.

c86d0e41e7b69283.title: Research Analyst – Ethics & Data Protection
c86d0e41e7b69283.description:
Trilateral Research

Trilateral Research is a UK and IE-based enterprise, founded in 2004. Our teams include social scientists, data scientists, ethical, legal and human rights experts who work across the technology-social disciplinary divide. We apply rigorous, cutting-edge research when developing and assessing new technologies to ensure they achieve sustainable innovation and measurable impact.

Our culture is based on delivering high-quality outputs, through our commitment and passion for what we do. We work in an open and collaborative environment where the team culture provides support amongst peers and colleagues. Find out about our people and our culture, and see how our mission drives the research projects we take on, the key data protection services we provide, and the technology products and supplementary services we develop.

We are seeking a Research Analyst to support our research activities and assess the impacts of novel technologies and data on complex societal problems.
Main Activities and Responsibilities:

Work on projects in both the public and private sectors, with a focus on social science. The successful candidates should have expertise in legal (particularly privacy and data protection), ethical and/or social considerations across a number of sectors and issues, including:

Pandemic management
Climate and environmental issues
Crisis and resilience
Humanitarian assistance
International law

Please note that expertise in only one of those sectors, or only related ones, does not preclude applicants from applying. The post-holder will be expected to provide ethics and data protection guidance and support across a variety of projects. Expertise in research ethics and understanding policy would be a plus.

The post-holder will be expected to liaise with project partners and clients across the EU and internationally and deliver high-quality research and project outputs in a collaborative environment in which short and demanding deadlines are frequent. The projects could include travel (pandemic permitting). The post holder will also be required to contribute to business development, so experience in writing tenders and proposals for research grants would be desirable.
Key Competencies

Interpersonal Skills:

Flexibility and adaptability.
Ability to take own initiative and work independently.
Academic openness and a positive approach to continuous learning and development.


General Knowledge and Technical Skills:

Strong organisational skills.
Excellent attention to detail.
Strong verbal and written communication.

Required Education and Experience:

Essential:

Candidates will be studying for or will have completed a master’s degree, preferably in the social sciences. Interdisciplinary backgrounds are also welcomed.
Demonstrated ability to design and conduct qualitative research activities, particularly those that relate to developing novel technologies or stakeholder engagement.
Familiarity with at least one of the following fields: pandemic management, climate and environmental issues, crisis and resilience, humanitarian assistance and/or international law.
Interest in evaluating the impact of technology or data from an ethical or societal perspective.
Experience with using online platforms (e.g., Microsoft Teams, SharePoint) for remote work and research activities.


Desirable:

Experience in following ethical standards and procedures for conducting scientific research.
Practical knowledge and/or experience in applying EU data protection law (GDPR).
Familiarity with Europe Commission projects or proposals.
Experience of writing funding applications.
Experience in working in interdisciplinary research and innovation settings.

Location: This position is open to candidates based in the UK
Contract type: Fixed Term of 12 months

Salary: Commensurate with experience

Hours: Full time
In return, you get ...

Flexible working hours
A competitive salary
Remote working/working from home options
A friendly and enthusiastic team of experts in the field
We are an Equal Opportunities employer and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates, regardless of their age, sex, race, disability, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital/civil partnership status, or pregnancy and maternity. We are a Disability Confident committed and Living Wage employer.

At Trilateral Research, we value privacy and data protection rights. We have a longstanding data protection culture and promote robust ethical standards in data management and research ethics. Please read our Privacy Notice in relation to our recruitment activities before submitting your application to work with us.

e529519d4dbf9fc5.title: Economics Research Analyst
e529519d4dbf9fc5.description:
Economics Research Analyst
London
This role is deemed as a Certified role under the PRA & UK Financial Conduct Authority - Individual Accountabilities Regulations and may require the role holder to hold mandatory regulatory qualifications or the minimum qualifications to meet internal company benchmarks.
As a Barclays Economics Research Analyst, you will provide economic analysis, economic forecasts and fiscal forecasts for the big countries of the regions and be involved in monetary policy decisions. You will also assist our clients to understand the big picture, macroeconomic situation of governments and central banks, as background information for their investment decisions.

Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.

What will you be doing?
Contributing to economic research effort for euro area countries, produce macroeconomic forecasts, economic analysisParticipating in thematic studies on the euro area with other economists and strategists, in the areas of economic reforms, fiscal policies, foreign trade, financial links and politicsCommenting economic information for the euro area and manage our database on euro area data in coordination with other team membersContributing to research products written by the European economics team (Global Economics Weekly, Global Outlook, Euro Themes, data comments)Partnering with other economic teams on thematic topics, in particular with economists covering the UK and central and Eastern emerging Europe.Contributing to the visibility of Barclays economic research in the investor community: present views to external and internal clients, answer their requests
What we’re looking for:
Educated to masters or PhD level (or equivalent), preferably in an Economics or Finance disciplineExcellent modelling skillsKnowledge of Excel and one or more the following softwares (Matlab, Phyton, R, Stata, Eviews)
Skills that will help you in the role:
Experience as an Economist in a sell-side or buy-side Economics Research teamExperience in a Research department of a central bank or an international policy institution or academiaExcellent presentation skillsAbility to juggle a busy and varied workload

Where will you be working?
5 North Colonnade is home to our investment bank and is in the heart of Canary Wharf, just a short walk from our headquarters at Churchill Place. It boasts an array of onsite amenities such as dry cleaner as well as a deli and buffet style staff restaurant. The building is easily accessible by tube, docklands light railway and all major bus links. The atmosphere is second to none with a real buzz being created around the offices within.

f12bef54914b908a.title: Brand Marketing Finance Analyst
f12bef54914b908a.description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, a related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with financial analysis and accounting.
Preferred qualifications:

Experience working with SQL.
Experience in financial planning and analysis or a related function.
Experience working in an analytical role (e.g., strategy consulting, finance, investment banking, quantitative marketing, statistics, etc.).
About the job
The Finance Operations team manages Google's cash transactions on a global basis and ensures that Google's incoming and outgoing cash processes are controlled, effective and efficient. As a member of this team, you'll find innovative ways to manage our complex set of transactions. You'll make processes more efficient and scalable, work to ensure the highest level of quality of our operations, and proactively minimize operational risk. Externally, you collaborate with our extended workforce partners and internally, you will collaborate across the multiple areas of the Financial Operations team.
We help marketers define strategy and recommend investment allocations based on campaign measurement and data-driven insights, using tools and processes.
In this role, you will develop and drive an understanding of the financials for EMEA marketing’s spend. You will partner with regional and global Finance and Marketing. You will develop analyses and insights to help your business partners understand the value of marketing initiatives, provide recommendations on financial spending, and improve day-to-day financial processes.
The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
Responsibilities
Ensure sound financial goals and tracking for marketing campaigns and report on performance.
Define and set goals.
Contribute to developing, implementing, and executing methodologies to measure Google’s brand.
Analyze the impact of marketing investments to understand campaign performance across markets.
Contribute to resource allocation decisions through careful analysis of historical activity/spend effectiveness.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

3f312191b511ec89.title: Decision Science Modelling Analyst
3f312191b511ec89.description:
Grade
C
End Date
Monday 28 February 2022
Salary Range
£27,540 - £30,600
Agile Working Options
Other Agile Working Arrangements / Open to Discussion
Job Description Summary
To deliver industry leading Credit Risk models using statistical techniques (e.g. operational scorecards, Basel Expected Loss models, Fraud detection models and forecasting models) and develop other analytical solutions to support decision making in LBG.
Job Description
ABOUT DECISION SCIENCE
Sitting within our Risk function, Decision Science (DS) is a centre of excellence for analytics, modelling and customer insights.
The team are responsible for supporting the wider Risk division by:
Carrying out advanced data analytics and modelling to support retail and commercial customer needs, and credit decisions across the credit lifecycle
Supporting the bank’s prudential requirements such as capital and impairment allocation, and capital optimisation
We work with data that underpins vital business decisions, and together we make it possible to add customer value, control risk, and help to build a safe, strong bank for our customers.
THE ROLE
This is an excellent chance to initiate your career working within the Decision Science team at Lloyds Banking Group (LBG).

Working as part of a team, you’ll support every aspect of the end-to-end model development process and help to ensure the timely delivery of high quality models. Using tools such as SAS and Excel to manipulate and interrogate complex data, you’ll use your commercial acumen to interpret results and produce actionable recommendations to colleagues, management and business partners across a range of teams.
You'd be tasked with developing and monitoring industry leading Credit Risk models, such as customer decisioning scorecards, fraud models, and capital and impairment expected loss models, using statistical techniques. You'd also be providing insight into customer behaviour, credit performance and profitability and developing other analytical solutions to support decision-making in LBG. We’ll expect you to actively identify and pursue opportunities to enhance model performance and accuracy – for example, by improving decision tools and processes.
THE PERSON
We're looking for a highly organised and motivated individual who is passionate about data insights and storytelling.
You possess a good degree, or equivalent, in a very numerate subject, for example maths, statistics, operational research, physics or economics.
You'll be able to work at a fast pace and have an eye for detail and accuracy. You'll have a highly analytical approach to problem solving and it would be desirable for you to have knowledge of advanced statistical, modelling and analytical techniques.
Experience of statistical packages or programming languages (e.g. MATLAB, EViews, SAS, SPSS, R, C++), as well as good Excel skills, would be advantageous.
Ideally you'll be a self-starter and have the ability to work well within a team environment, without the need for close supervision. You’ll be a positive contributor to the team and take an active role in progressing your development. You'll demonstrate good time management and planning/organisation skills in your day to day activities.
You'll be able to communicate conclusions and suggestions clearly, using superb written and verbal interpersonal skills, and have a high level of creativity, drive, innovation and initiative.
At Lloyds Banking Group, we're driven by a clear purpose; to help Britain recover. Across the Group, our colleagues are focused on making a difference to customers, businesses and communities. With us you'll have a key role to play in shaping the financial services of the future, whilst the scale and reach of our Group means you'll have many opportunities to learn, grow and develop.
We're focused on creating a values-led culture and are committed to building a workforce which reflects the diversity of the customers and communities we serve. Together we’re building a truly inclusive workplace where all of our colleagues have the opportunity to make a real difference.

03a98928f2131021.title: Data Analyst
03a98928f2131021.description:
Who we are...

Tutela is a leading provider of telecom data and insights. Trusted by telecom brands around the world, Tutela helps clients understand and improve network speeds and network coverage, and build better networks in the areas that need it most.


How you will make an impact…

Tutela is seeking a quantitative, critical thinker with an insatiable curiosity to join the Network Solutions team as a Data Analyst. The Network Solutions team is a critical component of Tutela. The team helps our customers understand and use our data, support them in discovering new actionable insights enabling a data-driven strategy, and explore opportunities to improve and create new products.
The Data Analyst will support the Network Solutions team by producing insights for specific customers, refining and reproducing new analysis insights developed by the team, contributing to new product development, and working with customer success and sales teams by presenting and explaining insights and associated analysis


What you will do...

Analyze and interpret data using statistical models
Develop insights using both quantitative and qualitative analysis
Identify correlations and trends in data, in addition to internal and external factors that could affect the results of our information
Visualise insights to a high standard of presentation
Contribute to the development of new insights through investigative analysis
Collaborate with colleagues on ad hoc projects within the Network Services team


Desired Skills & Abilities

Experience of storytelling with data
Knowledge of Tableau, Python, Slack
Communications Industry knowledge, in particular mobile
Presentation skills


 Experience

1– 3 years of work experience (or comparable educational experience) in quantitative analysis
Proficient in Excel, SQL and Powerpoint
Experience with statistical modelling
Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills
Creative and independent thinker with a desire to learn new technical skills
Success at working on cross-functional teams to meet a common goal
Self-starter with a high sense of urgency
Ability to prioritize in a multitask environment
Strong attention to detail

We would like to thank all applicants for your interest; however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Follow us:

LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/tutela-technologies/
For other career opportunities with Tutela Technologies, visit: https://www.tutela.com/careers
AFFIRMATIVE ACTION/EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Tutela Technologies strongly supports and values the uniqueness of all individuals and promotes a work environment where diversity is embraced. Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer.
