77270c8ff49a20a4.title: Marketing Data Analyst
77270c8ff49a20a4.description: Onto is the all-inclusive electric car subscription changing the rules of the game for car ownership.We’re on a mission to create a faster, smarter and more innovative way of accessing an electric car. We offer an all-inclusive subscription solution, with no deposit and only a monthly rolling commitment. Hassle-free, emissions-free, and affordable driving.We are a high-growth tech scale-up, having launched 4 years ago with significant funding from top-tier VCs, most recently raising £125 million of investment in July 2021 through a Series B funding round. Over the last 12 months we have averaged 30% month-on-month growth and we have the largest electric fleet in the UK, with over 3,500 active subscribers in August 2021. Our team has grown dramatically, with offices in London, Leamington and Birmingham with overseas expansion planned for 2022.Our challenge now is to take Onto to a new level without losing what makes us special for our customers. We need to be able to deliver reliably on a large scale to mass-market customers, while still maintaining our speed, creativity and a mindset of growth and accountability. It’s a challenging combination, but one we're embracing in the next stage of our journey. And that's where you come in.About the roleWe're looking for a candidate with an exceptional drive and entrepreneurial spirit to join our small but rapidly growing Marketing Analytics team. Reporting directly to the Senior Data Analyst, this is a newly created position and will play a key role in developing frameworks, media modelling, reporting maps and setting up automated reports to enable the Marketing Team and broader business to monitor KPIs and support Onto's data-driven approach.In particular, you will:Be responsible for building the core reports and dashboards to monitor the marketing function.Be regularly reporting findings and ongoing KPIs to the management team to facilitate better and quicker decision making.What you'll be doingWork closely with senior business and marketing leadership to create value and impact through better data availability, visualisation and analysis.Discover, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets to perform ad-hoc analyses and deliver insights to the executive team and senior management.Understand key marketing and growth drivers of the business and provide data-driven guidance on key levers.Work alongside the Senior Data Analyst on key marketing projects such as attribution, customer segmentation and churn analysis to provide visibility into campaign performance and assist in campaign optimisation.Identify and specify Marketing Team data needs and quality requirements and work closely with Data Scientists and Engineers to ensure data is available, accurate and corresponds to the business needs.RequirementsA bit about youYou have a "no job is too small" attitude, and you are passionate about working with and learning from industry-leading expertsA creative thinker, you have a hunger for novelty and newness with a keen interest in exploiting new technologies as they emerge.A compelling storyteller and an eye for powerful visualisations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)Passionate about learning, and this curiosity will lead you to a deep understanding of and empathy for the business & customer and your stakeholders' objectives and needs.Ability to prioritise and assist business requests with a service mindset.Flexible and well organised, with the ability to manage multiple projects at the same time.Experience working in an analytical role; manipulating data to deliver insight and actionable recommendations.Problem-solving solid abilities involve identifying the root cause of problems, assessing risks/impacts and determining and implementing practical solutions.A good understanding of querying in SQL and knowledge of database structure - you'll be expected to extract the data you need for your analysis.Proficiency in Data Visualisation and Dashboards using tools such as Tableau, Power BI and Looker.A strong understanding of digital channels and marketing funnels, especially when it comes to cohort analysis, churn and lifetime value.Good knowledge of Excel/GSheets - depending on the task, there is a good chance that this is where some of your exploratory analysis will take place. Being comfortable with pivot tables and functions will be essential.Nice to have:Experience working at a subscription-based company.Experience using tools such as Google Big Query, Segment or Google Analytics.Understanding of another coding language (Python/R)Understanding of digital channels and marketing funnels, especially when it comes to cohort analysis, churn and lifetime valueBenefitsAs well as a competitive salary we provide a number of other benefits including:*Onto discounted car (via salary sacrifice) - become a customer and join the EV revolutionStaff options scheme - everybody qualifies for this, we are building something incredible and want all our staff to feel valued and part of the future success.Pension contribution25 days holiday (excluding bank holidays)£200 annual learning budgetSummer and Christmas PartyTeam social budget of £15 per person per monthQuarterly off-sites and team building (digitally at times)Small milestone gifts (Birthdays, Life Milestones, Work Milestones)Reward and Recognition monthly and every quarter for employeesDiscounts on retail, travel and cinema tickets through perks at workShuttle bus & car available for staff from Kings Cross & the officeJob Type: Full-time

a8d6dbfbe7f73151.title: Analyst, Investment Analytics and Data
a8d6dbfbe7f73151.description:
The Research Department at Dimensional is integral both in the successful day-to-day functioning of the firm and in developing Dimensional’s long-term strategy. The team produces high-quality, thought-leadership research on investments and financial markets that is of interest to clients. The team also leads the development of the firm’s investment approach, the application of that approach through portfolio management and trading, and the implementation of technology solutions that make the investment process more efficient.
Investment Analytics and Data (IAD) is part of the Research Department within Dimensional. Data and data analysis are at the underpinnings of how Dimensional constructs and manages portfolios and works to provide the best investment experience possible for our clients. IAD is responsible for ownership of investment data, which means managing data from acquisition through distribution, driving analysis to create information from data, and creating the information and analysis consumed by internal and external reports. IAD is a hub group touching numerous areas of the implementation of the investment process and interacting with most other departments within Dimensional.
The London IAD team seeks an analyst capable of supporting key initiatives underpinning our daily implementation process. The work is team based and includes responsibility for analysing the quality of investment data within Dimensional, including fund characteristics and index data, security reference data, and all other data crucial to the investment process and to downstream reports. The analyst will also be working on the daily operations of Dimensional’s investment systems and producing ad-hoc investment performance reports for portfolio managers, traders, client services, and executives. Success in this role will mean delivering clean, accurate data to internal as well as external clients in a timely manner, being creative at finding different ways to analyse and present relevant investment data, and enhancing operational efficiencies at Dimensional to deliver value-added investment solutions to our clients.
Responsibilities:
Support Dimensional's operational processes around investments and ensure that tools and systems built follow appropriate business logic.
Compile and manage large data sets from multiple sources in support of investment team systems.
Create and distribute regular investment reports on fund assets, returns, characteristics, and attribution .
Execute regular validations to ensure inputs to research, portfolio management, and client reporting are appropriate and accurate .
Interface with investment teams to answer internal and client questions in respect to our investments and strategies.
Work with clients to gather and define requirements for core business systems, in partnership with teams across the organization.
Design, build, and test systems from start to finish and take ownership over the final product, in partnership with Technology teams.
Assist in data architecture for distribution of investment data to internal clients and help define and build data structures for exposure of data to end consumers.
Contribute to ongoing efficiency efforts through automation, process design, and implementation.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Finance/Accounting, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Master’s degree preferred.
Relevant experience working with large datasets, performing quantitative analysis, and using SQL, T-SQL, or similar data management tools.
Experience in Python is strongly desired.
Self-starter capable of managing multiple projects and meeting deadlines.
Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills.
Ability to work with details and ensure accuracy while maintaining a big picture focus.
Ability to clearly communicate ideas and solutions to technical and non-technical teams.
Intellectual curiosity combined with attention to detail.
Dimensional offers a variety of programs to help take care of you, your family, and your career, including comprehensive benefits, educational initiatives, and special celebrations of our history, culture, and growth.
It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. The Company does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, ancestry, medical condition, marital status, covered veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, or any other protected status. This policy applies to all areas of employment including recruitment, hiring, training, job assignment, promotion, compensation, benefits, transfer, discipline, termination, and social and recreational programs.

48d88580ceec9807.title: 2022 UK L6 Data Analyst Degree Apprenticeship - London Paddington
48d88580ceec9807.description:
Job Description
Vodafone is creating the future – here and now. An Apprenticeship with us is your chance to make an impact in your career and the world. Hands on-experience. Learn from experts. Earn a salary and a degree. All at once. Next up, an Apprenticeship with Vodafone that can give you all of this, and more.
Start date: September 2022
Duration of Programme: 3 years
Starting salary: £21,500; with a yearly salary increase & bonus.
Location: This role will be based in London (Paddington or Southwark). You can only make one application, so please ensure this is your location of choice for the role.
Application close date: 28th February 2022, however, we may close earlier if we have enough game-changing applications, so apply early!
About the Apprenticeship
Whether it is utilising the location-centric data of over 500 million global consumers to develop useful and profitable insights; supporting teams on making commercially sound decisions for our customers and us; building chatbots for our business or helping run our Big Data Delivery Platform, you will help us shape the way we work, the way our world moves forward, and how people use tech for the greater good.
Data and Analytics is no longer restricted to the depths of company’s basements. These techniques and technologies are now the backbone of the modern technology company and are essential for any business wishing to remain relevant, gain an edge, and be successful as the world goes digital. Be part of the Data Revolution with a business that combines the agility and spirit of a start-up with all the resources and opportunities of a global corporate.
With a combination of digital and classroom-based learning, you’ll take modules including Data Modelling & SQL Language, Big Data & Analytics, Data Communications & Network Security, AI & Machine Learning and Business Strategy. You’ll gain hands-on experience working alongside industry leaders who’ll share their knowledge with you. And you’ll develop into a Data Analytics expert who can use a range of analytical techniques, present data visualisation, create reports and make recommendations that influence business-transforming decisions.
At the end of 3 years, you’ll have a BSc (Hons) Degree in Digital & Technology Solutions, specialising in Data Analysing.
What you will need
To be 18 years old or over as of 1 September 2022GCSE English & Maths at grade C or above (or equivalent qualifications)3 A-Levels including ICT or Maths, gained by September 2022 (or equivalent qualifications in a similar subjects)
A Level 3 Apprenticeship
An International Baccalaureate at Level 3
A BTEC Extended Diploma (180 credits)To be eligible to work in the UK and not in full-time educationTo have lived in the UK and/or EU for three years or moreTo be willing to or be located in England for the duration of the Apprenticeship
You must not hold an existing qualification at the same or higher level in a similar subject (e.g. a degree or masters in a similar subject).
We're committed to recruiting the best people, whatever their background. If you have a disability, learning difficulty, medical condition or any other individual need, we'd be happy to talk to you about making reasonable adjustments to our application and selection process that will enable you to be your best.
All you have to do, is start.
Apprenticeships aren’t what they used to be. You could have entry level qualifications, or you might be interested in Advanced, Higher or Degree level Apprenticeships. Whatever your plans, an Apprenticeship at Vodafone is your ideal next step.
You’ll be trusted with exciting projects from day one, where you can learn, and make a genuine difference, all while being in an environment that empowers you and your development.
You’ll find it all, exclusive to Vodafone Apprenticeships.
Apply now!
If you have any questions, please let us know at the following address: youth.recruitment@vodafone.com.

245ea9386aacd878.title: Business Analyst
245ea9386aacd878.description:
Simbec-Orion is a responsive and agile full-service CRO, with wide therapeutic experience and specialist expertise in clinical pharmacology, oncology and rare diseases. Perfectly structured, we provide full-service clinical development solutions for small and mid-size drug developers headed up by a centralised leadership team.
With a focus on tailormade and scalable solutions, well adapt our delivery style, communications and operations to suit the demands of the project, helping clients achieve their clinical and commercial objectives. Because our goal is the same as theirs; to improve patients lives.
Summary of the Position:
We are looking for a Business Analyst to join our Business Systems Group department. You will be based remotely in the UK.
The Business Analyst is a key position within Simbec-Orion and you will operate with a pre-defined business area of Simbec-Orion to work with our business and clinical users to drive Business Transformation through:
Understanding the key business deliverables and what dependencies exist with other departments and defined the key inputs and outputs.
Identifying opportunities for process improvement and understanding and prioritising which processes will drive/improve productivity
Identifying and documenting improvement requirements and managing the pre-project process
Selecting and Implementing solutions (solutions comprising technology, data, processes and people) and being involved in the Change Management associated with business
Working alongside an experienced Business Analyst you will report to the Clinical Systems Specialist who is experienced in Business Analysis, Project Management and Project Governance.
Key Accountabilities:
Development of To-Be Process maps
Development of project plans to deliver improvements to Business and Clinical teams (i.e. Business Transformation)
Analysis of Business/Clinical requirements, via Workshop Requirement Gatherings, resulting in Requirements Specifications Catalogue and Project Documentation
Managing the Procurement process if a new system is required
Ensuring Solutions (comprising technology, processes, people and data) work to deliver data security, accuracy, completeness, validity, timeliness and reliability
Being involved in the Change Management associated with a Project, including Training, Role Definitions, Communications etc.
Ability to work with and co-ordinate with multiple vendors.
Create and execute Installation Qualification (IQ), Operation Qualification (OQ), Performance qualification (PQ) documents for GxP applications.
Collaborate with quality team to develop project validation documentation and test plans.
Ability to execute protocols, perform testing sequences and change controls.
Administer enterprise applications and maintain (patch), repair and manage new and existing systems in a regulated environment.
Attend or provide support to external Sponsor/Regulatory Audits and manage any Audit responses
Provide day to day and scheduled application support; respond to application support issues from multiple business customers.
Ability to provide communications, both written and verbal, to the wider teams.
Minimum Requirements:
Essential:
Bachelors degree in a subject that demonstrates logical and analytical thinking
Previous experience working as a business analyst
Previous experience of Computer System Validation
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Able to create documentation for a variety of audiences
Desirable:
Previous experience of managing a project from inception to operation
Previous experience of working within a Business Analyst Role within a Clinical Research Organisation or Pharmaceutical Company
Simbec-Orion Job Profile - Business Analyst .docx
Simbec-Orion is an equal opportunity employer. Simbec-Orion will consider all qualified applicants for employment without discrimination on grounds of disability, sex or sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity leave status, race or national or ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, gender identity or re-assignment, marital or civil partnership status, protected veteran status (if applicable) or any other characteristic protected by law.

At Barclays, we are working together to build a better bank, a more efficient bank that is safe, intuitive and that will support people and businesses responsibly and sustainably. b815a731a4d368d7.title: Data Analyst
b815a731a4d368d7.description:
Do you want to work on the most pressing problem of our generation?

We're building the infrastructure for the net zero transition, and we're looking for brilliant engineers, designers, and data scientists who want to help define a low carbon future.

Decarbonizing the economy requires a granular, real-time view of where emissions come from and how they might be reduced. We build software to automate the carbon footprinting of supply chains. Banks, traders, and manufacturers use our product to tame the complexity of international supply networks, identify the most carbon-intensive parts, and find greener alternatives. We were part of the Y Combinator Summer 2020 batch and have secured backing from the UK government's innovation arm, InnovateUK, the NatWest accelerator and the London Business School Incubator.
To join Carbon Chain, you'll be a keen technologist who loves to learn from others. Our company is made up of 10 passionate people with expertise ranging from oil refining to deep learning. Between us we've run Amazon's European supply chain, built JustEat's corporate meal delivery platform, and monitored industrial emissions with satellites for Al Gore. We've got MBAs and PhDs but we know that there's a lot we don't know, and we're hoping you can help fill that gap.

What will you be responsible for at CarbonChain?

As the world wakes up to the reality of climate change and the need to decarbonize, there's a pressing need to understand the carbon intensity of every activity in the economy. Your job as Data Analyst is to help build the datasets and dashboards that help our clients make sense of their emissions.

We're a small team of versatile technologists and we don't believe in a siloed approach. Our data team sits side by side with software engineers, making sure that we have the data we need to provide the experience our customers want. You'll collaborate closely with data scientists to make sure your insights can be deployed to clients at scale. You'll work hand in hand with our domain experts, and have the chance to present to clients if that's something that excites you.

You can expect to have:

Ownership of your projects
Support in deepening your technical skills, including coding
The ability to make real changes with tangible business value

In a typical day, you might:

Do some research to understand the major sources of emissions in the production of batteries
Help a data scientist clean up a data set of soy emissions to load into our database
Answer a client's question about which suppliers they should avoid to reduce their emissions from buying steel

Our only must-haves are possessing a hunger to solve business challenges using technology, the ability to build close relationships with your team, and the right to work in the UK.

Which tools, technologies, and processes will you work with?

We don't expect our analysts to write code, but it's great if they want to learn!

We require:

Very strong analytical skills
Excellent data analysis and visualisation with at least one tool of your choice
Ability to engage stakeholders throughout the business
Experience or appetite in building dashboards for clients, using tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, Looker etc.
A passion to learn about complex real world problems, such as how to smelt iron without using coal, and ways to reduce emissions from bulk carrier ships

Our team would be a great place for somebody who is strong in Excel and taking their first steps with Python. Much of the work you do will subsequently be incorporated into the product by our data scientists and engineers.

What we require from applicants
Right to work in the UK and willingness to come to London office 2+ days a week
1+ years of commercial Data Analysis experience
A passion for environmental issues
An obsession with getting the numbers right
The grit and energy to work in an early stage startup
What we're offering
Competitive salary + generous equity package
Flexible working hours - we encourage regular breaks and being AFK (away from keyboard) to support your wellbeing
Flexible working location (we like to meet in the office couple of times every week)
£500 work from home set up budget
£1000 annual development allowance for you to spend on developing your current skills and learning new things
Tech equipment of your choice
Team lunch on Wednesdays, and frequent pub trips
Pact coffee and snacks of your choice in the office
26 days holiday + bank holidays

We're striving to build a diverse team and we would love to hear from applicants from backgrounds less frequently represented in technology, be that in terms of gender, race, or professional background.
If you think your skills and experience match what we're looking for and you'd like to join a Carbon Tech industry unicorn, please get in touch!

30126d9b85b8cca0.title: VAC2711 - Insight Analyst
30126d9b85b8cca0.description:
VAC2711 - Insight Analyst
Reference Number: VAC2711

Please note, the deadline for submitting applications for this vacancy is 23:55pm on the closing date.

About Alzheimer's Society

Dementia devastates lives. By 2021, 1 million people will be living with the condition. But dementia won't win. Until the day we find a cure, Alzheimer's Society will be here for anyone affected by dementia - wherever they are, whatever they're going through. Everything we do is informed and inspired by them.

We are the UK's leading dementia charity. Every day, we work tirelessly to find new treatments and, ultimately, a cure for dementia. We provide expert information, training, and support services to all those who need our help. And we are creating a more dementia-friendly society so people with the condition can live without fear and prejudice.

About the role

A fantastic new opportunity within our Data team is now available and we're recruiting for a Insight Data Analyst to join us! As part of the Data department, this role will work on a wide variety of projects to help colleagues make sense of datasets and develop findings so they can make more effective decisions or communicate more impactful information.

Using statistical analysis, data visualisation and storytelling as tools towards creating understandable recommendations, this role will play a crucial role in giving our colleagues and campaigns insights required for success.

This role provides the organisation with capability to leverage and extract greater value from our data. Working across departments and projects as well as interacting with local teams and senior management this is an exciting role which offers a wide variety of experiences.

About you

We are looking for someone who can dive into the depth of broad datasets and emerge with jargon free findings for others who want to use the data but may not understand or need to know statistical methods. You can present findings in both written and oral form whilst engaging your audience by making your work relevant and accessible for them. You have all the analysis to hand if required but know that often, less is more when it comes to delivering focused messages that stick.

You have great technical skills in data analysis and have some experiences in languages such as SQL, R and Python. You can direct your own work but know how to keep business colleagues and technical colleagues engaged as part of a broader project team.

Our employees work hard every day to make a true difference in people's lives. We are proud to support them with a range of benefits, recognition and many options for working agilely, all contributing to a strong work life balance. We also have various learning programmes to support you in your development and help you grow to realise your potential and shape a career with Alzheimer's Society.

d90266cf6beb8239.title: Senior Analyst
d90266cf6beb8239.description:
Are you passionate about improving the lives of people with cancer? Do you want to ensure more people survive cancer than ever before? Working in NHS England’s Cancer Programme, that’s exactly what you’ll do.

As a part of the NHS Cancer Programme, you will set the agenda for cancer services in England. Working with patients, clinicians, charities and across the public sector, our aim is to reduce preventable cancers, diagnose cancer earlier, increase survival and improve the quality of life and experience for cancer patients. We develop national policy and strategy, and work with our Cancer Alliances across the country to transform services for patients.

This is an exciting time for the Cancer Programme. We are well underway in the delivery of the NHS Long Term Plan, making service improvements for patients. You will be instrumental in delivering on our ambition to diagnose three in four cancers at an early stage so that even more people survive cancer in the future.

The Cancer Programme Team takes its responsibility to promote equality and diversity seriously. We respect colleagues from diverse backgrounds and embrace diverse cultural preferences in everything we do

We are looking for an enthusiastic and experienced Senior Analyst in the Cancer Alliance Data, Evaluation and Analysis Service (CADEAS). The post will work as part of the NHS Cancer Programme, within the Chief Operating Officer Directorate.

The CADEAS team, established during 2017/18, supports Cancer Alliances’ analytical needs enabling them to lead transformation using a whole pathway and cross-organisational approach. Funded by the NHS Cancer Programme, CADEAS is a partnership between NHS England and NHS Improvement and NHS Digital. The partnership enables the work programme to be strategically focused in line with the priorities of the Cancer Programme and aligned with approaches and methodology of the National Cancer Registration and Analysis Service (NCRAS) in NHS Digital. It also allows access to a broad range of cancer data and analytical expertise.

The post offers excellent opportunities to support a team of Lead Analysts and Senior Analysts (Bands 8b/8a) in the provision of timely data, analysis, and evidence to Cancer Alliances across the country. The post holder will use strategic data analysis and evidence to drive transformation. Partnership working will be crucial to the role working closely with Cancer Alliances and the Cancer Programme team as well as different analysts across the system to ensure alignment of work and priorities. The roles are designed to build a combination of subject matter expertise and technical skills to develop a strong service delivery.

Shortlisting will be completed within a fortnight of the advert closing, with interviews taking place during the following fortnight (i.e., within 4 weeks of the advert close date).

For further details contact:
Rosemary Main (rosemary.main1@nhs.net)

1ebd12ac8d6adfca.title: Analyst I - Student Placement - Manchester
1ebd12ac8d6adfca.description:
Job title: Analyst I Student Placement
Reporting to: Audit Lead

Duration: 1 year - Start date July/August 2022

Degree Background: Business/Finance/Economics/Mathematics/Languages/any other analytical biased degree

Work location: Manchester

Company Overview: We are one of the world’s most exciting Professional Services Companies specialising in Profit Discovery Auditing, Data Analytics and Consulting.

o Our clients include 75% of the Top 30 Global Retailers

o We make our clients US$1.6BN each year

Main purpose of job: Clarify and conclude whether all financial commitments and agreements made by suppliers to the Client have been actioned correctly and rectifying any errors that may arise. This involves financial analysis, research, investigation, collaborative working supporting our internal colleagues and external clients, understanding the needs and then presentation and negotiation.

Key tasks: Review client contracts, archived data, emails and other documentation for evidence of errors and omissions in the financial commitments and agreements made by suppliers to the Client. Pursuit of such claims to the satisfaction of the client; liaising with key stakeholders up to CFO level.

Skills required: On course for achieving a 2.1 or above in their respective degree. High numerical ability.

Microsoft Office experience, particularly Excel is advantageous.
Personal attributes: An ability to question and present information effectively.

High level of attention to detail with a clear questioning, methodical mind.

Integrity, support, honesty and trust is key

High motivation.

Excellent interpersonal skills, both spoken and written

External contacts: Global Manufacturers, Client Trading and Finance Teams, Accounting and Data Services Colleagues.

Internal contacts: Other audit staff on site

Regional and Head Office staff of PRGX up to Managing Director

Remuneration: Competitive Placement Fixed Salary Income

Flexible working hours plus 25 days + bank holidays per year.

Interview Date: MS Teams Video Interviews to take place February/March/April 2022

Start date: July / August 2022

How to Apply

Send a brief Covering Letter and CV to studentplacement@prgx.com and quote reference PRGX (insert the university you are studying at) Student Placement 2022 in the subject title.


Student Placement Programme - Our Commitment to You


PRGX have been hiring students on a one-year placement scheme for over 15 years. Student hires are an integral part of our continued success as one of the UK’s top Recovery Audit companies. We now take on over 30-40 students per year across the UK. You will sometimes hear of student placements schemes involving non-business-related tasks - at PRGX this is not the case.


Preparing you for the “Real World”
At PRGX you’ll get the exposure to both the soft skills and behavioral traits essential for progressing your career that you may not at other organisations. You’ll conduct work for clients across many industries where you will develop your skills around communication, teamwork, client interaction including composing business emails, telephone manner, time management, organisation, work ethic and professionalism. This will be a great grounding for your career


We often look to fill roles from our former student placement hires, in fact, our current Managing Director was a student placement at PRGX 20 years ago

We’re always expanding and looking for top talent and should you enjoy working at PRGX, there will likely be an opportunity to return and build a career with us once you have completed your degree. Many of our staff are ex-student placements who have progressed into Managerial, Director and Vice President roles. Being a global organisation we sometimes even offer opportunities around the world.


Essential hard skills (and soft skills) that you’ll gain exposure to

When applying for jobs today it is very likely you will require experience of Microsoft packages. At PRGX this is one suite of tools we offer training on while in the programme. If you wish to gain exposure to something outside of your job then we’ll try and accommodate this for you, whether it’s to improve your PowerPoint skills and deliver presentations, incorporate a more sales or data focus to your role or gain exposure to a certain technology such as SQL, we’ll try and make this happen.


Our PRGX culture

As well as working hard at PRGX we also like to have fun. Our Social Committee ensures that regular events are organised such as Summer and Christmas gatherings, bowling, golf days and Tough Mudder participation to name a few. Due to the amount of students at PRGX there is always a social buzz outside of the workplace and lifetime friendships are made.


Our student placement programme is a great grounding for your career offering endless opportunities both during your placement year and beyond.

For more information, contact:

Sandra Williams-Carraro

HR Resourcing Specialist | PRGX UK, Ltd

studentplacement@prgx.com


Testimonials


Shreyas – Bath University

The PRGX placement experience throws you in the deep end straight away, allowing you to make real sizeable contributions to the business. Our teams have a good mix of youth and experience and placement students are given the freedom and support to contribute to important business decisions. After completing my placement year in 2018, I returned to PRGX as a graduate and was managing a team of 10 within a year of me joining!

Sanjay – Loughborough University

My time at PRGX has helped aid my growth in terms of developing soft skills through working with a team where there has been great emphasis on having a friendly and collaborative workspace. This has made the transition from being a student to working in a professional environment a seamless one.

Bilal – University of Hertfordshire

I was part of PRGX’s placement programme in 2016-17. It was an invaluable experience as I was involved in a variety of projects and given many opportunities to showcase my abilities. From learning the core foundations of Recovery Audit, to being involved in the beta testing of new tools for the business; my placement year allowed me to gain a whole portfolio of skills which not only helped kick start my career but also proved instrumental in my final year of university. I was offered a role after graduating and I returned to PRGX as an Analyst within one of our core audit teams. Here at PRGX there is a very clear and structured career path which allowed me to set my professional goals and put a career plan in place. At present I am a Senior Analyst working within a great team and the work we do makes a real difference to the business.

Arani – University of Kent

I have had a great experience working at this company. The atmosphere in the office is relaxed and comfortable, and I have consistently felt supported by my team.

The skills I have learnt will be very helpful in progressing my career and I’m glad to have taken on this opportunity to learn something new.

Caitlin – Nottingham Trent University

This placement has been a great opportunity for me to improve my interpersonal skills and gain valuable experience in working as a financial analyst. The office environment is professional but also friendly and welcoming. There is also a good support system in place at PRGX which helps you to grow and become part of the team.

De’Shontay – University of Westminster

Completing my placement year at PRGX has been an amazing experience. At PRGX, you receive so much guidance from your superiors while still being able to work independently as a real part of the team even as a student, which allows you to receive a genuine experience of the work world. The work culture at PRGX is nothing shy of welcoming. PRGX ensures its staff are happy, safe and loaded with work benefits! I’ve learned so much working here and I would recommend this placement to anyone.

Anh Tu – Nottingham Trent University

It was so lucky when I had a chance working as a placement student at PRGX. If you’re looking for great mentors, lovely and supportive colleagues, and dynamic work environment, PRGX is the exact right place for you. It’s been a fantastic and memorable experience for me so far, and I’m sure it would be the same for you.

Gareth – University of Brighton

PRGX has been the best experience of my working life, from day one being valued as a team member from a working and social point of view. PRGX and its people have been supportive and offer a fantastic culture with plenty of opportunities. Could not have asked for more from a placement and I hope to return in the future.

7d7fd1703b1c3167.title: Insight Analyst
7d7fd1703b1c3167.description:
When a child is diagnosed with cancer life becomes full of fear, for them and their family. Fear of treatment, but also of families being torn apart, overwhelming money worries, of having nowhere to turn, no one to talk to.

THE ROLE

As the Insight Analyst, you will be key to helping Young Lives vs Cancer understand its supporters and its impact. Working together with a team of insight and selections experts, you’ll partner with departments across Young Lives vs Cancer, being clear about how evidence and insight can answer key business questions, like how do we get our supporters to stay longer, do more and give more. Understanding the power of good information, you’ll work to understand what your colleagues need to know and work out ways of getting this to them. You will work on a variety of projects large and small, and will provide new questions for you to get to the bottom of.

Young Lives vs Cancer is open to and in support of flexible working. We are currently defining our approach to hybrid working. Your flexibility requirements and that of the role will be discussed at interview stage with you.

This role falls under the home-based category. This role is home based and can be based anywhere in the UK with occasional/ regular visits to Young Lives vs Cancer workplaces.

ABOUT YOU

You’ll have experience of asking the right questions and creating insight out of data. You’ll be able to sniff out nice to have (but unnecessary) insight from that which can really change how an organisation thinks. You’ll be a numbers person who can forecast accurately, build propensity models and structure quantitative analysis. You’ll be naturally curious and enthusiastic about getting to the core of complex problems. You’ll be a self-starter who is comfortable learning new techniques and tools, and you’ll thrive in finding new innovative ways to answer key business questions.

You will set yourself extremely high standards and be a master in taking your colleagues – both in your team and across the charity – with you. You’ll have a genuine love for data and insight which you will share with the wider organisation. Most important of all is a for your work and for our fight for young lives against cancer.

WHAT WE OFFER

In return for your commitment, we offer a great reward package, which includes generous annual leave entitlement, pension scheme and season ticket loan.

We are always looking for talented people from all backgrounds, to join us and help improve the lives of children and young people with cancer and their families. We particularly want to encourage people from under-represented groups to step forward and apply to work or volunteer with Young Lives vs Cancer.

Young Lives vs Cancer is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people and expects all staff to share this commitment.

3b39dfeba223a944.title: Lead Data Analyst
3b39dfeba223a944.description:
Introduction
The client has an office in London and Swindon but they are happy with people working remotely. There will be an element of travel to client sites. This could be weekly depending on the client.

Our client is ranked by the Financial Times in the UK’s Top 20 Leading Management Consultancies, and the highest ranked SME.

They transform their clients’ operational data into actionable, operational intelligence to achieve measurable and sustainable cost benefits.

Whether their clients are looking to make longer-term strategic cost decisions or drive operational efficiencies at pace, they work as part of their clients’ teams to deliver tangible, quantifiable results.

They combine consulting expertise and our proprietary digital platform to generate and embed client-specific insights that deliver operational cost savings.

The client is looking for someone with experience with visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau, and also experience SQL and Python. The successful candidate will need to be very strong technically and lead a team of Data Scientists and data projects.

Key responsibilities
As a management consultant you would nurture and grow existing client accounts, identifying and execution of sell-on opportunities
Gaining insight into sector and client businesses to enable demonstration of thought Leadership
Developing new data offerings
Overseeing the work of the data science team
Contributing towards internal training, developing programs and sharing knowledge across the business
Project Management: taking overall responsibility for delivery excellence and exceeding customer expectations
Working with the Leadership team on client assignments to develop a strategy and then refocus the organisation on making that strategy a reality
Articulating how our client can transform their business and providing an evidence-based recommendation on how the client’s business will need to adapt
Demonstrating our technical capability to clients
Supporting the sale with implementation of technology apps within current clients
Skills & experience
A minimum of 5 years’ experience as an Analyst gained in one or more of the company’s core sectors:
Aerospace and Defence
Automotive
Consumer products
Industrial manufacturing
Private equity
Technology, Media & Telecoms

2b378b064d2d7738.title: Business Analyst, Global Markets
2b378b064d2d7738.description:
Business Analyst - Global Markets
London
As a Barclays Business Analyst – Global Markets, you will be supporting the Global Markets Chief of Staff in running managerial and administrative processes for the Global Markets business. This is a newly created role in the Chief of Staff office and is a fantastic opportunity to learn about Global Markets and make an impact.

Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.

This opportunity is open to flexible working arrangements. Such as working from home, flexible or compressed hours, and part-time options. If you have a need for flexibility, please apply and discuss this with us during the hiring process.

What will you be doing?
• Assisting the Global Markets Chief of Staff, in preparing and organising management business reviews and other management forums, including Global Markets management meetings
Running standard management processes for the Global Markets Chief of Staff Office & proactively flag and execute on opportunities, for improvement and optimisationProducing data analysis and writing reports, including draft presentations for use by the Co-Heads of Global Markets, to assist in executive governing and management forumsDrafting briefing materials for the Co-Heads of Global Markets ahead of meetings, with Board members, senior management, direct reports, infrastructure partners, regulators and clientsProducing presentations and talking points to support the Co-Heads of Global Markets in regular colleague communications, including Town Halls and all-colleague callsAnalysing benchmarking intelligence, to assess relative performance, versus peers and opportunities for growthOwning, maintaining and continuously improving action trackers and business performance scorecardsTaking minutes in governance forum and liaising with stakeholders across the firm to track action points through to completion

What we’re looking for:
• Educated to Degree level (or equivalent), preferably in a numeric or business related discipline
Work experience is required, gained within Financial Services, coupled with a working knowledge of MarketsHighly adept user of Power Point and MS Excel, including macro level, ideally VBAExcellent oral and written communication skills, including creative writing and presentation skills
Skills that will help you in the role:
• Work experience gained within a management or strategy consulting firm, would be highly desirable.
Excellent work ethic, entrepreneurial attitude. Able to effectively under pressure, handle multiple priorities, demands and time-sensitive situationsAbility to extract information, set expectations to complete tasksAble to develop successful working relationships with Sales and Trading and Infrastructure partners across the firm
Where will you be working?
In the heart of Canary Wharf, our headquarters at Churchill Place boasts onsite amenities such as; a gym, staff restaurant and deli bar, and is easily accessible by tube and bus links. With a population of around 5000 staff the atmosphere is second to none with a real buzz being created around the offices within.

488882bbd1ab16df.title: Data Privacy Analyst
488882bbd1ab16df.description:
Data Privacy Analyst

Tech Our Way

The Data Privacy Analyst will work within the Cybersecurity function with a focus towards strengthening privacy controls within systems/applications deployed by the organization.
The Data Privacy Analyst will liaise with business and project stakeholders to elicit, analyse, communicate and validate data privacy requirements as a result of changes to business processes and information systems. This position requires an ability to understand and translate data privacy standards into usable business requirements and thereby embed a culture of privacy by design into the organization

Key Responsibilities

Work across all Technology projects to ensure security and data privacy requirements are fully documented and understood. Ensure all new projects build in the appropriate security controls and measures to comply with the Technology GDPR / Security Stage Gates and standards
Collaborate with the Legal compliance team on Data Privacy Impact Assessments for high risk data processing activities
Ensure that all projects follow the PMO gate governance process and complete GDPR / Security impact assessments before going live
Work with project teams on an ongoing basis supporting them to build in data privacy requirements from the start
Be a proficient system analyst to analyse privacy gaps in projects / systems & applications and work with the project team to bring them to closure
Collaborate with business streams, Cyber Team members, Legal team and Operations personnel to advance our Data Privacy programme
Perform Data Protection assessments / gap analysis and assessing controls across the lifecycle of personal data
Develop creative ways of embedding Privacy requirements into key operational processes, in a way that allows business stakeholders to clearly understand their compliance duties.
Support Legal, Compliance, Information Security, and the DPO in performing due diligence and contracting with new third parties. This will involve assessing privacy and information security controls and standards, reviewing and recommending Privacy & Data Protection contractual requirements and coordinating across the business to communicate and remediate risks associated with new third party relationships.
Work with information gathered from multiple sources, be able to evaluate true security / data privacy impact, ensuring that proposed solution/s are reconciled with all security standards and controls.
Ensure that the Security and Data Privacy Non-Functional requirements are kept up to date in accordance with Primark’s Policies and Standards
Knowledge & Experience Required:
3+ years focused on Information Security / GDPR and a proven track record working on security / privacy projects
Working knowledge of Privacy & Security principles, techniques and technologies.
Privacy experience within a retail or regulated environment
An appropriate degree, equivalent qualification or experience
A recognised Privacy / security certification is desirable e.g. CIPPE, CIPM, CISM, CISA, CISSP or CRISC
Knowledge of security tooling is desirable – for example Varonis
Successful candidates will:
Be a passionate professional able to inspire others to challenge and disrupt the current reality to co-create a compelling technology/cyber security orientated future business by embracing new ways of working and successfully executing new opportunities
Possess excellent communication and influencing skills with the ability to operate within a pressurised and fast paced environment, delivering results and achieving objectives in line with the agreed parameters.
Why work with us?
At Primark, we know how hard everyone works to achieve our business goals. Having a competitive salary and annual bonus scheme is our way of acknowledging this. We'll also provide you with a progressive career path, because clear advancement is what we’re all about at Primark
Our flexible working benefit, Your Day Your Way, means you get to choose when to start and finish your workday. Choose to work remotely if you like, in a way that suits you but also helps us get the most out of your talents.
There’s a lively culture here, and it’s easy to get to know each other in a truly warm atmosphere.

b56249b9d633bc1f.title: Data Analyst - Telemetry
b56249b9d633bc1f.description:
Chief Technology Office - Data Analyst - Telemetry
The Chief Technology Office (CTO) team is currently seeking a Data Analyst to join the team delivering our firmwide Product focused on capturing and tracking continuous improvement measures and modernization roadmaps to drive global technology modernization. One of the key drivers of the CTO org is to effect change across the global technology organization to improve the way in which our 50,000 internal technologist deliver software to our business. With this comes exciting opportunities to partner with tech teams across the globe in all lines of business.
The CTO organisation drives Modern Engineering Practices across the firm and provides the pathway for technologists to improve their speed, stability, scalability, security and skills. We're focused on optimizing how apps are designed for the future, targeting solutions that are portable across multi-cloud platforms to stay resilient, scalable and maintainable.
The successful candidate will be a technical data analyst with related experience in software engineering and/or architecture projects within a large scale organization. The individual must be able to effectively partner and establish relationships across line of business, function and level in order to execute initiatives contributing to the Global Technology Modernization strategy.
Job Description

Work closely with various stakeholders and customer / users to understand their user journey / data needs and translate those into specifications for our data products.
Work with external stakeholders / customers / users to provide data insights / reports to meet specific use cases to enable our customers to understand their data.
Working with multiple teams focused on data analysis aspects of the delivery of the Product.
Identifying / specifying API contracts, data modelling, systems integration approaches
Partner closely with Information Architects and Software Engineers
Working closely with the Product Owner on Roadmap and backlog items.
Documenting where required requirements with user stories for the product suite, understanding dependencies and breaking down complex asks into user stories
Define acceptance criteria using Specification by Example and writing test specifications (e.g. Cucumber 'feature files')

Experience required:

Strong agile, organisational, data analysis skills and the ability to coordinate multiple parallel work streams across a number of teams
Strong analytical skills with a concentration on data flows, data mapping
Strong base of core SQL skills as data analysis is a key requirement.
Strong base of story writing and acceptance criteria documentation (e.g. Specification by example).
Strong understanding of the modern software development processes including Agile, DevOps, Continuous Integration / Continuous Development Practices
A strong knowledge and understanding of testing, including automated testing. Specification by Example highly desirable.
Ability to articulate complex issues concisely, communicating effectively and comfortably with senior stakeholders
Excellent reporting skills and presentation preparation skills for Senior Management
J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

5457ff9649001212.description: The role is within the Business Intelligence (BI) Team at the heart of a large NHS organisation covering 999, 111 and Patient Transfer Services to over 5 Million Households.This role is ideal for a recent graduate or someone with some experience of BI with the skills required for the role.This role is for a recent graduate or someone with some experience of BI with the skills required for the role. When applying for this role please ensure you demonstrate how you match the requirements of the role.As part of a busy BI team you will be responsible for running regular reports and performing some adhoc analysis with the support of BI Analyst.Your role will include the day to day submission of mandatory returns and the production of regular reports (for both internal and external requirements).You will also be supporting other members of the team in their work and the development of new processes to aid the streamlining of reports.Ideally you will have good communication skills to share information in a clear, understandable manner.Yorkshire Ambulance Service (YAS) NHS Trust geographically covers nearly 6,000 square miles of varied terrain, from isolated moors and dales to urban areas, coastline and inner cities.We serve a population of over five million people across Yorkshire and the Humber and strive to ensure that patients receive the right response to their care needs as quickly as possible, wherever they live.We employ more than 5,800 staff, who together with over 1,100 volunteers, enable us to provide a vital 24-hour, seven-days-a-week, emergency and healthcare service.Our values:  Compassion, One Team, Integrity, Innovation, Empowerment, Resilience are at the heart of all we do.Work closely with the Deputy Head of BI and as part of the wider BI team to ensure the delivery of day to day reportsSupport the delivery of routine and adhoc information analysisDevelop analysis skills through the use of the the trusts analytical tool, Microsoft PowerBIPlease see attached job description for full role responsibilities.Job Type: Full-time

d3c20ac8237374f9.title: Data Analyst
d3c20ac8237374f9.description:
Cyient is a global engineering and technology solutions company. As a Design, Build, and Maintain partner for leading organizations worldwide, we take solution ownership across the value chain to help clients focus on their core, innovate, and stay ahead of the curve. We leverage digital technologies, advanced analytics capabilities, and our domain knowledge and technical expertise, to solve complex business problems.
With over 15,000 employees globally, we partner with clients to operate as part of their extended team in ways that best suit their organization’s culture and requirements. Our industry focus includes aerospace and defence, healthcare, telecommunications, rail transportation, semiconductor, geospatial, industrial, and energy.
Job Description
Responsibilities:
Support the Local Land Charges (LLC) work programme by performing geospatial and non-geospatial data analysis across the various stages and lifecycle of the programme
Support the Discovery Team by identifying input datasets including quantifying data quality, coverage and assessing complexity through exploratory and process driven data analysis

Demonstrable experience performing data analysis on geospatial and non-geospatial data sets using a variety of tools and languages (e.g. ESRI, FME, SQL)
Experience of working with data systems and data processing pipelines and managing change
Experience of working with Local Land Charges and/or Local Authority planning related systems and data highly advantageous
Experience with data testing highly advantageous
Skills & Experience
Business Analysis, Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN), Data Analysis, Data Modeling, Data Modeling Software, Data Modeling Tools, Data Modelling, Entity Relationship Modelling, FME, Geographic Information Systems (GIS), GIS Analysis, GIS Modeling, Spatial Analysis, Spatial Databases, Spatial Data Management, Structured Query Language (SQL)
Cyient is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Cyient recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law. We are proud to be a diverse and inclusive company where our people can focus their whole self on solving problems that matter.

a5616dd9de3f16de.title: Payments Product Analyst
a5616dd9de3f16de.description:
Our people work differently depending on their jobs and needs. From home working to job sharing, visit the remote and flexible working page on our website to find out more.
This role is based in the United Kingdom and as such all normal working days must be carried out in the United Kingdom.
Join us as a Payments Product Analyst
Take on a new challenge and help us design, develop and launch new products
You'll be joining a team to manage, prioritise, and own Product Backlog items for Domestic Sterling Payments, using tools such as Jira, adoption of new Ways of Working and WSJF framework
In this role, you will have the opportunity to be a Product Owner for a key Domestic Payment Product.
We’ll look to you to support the team in developing new products to meet customer needs and respond to competitive threats
What you'll do
In this role, you’ll be working with our analytics teams to gain insight into customer needs, market landscape, competitor trends and market share. As a Payments Product Analyst, you’ll work with product managers to support the specification and implementation of approaches to discretionary and non-standard pricing.
In addition, you’ll also be:
Working with the analytics teams to monitor, forecast and report product financials, MI and performance
Supporting our Payment Scheme Management goals, coordinating activities across internal and external stakeholders, including mandatory change such as the New Payments Architecture.
Providing Payment Scheme Forecasting of volumes and values through the use of data and wider insight collected from various sources.
Providing input into ensuring regulatory compliance for the defined set of products
Assisting the analytics teams in executing deep dives, including understanding customer behaviour and income drivers
The skills you'll need
To thrive in this role, you’ll need experience in the banking industry in a commercial environment. You’ll have strong stakeholder management skills and be able to communicate complex tasks in a simple and clear manner.
You’ll also need:
Knowledge around Payments and how they interact across the various touchpoints in the E2E journey
Strong commercial and financial acumen
Highly numerate with analytical expertise
The ability to analyse and evaluate complex information to help effective decision making
If you need any adjustments to support your application, such as information in alternative formats or special requirements to access our buildings, or if you’re eligible under the Disability Confident Scheme please contact us and we’ll do everything we can to help.

4d56620bdbb97404.title: Intelligence Analyst
4d56620bdbb97404.description:
Job Information

Achieving for Children is a Community Interest Company that has a public sector ethos, combined with the freedom to innovate enabling us to do things differently. As a not-for-profit social enterprise owned by three local authorities (Windsor & Maidenhead, Kingston and Richmond), we offer the freedoms of a social enterprise with the employment benefits of local government.

We are responsible for the entire range of children’s education, health and social care services in all three boroughs. We use a Signs of Safety practice model and approach which ensures the voice of the child is at the heart of everything we do. There’s never been a better time to join AfC, we are growing our workforce, implementing new flexible working arrangements and have increased our virtual wellbeing offer.

We now have the following job opportunity available and we would be delighted to receive your application to continue our story. You can download the Job Profile which is shown within the "Documents" heading on the left hand side, above the map.

We are seeking an Intelligence Analyst to join our Intelligence and Improvement Team in supporting our Kingston and Richmond services. The post will be primarily based in our Twickenham office and will also be able to access home working/flexible working options.

The Intelligence Analyst will support the delivery of information and intelligence about service performance and effectiveness through the collection, validation, analysis, interpretation and dissemination of data and other qualitative information.
About the role

The Intelligence Analyst will work within the team to ensure that the business has the information it needs to meet organisational objectives and achieve continual improvement. The post holder will work with the Team Leader to develop systems and improve the timeliness, quality and use of data to achieve service improvement.

As a Intelligence Analyst you will:

Report and interpret complex data as required by the organisation and supporting the development of processes that facilitate data quality and timely reporting
Contribute to the completion and quality assurance of statutory returns by the required deadlines
Attend key meetings from time to time to present data and associated analysis
Responsibility for the production of data and analysis for a primary area of expertise as required
Work with front line services to help develop intelligence reports that are useful and impactful in identifying improvements for the children and their families they work with

If you are interested in this role and would like to request an informal discussion please contact Kate Sheppard on kate.sheppard@achievingforchildren.org.uk

About you

The successful candidate will have the following attributes:

Good working knowledge and understanding of children’s services data recording and requirements including statutory reporting and returns
Keen eye for detail and a good level of numeracy
Preferably an Analyst with previous experience of SEND, although this is not a requirement
Highly organised and have the ability to work as part of an effective and supportive team to meet performance reporting and data analysis requirements in a timely manner
Someone who is self-motivated with a drive to get involved and improve processes
About our benefits

We are focused on creating a positive supportive environment, where you will have access to a really wide range of resources, as well as a competitive salary and all the perks to enable hybrid working. In AfC you will also have access to:

Tailored induction sessions commencing on the date you start working for AfC
Stable and supportive leadership
Hybrid and mobile working with latest technology to facilitate this
Local Government salary and pension scheme (LGPS or Teachers Pension)
Holiday package upto 34 days per year with option to purchase additional leave
Flexible working options - helping to keep a good work life balance
A comprehensive Employee Assistance Programme
A range of staff benefits and discounts
A excellent learning and development offer to support your career pathway

To find out about all of the breadth of benefits of working for Achieving for Children

Important Information

Start dates: Achieving for Children have set start dates meaning successful candidates join on a set date in each month. Candidates are advised to prepare for this should a job offer be accepted to ensure eligible continuous service is not affected.

Right to work: The UK has introduced a new points-based immigration system affecting EU and Non-EU workers and sponsorship requirements. We advise checking the GOV.UK website for right to work guidance.

Equality: We particularly welcome applications from sections of the community who are currently underrepresented within our teams. Achieving for Children are committed to making our recruitment practices as inclusive as possible for everyone. We are committed to promoting equality and diversity and developing a culture that values differences, recognising that employees from a variety of backgrounds bring important and positive contributions and can improve the way we deliver services. We are proud to be a Disability Confident employer.

Safeguarding: We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults. We expect all staff and volunteers to share this commitment. This post is exempted under the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974 and as such appointment to this post will be conditional upon the receipt of a satisfactory response to a check of police records via Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS).

We reserve the right to close this vacancy once a sufficient number of applications has been received. Therefore, it is strongly advised that you complete and return your application as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.

536a79a6aab4c8ef.title: Financial Crime Data Analytics - Analyst
536a79a6aab4c8ef.description:
Job details
Location: London 15 Canada Square
Capability: Consulting
Experience Level: Junior Professional
Type: Full Time
Service Line: Inv & Compliance
Contract type: Permanent
Job description
The Team

The Financial Crime Technology team sits within KPMG's Risk Consulting Function, working within our Forensic practice.

The candidate will be required to work closely with our clients, typically large financial institutions, on the challenges with their financial crime compliance obligations. As such, the candidate will be expected to possess a variety of technical skills and knowledge of the market.

Our specialisation is data analytics in the financial crime space. The role will involve interactive scoping workshops with clients to identify engagement requirements, creating detailed project plans, analysing both structured and unstructured data, understanding relevant legislation in order to assess clients’ policies, procedures and organisational risk, and forming logical conclusions and solutions in order to provide sound advice. A full list of required technical and soft skills is provided under the ‘Qualifications, Skills and Experience’ section.

The Role
The role gives an opportunity to work with many areas of the business, from technical SMEs through to the consulting side in the wider Forensic practice. Furthermore, the role will offer the chance to develop the skills required for progression; the candidate will therefore be expected to present their work to both clients and the team internally.

The Person
Essential:
This exciting role will fully utilise your existing programming, data analysis and data management skills. Strong technical skills are essential as you will be required to develop solutions either individually or as part of an integrated multi-disciplinary team.

Experience with SQL: functions, stored procedures, pivoting, cursors, recursion, CTEs, triggers, dynamic SQL, query optimisation, transactions and XML.A working knowledge of database architecture, specifically designing and reviewing data storage structure, database normalization (1NF, 2NF, 3NF etc) and ensuring these structures are fit for purpose and scalable.Good understanding of using Python including its built-in functions and knowledge of data manipulation packages.Proven experience in automating manual tasks and ETL.Experience using any version control system (e.g. Git or CVS).Knowledge of full stack development in any programming/scripting language.Basic understanding of working with or building an API (REST)Ability and curiosity to conduct root-cause investigative work in relation to a system’s performance, configuration or data flow issues.
Desired:
Knowledge of statistical techniques and analysis (such as regression, clustering, sampling and social network analysis).Experience in cloud-based deployment (e.g. Azure, GCP or AWS)Applied knowledge of machine learning and cognitive computing.A functional understanding of international sanctions, regulations and anti-money laundering protocols.
You:
Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical analysis to a non-technical audience.Tenacious problem solving attitude: the ability to identify and fix issues before they become critical.Independent worker: you are reliable and can be trusted to deliver high-quality work with minimal oversight.Self-review system: you use a structured approach to ensure that your deliverables would require only minor review points from a stakeholder.

Why Consulting at KPMG?
Technology is a critical focus for us. It underpins everything we do. We're investing in technology like never before – not least because the pace of technological change is disrupting organisations in new and challenging ways. Through advanced data analytics and emerging tech-enabled solutions like AI and machine learning, we're helping clients across diverse sectors to navigate that change. We enable them to avoid any unnecessary risks and to uncover new, transformative opportunities that could give them a competitive edge. A career here means stretching your skills and honing your expertise by solving complex problems as part of a collaborative, results-driven and supportive team. Whether we're helping our clients to reduce their costs, make better decisions, improve efficiencies or deploy the latest technologies, we bring together broad specialisms and talents to deliver robust, connected solutions.

638d8946200a70a2.title: Data Analyst
638d8946200a70a2.description:
Will you like to work in a Global team to build solutions and support the business Worldwide? Do you want to help The LEGO Group in becoming the best analytical company, while experimenting the LEGO® adventure?
Learn how to deal with data in a global context and discover the tools and the processes enabling reporting in a large and diverse organization!
Core Responsibilities
We are looking for a data analyst with Python, SQL proficiencies, a Power BI developer with data modelling capabilities - all eager to learn! You will function as our creative problem solver, inventive in getting things to work, working independently as well as collaboratively. Besides using your curiosity to understand the data landscape, you will:

Collaborate across the business and IT to provide access to a broad set of data (Datalake, Hana views, SAP), in a team environment that extends to colleagues in remote locations and from various lines of businesses.
Demonstrate your passion for data, co-creating tables and Hana views to enable the creation of holistic Power BI dashboard for the entire organization.
Play a leading role in bringing the capabilities of the Finance and BI organizations to the next level in the data self-service environment.
Engage with end users to better understand the needs and collaborate on concepts for new functionalities (e.g. predictive analysis)
Play your part in our team succeeding
As a Business Intelligence consultant, you will join the Global Business Intelligence team of approximately 10 colleagues, ensuring the financial and sales data integrity for the entire LEGO® Group.

We are dedicated to make The LEGO Group the best data-driven company. By using Power BI and a constantly evolving Big Data platform, we build value by bringing data closer to the business.

Your role will be to facilitate access to sales, consumer related and financial information. You will build data portals, merging data flows from various sources. Your responsibilities will include connection, integration, design, deployment and maintenance of the data portals and solutions that enable data reporting and analysis. You will be closely collaborating with our internal IT department. You will enable our partners to build Power BI dashboards from a governed source of information. You will facilitate fact based decision-making.
Do you have what it takes?
You have either a bachelor degree in IT, BI, Data Science, Advanced Analytics or data related field and at least 1 year of experience working with Python, SQL and Power BI. Moreover, you have:

Experience working in an Agile setup
Sophisticated Python and SQL skills
Visualization tools inc. PowerBI
Delivery oriented, eager to get things done
Passionate about data and raising data literacy
Proven communication skills
Speak and write English easily
Experience with Big Data methods, topologies and tools, knowledge of DAX, Experience with a SAP ERP would be a plus
This offer is an outstanding opportunity to discover the LEGO group from the inside, build a network and be in the best position to apply for potential future opportunities within the LEGO® family
Join the global LEGO family
Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

We support our employees in being there for the moments that matter in life and celebrate families of all kinds, the loved ones that make us who we are. Being part of the LEGO Group also means taking part in our annual Play Day, playing a part in building a sustainable future and continuing our mission to “inspire and develop the builders of tomorrow.”

Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.
