e8541289f74ac49c.title: Data Analyst
e8541289f74ac49c.description:
At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat forever by offering our customers high quality food and recipes for different meal occasions. Over the past 10 years, we've seen this mission spread around the world and beyond our wildest dreams. Now, we are a global food solutions group and the world's leading meal kit company, active in 16 countries across 3 continents. So, how did we do it? Our weekly boxes full of exciting recipes and fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of customers looking for delicious, healthy and sustainable options. The HelloFresh Group now includes our core brand, HelloFresh, as well as: GreenChef, EveryPlate, Chef's Plate, Factor, and Youfoodz.
About the job

The role will sit in the Marketing Analytics function, reporting directly into the Marketing Analytics Lead. Being in the Marketing team allows you to explore and work with data analytical tools and programming languages as well as seeing first-hand effects of the work you do. This role will work closely with all Marketing channel owners to identify opportunities to improve and optimise the way the team operates. Supporting them to optimise processes through automation pipelines which you will build and own.

What you will be doing:

Act as the process owner for building automation pipelines for manual processes to improve the agility and efficiency of the Marketing team.
Take ownership of the architecture, design, development, deployment and operation of the tools, reports, and dashboards that you buil
Work as part of the Marketing team to contribute to analytical projects, proactively looking for opportunities to simplify and automate redundant data flows with Python, combining and preparing data from our different sources and generating outputs using Tab
Extract and analyse data from various databases, draw actionable insights to enable decision-making on the key questions facing all areas of Marketing.
Create mechanisms for non-technical stakeholders to self-serve data.
Responsible for managing senior management relationships relating to insight gathering and strategic programmes of business improvements. You will identify weaknesses and opportunities to improve reporting reliability as well as the processes that go into formulating them.
Actively participate in meetings, formulate plans for the team to deliver outputs while balancing ongoing reporting priorities.
Collaborate closely with marketing channel stakeholders to understand their processes and their impact in detail.
Leverage and deploy best in class data tools and techniques from across the HelloFresh Group to the local UK market.
Communicating on a regular basis and exchange ideas and best practices with our global teams from around the world.
Documentation detailing the implementation of key projects including those designed to improve team productivity.

Who you are:

A minimum of a bachelor's degree from a top-tier university
Experience working with ETL development, data modelling, data warehousing and applying analytics
Strong problem-solving skills, taking ownership for business problems and creating lasting solutions
Experience in data management and automation techniques; strong Python, SQL and Google Sheets skills
Demonstrable experience in data visualisation tools such as Tableau
Confident communicator who can translate complex data trends into actionable insight

What you will get in return:

70% discount on HelloFresh or Green Chef boxes
Bippit financial wellbeing account
Premium Headspace account
Group Life Assurance
Cycle to work scheme
Eye care scheme
Learnerbly professional development membership
MoreHappi unlimited professional coaching membership
Upon passing probation:
Company pension scheme
Gym membership
Bupa private medical insurance (including dental)
Other great perks:
If in the office, enjoy a free breakfast every day
Dog friendly office! (London site only)
Hybrid working- 50/50 remote working & flexible start/finish times (role dependent)
Mental health first aiders and an employee assistance programme
Working from home equipment budget

Start date: ASAP

Location: The HelloFresh Farm, 60 Worship Street, EC2A 2EZ, London

Recruitment process: First, you will have a phone interview with a member of our Talent Acquisition team. Should you be successful, you will be asked to complete a technical test and, depending to the result, you will be invited for a Competency video interview.
About HelloFresh

We believe that sharing a meal brings people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures together. We are committed to celebrating all dimensions of diversity in the workplace equally and ensuring that everyone feels a sense of inclusion and belonging. We also aim to extend this commitment to the partners we work with and the communities we serve. We are constantly listening, learning, and evolving to deliver on these principles. We are proud of our collaborative culture. Our diverse employee population enables us to connect with our customers and turn their feedback into meaningful action - from developing new recipes to constantly improving our process of getting dinner to our customers' homes. Our culture attracts top talent with shared values and forms the foundation for a great place to work!

At HelloFresh, we embrace diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of an individual's race, national origin, color, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, marital status or any other protected characteristic under applicable law, whether actual or perceived. As part of the Company's commitment to equal employment opportunity, we provide reasonable accommodations, up to the point of undue hardship, to candidates at any stage, including to individuals with disabilities.

bd127a9191414c58.title: CDO Data Policy Analyst
bd127a9191414c58.description:
Data is intrinsic in everything we do across the firm - from audits to transformations, we can’t deliver to our clients or continue to grow our firm without it. That’s why we have appointed a Chief Data Officer (CDO), Sunil Patel, who will be responsible for a firmwide strategic data team. This new team is charged with delivering world class data management capabilities to enable the UK firms business priorities and growth with internal, client and third party data, such that it is trusted, protected, easy to use and provides insight.
Our vision is to encourage the responsible use of data to make informed business decisions and create more value for our clients. The Data Governance & Policy team within the CDO will work to provide clarity, structure and coherence through policies and frameworks across all types of data and the entire data lifecycle.
We are recruiting for a Data Policy Analyst to support the development of a more coherent, joined up data policy framework that will enable more efficient and effective delivery of our data ambitions.
The individual will:
Support the development of relevant Data Policies to support the firm’s data ambition
Collaborate with key stakeholders in developing guidance to support policy understanding and adoption
Assist in the development of a framework to assess and measure the effectiveness of Data Policy implementation
Work collaboratively across related teams (e.g. Data Privacy, Security, Global CDO) to identify, agree and ensure implementation of changes and improvements to existing policies, or the development of new policies that will better enable the delivery of our data ambition
Engage in activity to clarify Data Ownership roles and responsibilities and facilitate the network of Data Owners to ensure needs are appropriately addressed by the CDO.
Where required, escalate any conflicts or complex challenges to CDO leadership team for appropriate resolution
Knowledge and experience of Data Policy and Data Management best practice
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
An interest in data and the possibilities it presents
Collaborative across LoS & IFS
Thrives in a fast-paced environment
Ability to assimilate complex requirements
Ability to work to project time scales
Curiosity to learn, whilst displaying resilience, cultural awareness and a can-do attitude
Not the role for you?
Did you know PwC offer flexible contract arrangements as well as contingent work (ie temporary or day rate contracting)?

The skills we look for in future employees
All our people need to demonstrate the skills and behaviours that support us in delivering our business strategy. This is important to the work we do for our business, and our clients. These skills and behaviours make up our global leadership framework, ‘The PwC Professional’ and are made up of five core attributes; whole leadership, technical capabilities, business acumen, global acumen and relationships.
Learn more here: www.pwc.com/uk/careers/experienced/apply
The Deal
We want all of our people to feel empowered to be the best that they can be, which is why we have ‘The Deal’.

Find out more about our firmwide Employee Value Proposition: https://www.pwc.co.uk/careers/about-us/the-new-deal.html

Diversity
Valuing Difference. Driving Inclusion.

We work in a changing world which offers great opportunities for people with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We seek to attract and employ the best people from the widest talent pool because creating value through diversity is what makes us strong as a business, enabling us to solve important problems and deliver value to our clients. We encourage an inclusive culture where people can be themselves, are valued for their strengths and are empowered to be the best they can be. As an organisation with an increasingly agile workforce, we also support different ways of working offering flexible working arrangements. Learn more here about our work to support an inclusive culture.

www.pwc.com/uk/diversity

2659214792661885.title: Data and Systems Analyst
2659214792661885.description:
Please note this role is substantially the same as the Data and Systems Analyst (reference 75133-0222) also being advertised, with the difference being this role has responsibility for a team and requires line management experience.


Full time, permanent position



This is an exciting role leading a newly formed team of five Data Support Specialists within Warwick Business School (WBS). You’ll ensure that your team delivers a high-quality service to a range of programme teams across the School, ensuring operational efficiencies are realised and that the team are responsive to stakeholders’ needs. You’ll be pro-active in planning to support business needs throughout the year, ensuring that the team are flexible, adaptable, and work in unison with each other. You’ll ensure that standard operating procedures are in place for key processes, that documentation is maintained to ensure currency of information, and that there is a process of ongoing personal development for all team members to ensure effective support and knowledge of new policies, skills, and innovations.


You’ll be technically adept, with an excellent understanding of how to extract, manipulate, and validate data. Core to this will be competency in Excel and Access, although experience of using other software packages is highly desirable, including knowledge of writing SQL queries. Experience with data visualisation packages is also desirable.


With a problem-solving mindset, you’ll be able to quickly learn new systems and processes, identifying ways in which they can be improved and working with your team, peers, and other stakeholders to enhance existing services. You’ll lead on a number of projects across the School’s operations as required and be expected to contribute towards wider team and school strategy, through collaborative working with the Software Development Team to test new developments. You’ll be expected to contribute towards establishing a strong community of practice within the School relating to data and systems, sharing best practice and innovations in this area as well as delivering training.


Informal enquiries can be directed to Dan Pearson, Director of Academic Services, WBS – Dan.Pearson@wbs.ac.uk
Job Description
Job Purpose


To manage a team of five Data and Systems Support Specialists, providing high-quality operational support to taught programme operations teams. To ensure ensuring data is accurate, validated and presented appropriately for a wide-range of purposes. This role will also focus on designing queries, providing data and systems support through diagnosing problems and finding resolutions, and will involve communicating effectively with a wide range of stakeholders


Duties and Responsibilities


Operational Oversight for Data and Systems


To provide expertise and implementation skills in projects to exploit the potential of data and systems within the School. Within an assigned area of operation, Data and Systems Analysts will be required to develop a broad and deep understanding business processes and needs of the School.


To contribute to the work involved in planning, establishing, documenting and maintaining the systems and data infrastructure in their areas of responsibility.


To support users providing excellent customer service in the effective use of existing systems and efficient implementations of new ones.

To keep abreast of wider technical developments, assisting Information Systems Consultants in the Software Development Team in the creation and evolution of School platforms, systems, and services.

To take on key responsibility for developing the effective use of data and systems through the provision of appropriate tools and by ensuring that colleagues make effective use of them, ensuring potential efficiency savings in business processes and procedures are identified and considered.


Project Management


To lead on bespoke projects to enhance service levels and operational efficiencies within a range of functional areas, taking into account full user-journeys and pro-actively engaging key stakeholders throughout.


To maintain a deep understanding of the operations within the role’s remit, including pro-actively attending briefings and information sharing networks and events to better understand developments within areas of focus, including those hosted by colleagues within WBS and the wider University.

To work closely with WBS eSolutions developers during any development of a product or service for their area of activity, acting as the key liaison between the E-Solutions development group and stakeholders within their area of specialism


Maintaining and fostering Communities of Practice and Line Management


To contribute to an on-going programme of training (induction, one-to-one, and standard and bespoke courses). The aims are to create and maintain a high level of understanding amongst all staff of the potential contribution of technology to management and operational activities, and to instil the requisite skills to facilitate wide take-up of the possibilities offered by existing services and new developments.


To maintain close contacts with peers and relevant managers, share expertise and information to ensure that developments are co-ordinated, and that a coherent development and service environment is maintained.


A number of posts will have line management responsibilities for individual Data and Systems Support Specialists. Regardless of reporting lines, all Data and Systems Analysts will be expected to support, mentor, and coach more junior staff to ensure that they develop their knowledge and skills base.

To lead a Team of Data and Systems Support Specialists to deliver a high-level of support and customer service to a range of course-related programme teams, including pro-actively identifying stakeholders’ needs


To ensure effective business continuity plans across the team to enable line reports to work across teams at peak periods or in times of staff absence and/or illness


To ensure currency of knowledge and skills of line reports through dedicated training and developmental opportunities to support their effectiveness and future progression

2cdc14061ae47308.title: Data Analyst
2cdc14061ae47308.description: What is ICE?ICE is the result of a big vision for the music industry. We sit at the exciting junction between technology, data and digital music consumption, addressing many of the industry’s biggest challenges. Based in the UK, Germany and Sweden, with a multi-national team of 250+ committed colleagues we are purpose-driven in our mission to enable accurate, transparent & fair compensation for songwriters and publishers on an international basis. We achieve this through our music licensing, processing and copyright services.Our team negotiates deals with digital music services such as YouTube, Facebook, TikTok and many other services who rely on & benefit from music in their services; innovatively address the data challenges involved in analysing epic volumes of global usage data to match written songs to recordings and calculate royalties based on terms from licensing deals and consolidate complex song ownership data from multiple sources to provide the industry’s most authoritative rights picture, underpinning accurate songwriter payments from a wide range of sources, this work has seen us distribute more than €1bn in digital royalties to our customers since 2016.At ICE we are guided in our working culture by our values, and a firm commitment to Diversity & Inclusion. Working at ICE means demonstrating Respect for everyone by understanding and celebrating our differences, embracing the Creativity that comes from different perspectives and achieving Excellence by Profile:Detail-orientated analytical approach. Must enjoy problem solving and making sense of new developments.Interest in music, licensing, music industry and rights, and music-related tech.Basic understanding of music royalties and rights flows.Interest in learning licensing practices and processes.Passion for interesting analysis on a range of topics – music services, countries, user behaviours, tech developments, copyright.Ability to simplify complexity for a range of audiences including internal leadership team, commercial partners and non-specialists.Able to consider various factors and develop practical, innovative and creative solutions as required.Works with business goals and priorities in mind.Able to manage own schedule and plan effectively.Collaborate effectively with partners, stakeholders, and across the organisation.Ability to communicate well both internally and externally at all levels.Confident and approachable.Promote and support innovative thinking and a flexible approach.Consider opportunities to add and maximise value to the business.We offer You: Up to 10% discretionary bonus25 days holiday (excluding bank holidays)Flexible working hoursCompetitive pension schemePrivate healthcareIncome protectionDental careSubsidised gym membershipStudy SupportEye care vouchersSeason ticket loanApplication Requirements: In order for us to consider your application, we ask you to submit the following:Your current CVIf your experience and capabilities match our required qualifications outlined above, we are very much looking forward to your application (only online). Please speak to our recruitment team and we will work with you to make reasonable adjustments to ensure you can perform at your best throughout your application.Job Type: Full-time

e8f840d9681b41bd.title: Data Analyst
e8f840d9681b41bd.description:
The Dyson Institute is building a world class Institute, to develop the Engineering Leaders of the future. We are searching for a talented individual who is passionate about data to join our newly established Operations team. This is an exciting opportunity to shape the future of a Higher Education institute, implementing inventive data processes to enable the Dyson Institute to deliver its ambitions.
With the newly awarded New Degree Awarding Powers, you will also have the unique opportunity to join a Higher Education Institute like no other.
You’ll be enthusiastic about using data visualisation software to create engrossing dashboards that deliver on requirements from senior leaders, as well as having experience of analysing varied data sets and using visualisations to communicate findings. You’ll have strong communication skills and understand how to share insights with stakeholders, finding ways to tell compelling narratives and using your initiative to solve problems as they arise.
Responsibilities
As a Junior Data Analyst, you’ll support The Dyson Institute in delivering the data and reporting strategy. You will need to develop strong relationships with the wider Institute team and ensure The Dyson Institute follows best practice with its data at all times.
Delivery
Deliver the data strategy and meet reporting expectations as set out by the Senior Data Analyst
Work with colleagues within the team to access data stored in a range of systems
Analyse and interpret complex data sets to generate reports and business insight for a broad range of purposes
Summarise and present data and conclusions, suitable for the understanding of the Dyson Institute Team
Work with the cross functional Institute Team to deliver dashboard reporting and visualisations
Collaborate with members of the wider Institute Team to deliver accurate submissions for statutory and regulatory returns
Monitor and audit data quality
Person Specification
Proven data analysis skills and experience using a range of software, including Excel, Power BI, and Tableau
Knowledge of SQL
Some experience of stakeholder management
Excellent communication skills
Enthusiasm for using technology to develop dashboards and visualisations that meet customer requirements, improve efficiency and support the development of a compelling narrative or measurement against key metrics.
Experience of Higher Education reporting requirements is desirable.
At Dyson, it's about more than our machines. We recognise that our success comes from our inventive people. We believe in including everybody and supporting you on your journey with us
Interview guidance

We are following the government guidelines regarding COVID19. At this time all interviews will be conducted via video or telephone. We’re taking these precautionary measures to protect both our employee and candidate wellbeing. Our Talent Acquisition team will work with you and provide further information as appropriate.

8c4f563ab7f73bbb.title: Data and Systems Analyst
8c4f563ab7f73bbb.description:
Closing date deadline for applications is 1st March 2022.
Full time position : 36 hours per week

Data and Systems Analyst

About Barnet Council

Barnet is a borough with much to be proud of. Our excellent schools, vibrant town centres, vast green spaces and diverse communities all help make it a great place to live and work. As a council we want to build on these strengths as we move into the future. We are growing and developing as an organisation to meet the challenges facing our borough, and we are committed to working with partner organisations and residents to make Barnet even better.

As an organisation, our staff are committed to Our Values – We Care, We Can Be Trusted, We Work Together, We Value Diversity, We Embrace Change and Innovation – which drive everything we do.

About the role
The Data and Systems Team provides vital support to the Street Scene Directorate by managing its systems and data. The team is responsible for the management and development of essential systems, provides analysis of information, produces intelligence to aid the senior management team in making effective decisions about services. An exciting opportunity is available to join the Street Scene Data and Systems Team as a Data and Systems Analyst. We are looking for candidates with real demonstratable knowledge and experience in using and maintaining data systems, analysing complex data models and using software including Microsoft Power BI to analyse and present data.
This is an exciting time to join Street Scene and be a driving force in the council’s digital strategy and be part of our journey to improve the quality of services that we offer to our residents.

What we offer

30 days annual leave, plus public and bank holidays
Work-life balance options may include flexitime, job share, home working, part-time
Generous Local Government Pension Scheme
Cycle to work scheme and season ticket loan
Excellent training and development opportunities
Employee well- being training programs

How to apply

Click on the apply button on our website where you will find the job listed. Please read through job description and person specification and complete the online application form. For any additional questions please email hiten.tailor@barnet.gov.uk. Interviews will take place week commencing 7th March 2022.

If shortlisted you will be required to bring photographic ID to your interview to prove your identity.

Barnet Council is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people, and vulnerable adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment. Barnet operates stringent safer recruitment procedures.

To deliver Barnet Council’s commitment to equality of opportunity in the provision of services, all staff are expected to promote equality in the workplace and in the services the Council delivers. As such we value diversity and welcome applications from all backgrounds. Click here to read our equality statement.

Barnet Council embraces all forms of flexible working (including part-time, compressed hours, and remote working) and is committed to offering employees a healthy work-life balance. Candidates are encouraged to talk about relevant requirements and preferences at interview. We can’t promise to give you exactly what you want, but we do promise not to judge you for asking.

All posts with the council are subject to a probationary period of six months, during which time you will be required to demonstrate to the council satisfaction your suitability for the position in which you will be employed.

Due to the high number of applications that are received for some posts we may close vacancies before the stated closing date if sufficient number of applications are received. Therefore, please apply as soon as possible.

Please ensure you regularly check the email account (including JUNK MAIL folders) that you use to submit your application, as any further communication regarding your application will be sent electronically. Should you not hear from us within four working weeks of the closing date for this post, then regretfully in this instance, you have not been shortlisted.

If shortlisted, you will be required to bring photographic ID to your interview to prove your identity.

f8a166f5a7814e9c.title: Data Analyst Apprenticeship (Level 4)
f8a166f5a7814e9c.description:
We help people and wildlife adapt to climate change, work to reduce the impacts of flooding, drought, rising sea levels and coastal erosion. We improve the quality of our water, land and air by addressing pollution and work with businesses to help them comply with environmental regulations.


Do you have a passion for number crunching, statistics and modelling? Are you motivated by spotting patterns, identifying trends and understanding what the data is telling you? If so, we’re looking for a Data Analyst Level 4 Apprentice full of enthusiasm and potential to join us.


You’ll be completing a Data Analyst L4 Apprenticeship through a combination of online learning and remotely delivered workshops.


A minimum of 20% of your paid hours is allocated to apprenticeship training with the remainder of your time spent learning in the workplace.


You’ll be responsible for completing coursework on time, maintaining evidence for your assessments and putting into practice what you’re learning.


Applicants are welcome from all locations, however not all roles are available in all locations. These are ‘potential opportunities’ and we cannot guarantee a vacancy in every place listed, but encourage anyone interested to submit an application and clearly state your preferred location and apprenticeship.
The team
As well as receive coaching and mentoring from professional team members, you will work with and learn from experienced Data Analysts


You'll be active in different types of work and involved in the delivery of various projects, all of which will enhance your knowledge and skills.


You will gain experience of Data Analysis., learn about various parts of our organisation, our great colleagues, obtain insight and knowledge to support your role and career.
Experience/skills required
You need to meet the apprenticeship eligibility criteria, detailed in the applicant Candidate Pack.

Experience is not as important as your enthusiasm and commitment, but you must be confident using numbers. The role is about being able to collate, interpret and analyse data. You will have access to both training and support to develop your abilities whilst in the role.

What is important is that you have good attention to detail and would enjoy generating, analysing and understanding the data to establish what it tells us. For this you’ll need a good mathematical understanding.


You’ll also need;

Experience using Excel with a willingness to learn to use databases and geographical information systems
Good verbal and written communication skills.
Effective planning skills with the ability to prioritise and deliver to tight deadlines
Decision making skills, based on data and evidence

Qualifications

A Level Maths (Grade A – C)
Contact and additional information
We offer a fantastic benefits package to our employees, in addition to an attractive salary i.e. flexible working, 25 days annual leave, an award-winning Pension Fund.

As an organisation we strive to reflect the communities we serve and continue to develop diversity throughout our workforce. We welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, sexual orientation or religion.

The roles will be full time with flexibility (30 hours+ for apprenticeships).

Remote interviews likely held in April, using an online platform such as MS Teams. We do reserve the right to close this advertisement early if we receive a high volume of applications.

Apprenticeships are likely to start in August/September 2022.

For any questions please contact: EANWC@environment-agency.gov.uk.

Your role at a glance
We are looking for a Data Support Analyst to join us in the Production Support Data & Batch Team. In this role you'll be managing all business and technical problems arising from deliverables of LGIM’s Data Programme - including the Master Data Management System, the Client Book of Records (CBOR) and the Investment Book of Records (IBOR).
You will be providing business and technical support for these systems with a particular focus on IBOR and Global Analytics, ensuring that issues are properly recorded, tracked and resolved.


What you'll be doing
Providing second line support for all issues relating to Data systems within the scope of the Data Support team
Becoming a Subject Matter Expert for the Nexus Data and Global Analytics systems, used by data consumers as a golden source of instrument, index and portfolio data
Ensuring all incidents are recorded according to standard procedures.
Specifying and/or developing appropriate monitoring to detect or prevent production incidents
Analysing issues as they occur, working with software and data suppliers, business users and other IT departments to prioritise and progress resolution in appropriate timescales
Identifying and capturing any resultant business requirements and feeding back into existing or future data work-streams
Monitoring and recording Service Level Agreements with consuming systems
Providing Management Information which will help to recognise common issue types, resolution patterns and the cost of running the function
Documenting current processes and common exception types
Ensuring that common standards and procedures are applied across all Production Support teams
Providing out of hours support on a rota basis for supported systems.
What we're looking for
A highly analytical person with logical approach to problem solving
Someone with excellent knowledge of data and how it is used in an asset management organisation
Capable of understanding database structures with the ability to query and analyse underlying data patterns
Good communicator who has the ability to work within a tight knit team
Someone that has worked in Financial Services
Ideally someone with experience in Kafka, Grafana or container-based (microservices) technologies such as Kubernetes
Benefits
Whatever your role, we reward ability, performance and attitude with a package that looks after all the things that are important to you. Our employees have a wide range of benefits including a generous pension scheme, life assurance, at least 25 days’ holiday (with potential to rise to 26 days), private medical insurance, performance related bonuses, a variety of share schemes, discounts at both a huge range of high street stores and our own great products. Your hard work will be rewarded when you join us.

256edf1fb08ab006.title: Reporting Analyst
256edf1fb08ab006.description:
Our mission is to break down the barriers of today to release the potential of tomorrow. Join us today and release yours.
There are two things that we want to share with anyone considering joining us.
Firstly, we’ve got big ambitions for our colleagues and the future of the organisation. These include our vision that inclusion and accessibility drive every conversation we have and every decision we make. We want our workforce to fully represent the communities and customers we serve, because a diverse business is a better business. We value every colleague, their diversity and the contribution that they make. When we say you’re welcome at BT, we really mean it.
Secondly, the one thing the pandemic has taught us is that a lot of current and future colleagues, where and when possible, want to embrace hybrid working. Therefore, we are introducing smart working at BT. Smart working means having the flexibility to choose, as a team, how and where you work depending on your team’s deliverables and needs; when you are at your shared core location to connect with others and when not. It may not be for every role, and, as part of the recruitment process, you’ll have the chance to discuss smart working and how it might work for the job you are applying for.

About this role
This Job Matters as it empowers the Group IT teams with the right set of insights to help them in making decisions and tracking their deliveries for providing the experience to our BT colleagues just like we are providing to our customers.
You are accountable for delivery of reporting and analysis across a range of activities. Your output supports decision making for our key stakeholders through quality and actionable insights to deliver a holistic customer view.
You'll have the following responsibilities
Conducts accurate, insightful and timely analysis of short and long-term performance, deriving accurate insights and identifying early indicators of issues or risks to strategy and/or objectives delivery.
Works with own team to analyse qualitative and quantitative information and identify key findings to inform strategy development.
Delivers specific projects to shape and progress various aspects of the strategic agenda, using highly advanced technical knowledge of analytics and modelling and inputting to the development of the overall strategic plan.
Applies advanced technical capabilities to lead or support in key accountability areas or major projects in own area, performing short and long-term performance analysis, reporting and planning to support formulation of business plans.
Supports the development of clear and insightful material and makes presentations in a variety of forums to manage and maintain stakeholder interaction and senior stakeholder engagement.
 Identify and implement ways to improve working processes within the area of responsibility
Coordinate and execute financial analysis, preparation of reports and other finance activities to support Group / CFU / CU finance priorities, working across the Finance teams as required.
You'll have the following skills & experience
Skills required for the job
 Use data analytics - You use your knowledge of data and its presentation to help colleagues make decisions. You deliver initiatives that improve data analytics in our business.
Business insight - You apply your understanding of competing commercial and people priorities to challenge the business and optimise performance. You use your knowledge of the unique environment in which our business operates to shape advice and decision making.
Systems thinking - You provide technical expertise to evaluate the impacts and links between structure, people, process and technology. You think through the whole systems context, new perspectives and insight before taking on projects.
Accounting principles - You demonstrate and apply a thorough understanding of financial statements and accounting principles, procedures and systems. You build your expertise in at least one functional area.
Assurance - You apply your understanding to consider the design and operation of policies, standards and control activities in an area of the business. You help to identify the appropriate outcomes and check actions are completed to standards and in agreed timeframes.
Improvement focus - You question and challenge the way things are done and work with others to make improvements. You build your understanding of the end to end processes to which your own role and the wider team contributes.
Measuring effectiveness - You help to set up measures to track operational performance. You support the reviewing, analysing and interpreting of data to provide insights for decision-making.
Benefits
Competitive salary.
10% on target bonus.
25 days annual leave (plus bank holidays), increasing with service.
BT Pension scheme, minimum 5% Employee contribution, BT contribution 10%.
Huge range of flexible benefits including cycle to work, childcare vouchers, healthcare, season ticket loan.
Option to join BT Shares Saving schemes.
Discounted BT products including free broadband and BT Sport.
Access to 100’s of retail discounts including the BT shop.

About BT
BT has a key role in British society, fostering change and leading technology innovation. From delivering the Olympics, to supporting the emergency services, to investing more into research than any other UK technology company, we take pride in everything we do - and in the people who work here.
We're now a global company operating at the forefront of the information age, employing 90,000 people in 180 countries. And we're on a mission. Guided by our core values of Personal, Simple and Brilliant our goal is to help customers, communities and businesses overcome barriers and release their potential.
So, if you're interested in the power of potential, why not join us today and release yours? You can read more here about what it's like to work at BT
How to Apply
It's easy to apply online; you just need a copy of your up-to-date CV and to follow the step-by step process. Don't worry if you need to make changes - you'll have the opportunity to review and edit your work on the final page. We look forward to receiving your application!

4920412b4ecff321.title: Data Quality Analyst
4920412b4ecff321.description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Data Quality Analyst to join the Data Quality Team on a 6 month secondmentbased at Britannia Park in Southend.

The Data Quality department supports the provision of good quality data within the Trust and ensures accurate, timely and accessible information.

You will be able to demonstrate a good understanding of the patient pathway, Trust data collection systems, in particular Medway and links with data quality..

You will have outstanding tact and diplomacy skills, accurate keyboard/computer skills, be able to meet deadlines, have attention to detail and an excellent concentration span.

If you like the challenge of working in a fast pace and exciting environment where we look after and value you then you may be the person to join our team.

The Data Quality Assistant will identify, investigate and resolve quality issues on a day to day basis and will correct errors on the Medway system and paper records according to protocol.

Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust is now one of the largest trusts in the country, serving a population of 1.2 million people. Our newly formed Trust, comprising acute hospital sites at Broomfield in Chelmsford, Basildon and Southend, is determined to provide the best health services for its local population. We are a well-led, high-performing and innovative organisation working in the best interests of the people we serve.

With a workforce of approximately 15,000 staff, we can now do more and go further in delivering health services to our local communities.

Our ambition is to deliver excellent local and specialist services, to improve the health and wellbeing of our patients, and provide a vibrant place for staff to develop, innovate and build careers.

We will deliver safe and high-quality services and be an employer of choice for our workforce.

We are ‘one team, working together’

The post holder will be responsible for resolving regular and ad hoc reports relating to data quality issues. This will include co-ordinating the monitoring of data quality on all the hospital information systems. They will work within the Informatics Team and provide direct support to the Trust Data Quality Team and contribute towards developing and implementing the Data Quality agenda across the Trust.

f1455b422026f6db.title: Quantitative Analyst – Macro Products
f1455b422026f6db.description:
Quantitative Analyst – Macro Products
London
As a Barclays Quantitative Analyst you will be part of the QA Macro Products Development team and you will help develop pricing, valuation, and risk management models and analytics for the Non Linear Rates and FX Flow business in the strategic analytics library. This is a real opportunity for you to showcase your skills as you develop the desk delivery tools and analytics used by Macro trading desks to perform custom analysis.

Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.

What will you be doing?
• Developing functionalities in the Omega C++ library required to price and risk Macro products: trade conversion, vanilla pricers, PDE and MC implementation, static data, etc.
Developing a Python pricing framework for the Macro models used by both the Macro quants and tradersSupporting the Macro trading desks to perform bespoke analysis by developing the desk delivery tools and analytics
What we’re looking for:
• Post graduate degree in a technical discipline (STEM) from a top-rated university. Ideally with a background in Computer Science and/ or Financial Engineering
In depth C/C++ knowledgeTrack record of developing pricing and risk analytics

Skills that will help you in the role:
• Previous experience on Macro products (flow and vanilla options, Fixed Income, FX or Inflation), and developing in a shared codebase with multiple developers is desired
Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users
Where will you be working?
5 North Colonnade is home to our investment bank and is in the heart of Canary Wharf, just a short walk from our headquarters at Churchill Place. It boasts an array of onsite amenities such as dry cleaner as well as a deli and buffet style staff restaurant. The building is easily accessible by tube, docklands light railway and all major bus links. The atmosphere is second to none with a real buzz being created around the offices within.

efde33c82fefb886.title: Resolution Data Analyst, Finance (6 Months)
efde33c82fefb886.description:
Our people work differently depending on their jobs and needs. From home working to job sharing, visit the remote and flexible working page on our website to find out more.
This role is based in the United Kingdom and as such all normal working days must be carried out in the United Kingdom.
Join us as a Resolution Data Analyst
This is an opportunity for an analytical professional to join our Finance function
You’ll be helping management to ensure our data principles are met whilst we develop our resolvability assessment framework
Hone your financial expertise and advance your career in a varied and challenging role
This role is offered on a secondment basis
What you'll do
As a Resolution Data Analyst, you’ll actively support the design and delivery of the resolution planning agenda across the bank, ensuring all regulatory data mapping requirements are met. You’ll be supporting the planning and delivery of data management activity for ad-hoc and scheduled reporting to regulatory bodies and relevant governance forums.
Your role will also involve:
Supporting activity across the Resolution programme to ensure NWG data principles are met including lineage, identification and logging of KDEs, and updates to InfoMap.
Making sure that there’s full traceability of the resolution requirements from legislation or regulation through to the self-assessment
Helping to deliver the testing mechanisms for making sure that the self-assessment is an accurate and verified view of the resolution readiness
Supporting management in aspects of Resolution Planning as appropriate
The skills you'll need
To join us in this role, you’ll be educated to degree level or will have equivalent experience in the financial sector. You’ll be able to take initiative, analyse complex problems, think strategically and break down challenges into tangible tasks to achieve a set of overall objectives.
As well as this, you’ll bring:
Knowledge of the NWG data management policy
Experience of working within a change or regulatory team
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Strong relationship and networking skills, with the ability to develop relationships and interact at all levels
A proven ability to work to demanding timeframes
Excellent PowerPoint, Word and Excel skills
If you need any adjustments to support your application, such as information in alternative formats or special requirements to access our buildings, or if you’re eligible under the Disability Confident Scheme please contact us and we’ll do everything we can to help.

e628da2ff665d558.title: Marketing Data Analyst
e628da2ff665d558.description: The Market Insight team are currently recruiting for a Marketing Data Analyst, responsible for supporting the Market Insight Manager in using data and trends to provide insight to influence marketing strategy.This is an exciting opportunity to join the team, where you will be able to use your analytical and data skills to influence marketing and Customer Relationship Management activity, supporting regional and demographic targeting for events, advertising and enquirer and applicant communications. This role combines technical capabilities with the ability to present the story behind the numbers to a wide range of stakeholders.The successful candidate will be responsible for advising colleagues on appropriate data sets to run targeted campaigns and to drive maximum return on investment. They will also develop reports and dashboards which help teams visualise and understand applicant behaviour, providing insight into event booking and attendance, enquiries, applications, and conversion, which informs strategic and operational marketing planning.Previous experience of analysing, presenting, and evaluating complex datasets is essential for this role.For an informal discussion prior to application, please contact Safina Tai, Market Insight Manager at s.tai1@bradford.ac.uk or Tel 01274 236855.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: £27,116.00-£29,614.00 per year

535a0bd4aed2b992.title: Data Analyst
535a0bd4aed2b992.description: Who We Are?Pass the Keys is a fast-growing short-let management company, originally founded in London in 2015 and now UK wide across 56 locations in the UK and counting.We manage hundreds of properties on multiple platforms including AirBnb, Booking.com and HomeAway and our recently launched Direct bookings site.We offer a fully managed service for our hosts and guests ( including Listing & Revenue Management, 24/7 Guest Services, & Cleaning & Maintenance servicesOur Mission: “ We create opportunities in every corner of the world, for our hosts, our guests and our people”.Objectives of the role: Through data ensure that through great customer understanding we become the leading disruptor within this market.Roles and Responsibilities: Strong analytical skills, with the ability to identify business questions, analyze data, draw conclusions, and develop actionable recommendations.A knack for presenting complex data in clear & simple formats that cuts through the noise and allows audiences to focus on key insights.A natural collaborator, and enthusiastic about building relationships across the business.Knowledge of advertising and communications landscape. A clear understanding of how marketing works.Maintain and manage BI tooling (we use holistic) and ensure that it is working to its fullest potential.Provide clear data-led reporting to our varied stakeholder network.Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.Proactively identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in data to provide reports and actionable insights.Clean data and maintain data quality.Create and maintain data visualizations to answer business questions.Develop and maintain our data warehouse (BigQuery) in conjunction with our CTO.Develop and implement appropriate business metrics.Ultimately, empower business users to self-serve their own data questions.Requirements3+ year data analytics experiencePreferably a bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or StatisticsKnowledge of statistical methods and strong analytical skillsExperience or the willingness to learn Holistics (similar to Looker), Freshdesk, Hubspot and other sources of dataExperience working with data (SQL, Excel/Google Sheets)Experience with Google Cloud data stack (BigQuery, Data Studio, Colab)Experience with managed ETL tools such as Stitch, Hevodata etcTechnical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniquesHospitalilty experience preferred.Prior experience with database and model design and segmentation techniquesGet under the skin of marketing problems, and generate genuine insights that will resonate with business leadershipAdept at queries, report writing and presenting findingsProven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environmentExcellentBenefitsSalary £30K30 Days holiday ( inc Bank Holidays)Birthday Day OffFlexible working policyJob Type: Full-time

9cb007e95755523b.title: Data Governance Analyst
9cb007e95755523b.description:
Description
We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Governance Analyst that will support our Operational MI team, you'll be managing and maintaining processes, documentation and governance within the team, giving the business the information necessary to develop and deploy strategy which will deliver its growth targets.
You'll be reporting into our Operational MI Team Leader, within our COO function that is part of AXA Commercial. AXA Commercial is undergoing significant transformation, and this is an exciting time to shape the future at AXA. We are seeking an ambitious individual to take on this challenge and take advantage of this great opportunity. At AXA we’re adopting a Hybrid way of working, empowering our people to balance their time between home and the office in and in a way that works best for them, their team and our customers.
What you'll be doing:
Liaising and building effective relationships with key stakeholders across AXA Commercial to develop and define effective MI requirements for the business.
Ensure reports produced are delivered within agreed SLA’s and effective controls are in place.
Responsible for set up and maintenance of document management system. Management and control of risk and incidents log
Plan and co-ordinate UAT as required after change/developments.
Act as contact point for projects where MI support is required, providing guidance on requirements and completion of DPIA where required
Production, maintenance and storage of MI and data in line with regulation and group policy.
Control of circulation of information internally and externally.
Production and maintenance of governance frameworks on processes and procedures within the team as well as carrying out quality assurance to evidence compliance.
Contribute to a positive team culture through engagement, effective communication and recognition.
Qualifications
Knowledge and understanding of project tools preferred, SQL and PowerBI knowledge desirable.
Experience of work related to DPIA, Governance and compliance.
Advanced experience in all Microsoft office products, particularly Excel.
Ability to work across various projects simultaneously.
Srong understanding of risk and conduct.
Developed relationship management skills.
What we offer
One of the best things about joining AXA is our rewards package. At AXA UK, we’re appreciative of the people who work for us and our rewards package is reviewed regularly to reflect that. You can expect to receive:
Competitive annual salary of £24,500 - £35,000 dependent on experience
Annual company & performance-based bonus
Contributory pension scheme (up to 12% employer contributions)
Life Assurance (up to 10 x annual salary)
23 days annual leave plus Bank Holidays
Opportunity to buy up to 5 extra days leave or sell up to 3 days leave
AXA employee discounts
Gym Benefits
AXA is proud to support the needs of our employees and as such understands everyone has individual work and home life responsibilities. We’re happy to discuss flexible working arrangements for this role, should this be a requirement for you.
At AXA, we want to become one of the most inspiring companies to work for and to achieve this ambition, we need the best talent to come and work for us. We look for candidates with the right skills and values to join us and selection is based on a fair and equal process. We’re proud to be committed to equal opportunities and welcome applications from all backgrounds. As a financial services company, all successful candidates will be subject to preemployment checks, so we can ensure regulatory compliance.
To apply, click ‘Apply Now’ and you’ll be able to upload your profile/CV from there. If you require an alternative method of applying or would like to discuss this role further, please send an email to ryan.2.baker@axa-insurance.co.uk.
#LI-Remote
About AXA
With a presence in over 60 countries, and 165,000 employees serving the needs of 107 million customers, AXA is big.
But never too big to care for every single person who works here. So when you join us, we promise to put our collective might behind you and your career.
You’ll work in an open and supportive environment where you’ll be developed, challenged and encouraged to move around to achieve even bigger and better things – nationally and internationally. You’ll learn directly from senior leaders, from the best in our business. And you’ll enjoy real responsibility, really early on.
Every large company today talks about supporting diversity and inclusion. But at AXA UK, these values form an integral part of everything we do. For us, it’s about bringing together the best talent, helping people to realise their full potential by being 100% themselves at work and delivering outstanding service to everyone – regardless of difference.
Proud to be part of the AXA Group, a global insurance brand and a worldwide leader in financial services, AXA Insurance businesses employ over 5,500 in a network of offices across the UK. Our expert teams care for a huge range of customers, helping them protect their cars, homes and businesses against life’s uncertainties. Whether bought directly, through brokers or through a number of corporate partners, our market-leading products are trusted by millions.

b4f57a55ab8273ab.title: Senior Commercial Data Analyst
b4f57a55ab8273ab.description:
The purpose of the Commercial Directorate is to support the health system in England to improve the quality, efficiency and value of its commercial, corporate and estates management and services.

This will be primarily achieved through:

improving the commercial performance of the system, including generating income for the NHS;
reducing unwarranted variation in the delivery of corporate and support service functions;
defining the policy and standards for commercial, estates and corporate services;
ensuring supplies, suppliers and supply chains ensure continuity of supply are efficient and effective
developing, defining and attracting a workforce to meet the requirements and,
supporting the system to adopt the former and latter to improve both the working environment for the patients and staff.

As a Senior Commercial Data Analyst, the post holder will work as part of a dynamic Commercial team providing an effective Analytical and reporting service across the Commercial team to support the function in the achievement of savings and to drive maximum compliance, strengthened financial controls and improved Governance across the Organisation.

The post holder will support the Head of Department and their team to ensure that their work stream of programmes are planned and managed effectively and take the lead in assisting in their successful delivery:

Manage all commercial business returns, including planning.
Design and produce reports using various commercial and financial systems and present the information in various formats eg. Graphs, trends, dashboards.
Work with colleagues in the Team, Directorate and wider organisation to produce reports to support their areas of business.
Develop and implement a content management system to ensure information is properly managed and best practice is shared across the team, Directorate and the wider NHS organisation.
Liaise with appropriate functions within the regions, organisation and the Sector.

This role is located in either Leeds (Quarry House) or London (Skipton House). The Commercial directorate supports individuals working flexibly and remotely.

5bdf6a7bc02e4cf4.title: Junior Research Analyst
5bdf6a7bc02e4cf4.description:
We are looking for a number of Junior Research Analysts to join us in London!
Reuters Professional is an agile digital publishing business in the heart of the world’s largest news organization.
We exist to deliver market intelligence across verticals, foster relationships that shape strategy and safeguard success at leading companies worldwide.
Our mission is to be the premier source of news & intelligence for global professionals & industry leaders. We combine a depth of industry research with technology and editorial innovation across Reuters.com, Reuters TV & Reuters Events. Bringing together an unrivalled depth of industry knowledge across multiple verticals to deliver a powerful experience to over 50 million monthly users on the web, mobile and set-top-boxes.
Now - the product suite is diversifying. We are looking for individuals to aid in driving this build and diversification.
If you want real responsibility, from your first day and the opportunity to be a key cog in a new business venture from the start, developing your career quickly with potential to be in a leadership role within the team as it grows, we’re interested in talking to you.
We deliver world-class content across multiple global industries, and work with industry leaders and visionaries to provide the critical intelligence senior level executives need to make strategic decisions.
Markets we work across include:
Pharma
Sustainability
Insurance
Supply Chain
Energy
Amongst many others!
About the Role
As a Junior Research Analyst you will:
Research Market Trends - Provide insight to the business from primary and secondary market research and analysis in the areas of the marketplace, customer, and competition across multiple verticals
Identify the business-critical strategic questions senior leaders across the industry are asking
Develop data sets & strategic insights to provide insights and answers to these questions
Analyze and interpret Data - Publish regular updates on market conditions to track trends in specialized market niches or product technology disciplines.
Help define product & business strategy
About you
Are you ambitious and fearless? Do you want to help grow communities & aid in informing their business strategies within a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? We’re looking for a Junior Research Analyst to join a new initiative within Reuters Professional, a fast-growing team within Reuters as the product suite expands.
To be our Junior Research Analyst, you will likely:
Be commercially driven first and foremost – you should understand the commercial drivers behind our customers decisions, as our job is to help them make smarter ones!
An interest in business is a must, as is an entrepreneurial spirit, a readiness to take responsibility for your work and, of course, great communication skills
Thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative, high-growth environment and work well in a team as well as being a self-starter
Ability to suggests process improvement following investigative, analytic, or diagnostic services
Be someone with the ability to identify new and interesting business trends coupled with the drive to develop great products that senior business people can’t afford to miss
Communication and research and analytical skills are essential, along with an entrepreneurial flair and a target-driven mindset
Ability to anticipate and interpret customer needs to identify solutions
Ability to explain difficult concepts and influence others to adopt a point of view for ideas and initiatives
Preferable but not necessary skills / experience:
Previous experience that demonstrates commercial acumen and research skills – above and beyond university level research.
A knowledge of research fieldwork / frameworks and design
Proven written skills
Phone based interview experience
Please note, the deadline for applications is Friday 11th March 2022 at 11.59pm UK Time.
What’s in it For You
At Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:
Global Career: As a global company, we can offer truly international career and progression opportunities
Learning & Development: we have a dedicated training team focused on the continuous development of our employees
Benefits: We offer competitive salary packages and market-leading benefits
Perks: Work alongside Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists and a team who provide unmatched, award-winning coverage of the world’s most important stories
About Reuters
Reuters is the world’s largest multimedia news provider. Founded in 1851, it is committed to the Trust Principles of independence, integrity and freedom from bias. With unmatched coverage in over 16 languages, and reaching billions of people worldwide every day, Reuters provides trusted intelligence that powers humans and machines to make smart decisions. It supplies business, financial, national and international news to professionals via desktop terminals, the world's media organizations, industry events and directly to consumers. Reuters: The Real World in Real Time
#LI-LM1
Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.
We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.
Accessibility
As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

2b63cb760de7a559.title: Game Data Analyst
2b63cb760de7a559.description:
Why PlayStation?

PlayStation isn't just the Best Place to Play — it's also the Best Place to Work. Today, we're recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, PlayStation™Now, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.

The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.
Department overview:

In Game Analytics, we work with some of the best game studios in the world - responsible for developing some of the most recognisable and ambitious console games and franchises on PlayStation, including Uncharted, The Last of Us, Horizon, God of War, and Gran Turismo.

We provide end-to-end analytics services for PlayStation Studios and use data to help them make their amazing games even better. We are looking for talented people to join us in pushing the boundaries of game analytics for PlayStation games.

What you'll be doing:

You'll work in our cross-disciplinary team to help game studios use data effectively to improve games. You'll work with decision-makers to understand their goals, identify opportunities, and inform decisions about features and games across the company. Come join us, and help define and build the future of analytics for PlayStation games.

What we are looking for:

Adept at working with people and customer behaviour data to inform decisions and improve products
Fluent in SQL on analytics data warehouses – We use Redshift, but experience with similar ones like Vertica, Netezza, or Postgres are fine
A strong background in Looker or a similar analytics visualisation tool like Tableau or MicroStrategy
You can apply data-backed analyses to produce insights that help improve game design
Excellent communication skills, and can get your point across to game designers, producers, programmers, and executives
A strong interest in a variety of modern console games.
Strategic and business-savvy. You know that people don't always know what they want, or ask for the right things. You can help them figure out what they need, and then make it happen
Comfortable with statistics, probability, and quantitative analysis methods
You're committed to quality as a top priority
A track record of trying and learning new things
Bonus points for experience in Python, iPython notebooks, R, or machine learning

Benefits:
Discretionary bonus opportunity
Private Medical Insurance
Dental Scheme
London Allowance (if applicable)
25 days holiday per year
On Site Gym
Subsidised Café
Free soft drinks
On site bar
Access to cycle garage and showers

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

df29a7a914952d9f.title: Business Analyst
df29a7a914952d9f.description:
BUSINESS ANALYST

Level
L2 - Junior Manager

Closing Date:
25/02/2022

Permanent / Fixed Term
Permanent

Support Centre Location
London Office

More about the role
Digital Business Analyst

Purpose
Understand the product vision and convey it to the development teamFocus and guide the work of the sprint teamEnsure the key stakeholders understand the relevant impacts on the business and IT so that changes are taken on smoothlyTo assist and advise the business in identifying and understanding changes required to meet their objectives, supporting them throughout the change lifecycle
Tasks and responsibilities

Delivery
Own, define and elaborate stories on the iteration team backlog, including definition of functional and non-functional acceptance criteriaUse a range of techniques such as workshop facilitation, document analysis, sites visits, use cases, scenario modelling, task and workflow analysisEnsure stories are concise, complete, specific, unambiguous and that they are aligned to the goals of the sprint, project and the businessSupport prioritisation of stories for sprints with the Product ManagerRefine stories to a sufficient level of detail to allow appropriate implementation of solutions and testingAct as a proxy to the product manager and business as the key stakeholder / SME and decision makerClarify questions on stories and acceptance criteriaParticipate in team demos, retrospectives, stand ups and relevant ceremoniesManage the scope and traceability of stories throughout the project lifecycle, ensuring that they are understood by both the team and Product ManagerIdentify blocker, dependencies and any impacts (business, service solution etc)Design and model the to-be process, performing gap analysis and identifying areas for improvement, where requiredAssist with the identifying and managing of risks, issues and dependencies

Competencies

o Decisive, must be able to make decisions quickly under pressure on behalf of other parties
o Ownership, will be accountable for product success from inception to delivery
o Excellent communicator, collaborator and “people person” capable of sharing a vision, aligning people, focusing efforts and motivating the team
o High emotional intelligence, will help to collaborate and steer the product development to a successful conclusion
o Able to manage conflict and maintain relationships
o Strong influencer, will be able to keep to the product vision in the face of different views
o Strong Motivator, development team will require energy and enthusiasm
o Experience of applying data and insight to inform decision making
o Analytical mind-set, with a passion for identifying and resolving issues and the ability to turn findings into actions
o Enjoy working in fast paced, high growth, high volume, multi-channel customer focused organisations
o Passion for emerging technologies and trends, with experience of exploiting these where applicable

Toolsets
Use toolsets as required e.g. JIRA and confluence
Test support
Support any queries and triage any defects raised throughout the test cycles
Release Management
Support release management and business cut over activities with the Product Manager
Experience
Experience of managing products through their lifecycle from idea to deliveryProven experience in successfully delivering measurable business value through software or initiatives they have definedExpertise in delivering value from Agile methodologiesExperience organising and enabling cross functional teams to deliver to tight deadlines working without line management responsibilityExperience in writing clear and succinct user stories with explicit acceptance criteria that have led to successful deliveryExperience in analysing and mapping business processesGood understanding of the commercial realities of digital retailingIdeally from a retail environment
Key Stakeholders
Internal and externalBusiness teams (all levels)Product ManagersEnterprise and solution architectsContinuous development teamUXOptimisersTest TeamService Team

EMAIL TO A FRIEND
