695593d497b32eb4.title: Data Analyst - Internal Audit and Risk Control
695593d497b32eb4.description:
About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, Tokyo, Sao Paolo, Mexico City, and Toronto.

Position Summary:
Internal Audit and Risk Control team is missioned to be an independent and trusted gatekeeper and advisor through providing objective assurance, comprehensive evaluation, and proactively innovative consultancy on global employees integrity, business risk management and controls to protect and maximize organizational value for the Company, its investors, and stakeholders. We are now looking for data analysts in Singapore/Los Angeles/London who will power our mission with data engineering, data analytics and data science technology.

Responsibilities:

Analyse the company's business risk with data, locate key factors and generate key indicators out of the data and link to the process risks, develop and manage IARC data map and risk data warehouse.
Integrate fragmented and scattered local information into effective indices or models with data mining, clustering, classification technologies, to form a set of parameters and rules that fully describes the risk levels of different risks along with the business processes.
Leverage data engineering and data science to provide analytical insights, contribute to and help deliver risk data mining, ETL, data warehouse construction, data cleaning/restructuring, statistical modelling and machine learning application in partnership with internal audit, risk control, investigation and other cross-functional teams.
Participate in the development of Internal Audit and Risk Control data platform, deploy data cronjobs or monitoring models in ByteDance data platform. Design and develop BI dashboards to present the analytics insights and set anomaly alerts according to monitoring rules.
Bachelor's degree or higher in the advanced field of technology or management or other equivalent majors such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, financial engineering, etc.
1-5 years of strong industry experience in big data analysis and/or risk data modelling and/or other relevant data mining fronts. Data science (algorithms/machine learning) experience in large Internet companies is preferred.
Proficiency in data analysis and statistical analysis tools such as SQL, R, and Python. Proficiency in data science skills and common Machine Learning application knowledge.
Experience in coordinating cross-functional and cross-regional execution. Strong communication, critical thinking, internet related business acumen and quick learning are preferred.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at USRC@tiktok.com.

ec15e4a19f17f70e.title: Data Analyst Apprentice
ec15e4a19f17f70e.description:
Candidates should be 18 years or over before the start date and have the right to live and work in England

For the apprenticeship program we prioritize applicants eligible to government funding for their apprenticeship and for this you need to:
Have lived in the UK or in the European Economic Area (EEA) for the last 3 years
Be a resident of the UK for the entire duration of the program
Not be registered to study on a UK government funded course ending June 2022 or later

5 GCSEs including 1 STEM, Maths and English C/4 or above / equivalent

Please note, you will be required to evidence your qualifications. If you have gained qualifications outside of the UK you will be required to evidence that they are equivalent.

Note: This Apprenticeship assumes the candidate has some or little knowledge/ experience of the occupation, and is NOT suitable for candidates who already have a similar or higher-level qualification in the same or similar subject of the apprenticeship. If you already have related qualifications or 2 years plus experience in this field please visit amazon.jobs

Job summary
As a Data Analyst Apprentice at Amazon, you’ll gain a vast range of useful experiences and skills. You will work towards the L4 Data Analyst apprenticeship standard

You will build your skills over a 24 month period, starting in July, which will help you develop personally and professionally. Your apprenticeship will be made up of;

Classroom/virtual based training to cover knowledge,
On-the-job training in Amazon UK location-your base office
Online learning,
Mentoring from our experienced team members.

Alongside extensive development of your technical skills, you will also grow your abilities in crucial complementary areas like organization, prioritization, data and problem-solving techniques, teamwork, communication, and presentation skills.

You will work alongside the team supporting with day to day tasks learning how Amazon works and delivers for its customers. As your knowledge and skills increase over the duration of the scheme you will have opportunities to be part of and lead projects, making a difference for customers. The on the job experience will help you build a portfolio of evidence towards your apprenticeship. You will be given dedicated time to focus on your studies to help you stay on track and work towards successfully completing your qualification(s). Once you have successfully completed you will be able to apply for relevant roles across the business.

You will attend a number of workshops across the duration of the apprenticeship, workshops will be a mix of face to face and online delivery by a training provider. You will also attend internal workshops/ training to support you in developing Amazon related skills and knowledge. Depending on the scheme and location of the training provider you may be required to travel and stay overnight. (costs will be supported by Amazon)

Key job responsibilities
As a working student your primary focus is to complete your studies by learning and developing your skills, knowledge and behaviors to work towards successful graduation. You will be set objectives and goals by your training provider and hiring team to support your studies.

About the team
Amazon is the perfect place to start your career as Data Analyst. Our Data Analyst apprentices can work across a number of tech and no tech teams in Amazon supporting the business team in completing ad hoc data requests and analyses as needed, develop reporting using Tableau and Quicksight for repetitive data tasks where data pipelines/queries are already in place (concessions, CS metrics, operations), automation of manual processes and undertaking deep dive on metrics to help the business team understand metric changes, utilizing trend analysis

These will be a plus for your career at Amazon, but are not necessary to enter the programme:


You are able to operate in a challenging and fast paced environment and able to communicate well
You are able to demonstrate drive and a passion for learning

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

602ddfeb6e4f68e0.title: Reporting Analyst - Tableau / Power BI / Excel / SQL - Remote / MK
602ddfeb6e4f68e0.description: MBA are proud to partner one of the Milton Keynes most innovative finance organisations in their search for an experienced Reporting Analyst on a permanent basis.The role can be based entirely remotely however an office split (Milton Keynes) is encouraged.As Reporting Analyst you will design, create and analyse both operational and client data to identify and predict trends to help drive change in our customer and financial performance. The role is key to our client relationships and our own performance management, giving valuable insights allowing us to continually improve.Reporting Analyst – Role OverviewYou’ll be working closely with the Client Services and Global Hub teams and Programme Managers to create, modify, troubleshoot and automate the availability of timely and accurate data, along with actionable business intelligence, to satisfy external and internal customers.Timescale adherence and integrity of the MI Process is essential to ensure all data and reports are accurate, current, complete and consistent. You’ll interpret and analyse raw data, creating meaningful reports which translate well to a non-technical audience and confidently present to internal and external stakeholdersThey’ll also be an emphasis on identifying opportunities to drive changes that help transform claim outcome, together with introducing methods to update, simplify, and enhance data processes, procedures and technologiesReporting Analyst – SkillsExperienced in data analysis and confident with reporting tools such as Tableau & Power BI.You’ll also have/be:A degree in Computer Science or similar discipline would be advantageous, however qualified by experience candidates are equally as welcomed to applyThe ability to present to a varied non-technical audienceManage IT related projects to resolutionSound SQL knowledgeExcellent verbal and written communication skills.Advanced MS Excel capabilityPython knowledge advantageousReporting Analyst - PerksCompany pension schemeFlexible working / holidaysTraining and development opportunities.Salary: £30,000 / £40,000Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £30,000.00-£40,000.00 per yearBenefits:Flexible scheduleWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shift

466bd28e52365d6a.title: Senior Data Analyst
466bd28e52365d6a.company: Alexander Mann Solutions for Public Sector Resourcing
466bd28e52365d6a.description: Senior Data Analyst (Inside IR35)Contract Term: 12 Months +Contracting Authority: Location: Remote UKThis role will be supporting core analytical function within the UEC Data Team, Digital Urgent and Emergency Care sub-directorate (DUEC). The DUEC teams are working to solve a set of problems around effective sharing of information across UEC, with technology supporting the seamless flow. This will be achieved by running and maintaining existing live services and products, such as NHS Pathways, 111 Online, Directory of Services and the development of new products or services.The work of the UEC Data team is focused on enabling clinicians, commissioners, providers and other parts of the UEC system to understand what is really happening with patients as they traverse individual settings (online, phone, physical) by linking their journeys and publishing insights. This will enable improvements in the quality of commissioning and planning.It is a multi-disciplinary team, comprising of data and business analysts, user researchers, technical architects and other digital delivery specialists. They work collaboratively to develop new products, solve problems, and react to the emerging needs of the NHS. There is also the business as usual function, which keeps the existing products and services maintained and handles the frequent requests and queries which come from an array of stakeholders.Imagine having a talent that could benefit someone you’ve never met and solve problems you didn’t even know existed. Well, you do, and you can. And we’re here to help you do just that. At PSR we are the go-to place for talented contractors and temps for a rich variety of public sector roles.As a Senior Data Analyst your main responsibilities would be: An integral part of the core analytical function, working with a wide range of both internal and external key stakeholders, and responding to queries based on the team’s data assets and outputs.The main objective of the project is to maximise the utility of data, unlock new insights through the use of advanced analytics when working with large scale datasets, providing more evidence to a wider range of stakeholders, enabling them to implement improvements across Urgent and Emergency care services.You will be responsible for end-to end management of the agreed analytical outputs as well as for maintaining existing assets with a focus on data analysis, production of the outcome metrics and other information for clinical and operational useYou will have the opportunity to conduct novel analysis on linked data, be an integral part of the dashboard production and present our work at various Show & Tells and other relevant stakeholder meetings.You’ll have relevant knowledge in: Advanced analytical and requirements gathering skills.Advanced SQL skillsAbility to work with large data sets, specifically with complex health dataAbility to understand and interpret results from complex analysis, apply the results to the given problem and suggest conclusions to be drawn.Ability to present and explain results of analysis via written and verbal communication.Good working knowledge and experience of databases including database interrogation tools. Good working knowledge of spreadsheets, with experience of making use of their wider functionality (e.g. formulae).Understanding a wide range of data quality issues and the application of the appropriate data validation techniquesApplies knowledge of new and evolving technologies, including opensource software, and has confidence in making decisions around which methods and techniques to apply, and assists others in making these decisionsYou will also have these skills and experience: Experience of identifying and managing areas where there are shared and conflicting agendas.Excellent oral and written communication skills, with the ability to choose content and style to suit the audience, including large groups.Able to work within a team under guidance from senior colleagues, able to work on own initiative as well as a member of a team, able to work across teams.Able to communicate effectively with both external and internal customers and colleagues to understand the work required and present or explain work completed.Able to learn rapidly to use new statistical packages to a high standardAble to choose the appropriate analytical approachesBuilds strong relationships with customers and develops own reputation, as well as that of the team or Department.Able to communicate complex and technical concepts and issues to non-technical colleagues, customers and stakeholders.Experience of devising solutions to ensure internal specialist expertise adds demonstrable value to the wider system.If this Senior Data Analyst sounds like something that you would be interested in, please click the link to apply and speak to one of our PSR team now."In applying for this role you acknowledge the following; this role falls in scope of the Off Payroll Working in the Public Sector legislation. Any rates of payment quoted will reflect the gross rate per day for the assignment, and will be subject to appropriate taxes and statutory costs. As such the payment to the intermediary and your income resulting from this contract will be different."Job Types: Full-time, Fixed termContract length: 12 monthsBenefits:Work from homeSchedule:Monday to Friday
